value.name: round-robin
value.summary: Rotate among the DNS servers in listed order.
value.description: The round robin algorithm contacts DNS servers in the listed order. Each new connection is forwarded to the next server in the list.

value.name: first-alive
value.summary: Use the first healthy DNS server.
value.description: The first alive algorithm uses a primary and one or more backup servers. When the primary server is up, all connections are forwarded to this server. When the primary server is not up, connections are forwarded to backup servers. The primary server is the first server in the list.

property.name: Match
property.summary: URL match regular expression
property.description:
Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a URL set included in the cache policy. The following wildcard characters are available.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character.
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character.
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Document cache policy type
property.description: Select the cache type. The cache type determines whether to cache documents and the mechanism to use to remove cached entries. The default is Protocol-Based.

property.name: TTL
property.summary: Document lifetime
property.description: Sets the validity period in seconds for documents in the cache. TTL applies to only the Fixed policy type. Enter a value in the range 5 - 31708800. The default value is 900.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Document priority

description.p: Specifies the priority of a document to add to or remove from the cache. The greater the value, the higher its priority. Enter a value in the range 1 - 255. The default value is 128.

ul.li: When adding documents, the cache uses the policy with the highest priority. If the document matches multiple policies with the same priority, the cache uses the first matching policy in the alphabetized list.

When removing documents, the cache removes documents that were added by policies with the lowest priority. If multiple documents have the same priority, the cache removes the document that was least recently accessed.

description.p: When you define multiple policies, the appliance retains the policies in an alphabetized list. The appliance evaluates candidate documents against each policy. Consequently, the priority of policies is important to ensure that the appliances caches candidates documents for the appropriate validity period.

ul.li: Use a high priority for policies that you want to cache.
Use a low priority for generic policies. For example, set the priority to 1 when * or *.xml is the match pattern.

property.name: XC10Grid
property.summary: The name of the Cache Grid
property.description: The DataPower XC10 or WebSphere eXtreme Scale grid configuration to use for caching documents.

property.name: CacheBackendResponses
property.summary: Specifies whether to cache back-end responses
property.description: Caches responses to requests from back-end servers.

property.name: HTTPCacheValidation
property.summary: Allow HTTP cache validation with the origin server.
property.description: When a requested HTTP document results in a cache hit, HTTP cache validation with the origin server will be performed.

property.name: ReturnExpired
property.summary: Whether to return expired documents

description.p:
In the following situations, whether to return expired content when a client requests it.
The appliance cannot establish a connection with the origin server.
The document cache is getting the newest version from the origin server.

A document might persist in the cache after the document is expired. When enabled, the cached document is returned even though it is potentially stale. A warning header indicates that the document is stale.

property.name: RESTInvalidation
property.summary: RESTful invalidation
property.description: Will invalidate document cache on unsafe requests. For example: HTTP GETs are safe requests that do not change the internal state of the server. When an HTTP POST to the same URL occurs, the cache needs to be invalidated because the internal state of the server may have changed. The next GET request must contact the origin service to update the cache with any changes.

property.name: CacheUnsafeResponse
property.display: Cache Response to POST and PUT Requests
property.summary: Cache Response to POST and PUT Requests
property.description: Caches responses to POST and PUT requests when the cache policy type is set to fixed. The response to these requests is the result of an action on the server that might change its resource state. You might want to cache responses to these requests when you know that the action (for example: HTTP POST) will not change the server state.

description.p:
Caches documents that match the URL expression. HTTP caching rules, as defined in Section 13 of RFC 2616 "Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP 1.1", specify the cache-lifetime. Policy is set using the following criteria:
If the document does not contain a Date or Last-Modified header, do not cache.
If the document contains a Vary header, do not cache.
If the document contains an HTTP 1.1 Cache-Control header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine its cache-lifetime.
If the document contains an HTTP 1.0 Expires header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine its cache-lifetime.
If the document contains a Last-Modified header, cache and use the contents of that field in conjunction with the Date header to determine its cache-lifetime. The cache-lifetime cannot exceed 8 hours.

value.name: no-cache
value.description: Does not cache documents that match the URL expression.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Caches documents that match the URL expression. The TTL specifies the validity period for the document in seconds.

value.name: var://local/buffered-attachments
value.description: This variable returns data in the same format as the Attachment Manifest. However it only returns data for attachments that have been buffered in. It will not read more attachment data from the network as is the case for the Manifst.

value.name: var://local/attachment-content-ids
value.description: List of attachment identifiers (both content-location and content-id) including those that were processed through the system unbuffered (if multistep is told to save these attachment cids)

value.name: var://local/clone-attachments
value.summary: Copy the Attachments Into the Named Context
value.description: Copy the attachments in the context to the context with the name of the variable value. If the context does not exist it will be created. If the context does exist, any attachments in that context will be overwritten

value.name: var://local/set-root-content-id
value.summary: Set the content id for the root part
value.description: Set the content id for the root part

value.name: var://local/set-start-parameter
value.display: Set the start parameter of MIME content-type header
value.summary: Set the start parameter for the transport level multipart type
value.description: Set the start parameter for the transport level multipart related content type

value.name: var://local/_internal/ap_conformance/ap_cid
value.description: Internal variable used when creating multistep session for schema validating attachments for Attachment Profile. Indicates to current multistep session that input is an attachment (with content id the value of the variable) that should be validated against the wsdl

value.name: var://local/_internal/ap_conformance/results_err_msg
value.summary: Attachment Schema Validation Results Error Message
value.description: Internal variable used to store the error message when schema validating an attachment for Attachment Profile. Because the service://error_message will be cleared since we may be onError continue we need an additional variable to store attachment validation session errors

value.name: var://local/mime/conformance/results
value.description: Log of Attachment Profile 1.0 conformance failures for the attachments in this context

value.name: var://local/content-type
value.description: This variable returns the content-type value associated with a multistep context. It will return a multipart/related value if the context contains attachments.

value.name: var://local/_extension/responsecode
value.description: This variable is set on an Output context to indicate the protocol level response code of dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions. For instance, if an action of the form "results tmpvar2 http://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" was successful, the value "200" would be automatically written into the variable var://context/tmpvar3/_extension/responsecode.

value.name: var://local/_extension/header/
value.description: The variables of the form "_extension/header/*" can be set to append headers to the dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions connection when a context containing them is used as the Input context to an action. For example "setvar tmpvar2 var://local/_extension/header/X-foo bar" "results tmpvar2 http://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" would add the http header "X-foo: bar" to the HTTP request.

value.name: var://local/_extension/sslprofile
value.description: This variable can be set in the input context of a dp:url-open() extension function or in a results or fetch action to override the SSL profile used for that particular action. For instance, "results tmpvar2 https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" normally uses the SSL profile for any user-agent that matches against the url "https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp". But if the profile needed to be determined pragmatically, for example, based on AAA, you use the following code to dynamically resolve the value of *sslprofiletouse: "setvar tmpvar2 var://local/_extension/sslprofile var://context/notepad/sslprofiletouse" "results tmpvar2 https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3".

value.name: var://local/_extension/timeout
value.description: This variable can be set to override the default connection timeout parameters for this action when an action uses a context with these variables as its input. It is expressed in seconds.

value.name: var://local/_extension/response-header/
value.description: This variable in the output context of a dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions that contain the response headers.

value.name: var://local/_extension/response-headers
value.description: This variable in the output context of a dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions that contain the response header manifest.

value.name: var://local/_extension/allow-compression
value.description: This variable can be set to allow the compression of the outgoing results content and negotiate the returned document to be compressed if the underlying protocol supports it. If HTTP is being used that means the content-encoding and accept-encoding headers.

value.name: var://local/_extension/prevent-persistent-connection
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent persistent connections of the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. Wherever appropriate, persistent connections are supported by default.

value.name: var://local/_extension/donot-follow-redirect
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the following of protocol level redirect sequences on the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. Redirects are followed by default.

value.name: var://local/_extension/http-10-only
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the use of HTTP 1.1 when doing results and fetch actions on the related context.

value.name: var://local/_extension/error
value.description: This variable contains the error message, if any, from the last dp:transform(), dp:parse(), or dp:document() invocation. If the variable is empty, no error occurred. If an error occurs in any subsequent call to one of these functions, the existing error message, if any, will be overwritten.

value.name: var://local/_extension/donot-rewrite-host
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the rewriting of the HTTP Host header on the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. The HTTP Host header is rewritten by default.

type.name: dmFilesystemPartitionEncryption

value.name: None-Unsupported
value.description: None-unsupported

value.name: none
value.description: None

value.name: aes
value.description: AES encryption.

value.name: aesSha
value.description: AES encryption with SHA-1 hash.

type.description: Algorithm to encrypt the partition

type.name: dmFilesystemPurpose

value.name: localStorage
value.description: Partition for local storage.

value.name: b2bPersistence
value.description: Partition for B2B document storage.

type.summary: Gives the purpose of the RAID partition.
type.description: Gives the purpose of the RAID partition.

value.name: notify
value.description: Adds a log entry at the specified log priority.

value.name: reject
value.description: Rejects the transaction and adds a log entry at the specified log priority.

value.name: shape
value.description: Adds a log entry at the specified log priority. Messages are buffered and processed at a rate that is less than the threshold. When the buffer is full, messages are rejected.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The firewall communicates with the server that is identified by a remote IP address and remote port. The firewall can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: loopback-proxy
value.description: The firewall processes the incoming request using the selected policy and returns the result to the client. No server is involved. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: dynamic-backend
value.description: The firewall identifies the backend server by examining the request. The firewall can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

type.name: dmFirmwareType

value.name: primary
value.description: Primary firmware install

value.name: secondary
value.description: Secondary firmware install

type.description: Firmware install type

value.name: backend
value.summary: Retrieve forms from their mapped locations on the application server.

value.name: appliance
value.summary: Stores forms locally on the file system.

value.name: static
value.description: Use static HTML login, logout, and error pages from an explicit location. These HTML pages can be on the appliance or on a remote server.

value.name: custom
value.description: Use a custom stylesheet or a GatewayScript file that generates the HTML login, logout, error pages, and the form.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address
property.description: The address on which the service listens. The default of 0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Click Select Alias to use an alias for this value. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines. See Local Host Alias under Networking for more.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535, with a default of 3000) that specifies the port monitored by the stateful raw XML over TCP service.

property.name: UseSSL
property.summary: SSL for backside connections.
property.description: Use SSL for this front side server port. Make sure the SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile is configured on this object.

property.name: CredentialCharset
property.summary: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values
property.description: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The appliance transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. Defaults to Protocol which is ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

value.name: auth-off
value.description: Do not use the FTP AUTH command to encrypt the command connection. The username and password will be passed in the clear.

value.name: auth-tls-opt
value.description: Use the FTP AUTH TLS command to encrypt the command connection using TLS, if available.

value.name: auth-tls-req
value.description: Use the FTP AUTH TLS command to encrypt the command connection using TLS, fail if not available.

type.name: dmFTPCCCPolicy

value.name: ccc-off
value.description: Leave the FTP command connection encrypted after (optional) authentication with the USER and PASS commands. The command connection will remain secure, but will be incompatible with NAT and many firewalls.

value.name: ccc-opt
value.description: Use the FTP CCC command to request the end of encryption on the command connection using TLS, if supported by the server.

value.name: ccc-req
value.description: Use the FTP CCC command to request the end of encryption on the command connection using TLS, fail if the server does not support CCC. (Very few server support CCC.) Required for compatibility with NAT and many firewalls.

type.display: FTP Stop Encryption After Authentication Policy

value.name: disallow
value.description: Does not allow the FTP client to encrypt data connections.

value.name: allow
value.description: Allows, but does not require, the FTP client to encrypt data connections. TLS must be allowed on data connections.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires the FTP client to encrypt data connections. TLS should be required on data connections.

value.name: enc-data-off
value.description: Even when the command channel is encrypted, do not encrypt FTP data connections. Use the FTP PROT C command when the command channel is or has been encrypted.

value.name: enc-data-opt
value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Do not fail if server does not support data encryption.

value.name: enc-data-req
value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Fail if server does not support data encryption.

value.name: ascii
value.description: Transfer files as ASCII data. This mode allow standardization of end-of-line conventions between different operating systems. This mode increases the overhead at both ends. Uses the FTP TYPE A command.

value.name: binary
value.description: Transfer files as image data. This mode transfers data as binary 8-bit bytes. This mode is more efficient (less overhead at both ends). Some XML files, such as signed files, must be transferred in this mode. Uses the FTP TYPE I command.

value.name: virtual-ephemeral
value.description: The FTP server will have an ephemeral virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are private to an individual FTP control connection to the FTP server. The contents of this file system will not persist after this FTP control connection ends.

value.name: virtual-persistent
value.description: The FTP server will have a persistent virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are shared by all FTP control connections to this FTP server with the same authenticated user identity. The user identity is determined by the FTP user name and, if used, by the TLS/SSL certificate. The contents of this file system will persist after all FTP control connections end for a duration defined by Persistent Filesystem Timeout. This mode is required to support checkpoint/restart using the REST command.

value.name: transparent
value.description: The FTP server has a transparent file system. The files and directories shown are those on the back end of the associated Multi-Protocol Gateway.

value.name: allow
value.description: Allows, but does not require, the FTP client to use the PASV command to open data connections to the FTP server.

value.name: disallow
value.description: Does not allow the FTP client to use the PASV command to open data connections to the FTP server. The FTP server will open all data connections to the FTP client (as directed by the FTP PORT command). This mode is not always compatible with firewalls.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires the FTP client to use the PASV command to open all data connections with the FTP server. This mode is useful when the FTP server is behind a firewall device that requires clients to use passive mode.

value.name: pasv-off
value.description: Do not use the FTP PASV command to allow the client to open the FTP data connections. The FTP server will open all data connections to the FTP client. Often incompatible with firewalls

value.name: pasv-opt
value.description: Use the FTP PASV command to request that the FTP client be allowed to open all data connections to the FTP server, but do not fail if the server does not support PASV.

value.name: pasv-req
value.description: Use the FTP PASV command to request that the FTP client be allowed to open all data connections to the FTP server, and fail if the server does not support PASV.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Passive
property.summary: Controls use of FTP Passive mode
property.description: Select how to use the FTP Passive mode to control in which direction FTP data connections are made.

property.name: AuthTLS
property.summary: Controls use of TLS to secure connections
property.description: Select how to use TLS to secure FTP command connections.

property.name: UseCCC
property.summary: Stops command encryption after authentication
property.description: Select how to control the cessation of FTP command channel encryption after user authentication. Encryption must be stopped for compatibility with NAT (Network Address Translation) and other firewall applications. Although this might be a security risk, there is no other option when NAT is in use.

property.name: EncryptData
property.summary: Controls encryption file transfers
property.description: Select how to control encryption of file transfers. Compatible with NAT in all settings.

property.name: DataType
property.summary: Data type of file transfer
property.description: Select the default file transfer data type. In most cases, the value of binary is appropriate.

property.name: SlashSTOU
property.display: Write Unique Filename if Trailing Slash
property.summary: Creates a unique file if the name contains a trailing slash

description.p: Select how to create unique files if the name contains a trailing slash.

Some FTP servers provide the STOU command. Use the command only if the FTP server supports this command. The STOU command allows the server to choose the unique file name in the current directory. Using the STOU command does not require the client to choose a unique file name.
When enabled and a URL is given to write that ends in a /, the server uses the STOU command instead of the STOR command.

property.name: QuotedCommands
property.summary: Quoted Commands
property.description: This specifies a list of FTP commands to be sent to the server before each FTP STOR, STOU, or RETR command. A typical use would be to use "SITE" commands, such as "SITE RECFM=FB" for the MVS domain on a z/OS system. These commands cannot be data-transfer related, such as STOU, RETR, PORT, PASV, etc.

property.name: SizeCheck
property.summary: Perform Size check after file transfer
property.description: If set to Optional, do a size check after the file transfer is complete. This uses the SIZE command, and compares the returned number to the number of bytes transferred "over the wire" for the file transfer. If the number is not equal, the file transfer is marked as failing. If the FTP server does not support the SIZE command, no error results. Some FTP servers, particulary vsftpd in the default configuration, provide inaccurate SIZE responses for files transferred in ASCII mode. If you get such errors, you can disable this feature. (Alternately you can reconfigure vsftpd.)

property.name: QuotedCommand
property.summary: Quoted Command
property.description: The command to send to the remote FTP server. The command must not be one that would create an FTP data connection. Normally this will be a SITE command. This command must return a result code in the 200 series.

value.name: temporary
value.description: Stores response files in temporary storage on the system. This storage has limited size. Using temporary storage reduces the available system storage for processing. Temporary storage should not be used when using a virtual persistent file system. In virtual persistent file systems, it is highly unlikely that there would be enough space. After a system restart or power cycle, response files are not available.

value.name: nfs
value.description: Stores response files on the top level directory of the specified NFS server. Only the NFS server limits the storage space.

value.name: none
value.description: Indicates that no response is made available to the client. Any response from the backend server is dropped.

value.name: virtual-filesystem
value.description: Indicates that the response is made available as a file in the virtual file system that can be read by the FTP client. The directory for responses is configured on a per-virtual directory basis. The suffix specified by Response Suffix is added to the input file name and stored in the directory specified by Response Storage.

property.name: VirtualPath
property.summary: Directory in virtual file system of the FTP server
property.description: Enter the directory in the virtual file system of the FTP server where the FTP client can find this directory.

property.name: ResponseDirectory
property.summary: Virtual directory in which to put responses
property.description: Enter the directory in the virtual file system of the FTP server where the responses to files that are stored in this directory will go.

value.name: size-check-optional
value.description: If the FTP SIZE command is available, uses this command to check the file transfer size after file transfer.

value.name: size-check-disabled
value.description: Do not check file size after transfer.

description.p: Always use the supplied file name in the URL to generate the target file name requested on the server. If the URL ends in a slash, the request generally fails.
Uses the FTP STOR command to initiate the transfer. The STOR command is only a directory specification, without a file name specification.

value.name: slash-stou-on
value.display: Request Unique File Name When Trailing Slash

description.p: If the supplied file name ends in a slash, use the STOU command to write a unique file name. The slash must be before the ? that initiates the query parameters or before the ; that begins the suffix.

Uses the FTP STOU command to intiate the transfer and requests that the server generate a unique file name within the target directory. This approach is the only safe way to have multiple systems write files to the same directory without overwriting any files.
The transfer fails if the FTP server does not support the STOU command.

value.name: Request
value.summary: Runs actions in request rule in order
value.description: Enforces serial processing of the actions defined for request processing, excluding serial transmission of messages to the backend request queue. An action always sends messages to queue-based destinations in the order that they were pulled from the front-side request queue. If a later message arrives for processing by the action before an earlier message, the service buffers this message until after the action completes processing for the earlier message.

value.name: Backend
value.description: Enforces serial transmission of messages to the backend request queue. The output of request processing always sends messages to the backend request queue in the order that they were pulled from the front-side request queue. If a later message arrives for transmission before an earlier message, the service buffers this message until after transmitting the earlier message.

value.name: Response
value.summary: Runs actions in response rule in order

description.p: Enforces serial processing of the actions defined for response processing, including serial transmission of messages to the front-side reply queue.

ul.li: An action always sends messages to queue-based destinations in the order that were pulled from the backend reply queue.
The output of response processing always sends messages to the front-side reply queue in the order that were pulled from the backend reply queue.

description.p: If a later message arrives for processing by the action before an earlier message or a later message arrives for transmission to the front-side reply queue before an earlier message, the service buffers the message at this point until after processing the earlier message.

type.description: Internal state of currently active transactions on Multi-Protocol Gateway and WS-Proxy objects in this application domain.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The gateway sends all requests to the URL defined by the backend URL. The format of the URL determines the protocol that is used for the backend (server) communication.

value.name: dynamic-backend
value.description: The gateway determines the URL of the backend server dynamically during request processing. The URL determines the protocol used for the backend communication. Use this mode if any of the Front Side Handlers is Stateful Raw XML.

value.name: REPLAY
value.summary: GSS_C_REPLAY_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether replay of protected messages will be detected

value.name: SEQUENCE
value.summary: GSS_C_SEQUENCE_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether out of sequence protected messages will be detected

value.name: CONF
value.summary: GSS_C_CONF_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether confidentiality service may be provided

value.name: INTEG
value.summary: GSS_C_INTEG_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether integrity service may be provided

property.name: Direction
property.summary: Direction of the message
property.description: Select the direction of the message.

property.name: HeaderTag
property.summary: Name of the injected header
property.description: Enter the name of the header to inject. Even though the headers are not defined in the original request, the device provides the specified headers to the backend server.

property.name: HeaderTagValue
property.summary: Value for the injected header
property.description: Enter the value for the header tag.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: HeaderRetention
property.summary: Header Retention
property.description: Transactions matching this policy retain this header in the outgoing traffic at the backend.

property.name: Direction
property.summary: Direction of the message
property.description: Select the direction of the message.

property.name: HeaderTag
property.summary: Name of the suppressed header
property.description: Enter the name of the header to suppress. When these headers are defined in the original request, the device removes the specified headers before forwarding the request to the backend server.

type.name: dmHostToSSLServerProfile

property.name: HostNameWildmat
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern for matching host names.
property.description: Specify a match pattern for use against the host name in the incoming ClientHello SNI extension.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: SSL server profile
property.description: Specify the SSL Server Profile to use in response to a host name that matches the pattern.

type.display: Map Host Name to SSL Server Profile
type.summary: Host Name to SSL Server Profile mapping
type.description: This map allows virtual SSL server configuration where different SSL Server Profiles can be used in response to the host name value in the SSL client's SNI extension. In this way, a single IP address and TCP port can be used to host multiple SSL Servers with separate cryptographic keys and certificates.

property.name: Front
property.summary: Client-side HTTP version
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the client-side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: Back
property.summary: Server-side HTTP version
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the server-side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of an HTTP header field
property.description: Enter the name of the HTTP header field to be examined.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The value of HTTP Header field

description.p: Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a set of values to include in or exclude from the traffic definition. If the contents of the specified header field fulfill the defined match criterion, the match succeeds.
The following wildcard characters are available:

tr.td: Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
Matches one occurrence of any single character

Defines a character or numeric range.
For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

value.name: front
value.description: The message travels from the DataPower device to the client.

value.name: back
value.description: The message travels from the DataPower device to the backend server.

type.name: dmHTTPInputEncoding

value.name: plain
value.description: The expected encoding is plain text and the requested processing is to XML escape the input. All <, >, and & characters are replaced by <, >, and & respectively. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.

value.name: urlencoded
value.description: The expected encoding is URL-encoded, as in HTML forms, and the requested processing is to URL unescape, then XML escape the input. All <, >, and & characters are replaced by <, >, and & respectively.

value.name: xml
value.description: The expected encoding is an XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form <?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded XML, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.

value.name: urlencoded-xml
value.description: The expected encoding is a URL-encoded XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form <?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly.

value.name: base64
value.description: The expected encoding is Base 64 and the requested processing is to pass the input through but add the XML attribute encoding="base64" to the generated <arg> element for each argument which has this input encoding. If the base 64 data should include any illegal <, >, or & character, it is replaced by <, >, and & respectively.

value.name: base64-xml
value.summary: The value is a Base64 encoded XML fragment (decoded).

value.name: json
value.description: The expected encoding is a JSON structure and the requested processing is convert to XML according to the JSONx XML specification. JSON content cannot be specified as part of a multipart form and is only supported as the default encoding. When specifying JSON as the default encoding type, a name-value encoding map is not used.

type.description: Controls how the value in an HTTP form is traslated to generate XML. All of the options start with URL-decoding, except in an HTTP MIME POST. URL-decoding is not required for an HTTP MIME POST.

value.name: GET
value.summary: Match against the HTTP GET method.

value.name: POST
value.summary: Match against the HTTP POST method.

value.name: PUT
value.summary: Match against the HTTP PUT method.

value.name: DELETE
value.summary: Match against the HTTP DELETE method.

value.name: HEAD
value.summary: Match against the HTTP HEAD method.

value.name: OPTIONS
value.summary: Match against the HTTP OPTIONS method.

value.name: TRACE
value.summary: Match against the HTTP TRACE method.

value.name: default
value.summary: Match against the HTTP GET or POST method.

value.name: POST
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP POST method type

value.name: GET
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP GET method type

value.name: PUT
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP PUT method type

value.name: DELETE
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP DELETE method type

value.summary: Specifies the HTTP HEAD method type

value.name: POST
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP POST method type

value.name: GET
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP GET method type

value.name: PUT
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP PUT method type

value.name: DELETE
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP DELETE method type

value.name: HEAD
value.summary: Specifies the HTTP HEAD method type

type.name: dmHTTPResponseCodes

value.name: HTTP-100
value.summary: The client continues with its request

value.name: HTTP-101
value.summary: The server uses the Upgrade message header field to change HTTP version or protocol

value.name: HTTP-201
value.summary: The request succeeded and created a new resource

value.name: HTTP-202
value.summary: The request accepted for processing, but processing not complete

value.name: HTTP-203
value.summary: The request accepted, but the returned information is from a local or third-party copy

value.name: HTTP-204
value.summary: The request accepted and might return meta-information that does not change view

value.name: HTTP-205
value.summary: The request accepted and the view reset

value.name: HTTP-206
value.summary: The server fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource

value.name: HTTP-300
value.summary: The request matches one of a set of representations, and a choice must be made

value.name: HTTP-301
value.summary: The server returned the new permanent URI for a link

value.name: HTTP-302
value.summary: The resource temporarily resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-303
value.summary: The resource resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-304
value.summary: The client is using a local, cached copy

value.name: HTTP-305
value.summary: The request resource accessed through a proxy

value.name: HTTP-307
value.summary: The resource temporarily resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-400
value.summary: The server does not understand the request because of syntax

value.name: HTTP-402
value.summary: The request requires a charge-to header

value.name: HTTP-403
value.summary: The server understood the request and denied access

value.name: HTTP-404
value.summary: The server could not find the resource

value.name: HTTP-405
value.summary: The resource does not allow the specified method

value.name: HTTP-406
value.summary: The resource cannot generate a response because the contents are not acceptable

value.name: HTTP-407
value.summary: The request requires user authentication through a proxy

value.name: HTTP-408
value.summary: The client did not response to the server in the allocated time

value.name: HTTP-409
value.summary: The request could not complete because of a conflict is resource state

value.name: HTTP-410
value.summary: The resource is no longer on the server and no redirection known

value.name: HTTP-411
value.summary: The server refused the request because the Content-Length header is absent

value.name: HTTP-412
value.summary: A precondition in a request-header field evaluated to false

value.name: HTTP-413
value.summary: The server refused the request because it is too large

value.name: HTTP-500
value.summary: The server encountered an unexpected error and cannot process request

value.name: HTTP-503
value.summary: The server cannot process the request because the service is not available

type.summary: HTTP response codes that are allowed

value.name: normal
value.description: The server returns the requested documents.

value.name: echo
value.description: The server returns the GET and POST requests that it receives.

value.name: Echo-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP echo requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP echo requests.

value.name: Timestamp-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP timestamp requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP timestamp requests.

value.name: Info-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP information requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP information requests.

value.name: Addressmask-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP address mask requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP address map requests.

value.name: ZIP
value.description: Imports the configuration from a compressed ZIP bundle.

value.name: XML
value.description: Imports configuration from the exported XML configuration files.

property.name: InputMatch
property.summary: The PCRE to match an HTTP form name against.
property.description: The PCRE pattern that will be matched against the name of an HTTP form field. If the name matches this PCRE, the associated value will be processed by the rules of the Encoding. If a form field has no name, an empty string is used for the pattern matching.

property.name: Encoding
property.summary: The Encoding used for values whose name matches the Input Match
property.description: Select how to translate the value of a form field to the contents of the <arg> element in the generated XML.

value.name: up
value.description: The administrative state of the interface is enabled. The goal operational state is down.

value.name: down
value.description: The administrative state of the interface is disabled. The goal operational state is down.

value.name: testing
value.description: Some testing mode (not used yet)

value.name: up
value.description: The interface is operationally up.

value.name: down
value.description: The interface is operationally down.

value.name: testing
value.description: Some testing mode. After the test completes, the status changes as appropriate.

value.name: unknown
value.description: Cannot determine the operational state of the interface.

value.name: dormant
value.description: The interface is waiting for a connection.

value.name: notPresent
value.description: The interface is not present.

value.name: lowerLayerDown
value.description: The required lower layer is down.

value.name: ok
value.description: Indicates that all networking is up on the appliance.

value.name: linkErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more ethernet links are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: vlanErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more VLANs are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: aggErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: linkVlanErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more ethernet links and VLANs are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: linkAggErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more ethernet links and Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: vlanAggErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more VLANs and Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: allErrors
value.summary: Errors exist in all networking types
value.description: Indicates that one or more ethernet links, VLANs, and Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: Ethernet
value.description: Indicates that it is on the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: Tunnel
value.description: Indicates that it is on a encapsulation interface.

value.name: VLAN
value.description: Indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: Aggregate
value.description: Indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.3ad Link Aggregation composed of one of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

description.p: Refers to network interfaces that you cannot configure. Examples of other interface types include gre0 , ip6tnl0 , lo , sit0 , and usb0 . Not all appliances have all of these other interface types.

value.name: static
value.description: The configuration is static. Manually define the required properties.

value.name: dhcp
value.description: The configuration uses IPv4 autoconfiguration with DHCP.

value.name: slaac
value.description: The configuration uses IPv6 autoconfiguration with SLAAC.

value.display: Transition to non-critical from more severe

property.name: UserID
property.summary: The User Name of the user to enable
property.description: The name of an IPMI user to enable on this LAN channel.

property.name: PrivilegeLevel
property.summary: Maximum privilege level of user on channel
property.description: The maximum privilege level to allow the user on this LAN channel. If this value is greater than the maximum privilege level for the channel itself, the maximum privilege level of the channel is the effective limit.

property.name: SOLEnabled
property.summary: User can use serial over LAN on channel
property.description: Whether to allow the user to use the serial over LAN protocol (payload) over Remote Control and Management Protocol Plus (RCMP+) on this LAN channel. When enabled, The user can use serial over LAN provided that the user has a privilege level equivalent to or greater than the minimum required privilege level for serial over LAN.

property.name: MaxSimultaneousSessions
property.summary: Maximum simultaneous sessions for user on channel
property.description: The maximum number of simultaneous sessions to allow the user on this LAN channel. The minimum value is 0, and the maximum value is 7. If 0, there is no limit.

value.description: Use IPv6 to identify the remote host.
Use IPv4 to identify the remote host.

value.name: default
value.summary: Use the default IP version for DNS settings.
value.description: Use the IP version that is defined in the DNS settings configuration.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Enter the name of the new directory.
property.description: Specifies the name that identifies the new directory.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: Enter the host name of the directory server.
property.description: Specifies the host name of the directory server.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Enter the port to communicate with the directory.
property.description: Specifies the port that is used to communicate with the directory.

property.name: Suffix
property.summary: Enter the suffixes to add for the new directory.
property.description: Specifies the suffixes that are added for the new directory. To add multiple suffixes, separate each suffix with a comma (,).

property.name: BindDN
property.summary: Enter the DN to authenticate with the directory.
property.description: Specifies the distinguished name (DN) that is used to authenticate with the directory.

property.name: BindPassword
property.summary: Enter the password to authenticate with the directory.
property.description: Specifies the password that is used to authenticate with the directory.

property.name: SSL
property.summary: Indicate whether to enable SSL to secure the communication with the directory.
property.description: Specifies whether to enable SSL to secure the communication with the directory.

property.name: ClientCert
property.summary: Specify the client personal certificate for SSL communication with the federated directory.
property.description: Specifies the client personal certificate for SSL communication with the federated directory. The key file must be specified in order to specify the client certificate. If the key file is specified, but the client certificate is not, the default client certificate within the key file is used. The client certificate cannot be specified when the client cryptographic profile is specified.

property.name: CryptoProfile
property.summary: Specify the cryptographic profile for SSL communication with the federated directory.
property.description: Specifies the cryptographic profile for SSL communication with the federated directory. The cryptographic profile cannot be specified when the client cryptographic profile or the key file are specified.

value.name: remote

value.description: External authentication interface

value.description: None

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: Enter the DNS host name or IP address of the target server.
property.description: The DNS host name or IP address of the target server. For example, www.example.com

property.name: Port
property.summary: Enter the TCP or SSL port of the back-end third-party server.
property.description: The TCP or SSL port of the back-end third-party server. The default value is 80.

property.name: VirtualHost
property.summary: Enter the value of the Host header of the request that is sent to the back-end server.
property.description: The value of the Host header of the request that is sent to the back-end server.

property.name: VirtualHostPort
property.summary: Enter the virtual host port number.
property.description: The port number is required if the virtual host uses a non-standard port for the protocol. Standard port for TCP is 80. Standard port for SSL is 443.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Enter the IP address that is used to communicate with the target server.
property.description: The local IP address that the Access Manager Reverse Proxy uses when it communicates with the target server.

property.name: QueryContents
property.summary: Enter the path for the query_contents program file.
property.description: Provides the Access Manager Reverse Proxy with the correct name of the query_contents program file and where to find the file.

property.name: ServerUUID
property.summary: Enter the UUID of the target server.
property.description: The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) of the target server that is connected to the Access Manager Reverse Proxy by using a stateful junction.

property.name: DN
property.summary: Enter the distinguished name of the server certificate.
property.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the server certificate.

property.name: WindowsFSSupport
property.summary: Indicate whether to enable Microsoft Windows file system support.
property.description: Enable or disable Microsoft Windows file system support. When enabled, the server does not allow the 8.3 file name format and trailing dots in directory and file names. In addition, the Access Manager Reverse Proxy automatically treats URLs as case insensitive when it performs authorization checks on a request to a junctioned server.

property.name: URLCaseInsensitive
property.summary: Indicate whether to treat URLs as case insensitive.
property.description: Enable or disable URL case insensitivity. When enabled, the Access Manager Reverse Proxy server treats URLs as not case-sensitive when it performs authorization checks on a request to a target server.

value.name: none
value.description: None

value.name: filter
value.description: Removes all basic authentication header information from any client requests before forwarding the requests to the back-end server.

value.name: ignore
value.description: Passes the original client basic authentication header information to the back-end server without modification.

value.name: supply
value.description: Supplies the authenticated Security Access Manager user name (client's original identity) with a static, generic password.

value.name: gso
value.description: Supplies the back-end server with authentication information (user name and password) obtained from a server that is set up to handle global sign-on (GSO).

value.name: never
value.description: Disable client certificate authentication.

value.name: required
value.description: Always request a client certificate. Do not accept the connection if the client does not present a certificate.

value.name: prompt
value.description: Do not prompt for a client certificate until the client attempts to access a resource that requires certificate authentication.

value.name: optional
value.description: Always request a client certificate. If presented, use it.

property.summary: Enter the name of the domain.
property.description: The name of the domain that participates in the e-community.

value.name: none
value.description: Disables header encoding.

value.name: utf8_bin
value.description: Send the headers in UTF-8 binary.

value.name: utf8_uri
value.description: Send the headers in UTF-8 binary and URI encodes them.

value.name: lcp_bin
value.description: Send the headers in the local code page of the Access Manager Reverse Proxy server.

value.name: lcp_uri
value.description: Send the headers in the local code page of the Access Manager Reverse Proxy server and URI encodes them.

value.name: iv-user
value.description: Provides the user name (short form) to the iv-user HTTP header of the request.

value.name: iv-user-l
value.description: Provides the full distinguished name of the user (long form) to the iv-user-l HTTP header of the request.

value.name: iv-groups
value.description: Provides the user's list of groups to the iv-groups HTTP header of the request.

value.name: iv-creds
value.description: Provides the user's credential information to the iv-creds HTTP header of the request.

value.name: none
value.description: None

value.name: trailer
