value.summary: Get SLA policy enforcement mode (allow or reject)

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/gateway-name
value.display: Name of the gateway enforcing wspolicy
value.summary: Get the name of the Gateway

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/correlator-id
value.display: Policy Correlator ID for the current transaction
value.summary: Connects the generated Policy with a WSDL.

value.name: var://service/conformance/generatedPolicy
value.display: WS-Proxy Conformance Policy Name generated from WS-Policy
value.summary: WS-Proxy Conformance Policy Name generated from WS-Policy

value.name: var://service/multistep/input-context-name
value.summary: Input context name to current processing action

value.name: var://service/multistep/output-context-name
value.summary: Output context name to current processing action

value.name: var://service/multistep/loop-iterator
value.description: Get the loop iterator for the innermost for-each action. If the for-each action is set to run with a fixed iteration count, this variable retrieves the input context of the loop action. If the loop runs over a node-set, this retrieves the current element within the node-set.

value.name: var://service/multistep/loop-count
value.description: Get the current loop count for the innermost for-each action. If the current action is the first action run within the loop returns 1; the second action, 2; and so on.

value.name: var://service/multistep/tx-warn
value.description: Get the WTX warning messages from the transforming process. When the DPA file has defined warning conditions and you have enabled the WTX warning option in XML Manager configuration, this variable returns the warning message if the transforming process meets the warning conditions.

value.name: var://service/wsm/http-parsed-url-replacement
value.display: WSDL HTTP Binding Parsed URL Replacement Algorithm
value.summary: WSDL HTTP Binding Parsed URL Replacement Algorithm

value.name: var://service/wsm/wsdl-content-type
value.summary: The HTTP Content-Type specified by the WSDL

value.name: var://service/b2b-message-id
value.description: The message ID of the received B2B document. For outbound transactions, the value could be set in processing policy to customize the ID.

value.name: var://service/b2b-partner-destination
value.description: The destination where the document will be routed. The value of this variable must match an existing destination configured in partner profile.

value.name: var://service/b2b-doc-type
value.description: Type of EDI message being transferred through a B2B gateway. This may have one of the string values "x12", "edifact", "xml", or "binary".

value.name: var://service/b2b-routing-stylesheet
value.summary: Stylesheet to handle outbound document routing
value.description: URL of a stylesheet that handles routing for outbound documents. This may determine or override the document type and trading or receiving partner IDs. It is set from configuration.

value.name: var://service/b2b-xpath-routing-info
value.summary: XPaths used for outbound document routing for XML EDI messages
value.description: The value of this variable is an XML tree containing sets of routing XPaths used for routing outbound XML EDI messages. This may determine or override the document type and trading or receiving partner IDs. It is set from configuration.

value.name: var://service/b2b-incoming-as
value.description: True if incoming message came in on AS fsph, false otherwise

value.name: var://service/b2b-signed-message-b64mic-and-alg
value.display: B2B Signed Message Base64 Encoded MIC And Algorithm
value.summary: B2B Signed Message Base64 Encoded MIC And Algorithm
value.description: Base64 encoded string of the mic digest calculated over the data in an incoming signed message, plus the digest algorithm used.

value.name: var://service/b2b-aaa-policy-name
value.description: Name of the AAA Policy attached to the frontside protocol handler, if any.

value.name: var://service/b2b-process-attachment-as-payload
value.display: B2B Process Email Attachment As Payload
value.summary: B2B Process Email Attachment As Payload
value.description: First attachment in message received over POP3 FSPH is used for B2B payload

value.name: var://service/b2b-save-sink-protocol-contents
value.description: Save copy of on-the-wire contents for B2B viewer and archive. True if protocol is AS or incoming is non-AS.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-from-partyid-type
value.description: The type of the ebXML party ID. When this variable is set and the associated party ID is not configured as DUNS or DUNS+4 type, the value is used during ebMS message packaging process.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-to-partyid-type
value.description: The type of the ebXML party ID. When this variable is set and the associated party ID is not configured as DUNS or DUNS+4 type, the value is used during ebMS message packaging process.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-utc-timestamp
value.summary: The current timestamp in UTC format.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-timestamp-in-received-message
value.summary: The timestamp in the incoming message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/sync-reply
value.summary: If the inbound ebXML message requests a sync reply.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/sync-reply
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request a sync reply.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/ack-requested
value.summary: If the inbound ebXML message requests an acknowledgement.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/ack-requested
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request an acknowledgement.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/ack-signature-requested
value.summary: If the inbound ebXML message requests the signatures in the acknowledgement.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/ack-signature-requested
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request the signatures in the acknowledgement.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/duplicate-elimination
value.summary: If the inbound ebXML message requests duplicate elimination.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/duplicate-elimination
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request duplicate elimination.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/time-to-live
value.summary: The expiration date of the inbound ebXML message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/time-to-live
value.summary: The expiration date of the inbound ebXML message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-type-to-send
value.summary: The type of the ebXML message to send.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-type-received
value.summary: The type of the received ebXML message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-digests
value.summary: The ebXML message digests generated for the packaging message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-parsed-msg-digests
value.summary: The ebXML message digests parsed from incoming message (either an inbound User message, or asynchronous Ack or a synchronous Ack).

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error/error-code
value.description: The error code for the ebXML error message. It indicates the nature of the error in the message in error.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error/description
value.description: The description for the ebXML error message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error/location
value.description: The location for the ebXML error message. It points to the part of the ebXML message containing the error.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-ack-url
value.description: The URL to return asynchronous acknowledgement message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error-url
value.description: The URL to return asynchronous error message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-partner-from-role
value.description: The role of the 'from' partner.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-partner-to-role
value.description: The role of the 'to' partner.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-cpa-id
value.description: The CPA Id used in the ebXML message. It is a string that identifies the parameters governing the exchange of messages between two parties.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-conversation-id
value.description: The conversation Id of the ebXML message. It is used to identified the set of related messages that make up a conversation between two parties.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-service
value.description: The service of the ebXML message. It identifies the service that acts on the message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-service-type
value.description: The service type of the ebXML message. It identifies the type that acts on the message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-action
value.description: The action of the ebXML message. It identifies a process within a Service that processes the message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-ref-to-message-id
value.description: The message id of an earlier ebXML message to which this message relates.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-signing-key
value.description: Key used when signing an ebms2 message

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-signing-cert
value.description: Cert used when signing an ebms2 message

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-signing-alg
value.description: Algorithm used when signing an ebms2 message

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-signing-hash-alg
value.description: Hash algorithm used to combute digests of signed ebms2 message

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-signing-c14n-alg
value.description: Canonicalization algorithm used before doing XML Signature

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-encr-recipient
value.description: Certificate used to encrypt ebms2 message

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-encr-algorithm
value.description: Symmetric algorithm used to encrypt ebms2 message

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-decrypt-idcred
value.summary: Key used to decrypt the incoming ebMS2 message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-verify-valcred
value.summary: Id credential used to verify the incoming ebMS2 message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-default-signer-cert
value.summary: Default signer certificate used to verify the incoming ebMS2 message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-encrypted
value.summary: Identify whether the received ebMS2 message is encrypted

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-signed
value.summary: Identify whether the received ebMS2 message is signed

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-status-response-msg-status
value.summary: The messageStatus to be responded to inbound StatusRequest, or received from outbound StatusRequest.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-packaging-ctx
value.summary: The context to be packaged in ebMS format

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/header-parser-completed
value.summary: An internal stage used to match partner profiles and identify CPA collaboration based on inbound ebMS message header at transaction time.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/generate-start-parameter
value.summary: Indicator of whether we should generate the start parameter for the Content-Type header of ebMS outbound message

value.name: var://service/b2b-preserve-filename
value.summary: Indicator of whether to expose content-disposition header of the body of AS message for filename preservation

value.name: var://service/b2b-document-routing-preprocessor-type
value.summary: Configured value of B2B Gateway Document Routing Preprocessor Type

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/message-sign-required
value.summary: Get whether the incoming B2B message must be signed
value.description: This variable gets whether the incoming B2B message must be signed. If yes, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/message-signature-verified
value.summary: Get whether the B2B message signature is verified
value.description: This variable gets whether the signature of the incoming B2B message is verified. If yes, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/message-encrypt-required
value.summary: Get whether the incoming messages must be encrypted
value.description: This variable gets whether the incoming B2B message must be encrypted. If yes, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/message-decrypted
value.summary: Get whether the B2B message is decrypted
value.description: This variable gets whether the incoming B2B message is decrypted. If yes, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/is-mdn
value.summary: Get whether the received message is an MDN
value.description: This variable gets whether the incoming message is an MDN (Message Disposition Notification). If true, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/passthru-enabled
value.summary: Get whether the passthrough mode is enabled in the AS2 Proxy Front Side Handler
value.description: This variable gets whether the passthrough mode is enabled in the AS2 Proxy Front Side Handler. If yes, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/integration-id
value.description: This variable gets the auto-generated ID for integration with other B2B systems, for example, IBM Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway. The integration ID can be used to correlate events associated with one transaction.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/b2b-partner-from
value.summary: Get the B2B From Partner ID
value.description: This variable gets the from partner's ID that is extracted from the B2B messaging protocol header, such as AS2-From.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/b2b-partner-to
value.summary: Get the B2B To Partner ID
value.description: This variable gets the to partner' ID that is extracted from the B2B messaging protocol header, such as AS2-To.

value.name: var://service/b2b-proxy/b2b-message-id
value.description: This variable gets the unique message ID that is extracted from the B2B messaging protocol header, such as Message-Id.

value.name: var://service/rewrite-errors
value.summary: Control whether SOAP faults generated within the request rule will be replaced with a generic error text, rather than the reason specified when the fault was generated. If set to 0, rewriting is disabled; if set to 1, rewriting is forced. When set to -1 (the default), rewriting will be done if the processing rule has performed an action that could result in an oracle. In addition to this variable, rewriting may be disabled by the rewrite-errors service configuration parameter.

value.name: var://service/original-response-content-type
value.summary: Get Original Response Content-Type Header Value
value.description: Returns the original response Content-Type header value. The value remains unmodified and is not subject to both service header rewrites and multistep header rewrites.

value.name: var://service/preserve-mime-encapsulation
value.summary: Control whether to preserve MIME encapsulation
value.description: When enabled and the request or response was encapsulated with MIME, regardless of the number of entity parts, preserve encapsulation. This variable is meaningful with multipart messages with only one part.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/proxy-content-type
value.summary: Force the service to pass the Content-Type header unchanged
value.description: The variable controls whether the Content-Type header is preserved and under what conditions it can be modified, based on its value for each processing action and at the end of the processing rule. It can be set on both the request and response rules. If set in a request rule, the setting affects only the header sent to the backend server. The service variable must be set again in the response rule to specify this behavior for the header sent to the client. This variable does not prevent modification of the Content-Type header by applying transformation policy actions.

value.name: var://service/gatewayscript/debug-enabled
value.display: Control of GatewayScript Debbuger at Service Level
value.summary: Control whether to enable debugger based on B2B Gateway setting, beside the action setting
value.description: An internal variable. Currently used only by B2B Gateway internal logics to enable GatewayScript debugger run on the Document Routing Preprocessor.

value.name: var://service/gatewayscript/enable-eval
value.display: Enable GatewayScript dynamic code evaluation per transaction
value.summary: Enable GatewayScript dynamic code evaluation per transaction
value.description: Enable GatewayScript dynamic code evaluation (eval() and function constructor) per transaction

value.name: Processing
value.summary: Service Version is being processed for configuration and schema

value.name: Okay
value.summary: Service Version was loaded and is running.

value.name: Warning
value.summary: A warning was generated while loading the Service Version.

value.name: Error
value.summary: An error prevented the Service Version from being loaded.

value.name: transparent
value.description: The SFTP server has a transparent file system. The files and directories shown are those on the back end of the associated Multi-Protocol Gateway.

value.name: virtual-ephemeral
value.description: The SFTP server will have an ephemeral virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are private to an individual SFTP connection to the SFTP server. The contents of this file system will not persist after this SFTP connection ends.

value.name: virtual-persistent
value.description: The SFTP server will have a persistent virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are shared by all SFTP connections to this SFTP server with the same authenticated user identity. The user identity is determined by the SFTP user name. The contents of this file system will persist after all SFTP connections end for a duration defined by Persistent Filesystem Timeout.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: SSHClientProfile
property.summary: SSH client profile
property.description: Specifies the SSH client profile to be used for this SFTP Client policy.

property.name: UseUniqueFilenames
property.summary: Use unique file names
property.description: Specifies whether or not to generate a unique file name for files written to an SSH FTP server. When the Backend URL represents a directory, a unique file name is generated. When the Backend URL represents a file name that already exists in the remote server, any transfers result into a new unique file being created and its name will be modified to include a unique prolog.

property.name: VirtualPath
property.summary: Directory in virtual file system of the SFTP server
property.description: Specifies the directory in the virtual file system of the SFTP server.

value.name: reboot
value.description: Restarts the DataPower Gateway.

value.name: reload
value.description: Reloads the firmware.

value.name: halt
value.description: Stops the DataPower Gateway, but power remains on. This mode is deprecated. Use Power off system instead.

value.name: poweroff
value.description: Stops the DataPower Gateway and turn off the power. For cloud platforms and Docker, you cannot use this command to turn off the power to the host system. On Docker, use the native docker stop -t 300 container command to stop the DataPower Gateway container.

value.name: main
value.description: Main system task

value.name: llm
value.description: Low Latency Messaging task

value.name: b2bp
value.description: B2B document storage task

value.name: wtx
value.description: WebSphere Transformation Extender task

value.name: ssh
value.description: Secure Shell client task

value.name: odbc
value.description: ODBC endpoint task

value.name: db2cli
value.description: DB2CLI endpoint task

value.name: SecureCloudConnector
value.description: Secure Cloud Connector task

value.name: dco
value.description: Database Connectivity endpoint task

value.name: waxhn
value.description: WAXHN task

value.name: imscallout
value.description: IMS Callout task

value.name: jsdebugger
value.description: GatewayScript debugger

value.name: nfs
value.description: NFS Connector task

value.name: isam
value.description: IBM Security Access Manager Runtime task

value.name: sgclient
value.description: Secure Gateway Client

value.name: sshd
value.description: Secure Shell server task

value.name: QuotaEnforcement
value.description: Quota Enforcement Server

value.name: luna
value.description: Luna

value.name: lunaClient
value.description: Luna client

type.name: dmSLAPolicyEnforcementMode

value.name: allow-if-no-sla
value.description: Use allow to process all transactions. This is the default.

value.name: reject-if-no-sla
value.description: Use reject to process only the transactions that match at least one SLA policy.

type.summary: Controls the application of SLA Policies to transactions.

value.name: log
value.description: Posts a message to the log target.

value.name: throttle
value.description: Rejects transactions over the defined threshold.

value.name: log-only
value.description: No action. Attempt to process subsequent transactions.

value.name: reject
value.description: Discard transactions until the monitored entity is within conformance levels.

value.name: shape
value.description: Queue the next 2500 transactions for later transmission when the monitored entity is within conformance levels. After queuing 2500 transactions, discard subsequent transactions.

value.name: aaa-mapped-credential
value.description: The result of the credential mapping phase of an AAA policy. The results might be a user name, a client DN, or another value. This credential type requires that the processing policy contains an AAA action before the SLM action.

value.name: aaa-username
value.description: The result of the identity extraction phase of an AAA policy. This credential type requires that the processing policy contains an AAA action before the SLM action.

value.name: mq-application
value.description: The name of the IBM MQ application from the IBM MQ message. This credential type is valid for only IBM MQ transport protocol messages.

value.name: client-ip
value.description: The IP address of the client that submitted the message.

value.name: request-header
value.description: The value of the HTTP header field that contains the credential. When specified, provide the name of this header field.

value.name: ip-from-header
value.description: The value of the HTTP header field that contains the client IP address. When specified, provide the name of this header field (for example, X-Client-IP).

value.name: custom-stylesheet
value.description: The credential in the message that a style sheet extracts. When specified, provide the location for this style sheet.

value.name: terminate-at-first-reject
value.description: The policy stops processing any statement after the first rejection. A threshold was met.

value.name: terminate-at-first-action
value.description: The policy stops processing any statement after the first control procedure (an SLM reject or notify action). A threshold was met.

value.name: execute-all-statements
value.description: The policy processes all policy statements regardless of any action a statement takes.

value.name: fixed
value.description: A discrete block of time. For example, from 8:00 AM to 9:00 AM. Fixed intervals are from the start of the schedule. Without a schedule, fixed intervals are from 12:00 AM.

value.name: moving
value.description: A sliding window of time. For example, the last 60 minutes.

description.p: Specifies that transactions are measured when they are received rather than in intervals. The threshold level value specifies the number of concurrent transactions that can be processed at a time before the threshold is enforced.

This parameter is only valid with the count all threshold type and cannot be used with the token bucket algorithm type. The threshold interval length is not relevant with the interval type is "concurrent".

value.name: low
value.summary: The low or first limit threshold

value.name: high
value.summary: The high or second limit threshold

value.name: per-extracted-value
value.description: Extract and keep a list of all unique values of the specified type. All configured SLM policies apply to each extracted value.

value.name: exact-match
value.description: Match exact values. An SLM policy applies to only values that match.

value.name: regexp-match
value.description: Match against a PCRE-style expression. An SLM policy applies to only values that match.

value.name: aaa-mapped-resource
value.description: The resource identifiers from an AAA map resource action. This resource type requires that the processing policy must include an AAA action before the SLM action.

value.name: front-url
value.description: The URL that the client requests or the rewritten, client-requested URL.

value.name: destination-url
value.description: The URL that defines the destination server. This URL might be different from the one requested by the client.

value.name: xpath-filter
value.description: The resources identified by an XPath expression. When specified, provide the expression.

value.name: request-message
value.description: All client requests.

value.name: response-message
value.description: All server responses.

value.name: soap-fault
value.description: All SOAP faults.

value.name: errorcode
value.description: The resources defined by error codes. This error code might be generated by the remote server or by the appliance during message processing.

value.name: custom-stylesheet
value.description: The resource identifiers from a style sheet. When specified, provide the location of the custom style sheet.

description.p: All concurrent TCP connections. The TCP connection is from the requesting client to the DataPower appliance. Generally, a client opens only one connection to the appliance at a time. Concurrent connections are not specific to user credentials.
For this parameter, the threshold type must be count all and the algorithm type cannot be token-bucket.
All other active transactions.
For this parameter, the threshold type must be count all and the algorithm type cannot be token-bucket.

value.name: wsdl
value.description: The resources defined by a local WSDL file. A Web Service Proxy service might support more than one WSDL file.

value.name: wsdl-service
value.description: The resources defined by the name of a service in an underlying WSDL file. Only Web Service Proxy services support this resource type.

value.name: wsdl-port
value.description: The resources defined by the port binding in an underlying WSDL file. Only Web Service Proxy services support this resource type.

value.name: wsdl-operation
value.description: The resources defined by the name of an operation in an underlying WSDL file. Only Web Service Proxy services support this resource type.

value.name: request-mq-qname
value.description: The resources defined by the name of the IBM MQ Queue for client requests.

value.name: reply-mq-qname
value.description: The resources defined by the name of the IBM MQ Queue for server replies.

description.p: The UDDI subscription is deprecated. Instead, use WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) subscription.
The resources defined by the UDDI Subscription key. When specified, provide the subscription key.

value.name: wsrr-subscription
value.description: The resources defined by the WSRR Subscription. When specified, provide the subscription.

value.name: wsrr-saved-search-subscription
value.description: The resources defined by the WSRR Saved Search Subscription. When specified, provide the subscription.

property.name: SLMId
property.summary: Statement index
property.description: A unique integer that indicates the order in which to process the statement. The policy processes statements from least to greatest. Adding a statement that duplicates the value of a previous identifier replaces the previous statement.

property.name: UserString
property.summary: User annotation
property.description: The string or identifier that appears in log messages for this statement.

property.name: CredClass
property.summary: Credential class that defines users
property.description: The credential class that defines the users (credentials) to be subject to policy restrictions. Without a credential class, the appliance considers all messages as belonging to a single global user. Therefore, the statement applies to all messages that are identified as valid resources without respect to credential classification.

property.name: RsrcClass
property.summary: Resource class that defines resources
property.description: The resource class that defines a resources to be subject to policy restrictions. Without a resource class, the statement applies to all messages that pass the credential classification.

property.name: Schedule
property.summary: Schedule for policy enforcement
property.description: The schedule that defines the time frame to enforce the policy.

property.name: Action
property.summary: Action to run
property.description: The action that defines the administrative action for messages that exceed the threshold.

property.name: ThreshIntervalLength
property.summary: Length of measurement interval

description.p: The length of each measurement interval. The default value is 0, which allows all messages and never triggers the threshold to enforce the action.

The threshold interval length is not relevant when the interval type is "concurrent". However, concurrent transactions can also be configured with the resource class type of concurrent transactions. In this case, if the interval type is set to "fixed" (the default), the configuration behaves as concurrent, but an interval length of 0 allows all messages and never triggers the threshold to enforce the action.
When the threshold interval type is "moving", the maximum interval length is 65535 seconds.

property.name: ThreshIntervalType
property.summary: How to measure intervals
property.description: How intervals are measured. The default is a fixed interval.

property.name: ThreshAlgorithm
property.summary: Methodology that calculates the threshold
property.description: The methodology that calculates the threshold in the current interval.

property.name: ThresholdType
property.summary: How to apply the threshold
property.description: How to apply the threshold level to the monitored count or latency. For the token-bucket algorithm, latency threshold types do not apply.

property.name: ThresholdLevel
property.summary: Threshold that triggers the action

description.p: The threshold that triggers the action for all algorithms. The units of measure depends on the threshold type.

ul.li: If the threshold is a count, enter the aggregate count.
If the threshold is latency, enter the latency in milliseconds.
If the threshold is payload, enter the payload size in KB.

description.p: The default is 0, which has different behaviors based on algorithm and threshold type, threshold interval and level.

ul.li: When algorithm type is Less Than or threshold type is Latency, all messages are accepted.
When threshold interval is 0, a threshold level of 0 is overridden and all messages are allowed.

property.name: ReleaseThresholdLevel
property.summary: Stop point of the high-low algorithm
property.description: The stop point (low threshold). The start point (high threshold) is the value of the threshold level property.

property.name: BurstLimit
property.summary: Maximum size of the committed burst

description.p: The maximum size of the committed burst. The committed burst defines how much traffic can be sent during a reporting interval. The burst size should be at least twice the value of the threshold level. If the burst limit is less than the threshold value, the algorithm acts like greater than.
The default is 0, which throttles all messages.

property.name: ReportingAggregationInterval
property.summary: Interval to reporting statistics
property.description: The base aggregation level in minutes for the reporting statistics. This property is independent of the thresholding interval.

property.name: MaximumTotalReportingRecords
property.summary: Total number of records per reporting interval
property.description: The total number of records for a reporting interval. A single reporting aggregation interval can contain multiple records; for example, one record per resource or credential. This property allows you to define a maximum memory-consumption threshold. The default is 5000.

property.name: AutoGeneratedByWebGUI
property.summary: Whether the GUI created the statement
property.description: Read-only property that when on indicates that the WebGUI created the statement as part of a default SLM configuration.

property.name: MaximumResourcesAndCredentialsForThreshold
property.summary: Number of combinations of credentials and resources
property.description: The maximum number of records for the combination of credentials and resources. This property limits the maximum number of combinations and allows the setting of a maximum memory-consumption threshold. The default is 5000.

value.name: front
value.description: Monitors errors that occur at the front end (or client request) URL.

value.name: rate
value.description: Monitors the transaction rate per seconds.

value.name: greater-than
value.description: A simple numeric algorithm that triggers the action when the threshold level is greater than the defined value. Enforcement continues until reaching the value specified by this threshold.

value.name: less-than
value.description: A simple numeric algorithm that triggers the action when the threshold level is less than the defined value. Enforcement continues until reaching the value specified by this threshold.

value.name: token-bucket
value.description: A rate-based algorithm that allows bursting. The algorithm consists of a bucket with a maximum capacity of N tokens. The bucket refills at a rate of R tokens per second. Each token typically represent a quantity of the monitored resource.

value.name: high-low-thresholds
value.description: An algorithm that triggers the action after the high threshold and continues to trigger until reaching the high-low threshold. This algorithm uses the values of the threshold level and the high-low release level properties.

value.name: count-all
value.description: The threshold measures all requests for resources that are defined by the resource class.

value.name: count-errors
value.description: The threshold measures only errors.

value.name: latency-internal
value.description: The threshold measures internal latency (processing time).

value.name: latency-backend
value.description: The threshold measures appliance-to-server latency.

value.name: latency-total
value.description: The threshold measures the sum of back-end and internal latency.

value.name: payload-request
value.description: The threshold measures the payload for only the request message. The measure is in KB.

value.name: payload-response
value.description: The threshold measures the payload for only the response message. The measure is in KB.

value.name: payload-total
value.description: The threshold measures the payload for the entire transaction, which is both the request message and the response message. The measure is in KB.

value.name: frontend
value.description: Include in responses to the client.

value.name: backend
value.description: Include in requests to the target.

value.name: webagent
value.description: Indicates that the request is made against the CA Single Sign-On web agent.

value.name: webservice
value.description: Indicates that the request is made against the CA Single Sign-On authentication or authorization web service.

value.name: plain
value.description: Use the PLAIN authentication method.

value.name: login
value.description: Use the LOGIN authentication method.

value.name: StartTLS
value.description: Use the POP STARTTLS feature to negotiate a secure connection.

value.name: Auth
value.description: Use Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) for SMTP client authentication.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Recipient
property.summary: E-mail address of recipient ("To:")
property.description: The default e-mail address to which to send e-mails.

property.name: Sender
property.summary: E-mail address of sender ("From:")
property.description: The default e-mail address that identifies the sender.

property.name: Subject
property.summary: Subject line of e-mail
property.description: The default subject for e-mails.

property.name: Options
property.summary: SMTP options
property.description: The SMTP options to enable for the SMTP client.

property.name: Auth
property.summary: Authentication method
property.description: With the client authentication option, the method to authenticate the SMTP client.

value.name: none
value.description: No access is allowed.

value.name: read-only
value.description: SNMPv3 get, get-next, and get-bulk operations are allowed.

value.name: read-write
value.description: SNMPv3 get, get-next, get-bulk, and set operations are allowed.

value.name: none
value.summary: The account has no authentication key.

type.name: dmSnmpContext

property.name: Context
property.summary: The name of an SNMPv3 context
property.description: An SNMPv3 context that will allow access to an application domain.

property.name: Domain
property.summary: Local application domain for this context.
property.description: The local application domain whose SNMP MIB may be accessed via this context using SNMPv3.

type.description: SNMPv3 context definitions, which provide SNMPv3 access to non-default application domains.

property.name: EngineID
property.summary: Set the SNMPv3 engine ID.
property.description: The SNMPv3 engine ID. The value of 0 represents the local engine ID. For any other engine ID, the value is a hex string that represents the 5 - 32 byte value.
property.hoverhelp: Set the SNMP V3 engine ID. The value of 0 represents the local engine ID. For any other engine ID, the value is a hex string that represents the 5 - 32 byte value.

property.name: AuthProtocol
property.summary: Set the SNMP authentication protocol.
property.description: The SNMP authentication protocol.

property.name: AuthSecretType
property.summary: Set the format of the authentication secret.
property.description: The format of the authentication secret.

property.name: AuthSecret
property.summary: The authentication secret or key.

description.p: Enter the authentication secret or key.

ul.li: If a password, enter that plaintext password that is at least 8 characters long.
If a key with the MD5 authentication protocol, enter the hex representation of the 16-byte key.
If a key with the SHA authentication protocol, enter the hex representation of the 20-byte key.

description.p: You can use colon (:) characters between each two hex characters.

hoverhelp.p: Enter the authentication secret or key.

ul.li: If a password, enter that plaintext password that is at least 8 characters long.
If a key with the MD5 authentication protocol, enter the hex representation of the 16-byte key.
If a key with the SHA authentication protocol, enter the hex representation of the 20-byte key.

hoverhelp.p: You can use colon (:) characters between each two hex characters.

property.name: PrivProtocol
property.summary: Set the SNMP privacy (encryption) protocol for the user account.
property.description: The SNMP privacy (encryption) protocol for the user account.

property.name: PrivSecretType
property.summary: Set the format of the privacy secret.
property.description: The format of the privacy secret.

property.name: PrivSecret
property.summary: Enter the privacy secret or key.

description.p: The privacy secret or key.

ul.li: If a password, enter that plaintext password that is at least 8 characters long.
If a key with the MD5 authentication protocol, enter the hex representation of the 16-byte key.
If a key with the SHA authentication protocol, enter the hex representation of the 20-byte key.

description.p: You can use colon (:) characters between each two hex characters.

type.name: dmSNMPEngineIDSource

value.name: Fixed
value.description: Sets the Engine ID to "0x8000395d03000000000000". This option is a security risk.

value.name: Unique
value.description: Sets the Engine ID to be uniquely generated. Does not contain security risks

type.summary: Selects how to set the SNMP Engine ID

property.name: Community
property.summary: The name of an SNMP community
property.description: Enter the name of a specific SNMP community. All SNMP Version 1 or Version 2c managers identifying themselves as a member of this community will have the Mode permissions set here for the Associated Domains selected here and must originate from the Remote Host Address specified here.

property.name: Domain
property.summary: Associated Application Domain
property.description: Specifies the application domain visible to the SNMP managers belonging to this community. The default value is the default application domain.

property.name: Mode
property.summary: SNMP access privileges
property.description: Select the access privileges accorded to SNMP managers that belong to this community. Use none to disable SNMP access.

property.name: Host
property.summary: IP address of an SNMP manager
property.description: The IP address of an SNMP manager belonging to this community. The default value of '0.0.0.0/0' indicates all hosts, or all SNMP managers claiming membership in the community.

value.name: none
value.summary: The account has no privacy key.

value.name: password
value.summary: Convert password to a localized key.
value.description: The secret is a password that is converted to an intermediate key with a standardized algorithm. The intermediate key is then localized against the engine ID value.

value.name: key
value.description: The secret is a fully localized key, which is useful when the key was created on another system.

value.name: noAuthNoPriv
value.description: Does not require authentication or encryption.

value.name: authNoPriv
value.description: Requires authentication, but does not require encryption.

value.name: authPriv
value.description: Requires authentication and encryption.

property.name: Host
property.summary: IP address of a recipient of SNMP Traps/Notifications
property.description: Specifies the IP address of a recipient of SNMP Traps and Notifications generated by the local SNMP agent or engine. The IP address must be unique for each recipient.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Destination port for SNMP traps/notifications
property.description: Specifies the destination UDP port for SNMP Traps and Notifications generated by the local SNMP agent or engine. By default, SNMP Traps and Notifications are sent to port 162.

property.name: Community
property.summary: The name of an SNMP community
property.description: The SNMP community name included in SNMP Version 1 Traps and SNMP Version 2 Notifications. By default, a community name of public is used.

property.name: TrapVersion
property.summary: Version to use for Traps/Notifications
property.description: Select the SNMP version to use for sending Traps and Notifications to the recipient. The default is version 1.

property.name: SecurityName
property.summary: Security name for SNMPv3 notifications
property.description: The name of the local SNMPv3 user to use for Notifications to this recipient. Determines what authentication and privacy (encryption) protocols are used, and what keys.

property.name: SecurityLevel
property.summary: The SNMPv3 security level for notifications
property.description: The SNMPv3 security level at which Notifications are sent to the recipient. The default is Authentication, Privacy.

value.name: lax
value.description: Allow the SOAPAction header to be an empty header or a header that contains an empty string. The SOAPAction header in the client request can be quoted. For example, SOAPAction: "" would be a match.

value.name: strict
value.description: Require that the client provides the exact header as specified in the WSDL. The client can quote the SOAPAction header.

value.name: off
value.description: Ignore the SOAPAction header when issued by clients. The header is never compared against the contents in the WSDL.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: SoapAction
property.summary: Soap Action Header
property.description: The value of the SoapAction header. If the value "http://example.org/add" is entered here, the header looks like "SoapAction: http://example.org/add"

type.name: dmSOAPHeaderDispositionItem

property.name: Namespace
property.summary: The SOAP Header namespace URI
property.description: Specify the namespace URI of the SOAP header element, the default value is a blank string, which indicates no restriction.

property.name: LocalName
property.summary: The SOAP Header element local name
property.description: Specify the local name of the SOAP header element, the default value is a blank string, which indicates no restriction.

property.name: ChildLocalName
property.summary: The SOAP Header's chile element local name
property.description: Specify the local name of the SOAP header's child element, the default value is a blank string, which indicates no restriction.

property.name: Action
property.summary: The action to take for this SOAP header.
property.description: Specify what action to take for this SOAP header and/or child element.

type.summary: The instruction to dispose a SOAP header
type.description: Specify what the SOAP header is and how to process it.

type.name: dmSOAPHeaderRefineType

value.name: processed
value.display: The specified element was processed, take default SOAP action

value.name: unprocessed
value.display: The specified element was not processed, take default SOAP action

value.name: keep
value.display: Keep this SOAP header or child element

value.name: remove
value.display: Remove this SOAP header or child element

value.name: fault
value.display: Generate a SOAP fault if the element exists

type.summary: Type of the actions to refine the SOAP header and children elements.
type.description: Specify what action to take to handle a SOAP header and or its children elements. By default the processing rule, defined by the SOAP specification, will be used to remove/keep/fault a SOAP header with the assumption that all the SOAP headers are already processed by the prior actions.

type.name: dmSOAPServiceType
type.summary: Is it working as a intermediary or ultimate service provider
type.description: SOAP Specification defines different SOAP header processing rules for different type of soap nodes or services, those processing rules are also different whether the soap header are successfully consumed by the prior actions or not.

type.name: dmSOAPValidation

value.name: body
value.description: Validate only the contents of the SOAP Body element. Do not apply special processing to SOAP faults.

value.name: body-or-detail
value.description: If the document is a SOAP fault, validate the contents of the detail element for SOAP faults. If the document is not a SOAP fault, validate the contents of the Body element.

value.name: ignore-faults
value.description: If the document is a SOAP fault, pass it through without validation. If the document is not a SOAP fault, validate the contents of the SOAP Body element.

value.name: envelope
value.description: Validate the entire message, including the SOAP Envelope (or other wrapper).

type.summary: How to validate SOAP documents and faults

type.name: dmSoapVersion

value.name: soap11
value.description: Log target uses SOAP 1.1.

value.name: soap12
value.description: Log target uses SOAP 1.2.

type.summary: Version of SOAP to use for SOAP log targets

value.name: QueryString
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a ? (query string)

value.name: FragmentIdentifiers
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a # (fragment identifier)

value.name: DotDot
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a .. (dotdot)

value.name: CmdExe
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains cmd.exe

value.name: CustomMethods
value.summary: Allow requests with any other method, which supports protocol extensions.

value.name: QueryString
value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains a query string.

value.name: FragmentIdentifiers
value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains a # (fragment identifier).

value.name: DotDot
value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains a .. (dot dot).

value.name: CmdExe
value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains cmd.exe.

type.name: dmSQLDatabaseType

value.name: DB2
value.description: An IBM DB2 product

value.name: Oracle
value.description: An Oracle database product

value.name: Sybase
value.description: A Sybase database product

value.name: MSSQLServer
value.description: A Microsoft SQL Server product

value.name: IMS
value.description: An IBM IMS product

type.description: The database vendor

property.name: ParamName
property.summary: Name of configuration parameter
property.description: The name of the configuration parameter.

property.name: ParamValue
property.summary: Value for configuration parameter
property.description: The value for the configuration parameter.

value.name: SID
value.description: The identifier is an Oracle system identifier (SID). The SID is a unique name for an Oracle database instance.

value.name: ServiceName
value.description: The identifier is an Oracle service name. The service name is a domain-qualified database name. This global database name is defined during installation or database creation.

property.name: Host
property.summary: Host name or IP address of data server
property.description: The host name or IP address of the server where the data source resides.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Listening port on data server
property.description: The TCP port on which the data source listens for requests.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Type of this server configuration
property.description: Not all types are valid for all SQL data source configurations and vendors.

property.name: ID
property.summary: Identifier of the data source

description.p: The identifier of the data source. The terminology used by the vendor differs depending on the type of database.

ul.li: DB2 - The DB2 database alias
Oracle - The Oracle system identifier (SID) or service name
Sybase - The name of the Sybase database
Microsoft SQL Server - The name of the Microsoft SQL Server data source
IMS - The IMS data store name

value.name: static
value.description: Run a predefined, static SQL query. The SQL statement is identical each time the action is invoked.

value.name: variable
value.description: Run an SQL statement that is stored in a named variable. This variable must be set earlier in the processing.

value.name: stylesheet
value.description: Run an SQL statement that is constructed as the result of processing a stylesheet against the input to the action.

type.name: dmSSHProfileUsage

value.name: sftp
value.description: Profile used for Secure FTP.

value.name: scc
value.description: Profile used for Secure Cloud Connector.

type.description: The intended usage of the SSH Client Profile.

value.name: use-sni
value.summary: Whether to use Server Name Indication (SNI).
value.description: Indicate whether to send the Server Name Indication (SNI) TLS extension in the client hello message.

value.name: permit-insecure-servers
value.display: Permit connections to insecure SSL servers
value.summary: Whether to allow connections to SSL servers that do not support RFC 5746.
value.description: Indicate whether to permit connections to SSL servers that do not support RFC 5746 during the SSL handshake. Such servers are vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks as documented in CVE-2009-3555. The default setting is off .

value.name: compression
value.description: Indicate whether to enable SSL compression. Enabling SSL compression in HTTPS is dangerous because the connection becomes vulnerable to the CRIME attack.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Specify the local address that the service listens on
property.description: Specify the host alias or local IP address on the appliance that the service listens on. The default value is 0.0.0.0, which denotes all local addresses.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Set the local TCP port that the service listens on
property.description: Specify the unique, local TCP port that the service listens on. No other service on the appliance can use this port. Enter any value in the range 1 - 65535.

property.name: UseSSL
property.summary: Whether to secure the connection.
property.description: Indicate whether to use the assigned SSL profile to control connections to this TCP port. When enabled, the service expects HTTPS requests on this port.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: CredentialCharset
property.summary: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values
property.description: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The appliance transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. Defaults to Protocol which is ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

value.name: max-duration
value.summary: Whether to enable the option to specify the maximum duration of an SSL session in seconds
value.description: When you enable this option, you can specify the maximum time, in seconds, to maintain an SSL session before it is terminated.

value.name: max-renegotiation
value.display: Set maximum number client initiated renegotiation allow
value.summary: Whether to enable the option to specify the maximum number of renegotiation attempts that a client can initiate per session
value.description: When you enable this option, you can specify the maximum number of renegotiation attempts that a client can initiate per session.

value.name: Enable-Legacy-Renegotiation
value.display: Permit insecure SSL renegotiation to a legacy SSL client
value.summary: Permit insecure SSL renegotiation to a legacy SSL client that does not support RFC 5746
value.description: When acting as an SSL server, specifies whether to allow SSL and TLS renegotiation from legacy SSL clients that do not support RFC 5746. Such clients are vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks as documented in CVE-2009-3555. The default behavior is to reject renegotiation attempts from SSL clients that do not support RFC 5746. SSL clients which support RFC 5746 or have patched CVE-2009-3555 are permitted to attempt renegotiation regardless of the setting specified.

value.name: Enable-Compression
value.summary: Enables compression. Enabling SSL compression in HTTPS is dangerous since the connection becomes vulnerable to the CRIME attack.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set assigned to a specific proxy. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

type.name: dmSSLProxyDirection

value.name: forward
value.summary: Proxy acts as an SSL client in an SSL communication. The proxy creates SSL over TCP connection to the configured destination.

value.name: reverse
value.summary: Proxy acts as an SSL server in an SSL communication. The proxy accepts SSL over TCP connection and creates TCP connection to the configured destination. Use a reverse proxy profile when you want to do SSL offload.

value.name: two-way
value.summary: Proxy acts as both an SSL client and an SSL server and connects one SSL to another SSL. The proxy accepts SSL over TCP connection and creates new SSL over TCP connection to the configured destination.

type.summary: Role of the SSL Proxy in the connection

property.name: Group
property.summary: Standby group number
property.description: An integer used to identify a standby group; allowable identifiers are in the range 1 through 255. All interfaces in a given standby group must have the same group number. This value must be distinct from all group numbers being used by IP routers or switches in the same broadcast domain. The active interface in the group will change its Ethernet MAC address to 00:00:0C:07:AC:XX, where XX is the group number. This number must also be unique among all standby groups on a given system.

property.name: VirtualIP
property.summary: The virtual IP address of standby group
property.description: The IP address that will be used by the active member of the standby group. External clients that want to be able to contact the active member of the standby group should use this IP address. This address must be on the same IP subnet as the primary address of the interface.

description.p: With preempt mode enabled, the operational interface with the highest priority will always be the active interface and have the virtual IP address. Use this when one interface or device is truly better than another, and it is worth increasing the disruption of TCP connections to enforce this.

With preempt mode disabled (the default), the active interface remains active unless it goes down. This is desirable as it minimizes the loss of TCP connections caused when the virtual IP address moves from one device or interface to another. However, disabling preemption on standby group does not prevent active member change on link-up event. The configuration of preemption for standby only applies when there is normal negotiation of the active member. It does not apply when there is the repair of a network partition where each of the isolated broadcast domains has an active member. When a network partition is repaired, there are two active members, so the implementation is designed to have the first active member which detects another active member send a message to make that other active member not be active.

Disabling preemption will prevent unnecessary changes of the active member when devices are intentionally rebooted, when a device reboots due to a software failure, or when interfaces are administratively enabled or disabled. However, disabling preemption will not prevent unnecessary changes in the active member when a network interface goes down and then up again (link-down event followed by link-up event), because the implementation does not process that event, and the link-up is treated as the repair of a network partition.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: The device's priority within the standby group
property.description: The priority at which this interface will vie for being the active one in the standby group. The range is 0 to 255, with higher values winning over lower values, with a default of 100. There is no need to set the priority unless one system or interface is in some way better than another one.

property.name: AuthHigh
property.summary: The first four bytes of the Authentication field
property.description: The hexadecimal representation of an integer representing the first four bytes of the Authentication field. All devices in the same standby group should use the same authentication token. This is very weak authentication, so the default value is normally perfectly suitable.

property.name: AuthLow
property.summary: The last four bytes of the Authentication field
property.description: The hexadecimal representation of an integer representing the last four bytes of the Authentication field. All devices in the same standby group should use the same authentication token. This is very weak authentication, so the default value is normally perfectly suitable.

property.name: AuxVirtualIP
property.summary: Additional virtual IP addresses that follow the active virtual IP address to the active interface.
property.description: Additional virtual IP addresses that follow the active virtual IP address to the active interface. These addresses are on the same interface as the primary virtual IP address. They are enabled and disabled in coordination with the primary virtual IP address. Separate multiple addresses with a colon.

property.name: SelfBalance
property.summary: Enable to have the active standby group member forward connections to all available standby group members
property.description: With self-balancing disabled (the default), only the active member of the standby group receives VIP connections. With self-balancing enabled, the active member of the standby group forwards some connections to each available member of the standby group.

property.name: DistAlg
property.summary: Distribution Algorithm
property.description: Choose the algorithm for distributing incoming connections to available members.

value.name: active
value.summary: The interface is the active member in the standby control group

value.name: standby
value.summary: The interface is a standby member in the standby control group

value.name: initial
value.description: Indicates that the interface is in the Initial state. It is not participating in the standby group.

value.name: learn
value.description: Indicates that the interface is in the Learn state. It is waiting to hear an authenticated Hello message from the active member of the standby group.

value.name: listen
value.description: Indicates that the interface is in the Listen state. It knows the virtual IP address of the standby group. It is listening to Hello messages but is not sending messages. It is neither the active or standby member of the standby group.

value.name: speak
value.description: Indicates that the interface is in the Speak state. It is actively sending Hello messages to the standby group.

value.name: standby
value.description: Indicates that the interface is in the Standby state. It is the one member of the standby group that is in the Standby state.

value.name: active
value.description: Indicates that the interface is in the Active state. It is the one member of the standby group that is in the Active state. It is receiving traffic sent to the Virtual IP address.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: Enter the host name to map.
property.description: Specify the host name of the target host.

property.name: IPAddress
property.summary: Enter the IP address for the host name.
property.description: The IP address of the target host.

type.name: dmStaticHostEntryType

value.name: static
value.description: The entry is configured as a DNS static host.

value.name: alias
value.description: The entry is configured as a host alias.

type.description: Static host entry type

property.name: Destination
property.summary: IP address and netmask

description.p: Specify the IP address and netmask for each destination network address. The netmask is in CIDR format is the integer that specifies the prefix length.

ul.li: For IPv4, the prefix length can be in the range 0 - 32.
For IPv6, the prefix length can be in the range 0 - 128.

property.name: Gateway
property.summary: IP address of next-hop router
property.description: Specify the IP address of the next-hop router.

property.name: Metric
property.summary: Preference for the route

description.p: Optionally specify the preference for the route. The lesser the value, the greater the preference. For each IP family, the supported range differs.

ul.li: For IPv4, enter a value in the range 0 - 255. The default value is 0.
For IPv6, enter a value in the range 0 - 65536. The default value is 512.

value.name: validate
value.description: Performs schema-based validation against XML documents using a user-specified method.

value.name: filter
value.description: Accepts or rejects check on incoming documents.

value.name: route-action
value.display: Route using Stylesheet or XPath Expression
value.description: Performs stylesheet-based routing or XPath expression-based routing. For stylesheet-based routing, provide the dynamic stylesheet that specifies the destination. For XPath expression-based routing, provide the XPath Routing Map that specifies the destination.

value.name: aaa
value.description: Invokes an Access control policy. An access control policy identifies a set of resources and procedures that determine whether a requesting client is granted access to a specific service, file, or document. Access control policies are filters in that they accept or deny requests for specific clients.

value.name: xformpi
value.description: Uses a processing instruction in an XML document to transform that XML document. This action passes embedded parameters to the specified XSLT stylesheet. The stylesheets and parameters are embedded in the document to be processed.

value.name: xformbin
value.description: Transforms a non-XML document, such as binary or flat text, using an XSL style sheet. The style sheet, in turn, uses a flat file descriptor (FFD) file.

value.name: cryptobin
value.description: Signs, verifies, encrypts, or decrypts binary data. This action uses the syntax and methodologies described in RFC 2311, S/MIME Version 2 Message Specification, dated March, 1988, and RFC 2315, PKCS #7: Cryptographic Message Syntax 1.5, dated March, 1998.

value.name: xform
value.description: Transforms an XML document using a specified XSLT stylesheet.

value.name: convert-http
value.description: Converts non-XML CGI-encoded input (an HTTP POST, an HTML form, or URI parameters) into an equivalent XML message. This action in the active rule alerts the service to treat input as non-XML CGI-encoded input. For a service to use this action, the request type for that service must be set to XML.

value.name: log
value.description: Sends the contents of the input context as a log message to the identified location. The contents are sent with the log level and log type that are specified. The response, if any, is stored in the output context, if defined. When no output context is defined, this action sends the contents and does not wait for a response.

value.name: results
value.description: Sends a message to a URL. A results action can optionally specify a context in which to store the response.

value.name: results-async
value.description: Asynchronously sends a message to a URL. This action does not support sending a message to an output context. With this action, processing continues without waiting for a response.

value.name: setvar
value.description: Creates a variable for use in subsequent processing in a specified context. Variables are expressed in the var://URL format. Variables cannot be set when the context is the PIPE keyword.

value.name: fetch
value.description: Uses a user agent to retrieve a document from a specified location.

value.name: extract
value.description: Applies an XPath expression to a specified context and stores the result in another context.

value.name: rewrite
value.description: Rewrites HTTP headers or URLs using a URL rewrite policy.

value.name: route-set
value.description: Performs dynamic, variable-based routing.

value.name: strip-attachments
value.description: Removes all or specified MIME attachments from a specified context.

value.name: call
value.description: Invokes a named, reusable rule. After the action completes, processing continues to the next action, if any.

description.p: Defines a named rule that enables user-defined error handling when subsequent processing encounters errors. The on-error action either stops processing or continues to the next processing step. Optional, the action calls the named rule to handle the error condition. Without an on-error action, the default error handling is to stop processing and log a message.

A processing rule can contain one or more on-error actions. Each action defines error handling for subsequent actions until another on-error action is found. When another action is found, error-handling procedures are set to the new on-error action. As such, this action enables conditional error handling in a multistep context.

Note that a processing policy can contain on-error actions and an error rule. When a processing policy contains both on-error actions and an error rule, the on-error action overrides the error rule. An error rule, if the processing policy contains one, is invoked when an error occurs during processing. In this case, the error rule acts as an error handler.

value.name: checkpoint
value.description: Collects information for WS-Management agents and Service Level Monitors.

value.name: slm
value.description: Assigns and enforces an SLM Policy Statement to a processing rule. The SLM Policy operates on the Input context.

value.name: sql
value.description: Establishes a connection to a configured database and runs SQL statements against the configured SQL data source. The results can be used for further processing.

value.name: conditional
value.description: Evaluates a list of XPath expressions against the input context, and then runs the action that is associated with the first one that matches.

value.name: for-each
value.description: Loops through either all of the nodes in a nodeset or otherwise all of the natural numbers through the upper count limit. For each loop iteration, it runs the LoopAction.

value.name: event-sink
value.description: Looks through the list of named actions and waits for each of them to complete asyncronously in this Multistep Session at least once. Once they all have, then if any of them failed, then this action will fail with one of their errors. If they all eventually finish and succeeded, then this action will succeed, and control flow will continue. If this instruction times out while waiting for them to all finish (or even to be started), then this instruction will fail. This instruction can not be Asynchronous, it is inherently part of synchronous processing of asynchronous actions.

value.name: method-rewrite
value.summary: Add an HTTP method rewrite action
value.description: Rewrites the HTTP method to a new method type.

value.name: xformng
value.description: Transforms an input document (XML or non-XML, such as binary or flat text), using an optional processing control file.

value.name: gatewayscript
value.description: Executes a GatewayScript

value.name: jose-sign
value.summary: Add a JSON Web Sign action
value.description: Sign a message using JSON Web Signature standard

value.name: jose-verify
value.summary: Add a JSON Web Verify action
value.description: Verify a JSON Web Signature message

value.name: jose-encrypt
value.summary: Add a JSON Web Encrypt action
value.description: Encrypt a message using JSON Web Encryption standard

value.name: jose-decrypt
value.summary: Add a JSON Web Decrypt action
value.description: Decrypt a JSON Web Encryption message

value.name: abort
value.summary: Cancel the processing of the current rule

type.name: dmStyleRuleDirection

value.name: rule
value.summary: Applies to both client- and server-originated traffic

value.name: error-rule
value.summary: Invoked when a processing error occurs

type.summary: Direction to which the Rule applies

value.name: none
value.summary: No algorithm for compression or decompression.

value.name: gzip
value.summary: Use the gzip algorithms for compression and decompression.

value.name: pkzip
value.summary: Uses the PKZIP algorithms for compression and decompression.

property.name: ParameterName
property.summary: Name of stylesheet parameter

description.p: Specify the name for the stylesheet parameter. The following list identifies common stylesheet parameters:

ul.li: decrypt-key: For decryption operations, the name of the Key object to be used.
keypair-key: For signing operations, the name of the Key object to be used.
keypair-cert: For signing operations, the name of the Certificate object to be used.
recipient: For encryption operations, the name of the Certificate object for the intended recipient.
valcred: For authentication, the name of the Validation Credentials object to be used.

property.name: ParameterValue
property.summary: Value for stylesheet parameter
property.description: Specify the value for the parameter. Typically, the value is the name of a configuration object.

type.name: dmSymmetricKeyType

value.name: sct-available
value.display: Use a Key in Security Context

value.name: encryptedkey
value.display: Use a Random Key and Encrypt It for the Recipient

value.name: saml-symmetric-hok
value.display: Use the Symmetric SAML HoK Token from the Recipient

type.description: If the crypto action needs a symmetric key such as HMAC signing, configure what type of the symmetric key the message may contain. The fetched symmetric key then can be used directly or can be used as the base for WS-SecureConversation Key Derivation mechanism to generate a wsc:DerivedKeyToken (DKT).

type.name: dmSyncLevel

value.name: 0x00
value.description: IMS Sync Level 0x00 (NONE).

value.name: 0x01
value.description: IMS Sync Level 0x01 (CONFIRM).

type.description: Sync Level

type.summary: syslog facility, as defined by RFC 3164

property.name: TAMAZReplica
property.summary: TCP host name
property.description: Specify the TCP host name of the authorization server replica.

property.name: TAMAZReplicaPort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the listening port on the authorization server replica. The default value is 7136.

property.name: TAMAZReplicaWeight
property.summary: Preference
property.description: Specify the weight of the authorization server replica. The greater the weight, the higher the preference. Enter a value in the range 1 - 10. The default value is 10.

property.name: FedName
property.summary: Name of the federated directory entry
property.description: Specify the name of the federated directory entry to uniquely identify the entry in the federation.

property.name: Suffix

property.description: Specify a single LDAP suffix that is to be searched for users.

property.name: Host

property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the LDAP server.

property.name: Port
property.summary: The listening port on the LDAP server
property.description: Specify the listening port on the LDAP server. The default value is 389.

property.name: BindDN
property.summary: The distinguished name (DN) of an LDAP administrative user
property.description: Specify the distinguished name (DN) of an LDAP administrative user to bind with the LDAP registry.

property.name: BindPw
property.summary: The password alias of the password for the LDAP administrative user
property.description: Enter the password alias of the password for the LDAP administrator that corresponds to the entered distinguished name.

property.name: UseSSL
property.summary: Whether to use SSL to secure connections with the LDAP server
property.description: Control whether to use SSL to connect to the LDAP server.

property.name: KeyFileLabel
property.display: LDAP server SSL key file label
property.summary: Label of the personal certificate in the key file for client authentication

description.p: Enter the label of the personal certificate in the key file for client authentication.

ul.li: When using mutual authentication with the registry server and the personal certificate is not the default personal certificate in the key file, enter the label of the personal certificate. The personal certificate allows client authentication.
For server-only authentication, do not enter a value.

property.name: BasicPrincipalAttribute
property.summary: The attribute to use as the user identifier in the LDAP registry entry
property.description: Specify the attribute that represents a user in the LDAP registry entry. The attribute overrides the global basic user principal for the client. The attribute is optional when the basic user mode is disabled.

value.name: TFIM
value.description: Prepends the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager protected object space string.

value.name: TAMBI

value.name: WebSEAL
