type.description: If the crypto action instead needs a symmetric key, configure it here. The symmetric key will use WS-SecureConversation Key Derivation mechanism, it will generate a wsc:DerivedKeyToken (DKT).

type.name: dmWSSCKeySourceType

value.name: in-encryptedkey
value.display: Decrypt the encrypted key from message

type.display: Source of shared secret to initialize security context
type.summary: Where to get the shared secret to initialize the WS-Trust or WS-SecureConversation security context.

description.p: Select how to generate the ID type for a new element node. The WS-Security specification allows the message sender to use xml:id or wsu:Id to identify an element and reference it locally by a # and the ID value; for example, #foo-id.

The generated ID type impacts the TimeStamp, SecurityToken, SecurityTokenReference, or elements that were specifically introduced by the OASIS WS-Security standards. The XML Signature and XML Encryption elements should always use their local Id attributes. The default is wsu:Id (for backward compatibility).

property.name: Identifier
property.summary: Security Context Identifier

property.name: StartTime
property.summary: Start Time

property.name: Expiry
property.summary: Expiry

value.name: Always
value.description: The token must be included in all messages sent between the initiator and recipient. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/Always.

value.name: AlwaysToRecipient
value.summary: Always Include Token In Recpient Messages
value.description: The token must be included in all messages sent from the intiator to the recipient; it must not appear in response messages sent by the recipient. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/AlwaysToRecipient.

value.name: AlwaysToIntiator
value.summary: Always Include Token In Initiator Messages
value.description: The token must be included in all messages sent from the recipient to the intiator; it must not appear in response messages sent by the initiator. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/AlwaysToInitiator.

value.name: Once
value.description: The token must be included in only one message sent from the message exchange initiator to the recipient. Subsequent messages should use an external reference to refer to the token. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/Once.

value.name: Never
value.description: The token must not be included in any messages; instead, external references should be used instead. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/Never.

value.name: Strict
value.description: Any tokens in the SOAP message must occur before they are used. For example, a local (found in the message) signing token must occur before any signature(s) that use it, and a local encryption token must occur before any encrypted elements that use it. Also, any token serving as the source of a derived key token must occur before the derived key token.

value.name: Lax
value.description: Any order of tokens that conform to WS-Security: SOAP message security is allowed.

value.name: LaxTimestampFirst
value.description: As with the Lax layout option, with the exception that the first item in the security header must be a WS-Security timestamp element. This message layout option requires that the Timestamp property is set to "true" (i.e., the <IncludeTimestamp> element is present in the security policy alternative).

value.name: LaxTimestampLast
value.description: As with the Lax layout option, with the exception that the last item in the security header must be a WS-Security timestamp element. This message layout option requires that the Timestamp property is set to "true" (i.e., the <IncludeTimestamp> element is present in the security policy alternative).

type.name: dmWSSLMOps

property.name: Operation
property.summary: Name of the operation to monitor
property.description: Select the name of the operation, as defined in the WSDL file, to monitor. The current implementation supports only the default value. The default is All.

property.name: Target
property.summary: The target activity to monitor
property.description: Select the target activity to monitor. Define an operation for each activity to monitor.

property.name: Severity
property.summary: The action-threshold point

description.p: Select the action threshold and define its value.

For example as transactions rates increase, you could define low and high thresholds. If the low threshold is defined at 100 transactions per second and that limit is reached, some action can be taken. Then if the high threshold is defined at 300 transactions per second and that limit is reached, another action can be taken.

property.name: Threshold
property.summary: The threshold value required to trigger an action
property.description: Specify the threshold value that is required to trigger the action. The value is the count per second.

property.name: Action
property.summary: Action to take when the threshold is reached
property.description: Select the action to take when the threshold is reached.

type.summary: Web Service Service Level Monitor Operation

value.name: CancelBinding
value.description: The WS-Trust cancel binidng, as identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/Cancel.

value.name: AmendBinding
value.description: The WS-SecureConversation amend binding, as identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/RST/SCT/Amend. Note that this binding applies only to WS-SecureConversation security context tokens.

value.name: RenewalBinding
value.description: The WS-Trust renewal binding, as identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/Renew.

type.name: dmWSUsernameTokenPasswordType

value.name: Text
value.description: The actual password for the username, the password hash, or the derived password.

value.name: Digest
value.description: The digest of the password. as specified in the "Web Services Security UsernameToken Profile 1.0" specification.

type.description: The type of password in the UsernameToken.

property.name: WSDLName
property.description: WSDL file name or "*" to match all files. This is the local name of the WSDL file, as defined on the WSDL tab.

property.name: ServiceName
property.description: Matches wsdl:service/@name using the format {serviceNamespace}/name. Enter "*" to match all bindings.

property.name: ServicePortName
property.description: Matches wsdl:service/wsdl:port/@name using the format {serviceNamespace}/name. Enter "*" to match all ports.

property.name: PortTypeName
property.description: Matches wsdl:portType/@name using the format {portTypeNamespace}name. Enter "*" to match all bindings.

property.name: BindingName
property.description: Matches wsdl:binding/@name using the format {bindingNamespace}name. Enter "*" to match all bindings.

property.name: OperationName
property.description: Matches wsdl:binding/operation/@name using the format {bindingNamespace}name or wsdl:service/wsdl:port when formatted {serviceNamespace}port-name/operation-name. Enter "*" to match all operations.

property.name: Toggles
property.summary: Policy Toggles
property.description: Select the policy (availability and behavior) of the component made available by the Web Service Proxy. The established policy cascade (applies to all components that are contained by the current component).

property.name: Subscription
property.description: Matches all of the services obtained via the selected subscription. The selection may be further narrowed by configuring matches against specific wsdl components.

property.name: UseFragmentID
property.summary: Enable or disable the use of Fragment ID
property.description: Toggle to enable or disable the use of Fragment ID

property.name: FragmentID
property.description: Matches Fragment Identifier

value.name: first-applicable
value.summary: First unambiguous evaluation results in final evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in th eorder that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. For an individual Policy or PolicySet element, if the target (resource) evaluates to "TRUE" and the policy conditions evaluate unambiguously to "Permit" or "Deny", the policy combination evaluates to the effect of that individual policy. If the target evaluates to "FALSE" or the policy conditions are determined to be "Not Applicable", the policy combination evaluates to "Not Applicable".

value.name: deny-overrides
value.summary: Any "Deny" evaluation results in a final "Deny" evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in the order that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. If any Policy or PolicySet element evaluates to "Deny", the policy combination evaluates immediately to "Deny". In other words, a single "Deny" takes precedence over other policy evaluations. If all policies are determined to be "Not Applicable", the policy combination evaluates to "NotApplicable".

value.name: permit-overrides
value.summary: Any "Permit" evaluation results in a final "Permit" evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in the order that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. If any Policy or PolicySet element evaluates to "Permit", the policy combination evaluates immediately to "Permit". In other words, a single "Permit" takes precedence over other policy evaluations. If all policies are determined to be "Not Applicable", the policy combination evaluates to "Not Applicable".

value.name: only-one-applicable
value.summary: Evaluate all policies to render a final evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in the order that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. Unlike the other combining algorithms, this algorithm evaluates all polcies in the Policy Set to render a final evaluation. If no policy is considered applicable after evaluating all policies, the policy combination evaluates to "Not Applicable". If more than one policy is considered applicable after evaluating all policies, the policy combiation evaluates to "Indeterminate". If only one single policy is considered applicable after evaluating all policies, the policy combination evaluates to the result of that single policy.

ul.li: If the decision is "Permit", the client is authorized (the PEP permits access). If the "Permit" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is authorized only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.

If the decision is "Deny", the client is rejected (the PEP denies access). If the "Deny" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is rejected only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.
If the decision is "Not Applicable", the behavior is undefined.
If the decision is "Indeterminate", the behavior is undefined.

If the decision is "Permit", the client is authorized (the PEP permits access). If the "Permit" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is authorized only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.
For all other decisions, the client is rejected (the PEP denies access).

If the decision is "Deny", the client is rejected (the PEP denies access). If the "Deny" "Deny" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is rejected only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.
For all other decisions, the client is authorized (the PEP permits access).

type.name: dmXACMLVersion
type.description: The version to use for XACML messages.

type.name: dmXformNGBinaryInputLanguage

ul.li: The XML option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, is in XML format. It must be well-formed XML, and can be parsed as XML, but will not be understood according to a XML Schema by this transform action.

The DFDL option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, has a format that is specified by a DFDL Schema. Types should be understood per the DFDL Schema. A DFDL Schema must be specified.

The XSD option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, has a format that is XML as specified by a W3C XML Schema. Types should be understood per the XML Schema. An XML Schema must be specified.

The JSON option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, is in JSON format. It must be well-formed JSON, and can be parsed as JSON, but will not be type assessed.

type.description: Specify the input language for the transformation.

type.name: dmXformNGBinaryOutputLanguage

value.name: default
value.summary: Format Defaults based on the transformation

ul.li: The Default option specifies that the output to this transform action, has a format that will default based on the transformation. It is allowed only on output, not for input.

The DFDL option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, has a format that is specified by a DFDL Schema. Types should be understood per the DFDL Schema. A DFDL Schema must be specified.

type.description: Specify the output language for the transformation.

type.name: dmXformNGTransformLanguage

ul.li: Input and output mappings may be specified but no additional transformation is applicable.
The XQuery option specifies that the transform is specified as an XQuery file.

type.description: Specify the transformation language.

type.name: dmXMLAcceleratorType

value.name: embedded
value.description: The XML accelerator is embedded in the firmware.

type.description: XML accelerator type

value.name: any
value.description: Enable processing of messages from any (*) URI for legacy applications. An example is an application that posts SOAP management requests to '/'.

value.name: soma
value.description: Enable support for SOAP configuration management. The URI is /service/mgmt/current.

value.name: v2004
value.description: Enable support for the legacy SOAP management format. The URI is /service/mgmt/2004.

description.p: Expose AMP endpoints. Use the URI for the wanted version.

ul.li: /service/mgmt/amp/3.0
/service/mgmt/amp/2.0
/service/mgmt/amp/1.0

value.name: slm
value.description: Expose the management endpoint that supports the SLM protocol. The URI is /service/slm/datashare/1.0. This protocol manages SLM data among appliances and is not a public web service.

value.name: wsm
value.description: Expose the management endpoint that supports the WS-Management family of protocols. The URI is /service/ws-management.

value.name: wsdm
value.description: Expose the management endpoint that supports the WSDM 1.0 family of protocols. The URI is /service/wsdm10

description.p: The UDDI subscription is deprecated. Instead, use WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) subscription.

Expose the service endpoint that is the UDDI subscription listener web service. This service endpoint must be configured in the UDDI registry as the service endpoint of the subscription. Multiple subscriptions can use this endpoint. This endpoint processes subscription updates for all domains. The URI is /service/uddi-subscription.

value.name: wsrr-subscription
value.description: Exposes the service endpoint that is a WebSphere Service Registry and Repository listener web service. When exposed, a subscription receives a notification of changes to a subscribed resource in the WebSphere Service Registry and Repository server. Expose this service endpoint when a subscription uses automatic synchronization. Multiple subscriptions can use this endpoint. This endpoint processes subscription updates for all domains. The URI is /service/wsrr-subscription.

value.name: soap
value.description: The traffic is XML formatted in accordance with the SOAP schema standards. The service validates the message against SOAP schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: xml
value.description: The traffic is formatted in XML. The service validates the message against XML schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: unprocessed
value.description: The traffic is passed unaltered.

value.name: preprocessed
value.description: The traffic can be any format. However, for traffic that is flat file text or binary, you must use this option. The service passes the contents of the message unaltered. Document processing will not operate directly on the message content, but actions that authenticate and authorize access, set a destination, or attach variables to the context can be performed.

value.name: json
value.description: The traffic is formatted in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON). The service validates the message as well-formed JSON, and the message is made available both as JSON and as JSONx. Document processing can operate on the JSON message content with JSON schema validation, XQuery transformations with JSONiq Extensions, or GatewayScript, and can access the __JSONASJSONX context to process JSONx. Actions can authenticate and authorize access, set a destination, or attach variables to the context.

value.name: soap
value.description: The traffic is XML formatted in accordance with the SOAP schema standards. The service validates the message against SOAP schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: xml
value.description: The traffic is formatted in XML. The service validates the message against XML schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: unprocessed
value.description: The traffic is passed unaltered.

value.name: preprocessed
value.description: The traffic can be any format. However, for traffic that is flat file text or binary, you must use this option. The service passes the contents of the message unaltered. Document processing will not operate directly on the message content, but actions that authenticate and authorize access, set a destination, or attach variables to the context can be performed.

value.name: soap
value.description: The traffic is XML formatted in accordance with the SOAP schema standards. The service validates the message against SOAP schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: off
value.description: Disables the file capture trace utility.

value.name: always
value.description: Enables the file capture trace utility and provides a trace of all device traffic.

value.name: errors
value.description: Enables the file capture trace utility and provides a trace for failed transactions.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression

description.p: This is the XPath expression applied to submitted documents. This expression evaluates to true or false. If the expression points to a particular node and that node is present in the submitted document, the expression evaluates to true.

Note that this expression cannot exceed 330 characters. Use the Namespace Mapping tab to establish mapping that then allow the use of qualified names in the XPath expression, shortening the expression.

property.name: Host
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address to which matching documents should be routed.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the port to which matching documents should be routed.

property.name: SSL
property.summary: Whether to connect with SSL
property.description: Specify whether the connection to the target destination uses SSL communications. The default is off. When set to on, the appliance uses the SSL profile that is specified at the service level to establish SSL communications to the destination host.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The proxy communicates with the server that is identified by a remote IP address and remote port. The proxy can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: loopback-proxy
value.description: The proxy processes the incoming request using the selected policy and returns the result to the client. No server is involved. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: strict-proxy
value.description: The proxy identifies the backend server by examining the request headers. The proxy can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

property.name: mAdminState
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

description.p: The administrative state of the configuration.

ul.li: To make active, set to enabled.
To make inactive, set to disabled.

hoverhelp.p: Set the administrative state of the configuration.

ul.li: To make active, set the check box.
To make inactive, clear the check box.

property.label: Enable administrative state

object.name: AAAPolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: AuthorizedCounter
property.summary: Monitor for authorized messages. The count monitor should be configured with an XPath as the measure.

property.name: RejectedCounter
property.summary: Monitor for rejected messages. The count monitor should be configured with an XPath as the measure.

property.name: NamespaceMapping
property.summary: Map namespaces to Namespace URIs.
property.description: Establishes namespace mappings for namespaces that might be encountered in requests. A mapping is a prefix and URI.

property.name: ExtractIdentity
property.summary: How to extract identity information.
property.description: Select a method to extract the identity claimed or asserted in the service request.

property.name: Authenticate
property.summary: How to authenticate the identity.
property.description: Select a method to authenticate the extracted identity.

property.name: MapCredentials
property.summary: How to map credentials to what can be used for authorization.

property.name: ExtractResource
property.summary: How to extract resource information.

property.name: MapResource
property.summary: How to map resources to what can be used for authorization.

property.name: Authorize
property.summary: How to grant or deny a request.

property.name: PostProcess
property.summary: Which postprocessing activities to perform.

property.name: SAMLAttribute
property.summary: Namespace URI, local name, and expected value of SAML attributes.

property.name: LTPAAttributes
property.summary: User attribute name-value pairs encoded in the generated LTPA token.

property.name: TransactionPriority
property.summary: Transaction priority.

property.name: SAMLValcred
property.summary: SAML signature validation credentials.

property.name: SAMLSigningKey
property.summary: SAML message signing key.

property.name: SAMLSigningCert
property.summary: SAML message signing certificate.

property.name: SAMLSigningHashAlg
property.summary: The hash algorithm used for SAML signing message.

property.name: SAMLSigningAlg
property.summary: Algorithm to sign SAML messages.
property.description: Select the algorithm to sign SAML messages. rsa and dsa are supported by older releases. rsa is same as rsa-sha1. dsa is same as dsa-sha1.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile for securing the communication with external SAML entities.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection with external SAML entities.
property.hoverhelp: Select an SSL proxy profile for securing the communication with external SAML entities. The SSL proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection.

property.name: LDAPsuffix
property.summary: LDAP suffix.
property.description: The string to added to the username (separated by a comma) to form a distinguished name (DN) for LDAP authentication. For example, if the string value is "O=example.com" and the username is "Bob", the LDAP DN is "CN=Bob,O=example.com".

property.name: LogAllowed
property.summary: Log allowed AAA attempts.
property.description: Determines whether to log messages about allowed AAA attempts.

property.name: LogAllowedLevel
property.summary: Level to log allowed AAA attempts.
property.description: The level to log messages about allowed AAA attempts.

property.name: LogRejected
property.summary: Log rejected AAA attempts.
property.description: Determines whether to log messages about rejected AAA attempts.

property.name: LogRejectedLevel
property.summary: Level to log rejected Level.
property.description: The level to log messages about rejected AAA attempts.

property.name: WSSecureConversationCryptoKey
property.summary: Certificate that corresponds to the key that encrypts a WS-Trust secret.
property.description: When generating a WS-Trust token associated with a secret key (such as a WS-SecureConversation token), use this key to encrypt the initial secret.

property.name: SAMLSourceIDMappingFile
property.summary: File that contains the SAML Artifact mapping.
property.description: The file that contains a mapping of SAML Artifact source IDs to artifact retrieval endpoints. This file is required only if artifacts are retrieved from multiple endpoints and the source ID for these endpoints are encoded in the artifact itself, as per the SAML specification. If there is only one artifact retrieval URL, it can be specified by the SAML Artifact responder URL in the authentication phase.

property.name: PingIdentityCompatibility
property.summary: PingIdentity compatibility.
property.description: Enable PingIdentity compatibility when using SAML for authentication or authorization.

property.name: SAML2MetadataFile
property.summary: File that contains SAML 2.0 metadata.
property.description: The file that contains metadata used in SAML 2.0 protocol message exchanges. This metadata is used to identify Identity Provider endpoints and certificates needed to secure SAML 2.0 message exchanges. This file must have a <md:EntitiesDescriptor> top-level element, with one or more <EntityDescriptor> child elements (one per Identity Provider).

property.name: DoSValve
property.summary: Value to filter out denial-of-service (DoS) attacks.
property.description:
Set the maximum times of same XML processing that AAA policy allows for each user request. The AAA policy assumes that more than this value of the same processing is caused by potential DoS flooding attacks. The AAA policy limits the number of times to process the same request. These processes can include encryption, decryption, message signing, or signature verification. Currently, only identity extraction with subject DN from certificate in message signature and authorization with signer certificate for digitally signed messages support this setting. These methods designate the number of signatures or signing reference URIs.
The default value is 3. This value means that the AAA policy processes only the first 3 signature and each signature can contain up to 3 reference URIs. Additional signatures or reference URIs are ignored.

property.name: LDAPVersion
property.summary: Version of the LDAP protocol for bind.
property.description: Select the LDAP protocol version to use for the bind operation. The default value is v2.

property.name: EnforceSOAPActor
property.display: Enforce actor or role for WS-Security message
property.summary: Enforce the S11::actor or S12:role when the message is a WS-Security message.
property.description: Most of the times a WS-Security message has an S11:actor or S12:role attribute for its wsse:Security header, we can enforce those attributes when AAA tries to utilize wsse:Security header, for example, there should be only one wsse:Security element having same actor/role, and AAA should only process the wsse:Security header for the designated Actor/Role Identifier. This setting takes effect for all AAA steps except postprocessing, which generally generate new message for next SOAP node. The default value for this setting is 'on', enabling SOAP actor/role enforcement.

property.name: WSSecActorRoleID
property.summary: The assumed S11:actor or S12:role identifier that the AAA policy act as.
property.description:
If specified, the AAA policy acts as the assumed actor or role when it consumes the wsse:Security headers. This setting takes effect only when the AAA policy tries to process the incoming WS-Security message before making an authorization decision. Postprocessing does not use this setting. Postprocessing uses its own setting in generating WS-Security messages for the next SOAP node. Some well-known values are as follows:
http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/actor/nextEvery one, including the intermediary and ultimate receiver, receives the message should be able to processing the Security header.
http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/noneNo one should process the Security Header.
http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/nextEvery one, including the intermediary and ultimate receiver, receives the message should be able to processing the Security header.
http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/ultimateReceiverThe message ultimate receiver can process the Security header. This is the default value if such setting is not configured.
<blank or empty string>The empty string "" (without quotes) indicates that no "actor/role" identifier is configured. if there is no actor/role setting configured, the ultimateReceiver is assumed when processing the message, and no actor/role attribute will be added when generating the WS-Security header. There should not be more than one Security headers omitting the actor/role identifier.
USE_MESSAGE_BASE_URIThe value "USE_MESSAGE_BASE_URI" without quotes indicates that the actor/role identifier will be the base URL of the message, if the SOAP message is transported using HTTP, the base URI is the Request-URI of the http request.
any other customized stringYou can input any string to identify the actor or role of the Security header.
The default value is a blank value.

property.name: AUSMHTTPHeader
property.summary: HTTP headers of interest from CA Single Sign-on responses to include in responses or requests if configured
property.description: Specifies the HTTP headers from CA Single Sign-On responses. When specified, these headers are included into the request or response headers based on the setting of the CA Single Sign-on header flow.

property.name: AZSMHTTPHeader
property.summary: HTTP headers of interest from CA Single Sign-on responses to include in responses or requests if configured
property.description: Specifies the HTTP headers from CA Single Sign-On responses. When specified, these headers are included into the request or response headers based on the setting of the CA Single Sign-on header flow.

property.name: DynConfig
property.summary: How to obtain the AAA policy configuration dynamically
property.description: Specifies how to obtain the AAA policy configuration dynamically. Dynamic configuration enables users to configure AAA policy at run time. When enabled, the configuration of AAA is determined dynamically based on the template AAA policy and the parameters that the dynamic configuration custom URL returns.

property.name: ExternalAAATemplate
property.summary: The external AAA policy to use as the template
property.description: Specifies an external AAA policy to use as the template. When specified, it overwrites the configuration of the current AAA policy.

property.name: DynConfigCustomURL
property.summary: The location of the custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file

description.p: Specifies the location of the custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file where to obtain the AAA policy configuration. The obtained configuration overwrites the configuration that is defined in the template AAA policy. In the custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file, it is recommended that you modify only those properties to be dynamically overwritten in the template AAA policy.

See the ModifyAAAPolicy element in the store:///xml-mgmt.xsd schema to construct a schema-compliant AAA configuration. For the nodeset that the custom URL is expected to return and a sample stylesheet, see the topic in IBM Knowledge Center.

object.summary: A description of the policy for doing authentication and authorization.
object.description:
An AAA policy establishes the configuration to support the authentication and authorization of users requesting resources from the back-end servers. An AAA policy consists of the following components.
Identity extractionOne of many methods that discovers which identity is asserted in the service request. This processing phase answers the question, "What is your name?"
AuthenticationOne of many methods that authenticates the asserted identity. Methods include communication with external authorities, such as an LDAP server. The identity is accepted as authentic or rejected. When authenticated successfully, the identity is used as a credential.
Resource extractionOne of many methods that discovers which resource service is requested (such as query an account or perform an update) This processing phase answers the question, "What do you want to do?"
Credential mappingWhile an identity can be authenticated by one authority as valid, this identity or credential might not be known to the authority that authorizes the requested resource. This processing phase allows the mapping of credentials from one form to another for interoperability between systems.
Resource mappingWhile a resource can be identified from the service request, this resource name might not be known to the authority that authorizes use of the requested resource. This processing phase allows the mapping of resource names from one form to another for interoperability between systems.
AuthorizationThe combination of the authenticated and possibly remapped credential with the requested and possibly remapped resource are submitted to an authority for authorization. That authority could reside elsewhere on the network. The request for service is accepted or rejected.
PostprocessingAdditional processing to perform after authorization, such as the generation of a WS-Trust token or SAML assertion.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: BaseDir
property.summary: HIDDEN - Domain Base Directory
property.description: HIDDEN - Specifies the local directories of the application domain.

property.name: ConfigFile
property.summary: HIDDEN - Domain Configuration File
property.description: HIDDEN - Specifies the configuration file for the domain.

property.name: NeighborDomain
property.summary: Manage which application domains have their local: directory visible to this application domain.

description.p: Which application domains have their local: directory visible to this application domain.
References to visible application domains are explicit, not bidirectional. If application domain domainB is made visible to application domain domainA , the following conditions apply.

ul.li: Application domain domainA has read-only access to the local: directory of application domain domainB .
Application domain domainB cannot see application domain domainA .

description.p: In this case, you cannot make application domain domainA visible to application domain domainB . References to visible application domains cannot be circular.

hoverhelp.p: Set which application domains have their local: directory visible to this application domain. References to visible application domains are explicit, not bidirectional. References to visible application domains cannot be circular.

property.name: DomainUser
property.summary: DEPRECATED -Domain CLI User Access
property.description: DEPRECATED -Specifies a set of CLI users having access to this domain. These users can log into this domain through the CLI. This setting can be superceded by an existing Access Policy of the user.

property.name: URLMap
property.summary: HIDDEN - URL Protocol Permissions
property.description: HIDDEN - Specifies allowed URL protocol types in domain.

property.name: FileMap
property.display: File permission to the local: directory
property.summary: Set which file permissions to apply to the local: directory.

description.p: Which file permissions to apply to the local: directory. When access permissions are defined in this configuration and with role-based management, users are granted the lesser privilege.

property.name: MonitoringMap
property.summary: Set which types of events to generate when files are added to or deleted from the local: directory.

description.p: Which types of events to generate when files are added to or deleted from the local: directory.

property.name: ConfigMode
property.summary: Indicate whether the configuration file is local or remote.
property.description: Whether the configuration file is local or remote.

property.name: ImportURL
property.summary: Set the URL of the configuration file on the remote server.
property.description: The URL of the configuration file on the remote server.

property.name: ImportFormat
property.summary: Set the format of the remote configuration file.
property.description: The format of the remote configuration file.

property.name: DeploymentPolicy
property.summary: Set the deployment policy to preprocess the remote configuration file during import.
property.description: The deployment policy to preprocess the remote configuration file during import.

property.name: DeploymentPolicyParameters
property.summary: Set the collection of name-value pairs to replace variables in the deployment policy during import.
property.description: The collection of name-value pairs to replace variables in the deployment policy during import.

property.name: LocalIPRewrite
property.summary: Indicate whether to rewrite local IP addresses during import.

description.p: Whether to rewrite local IP addresses during import. When enabled, local IP addresses in the import package are rewritten to match the local IP address on the appliance. In other words, a service that binds to eth10 in the import package is rewritten to bind to the local IP address of eth10 on the appliance.

hoverhelp.p: Indicate whether to rewrite local IP addresses during import. When enabled, local IP addresses in the import package are rewritten to match the local IP address on the appliance. In other words, a service that binds to eth10 in the import package is rewritten to bind to the local IP address of eth10 on the appliance.

property.name: MaxChkpoints
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of configuration checkpoints to support.
property.description: The maximum number of configuration checkpoints to support.

description.p: An application domain contains the resources that support DataPower services. A DataPower supports multiple application domains. Application domains can share read access to files in their local: directory. All application domains share the contents of the store: directory.
After a user logs in to an application domain, everything the user does applies to only that application domain.

Except for the default application domain, all application domains can be restarted independently. For the default application domain, you must restart the appliance. When an application domain or the appliance is restarted, the persisted configuration is used. The persisted configuration can differ from the running configuration.

The configuration of an application domain can be locally stored or can be retrieved from a remote server. The use of a remote configuration file enables centralized management of application domains.

object.name: LDAPSearchParameters

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LDAPBaseDN
property.summary: LDAP base distinguished name

description.p: The base distinguished name to begin the search. This value identifies the entry level of the tree used by the LDAP Scope property.

property.name: LDAPReturnedAttribute
property.summary: The LDAP attribute to be returned
property.description: The attribute name whose value will be returned for each entry that matches the search filter. The default is dn.

property.name: LDAPFilterPrefix
property.summary: The LDAP search filter prefix

description.p: The prefix of the LDAP filter expression.
If the prefix is mail= and the user name is bob@example.com , the LDAP search filter would be mail=bob@example.com .

property.name: LDAPFilterSuffix
property.summary: The LDAP search filter suffix

description.p: The suffix of the LDAP filter expression.
If the prefix is (&(mail= , the user name is bob@example.com , and the suffix is ")(c=US)) , the LDAP search filter would be (&(mail=bob@example.com)(c=US)) .

property.name: LDAPScope
property.summary: The LDAP scope
property.description: The depth of the LDAP search. The default is Subtree.

object.description: An LDAP Search Parameters object is a container for the parameters to use to perform an LDAP search operation. When used with authentication, the search retrieves the distinguished name (DN) for the user. When used with credential authorization mapping, the search retrieves the group name (DN or attribute value) based on the DN of the authenticated user.

object.name: ProcessingMetadata

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: MetaItem
property.summary: Define a metadata item for this Processing Metadata.
property.description: Define a metadata item by selecting one from the predefined items for a Processing Metadata Category, or configure a custom metadata item for a "customizable" category to retrieve value from any arbitrary headers or variables.

object.description: A Processing Metadata object contains a list of metadata items extracted from a message, such as protocol header values, or from the device processing scope, such as system variables. This list, or manifest, of item values is then returned by the metadata object in an XML nodeset. Currently used by an AAA Policy for Identity and Resource extraction.

object.name: RADIUSSettings

property.name: Timeout

property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 30000, with a default of 1000) that specifies the number of milliseconds that the RADIUS client waits before retransmitting an unacknowledged request.

property.name: Retries
property.summary: Maximum number of retries per server
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 10, with a default of 3) that specifies the maximum number of times that the RADIUS client retransmits an unacknowledged request to a server.

property.name: Servers

property.hoverhelp: Enter the URL of the XML file for authentication. The XML file can be on the appliance or on a remote server. You can use the same XML file to map credentials.

property.name: AUSSLValcred

property.description: The host name or IP addess of the server.

property.name: AUPort
property.summary: Enter the listening port on the server.
property.description: The listening port on the server.

property.name: AULDAPSearchForDN
property.summary: Indicate whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.

description.p: Whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.

ul.li: When enabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP search parameters for an LDAP search to retrieve the user DN.
When disabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP prefix and suffix to construct the user DN.

hoverhelp.p: Indicate whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.

ul.li: When enabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP search parameters for an LDAP search to retrieve the user DN.
When disabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP prefix and suffix to construct the user DN.

property.name: AULDAPBindDN
property.summary: Enter the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Enter the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPBindPasswordAlias
property.summary: Enter the password alias for the password used by the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The password alias for the password used by the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPSearchParameters
property.summary: Set the LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.
property.description: The LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPPrefix
property.summary: Enter the string to add before the user name to form the DN.

description.p: The string to add before the user name to form the DN. If this value is CN= and the user name is Bob , the complete DN is CN=Bob,O=example.com when the LDAP suffix is O=example.com .

hoverhelp.p: Enter the string to add before the user name to form the DN. If this value is CN= and the user name is Bob , the complete DN is CN=Bob,O=example.com when the LDAP suffix is O=example.com .

property.name: AUForceDNLDAPOrder
property.summary: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format.

description.p: Whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from an SSL certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred .

When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US .

hoverhelp.p: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from an SSL certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred .

When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US .

property.name: LDAPsuffix
property.summary: Enter the string to add after the user name to form the DN.

description.p: The string to add after the user name to form the DN. If this value is O=example.com and the user name is Bob , the complete DN is CN=Bob,O=example.com when the LDAP prefix is CN= .

hoverhelp.p: Enter the string to add after the user name to form the DN. If this value is O=example.com and the user name is Bob , the complete DN is CN=Bob,O=example.com when the LDAP prefix is CN= .

property.description: The load balancer group of LDAP servers.

property.description: How to cache authentication results.

property.name: AULDAPReadTimeout

property.description: The method to map authenticated user credentials to access profiles.

property.name: MCLDAPSearchForGroup
property.summary: Indicate whether to search LDAP to retrieve all user groups that match the query.

description.p: Whether to search LDAP to retrieve all user groups that match the query.

ul.li: When enabled, the authenticated DN of the user and the LDAP search parameters are used as part of the LDAP search to retrieve all user groups that match the query. When a user belongs to multiple groups, the resultant access policy for this user is additive not most restrictive.
When disabled, the authenticated identity of the user (DN or user group of local user) is used directly as the input credential.

hoverhelp.p: Indicate whether to search LDAP to retrieve all user groups that match the query.

ul.li: When enabled, the authenticated DN of the user and the LDAP search parameters are used as part of the LDAP search to retrieve all user groups that match the query. When a user belongs to multiple groups, the resultant access policy for this user is additive not most restrictive.
When disabled, the authenticated identity of the user (DN or user group of local user) is used directly as the input credential.

property.summary: Enter the time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the appliance closes the connection.

property.summary: Set the LDAP protocol version to use.
property.description: The LDAP protocol version to use.

property.name: FallbackLogin
property.summary: Indicate whether to use local user accounts as fallback users if remote authentication fails.

description.p: Whether to use local user accounts as fallback users if remote authentication fails. With fallback users, local user accounts can log on to the appliance if authentication fails or during a network outage that affects primary authentication. The recommendation is to restrict fallback users to a subset of local user accounts.
Note: When authentication uses an SSL certificate from a connection peer, you cannot enforce RBM on CLI sessions unless fallback users are supported.

hoverhelp.p: Indicate whether to use local user accounts as fallback users if remote authentication fails. With fallback users, local user accounts can log on to the appliance if authentication fails or during a network outage that affects primary authentication. The recommendation is to restrict fallback users to a subset of local user accounts.
Note: When authentication uses an SSL certificate from a connection peer, you cannot enforce RBM on CLI sessions unless fallback users are supported.

property.name: FallbackUser
property.summary: Set the list of local user accounts that are fallback users.
property.description: The list of local user accounts that are fallback users.

property.name: ApplyToCLI
property.summary: Indicate whether to enforce the RBM policy on CLI sessions.
property.description: Whether to enforce the RBM policy on CLI sessions. When authentication uses an SSL certificate from a connection peer, you cannot enforce RBM on CLI sessions unless fallback users are supported.

property.name: RestrictAdminToSerialPort
property.summary: Indicate whether to restrict admin user account to serial port.

description.p: Whether to restrict the admin user account to the serial port.

property.name: MinPasswordLength
property.summary: Enter the minimum length of a valid password.
property.description: The minimum length of a valid password. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128. The default value is 6.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the minimum length of a valid password. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128.

property.name: RequireMixedCase
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain both uppercase and lowercase characters.
property.description: Whether passwords must contain both uppercase and lowercase characters.

property.name: RequireDigit
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain at least one number.
property.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one number.

property.name: RequireNonAlphaNumeric
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain at least one special, non-alphanumeric character.
property.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one special, non-alphanumeric character.

property.name: DisallowUsernameSubstring
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords can never contain the user name as a substring.
property.description: Whether passwords can never contain the user name as a substring.

property.name: DoPasswordAging
property.summary: Indicates whether passwords expires.
property.description: Whether passwords expires.

property.name: MaxPasswordAge
property.summary: Enter the expiry for passwords.
property.description: The expiry for passwords Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 30.
Enter the expiry for passwords Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535.

property.name: DoPasswordHistory
property.summary: Indicates whether to control the reuse of recent passwords.
property.description: Whether to control the reuse of recent passwords.

property.name: NumOldPasswords
property.summary: Enter the number of recent passwords to track to prevent reuse.
property.description: The number of recent passwords to track to prevent reuse. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 5.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the number of recent passwords to track to prevent reuse. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535.

property.name: CliTimeout
property.summary: Enter the time after which to invalidate idle CLI sessions.
property.description: The time after which to invalidate idle CLI sessions. When invalidated, requires reauthentication. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 600. A value of 0 disables the timer.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the time after which to invalidate idle CLI sessions. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. A value of 0 disables the timer.

property.name: MaxFailedLogin
property.summary: Enter the number of failed login attempts to allow before account lockout.
property.description: The number of failed login attempts to allow before account lockout. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 64, wheere 0 disables account lockout. The default value is 0.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the number of failed login attempts to allow before account lockout. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 64, wheere 0 disables account lockout.

property.name: LockoutPeriod
property.summary: Enter the duration to lock out local user accounts after the maximum number of failed login attempts is exceeded.

description.p: The duration to lock out local user accounts after the maximum number of failed login attempts is exceeded. Instead of locking out accounts for a specific duration, the account can be locked out until re-enabled by a privileged user. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1000, where 0 locks out accounts until reset. The default value is 1.

Note: The duration applies to all local accounts, including the admin user account. The only difference is that the admin user account cannot be locked out until reset. When the duration is 0, the admin user account is locked out for 120 minutes or until re-enabled by a privileged user.

hoverhelp.p: Enter the duration to lock out local user accounts after the maximum number of failed login attempts is exceeded. Instead of locking out accounts for a specific duration, the account can be locked out until re-enabled by a privileged user. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1000, where 0 locks out accounts until reset. The default value is 1.

Note: The duration applies to all local accounts, including the admin user account. The only difference is that the admin user account cannot be locked out until reset. When the duration is 0, the admin user account is locked out for 120 minutes or until re-enabled by a privileged user.

property.name: MCForceDNLDAPOrder
property.summary: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format.

description.p: Whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from an SSL certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred .

When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US .

hoverhelp.p: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from an SSL certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred .

When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US .

property.name: PasswordHashAlgorithm
property.summary: Set the hash algorithm to apply to passwords.

description.p: The hash algorithm to apply to passwords before they are stored. The hash algorithm affects firmware downgrade and cryptographic modes in the following ways.

ul.li: For firmware downgrade, sha256crypt is not supported in releases earlier than 6.0.1.0.
For cryptographic modes, like FIPS 140-2 Level 1, md5crypt is not supported in FIPS mode.

hoverhelp.p: Set the hash algorithm to apply to passwords before they are stored. The hash algorithm affects firmware downgrade and cryptographic modes in the following ways.

ul.li: For firmware downgrade, sha256crypt is not supported in releases earlier than 6.0.1.0.
For cryptographic modes, like FIPS 140-2 Level 1, md5crypt is not supported in FIPS mode.

property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets

property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets

property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets

description.p: Manage role-based management (RBM) settings: RBM, password policy, and account policy

ul.li: RBM consists of the following capabilities: Authenticating users, evaluating the access profile, enforcing access to resources
The password policy sets the password requirements for local user accounts.
The account policy sets the lockout behavior and the timeout for CLI sessions.

property.description: Define an attribute by selecting the source type and specifying the data source and SAML attribute name.

object.description: Define a list of SAML attributes for the SAML Assertion generator.

object.name: SOAPHeaderDisposition

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.summary: Define an instruction to process a SOAP header and/or child element.
property.description: Customer specifically asks this transformation to simply remove/keep/fault a SOAP header; or indicates whether a header was processed or not by the prior action, then this action will take the default behaviors.

object.name: TAM

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Descriptive summary for the configuration
property.description: Enter the descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: ADUseAD
property.summary: Use Active Directory instead of LDAP as the registry

description.p: Select whether the Access Manager client uses Microsoft Active Directory instead of LDAP as the registry. The default registry for an Access Manager deployment is LDAP. This selection will cause this client to use Microsoft Active Directory. Active Directory type is not supported after ISAM 7.0 .

Note: The type of registry that an Access Manager deployment supports is determined by the configuration of the Access Manager server. The registry that you define in this configuration is for a client and must match the registry of the server.

property.name: TAMVersion
property.summary: The version of the Access Manager client

description.p: Select the Access Manager client version to use. The default value is 8.0.1.
Note: The Access Manager version installed with your firmware is used as the client version regardless of which value you select here.

property.name: ConfigurationFile
property.summary: Location of the configuration file for the Access Manager client
property.description: Select the location of the configuration file for the Access Manager client. To be available for selection, files must have .conf or .cfg as their file extension.

property.name: ADConfigurationFile
property.summary: Location of the configuration file for user directories
property.description: Select the location of the configuration file for user directories. To be available for selection, files must have .conf or .cfg as their file extension.

property.name: SSLKeyFile
property.summary: Location of the SSL key file
property.description: Select the location of the key file for SSL communication. To be available for selection, files must have .kdb as their file extension. Generally, these files are in the cert: directory or the sharedcert: directory.

property.name: SSLKeyStashFile
property.summary: Location of the SSL key stash file
property.description: Select the location of the key stash file for SSL communication. To be available for selection, files must have .sth as their file extension. Generally, these files are in the cert: directory or the sharedcert: directory.

property.name: UseLocalMode
property.summary: Use the policy database that is cached locally instead of accessed remotely
property.description: Select whether to create a local copy of the policy database. Set this property to cache the policy database locally instead of accessing the remote policy server. This property must match the behavior defined in the configuration files for the Access Manager client.

property.name: PollInterval
property.summary: Refresh interval for the local policy database
property.description:
Enter the interval between requests to update the local policy database from the remote policy server.
default - Uses the default value, which is 600 seconds.
disable - Disables requests to the policy database for requests.
seconds - Specifies the time interval in seconds.

property.name: ListenMode
property.summary: Whether the appliance accepts update notifications from the policy server
property.description: Select whether to accept notifications to update the local policy database from the policy server. When you set this property, it overrides the behavior defined in configuration files for the Access Manager client.

property.name: ListenPort
property.summary: Listening port for update notifications from the policy server
property.description: Enter the listening port on the appliance to receive update notifications from the remote policy server.

property.name: ReturningUserAttributes
property.summary: Whether the registry returns user attributes.
property.description: Select whether the registry returns users attributes for successful authorization requests. When set, the registry returns user attributes.

property.name: LDAPUseSSL
property.summary: Whether to use SSL communication with the registry
property.description: Select whether to use SSL communication between the Access Manager client and the LDAP or Active Directory server.

property.name: LDAPSSLPort
property.summary: Listening port for SSL communication on the LDAP server
property.description: Enter the listening port that the LDAP server uses for SSL communication. This property does not apply for SSL communication with an Active Directory server.

property.name: LDAPSSLKeyFile
property.summary: Location of the key file with the certificates for SSL communication with the registry server

description.p: Select the location of the key file that contains the certificates for SSL communication with the registry server.

ul.li: For server-only authentication, the key file must contain the signer certificate for the registry server.

For mutual authentication, the key file must also contain a personal certificate that the registry server can validate. If the personal certificate is not the default personal certificate in the key file, you must enter the label of the personal certificate.

description.p: This file must be in the cert: or the sharedcert: directory.

property.name: LDAPSSLKeyFilePassword
property.display: Registry Server SSL Key File Password (deprecated)
property.summary: Password for the key file for SSL communication with the registry server.
property.description: Enter the password for the key file that contains the certificates for SSL communication with the registry server.

property.name: LDAPSSLKeyFilePasswordAlias
property.display: Registry Server SSL Key File Password Alias
property.summary: Password alias of the password for the key file for SSL communication with the registry server.
property.description: Enter the password alias of the password for the key file that contains the certificates for SSL communication with the registry server.

property.name: LDAPSSLKeyFileLabel
property.display: Registry Server SSL Key File Label
property.summary: Label of the personal certificate in the key file for client authentication

description.p: Enter the label of the personal certificate in the key file for client authentication.

ul.li: When using mutual authentication with the registry server and the personal certificate is not the default personal certificate in the key file, enter the label of the personal certificate. The personal certificate allows client authentication.
For server-only authentication, do not enter a value.

property.name: TAMUseFIPS
property.summary: Whether secure communication runs in FIPS mode
property.description: Select whether the secure communication between the Access Manager client and the authorization server runs in FIPS mode.

property.name: TAMChooseNIST
property.summary: Which compliance mode to use
property.description: In FIPS mode, there is a mandatory NIST compliance level to select. Select a level that is compatible with the corresponding Access Manager servers and registry servers. Note that the NIST and NSA options are available only in Access Manager versions 7.0 and 8.0.1.

property.name: TAMUseBasicUser
property.summary: Whether to support basic users in the client
property.description: Control whether to support basic users in the client. When enabled, you can use LDAP user entries for authentication or authorization without importing them into the ISAM domain.

property.name: UserPrincipalAttribute
property.summary: The attribute that identifies the basic user in the LDAP user entry
property.description: Specify the attribute that identifies the basic user in the LDAP user entry. The default value is uid.

property.name: UserNoDuplicates
property.summary: Whether to allow duplicate principals

description.p: Control whether to allow duplicate principals.

ul.li: When enabled, the search for basic users covers all suffixes to ensure that no users with the same name are found. If duplicate principals are found in this client, the system returns an error.
When disabled, the search for basic users ignores possible duplicates. By default, duplicate principals are not allowed.

property.name: UserSearchSuffixes
property.summary: The LDAP suffixes to be searched for principals

description.p: Specify the ordered list of LDAP suffixes to be searched for principals. When specified and suffix optimization is disabled, the suffixes are searched in entry order. If suffix optimization is enabled, this order is overridden by the suffix optimization order.
If you do not specify any suffixes, the system searches all available suffixes.

property.name: UserSuffixOptimiser
property.summary: Whether to search the suffixes in an optimized order

description.p: Control whether to search the suffixes in an optimized order.

ul.li: When enabled and uplicate principals are allowed, the suffixes are searched in an optimized order based on hit count, with the most hit of the suffix at the head of the search suffix list. This can help reduce the number of suffixes searched. If duplicate principals are not allowed, the suffix optimization setting is disregarded and all suffixes are searched to check for duplicates.
When disabled, the search order is provided by the order that is defined by the search suffixes property.

property.name: TAMFedDirs
property.summary: List of LDAP federated directories
property.description: Specify a list of federated directories. Each entry describes a unique set of LDAP suffixes and LDAP server. Federated directories define all the suffixes that can be searched for user identities.

property.name: TAMAZReplicas
property.summary: List of remote authorization servers

description.p: Replicas indicate the network location of remote authorization servers. You must configure at least one replica. You can configure additional replicas for failover purposes.
Note: If you uploaded a file that was created previously, it must define at least one replica.

Trace logging is a useful debugging tool. By default, trace logging is not enabled. Trace logging collects large amounts of data in a short amount of time and might result in a significant performance degradation. Enable trace logging only at the direction of IBM Support.
When enabled, the appliance creates two trace files for each library. The appliance writes the files cyclically. Double the size of the files to obtain the total allowable file size.

property.name: AutoRetry
property.summary: Whether to attempt starting the client after an initial failure

description.p: Select whether to attempt starting the Access Manager client after an initial failure. The appliance automatically attempts to start the client after a critical error. This property controls the behavior after the initial attempt to restart.

ul.li: When enabled, the appliance attempts to start the client with the defined configuration.
When disabled, the client is marked as down .

description.p: The default behavior is to not attempt to start the client after an initial failure.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Interval to wait between attempts to start the client.

description.p: Enter the number of seconds to wait between attempts to start the Access Manager client. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 180.

property.name: RetryAttempts
property.summary: Number of attempts before using the long attempt interval.
property.description: Enter the number of attempts to perform for the Access Manager client. After performing these attempts and the client did not start, each additional attempt waits the number of seconds defined by the long interval. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. A value of 0 disables the long interval. The default value is 3.

property.name: LongRetryInterval
property.summary: Long attempt interval before trying the failed connection again
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds to wait after reaching the number of retry attempts. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 900.

action.name: CopyLocalTAMDb
action.display: Manage local Access Manager policy database

object.summary: IBM Security Access Manager client for authentication and authorization

description.p: A DataPower appliance can support multiple IBM Security Access Manager registry types: LDAP or Microsoft Active Directory. Support for the registry type is established for each Access Manager client that starts according to its configuration.

object.name: TFIMEndpoint

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: mEndpointType
property.summary: TFIM endpoint type
property.description: Specify the endpoint type configured on the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.

property.name: mServerURL
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the domain-qualified host name or IP address of the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.

property.name: mServerPort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the listening port on the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.

property.name: mCompatibleMode
property.summary: Compatibility Mode

description.p: Select the currently configured version of Tivoli Federated Identity Manager. The selected value determines the details for the namespace and WS-Trust messages.

ul.li: For versions 6.0 or 6.1, version 1.2 of the WS-Trust specification is used.

For version 6.2, version 1.3 of the WS-Trust specification is used. On an TFIM version 6.2 server, this corresponds to the "Validate OASIS URI" Request Type. Version 6.2 also supports WS-Trust 1.2.
Note: To use WS-Trust 1.2 messages with a TFIM version 6.2 server, use 6.1 as the compatibility mode. On a TFIM version 6.2 server, this corresponds to the "Validate" Request Type.

property.name: mReqToken60Format
property.summary: Request Token Format for version 6.0.1
property.description: Select the format of the request token when using Tivoli Federated Identity Manager version 6.0.1.

property.name: mReqToken61Format
property.summary: Request Token Format for version 6.1
property.description: Select the format of the request token when using Tivoli Federated Identity Manager version 6.1.

property.name: mReqToken62Format
property.summary: Request Token Format for version 6.2
property.description: Select the format of the request token when using Tivoli Federated Identity Manager version 6.2.

property.name: mReqCustomURL
property.summary: Custom style sheet or GatewayScript file for request.
property.description: When Request Token Format is Custom, upload the custom style sheet or GatewayScript file to the appliance. The custom style sheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory.

property.name: mAppliesToAddress
property.summary: TFIM Applies-To field

description.p: When Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the scope for this security token. For example, enter the services to which this token applies. For example:

ul.li: http://tfim.ibm.com:9080/EchoApplication/services/EchoServiceUsername
http://9.33.97.251:9080/EchoApplication/services/EchoServiceUsername

description.p: Within the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager service, this information specifies the destination of the request. The TFIM trust service uses this information to determine which partner is being accessed.
To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your TFIM administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the AppliesTo field.

property.name: mIssuer
property.summary: Issuer

description.p: When Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the identity that issued the request. In the WS-Security Management (WSSM) component, the issuer is either the WSSM token generator or the WSSM token consumer. For example:

ul.li: urn:itfim:wssm:tokenconsumer

description.p: To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your Tivoli Federated Identity Manager administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the Issuer field.

property.name: mPortType
property.summary: Port Type

description.p: When Compatibility Mode is version 6.1 or version 6.2 and when Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the Web services port type to use. A port type is a group of Web services operations. For example:
To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your Tivoli Federated Identity Manager administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the PortType field.

property.name: mOperation
property.summary: Operation

description.p: When Compatibility Mode is version 6.1 or version 6.2 and when Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the name of the Web services operation as defined in the WSDL document. For example:
To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your Tivoli Federated Identity Manager administrator.

property.name: mSSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: Select the SSL proxy profile to manage SSL communications with the peer. The SSL Proxy Profile identifies the keys and certificates that are used in the handshake.

property.name: mSchemaValidate
property.summary: Schema Validate Response
property.description: Specify whether to schema-validate responses from the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server. When enabled, responses are schema-validated using the WS-Trust version that is defined by the compatibility mode.

property.name: mLTPAValueTypeMode
property.display: LTPA Binary Security Token Value Type
property.summary: LTPA Binary Security Token Value Type
property.description: The namespace mode to use when populating the ValueType field of an LTPA BinarySecurityToken.

property.name: mSTSUsername
property.summary: Enforcement point username
property.description: Basic authentication user name when connecting to the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager OAuth secure token service.

property.name: mSTSPassword
property.summary: Enforcement point password
property.description: Basic authentication password when connecting to the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager OAuth secure token service.

property.name: mSTSPasswordAlias
property.summary: Enforcement point password alias
property.description: Password alias for the Basic authentication password when connecting to the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager OAuth secure token service.

property.name: mSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: mSSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property-group.name: main
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display general settings

object.description: Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Configuration

object.name: XACMLPDP

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: EqualPolicies
property.summary: All the policies are evaluated on the same level, there is no general policy-set.
property.description: In case of a top level policy-set is undefined, all policies are evaluated equally, PDP will use the PolicyCombiningAlg for the final decision.

property.name: GeneralPolicy
property.summary: The URL of the top level XACML policy/policy-set file.
property.description: The URL of top level XACML policy/policy-set file, if there is one. This file may reside on the local device (typically as local:///file) or on a remote server. Attempts to retrieve this file from remote servers may be governed by the User Agent in use by the XML Manager of the service. This may be useful for SSL connections, for example.

property.name: CombiningAlg
property.summary: The combining algorithm when there is not a top level general-policy.
property.description: Select the policy-combining algorithm when not using a top-level comprehensive XACML policy file. The default is First Applicable.

property.name: DependentPolicy
property.summary: The URL of dependent xacml policy/policy-set files to be used by this PDP.
property.description: Some of the XACML Policiesi/Policy-Sets are indirectly needed when the PDP evaluates a request. They are called Dependent Policy Files. Specify their URLs with this setting.

property.name: Directory
property.summary: The directory of all the other dependent policy files.
