property.description: List directories that contain dependent files. In these directories, all files with the xml or xacml extension are available to the XACML PDP. Use this option when there are too many policy files to identify independently.

property.name: CacheTTL
property.summary: Time to cache the XACML policies.
property.description: This sets the explicit time to live (TTL) for cached XACML policies, either raw or compiled. The default value 0 means the cache never expire unless PDP explicitly refreshes the policies. The maximum TTL is 31 days (2,678,400 seconds).

property.name: PAP
property.summary: The external PAP which will provide any additional xacml policy/policy-set docs.

object.summary: Define the object for a XACML Policy Decision Point
object.description: The XACML policies can be evaluated on a DataPower device, This on-box XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP) allows customers to define the necessary information so that it can evaluate the corresponding XACML policies against a XACML request for an XACML Policy Enforcement Point (PEP). The DataPower PEP is implemented with AAA action.

property.name: AccessControlEntry
property.summary: IP addresses to allow or deny access
property.description: Defines the range of IP addresses to which to allow access and from which to deny access.

description.p: An access control list (ACL) consists of a sequence of allow and deny clauses. Each clause identifies an IP address or range of addresses that allow or deny access to a service.
After associating an ACL with a service, the ACL grants access to addresses in allow clauses and denies access to all other addresses.

Candidate addresses are sequentially evaluated against each clause in the ACL. A candidate address is denied or granted access in accordance with the first clause that matches. Consequently, the order of the clauses in the ACL is vital.

An ACL with only deny clauses effectively disables a service by denying access to all addresses. To complete the ACL, include an allow clause to ensure that all addresses that are not explicitly denied access are granted access.

object.name: AppSecurityPolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: RequestMaps
property.description: A list of Web Request Profile objects and their matching criteria. If the client request meets the matching criteria, its Web Request Profile runs.

property.name: ResponseMaps
property.description: A list of Web Response Profile objects and their matching criteria. If the server response meets the matching criteria, its Web Response Profile runs.

property.name: ErrorMaps
property.description: A list of Error Policy objects (Processing Rules) and their matching criteria. If an error meets the matching criteria, its Error Policy runs.

object.description: An Application Security Policy establishes the rules to use to enforce security for a Web Application Firewall service. This policy employs request maps, response maps, and error maps that provide a detailed security configuration. Each of these maps, in turn, matches to a Web Request Profile, Web Request Profile, or Error Policy, as the case might be.

property.name: Size
property.summary: Maximum log size
property.description: Specify the maximum size of audit log rotations. Enter a value in the range 250 through 500000. The default value is 1000.

property.name: Rotate
property.summary: Maximum number of rotations
property.description: Specify the maximum number of rotations to permit. Enter a value in the range 1 through 100. The default value is 3.

property.name: AuditLevel
property.summary: Desired level of audit
property.description: Specify the level of audit. Full includes all incoming connection information.

description.p: The audit log settings control the configuration of the audit log of the system. The audit log configuration can be specified to keep a number of rotations of a specific size.
This object also controls the level of audit. When set to full level of audit, connection information will be logged. More information is logged when in Common Criteria Compliance mode.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: CPAId
property.summary: CPA ID
property.description:
For outbound transactions, indicates the CPA ID in the outbound ebXML message that you send to the external partner.
For inbound transactions, indicates the CPA ID that you use to identify the inbound ebXML message. It is recommended that the CPA ID be a URI.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: InternalRole
property.summary: Role of internal party
property.description: Specifies the authorized role, such as "buyer", of the internal party in particular Business Collaboration. When sending an outbound message, the Internal Role is used as the Role element of the From Party; when receiving an inbound message, the Internal Role is used to authorize the Role element of the To Party. Required for a Business Collaboration. Imported from CPA the Role/@name value under the selected internal party. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Role/@name value of the To party when receiving an incoming ebMS message or of the From party when sending an outbound ebMS message.

property.name: ExternalRole
property.summary: Role of external party
property.description: Specifies the authorized role, such as "seller", of the external party in particular Business Collaboration. When sending an outbound message, the External Role is used as the Role element of the To Party; when receiving an inbound message, the External Role is used to authorize the Role element of the From Party. Required for a Business Collaboration. Imported from CPA the Role/@name value under the external party. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Role/@name value of the From party in the received incoming ebMS message or of the From party in the outbound ebMS message to be sent.

property.name: Service
property.summary: Value of service
property.description: The required Service identifies the service that acts on the message. For outbound message, the value of the Service is used as the value of the Service element in the ebXML Message Header. For inbound transaction, the Service along with CPAId, Internal Partner, and External Partner are used to identify the CPA Entry; the Service value of Collaboration and the Action value of Action binding then provide routing of received message to correct endpoint. Imported from CPA the Service element under ServiceBinding element. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Service element.

property.name: ServiceType
property.summary: Type attribute of service
property.description: If the type is specified, the value will be present in the type attribute of the Service element within the message being sent. If the type is empty, the value of the Service element should be a URI. Imported from CPA the type attribute within the Service element.

property.name: SenderMshSetting
property.summary: Default setting for sending ebMS MSH level signals
property.description: Specifies the default sender action binding within the MSH Signal Service Collaboration in which the Service attribute is valued "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service". This identifies the deafult setting for sending standalone MSH level signals (i.e., Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, Pong). The default can be overridden by Action entry. Created by referencing to the defaultMshChannelId of both parties when CPA import.

property.name: ReceiverMshSetting
property.summary: Default setting for receiving ebMS MSH level signals
property.description: Specifies the default receiver action binding within the MSH Signal Service Collaboration in which the Service attribute is valued "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service". This identifies the deafult setting for receiving standalone MSH level signals (i.e., Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, Pong). The default can be optionally overridden by the receiver action entry which is named as the MSH level signal identifier. Created by referencing to the defaultMshChannelId of both parties when CPA import.

property.name: Actions
property.summary: Actions
property.description: Defines the actions to bind. For a business Collaboration, each Action entry identifies an business message that a Party is capable of sending or receiving. For a Collaboration of MSH level signal, override the sending or receiving behaviors of default sender setting or default receiver setting using the value of "Acknowledgment", "MessageError", "StatusRequest", "StatusResponse", "Ping", or "Pong". Created when importing a CPA and are configurable.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalEndpointURI
property.summary: URI to receive the message

description.p: Specifies the URI where messages can be received.

Implied by CPA the Endpoint element of the internal (receiving) party's TransportReceiver element. If the value is specified, then the incoming URI received by the Frontside Handler should match the pattern specified otherwise the transaction will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender.

property.name: SyncReplyMode
property.summary: Sync reply mode the receiver expects

description.p: Specifies the type of sync reply mode the receiver expects. The value of "none", which is the default value, indicates that all MSH level and Business level messages will be returned as separate asynchronous messages. The value other than "none" indicates the synchronous connection will be used to exchange all messages necessary for conducting the business transaction.
Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's syncReplyMode attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

If the value configured is not identical to the implied mode requested by the received ebMS message, for example, the value is "none" but a SyncReply element is present in the received ebMS message header, the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender.

property.name: AckRequested
property.summary: Whether the receiver expects request for Acknowledgment

description.p: Used by the receiver to control whether to expect the incoming message to request an Acknowledgment.

If the value is set to "always" (or "never"), then the AckRequested element should (not) be present within the MessageHeader element in the ebMS SOAP Header otherwise it will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender. If the value is set to "perMessage", then it means whether the AckRequested element is present or absent can be varied on a "per message" basis and the receiving gateway will return an Acknowledgment signal if requested.
Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.
Used by the receiver to control whether to expect the incoming message to request a signed Acknowledgment.

If the value is set to "always" (or "never"), then the signed attribute within the AckRequested element should be set to "true" (or "false") otherwise it will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender. If the value is set to "perMessage", then it means the receiving gateway will sign the Acknowledgment if requested.
Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

property.name: AllowDuplicateMessage
property.summary: When to allow and reprocess duplicate inbound messages
property.description: Controls when to allow and reprocess duplicate AS or ebMS inbound messages. Note that this option does not apply to MDN or ACK.

property.name: PersistDuration
property.summary: Duration of message to be persisted

description.p: Indicates to the receiving gateway the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage. When receiving inbound message, the Persist Duration is used to compute the expiry time using the formula: Time to Persist = Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's expiry time has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation.
Default to 0 to expire the received document at the time we receive the document.
Imported from CPA, the PersistDuration element within ReliableMessaging element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding element.

property.name: EncryptionRequired
property.summary: Whether the incoming message should be encrypted

description.p: Controls whether the body of received ebMS messages should be encrypted. The default is off. Note that this option is not applied for the MSH level signals which is not to be encrypted.
Implied by CPA the isConfidential attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.

property.name: DecryptIdCred
property.summary: Identification credentials used to decrypt inbound messages

description.p: Sets the identification credentials to decrypt inbound messages.
Created when importing a CPA. Please set the correct identification credentials after import.

property.name: SignatureRequired
property.summary: Whether the incoming message should be signed

description.p: Controls whether the received ebMS messages should be signed. The default is off.
Implied by CPA the isNonRepudiationRequired attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.

property.name: VerifyValCred
property.summary: Validation credentials used to verify inbound message

description.p: Sets the validation credentials to verify inbound messages' signature.

Imported from CPA. If the isNonRepudiationReceiptRequired is set true, the SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.

property.name: DefaultSignerCert
property.summary: Default validation certificate used to verify the signature of inbound message
property.description: Set the default validation certificate to verify the signature of an inbound ebMS message or an acknowledgment. The default signature validation certificate is used if either keyInfo element is missing or signature method is not supported.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: EnabledDocType
property.summary: Enabled Document Type
property.description: Indicates which document types to support.

property.name: DestEndpointURL
property.summary: Destination URL

description.p: Specify the destination URL for sending the message to the external party's endpoint. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use. If the URL starts with http://, the service uses the HTTP protocol. If the URL starts with https://, the service uses the HTTPS protocol.
Imported from CPA the Endpoint element for the external party's TransportReceiver element.
To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.

description.p: Sets the SSL proxy profile to establish an SSL-enabled, secured connection.
Imported from CPA, the TransportServerSecurity element provides details about establishing the secure connection between the sender and receiver.

property.name: UserName
property.summary: User name

description.p: Overrides the user name in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses.
The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password

description.p: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses.
The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password Alias

description.p: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses.
The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.

property.name: ConnectionTimeout
property.summary: Override timeout

description.p: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to maintain an idle connection. Use any value of 3 - 7200. The default is 300.
This setting is not imported from CPA.

property.name: SyncReplyMode
property.summary: Type of synchronous response

description.p: Specifies the type of synchronous response requested by the message which is being sent. The value of "none", which is the default value, indicates that all MSH level and Business level messages will be returned as separate asynchronous messages. For the value of "mshSignalsOnly", the ebMS's SyncReply element will be included in the SOAP Header of the outbound message.
Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's syncReplyMode attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

property.name: DuplicateElimination
property.summary: Whether to request duplicate elimination

description.p: When sending an outbound ebMS message, this option controls whether the internal sending party requests the external receiving party to check duplicate elimination. If set to "always", the default value, the request for duplicate elimination will be made by presenting the DuplicateElimination element within the MessageHeader element in the ebMS SOAP Header.
Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's duplicateElimination attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

property.name: AckRequested
property.summary: Whether to request an Acknowledgment

description.p: Used by the sending party to control whether to request the receiving MSH to return the Acknowledgment signal. If set to "always", then the AckRequested element within the MessageHeader element in the SOAP Header is to be present.

Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element. As a sender the possible value is "always" (enabled) or "never" (disabled).

property.name: AckSignatureRequested
property.summary: Whether to request signed Acknowledgment

description.p: Used by the sending party to control whether the receiving MSH should return a signed Acknowledgment signal - containing a Signature element. If set to "always", then the message being sent outbound will have the signed attribute of the AckRequested element set to "true".

Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackSignatureRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element. As a sender the possible value is "always" (enabled) or "never" (disabled).

property.name: Retry
property.summary: Whether to retransmit an unacknowledged message

description.p: Controls whether to enable the logic for the retransmission of unacknowledged outbound messages. The default is off.
Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.

property.name: MaxRetries
property.summary: Maximum number of retries

description.p: Specifies the permitted number of retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 30. The default is 3, which means an outbound message can potentially be sent four times (the initiative one and successive 3 retries).
Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Time interval of each retry attempt

description.p: Specifies the interval in seconds between retry attempts. Use any value of 1 - 86400. This default is 1800.
Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.

property.name: PersistDuration
property.summary: Duration of message to be persisted

description.p: Indicates to the sending gateway the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage and is used to compute the TimeToLive value to be packaged in the outbound message. When sending outbound message, the TimeToLive is computed using the formula: with Retry, Current Time + ((Maximum Retries + 2) * Retry Interval); without Retry, Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's TimeToLive has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation.
Default to 0 to expire the sent document at the time it is being sent.
Imported from CPA, the PersistDuration element within ReliableMessaging element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding element.

property.name: IncludeTimeToLive
property.summary: Lifetime of the message
property.description:
Controls whether the sending partner includes the <TimeToLive> element in the outbound ebMS message header. The <TimeToLive> element indicates when the message expires.
If the receiving partner receives the message before it expires, the receiving partner accepts the message.
If the receiving partner receives the message after it expires, the receiving partner rejects the message.

property.name: EncryptionRequired
property.summary: Whether to encrypt messages

description.p: Controls whether to encrypt the body of outgoing ebMS messages. The default is off. This encryption is not applied for the MSH level signals.
Implied by the CPA element SenderDigitalEnvelope under DocExchange element's ebXMLSenderBinding.

property.name: EncryptCert
property.summary: Certificate used to encrypt outbound messages

description.p: Sets the certificate that encrypts outbound messages. Use the name of a certificate.

Imported from CPA, the EncryptionCertificateRef which is within the DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding/ReceiverDigitalEnvelope of the other party to point to what the other (external receiving) Party's encryption certificate to be applied.
Sets the encryption algorithm that encrypts outbound ebMS messages.
Imported from CPA the EncryptionAlgorithm element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding identifies the encryption algorithm to be used.

property.name: SignatureRequired
property.summary: Whether to sign message being sent

description.p: Controls whether to digitally sign the messages being sent from this internal partner. The default is off.
Implied by CPA the isNonRepudiationRequired attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.

property.name: SignIdCred
property.summary: Credentials used to sign outbound messages and the MSH signal response.

description.p: Sets the identification credentials used by this internal party to digitally sign an outbound message being sent and the MSH level signals being responded (including Acknowledgment, Pong, and StatusResponse).from this internal partner when requiring a signature.
Created when importing a CPA. Please set the correct identification credentials after import.

property.name: SignatureAlgorithm
property.summary: Signature algorithm

description.p: Sets the algorithm used to sign messages from this internal partner. The default is dsa-sha1 recommended by the ebMS specification.

Imported from CPA. The SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.

property.name: SignDigestAlgorithm
property.summary: Digest algorithm used in the XML Signature when hashing the payloads during signing

description.p: Sets the algorithm used to hashing the payloads during signing. The default is sha1. Refer to http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.

Imported from CPA. If the isNonRepudiationReceiptRequired is set true, the SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.

property.name: SignatureC14NAlgorithm
property.summary: Signature canonicalization algorithm used before signing process

description.p: Sets the algorithm used to canonicalize the SOAP Envelope XML and exclude comments before signing messages (either the business messages or the MSH level signals including Acknowledgment, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, and Pong). The default is Canonical XML 1.0with Comments, which is recommended by the ebMS specification.
Not imported from CPA but is required when Require Signature is set to true.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

object.name: B2BGateway

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: DocStoreLocation
property.summary: Storage location for documents

description.p: The URL to save copies of inbound documents, outbound documents, and intermediate documents that might be needed for retransmission. The location can be an NFS mount or an iSCSI server (deprecated), which stores documents off of the appliance. However, iSCSI locations cannot be set from the WebGUI.

ul.li: To use an NFS mount, select the NFS mount point. The list shows these mount points in the nfs- name : format, where name is the name of the NFS static mount.

To use an iSCSI mount (deprecated), configure and initialize an iSCSI volume. Because the iSCSI volume is mounted in the local: directory, use the local:/// directory format, where directory is the value defined by the directory property while in the iSCSI Volume configuration.

description.p: If unspecified, these documents are stored in the encrypted area on the RAID volume. If using this location, set the maximum disk use to 30 gigabytes.

property.name: ASFrontProtocol
property.summary: Front Side Protocol Handlers
property.description: The front side protocol handlers to assign to the B2B gateway. Handlers determine the network communication protocol, address communication protocol, address, port, and other protocol-specific settings.

property.name: AS1MDNEmail
property.summary: Default e-mail address for AS1 asynchronous MDN
property.description: For asynchronous MDN scenarios, the default e-mail address to send an AS1 asynchronous MDN. When sending outbound AS1 e-mail messages that request an MDN, this e-mail address can be used as the default e-mail address to send the response MDN. An e-mail address in the destination overrides this value.

property.name: AS1MDNSMTPServerConnection
property.summary: SMTP server connection to send asynchronous MDN responses
property.description: When an incoming AS1 message requests an MDN be sent as an e-mail request, the SMTP server connection describes how to send the MDN response to the specified e-mail address.

property.name: AS2MDNURL
property.summary: Default URL for AS2 asynchronous MDN

description.p: For asynchronous MDN scenarios, an explicit MDN URL can be provided for AS2 protocol. It can point to gateway itself or a firewall or proxy service that will eventually route the message back to gateway.

If the firewall or proxy between the external partner and the appliance does not forward the MDN to the appliance, the B2B gateway will keep retransmitting the message to the external partner. This property can be overridden in the destination configuration for the external partner.

property.name: AS3MDNURL
property.summary: Default URL for AS3 asynchronous MDN

description.p: For AS3 asynchronous MDN scenarios, an explicit MDN URL can be provided for AS3 protocol. It can point to gateway itself or a firewall or proxy service that will eventually route the message back to gateway.

If the firewall or proxy between the external partner and the appliance does not forward the MDN to the appliance, the B2B gateway will keep retransmitting the message to the external partner. This property can be overridden in the destination configuration for the external partner.

property.name: B2BProfiles
property.summary: Active partner profiles
property.description: Assigns B2B Partner Profile objects to the gateway.

property.name: B2BGroups
property.summary: Active profile groups
property.description: Assigns B2B Partner Profile Groups objects to the gateway.

property.name: DocumentRoutingPreprocessorType
property.summary: File type of document routing preprocessor
property.description: Specifies the file type of the document routing preprocessor to run against messages that are not received through AS or ebMS protocols. The default value is stylesheet.

property.name: DocumentRoutingPreprocessor
property.summary: Location of the document routing preprocessor file
property.description:
Specifies the location of a stylesheet or a GatewayScript file, based on the processor type, to run against transactions that cannot be handled by B2B-specific handlers.
A stylesheet examines information from transport headers and other non-content sources to select relevant trading partners. The default stylesheet is store:///b2b-routing.xsl .
A GatewayScript examines information from transport headers and payloads to select relevant trading partners. A Gatewayscript can parse messages of different data types, such as JSON, XML, and non-XML. A sample GatewayScript file is store:///gateayscript/example-b2b-routing.js .

property.name: DocumentRoutingPreprocessorDebug
property.summary: Whether to enable GatewayScript debugger for document routing preprocessor
property.description: Specifies whether to enable the GatewayScript debugger to detect and diagnose errors in your document routing preprocessor file. To debug a file, make sure that the file contains one or more debugger; statements at the points in your script where you want to start debugging.

property.name: ArchiveMode
property.summary: Archive mode
property.description: Indicates whether to perform archive operations before removing messages.

property.name: ArchiveLocation
property.summary: Location of the message archive
property.description: Specifies the URL of the directory that contains archive files. Use the fully qualified name of the directory. The supported off-device protocol schemes are: HTTP (http://) and HTTPS (https://), NFS (dpnfs://), FTP and FTPS (ftp://), and SFTP (sftp://). To store locally in RAID volume, specify a subdirectory in the configured Hard Disk Array; for example, local:///ondisk. The message archive is in Binary. When archiving to an FTP (or FTPS) destination, ensure that the FTP policies in the associated XML manager enable "Image (Binary) Data" for data transfer.

property.name: ArchiveFileName
property.summary: Base file name
property.description: Specifies the base file name for archive files. When archiving, the archive operation appends the current timestamp.

property.name: ArchiveMinimumSize
property.summary: Minimum size
property.description: Specifies the minimum size of the document store before triggering the archive operation. The default is 1024.

property.name: ArchiveDocumentAge
property.summary: Maximum age of processed documents
property.description: Specifies the maximum duration to retain processed documents. After exceeding this duration, automatically archive or purge processed documents. Use any value of 1 - 3650. The default is 90.

property.name: ArchiveMinimumDocuments
property.summary: Minimum number of documents to retain
property.description: Specifies the minimum number of documents to retain in the document store at the end of an archive operation. The minimum is 1. The default is 100.

property.name: DiskUseCheckInterval
property.summary: Interval between checks
property.description: Sets the interval between checks for documents that exceed the maximum age. During the check, documents that exceed the maximum age are archived or purged. Use any value of 1 - 1440. The default is 60.

property.name: MaxDocumentDiskUse
property.summary: Maximum storage for documents
property.description: Specifies the maximum storage size for documents. When storage exceeds this value, documents are archived or purged. The default is 25165824.

property.name: ArchiveMonitor
property.summary: Whether to use a monitor for the archive task
property.description: The monitor can limit the message injection rate to prevent archive problems in a critical situation like performance testing or on a heavily loaded device. When enabled, specify the threshold for the archive monitor in the Threshold for Archive Monitor field.

property.name: ShapingThreshold
property.summary: Threshold for archive monitor in transactions per second
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of transactions to allow per second during the archive task. When the maximum number is reached, the service queues incoming transactions for later processing. If the queue is full, the service rejects incoming transactions and generates a log message. Use any value in the range 10 - 10000. The default value is 200.

property.name: ArchiveBackupDocuments
property.summary: Types of document to back up
property.description: Specifies which type of documents to back up. We have four types of documents visible from transaction viewer: Content, Input, Output, and MDN(ACK). Inbound Message, Outbound Message, and Inbound MDN(ACK)/Outbound MDN(ACK) correspond to "Input", "Output", and "MDN(ACK)" respectively. They do not actually mean to select inbound/outbound transaction to archive rather to choose "filetype" to archive. Either Inbound MDN(ACK) or Outbound MDN(ACK) is checked, we will archive MDN(ACK) files. If none of four AS(ebMS) box is checked, we will skip archiving all AS(ebMS) transactions.

property.name: XPathRoutingPolicies
property.summary: XPath Routing Policy
property.description: Specifies the set of policies to extract partner identifiers from XML EDI messages.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML Manager
property.description: The XML manager to manage the DataPower service. The XML manager contains the reference to a user agent. The user agent defines the default settings for how the service connects to external services.

property.name: DebugMode
property.summary: Controls transaction diagnostic mode

description.p: Select the diagnostic mode for processing policies. When enabled, you can view details about the state of variables and contexts for a captured transaction in the probe. The default value is off .
Transaction diagnostic mode is not intended for use in a production environment. Transaction diagnostic mode consumes significant resources that can slow down transaction processing.

property.name: DebugHistory
property.summary: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe
property.description: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe. Enter a value in the range 10 - 250. The default value is 25.

property.name: CPAEntries
property.summary: CPA Entries
property.description:
Each CPA entry binds an ebXML messaging service (ebMS) to provide partnership interactions between the internal partner and the external partner. If the message is sent by or to the external partner through an ebMS communication protocol (ebms2:// or ebms2s://), specify CPA ID, Service, Internal Partner Profile, and External Partner Profile to identify the received ebMS message or route the ebMS message to be sent.
You can ping ebMS destination to send an ebMS ping message to the external partner, and requests a synchronous or an asynchronous pong message. The response can be:
Success: The connection to the external partner is successful.
Unexpected Error: An error occurs when getting the pong message. Go to View Logs from the Control Panel for details about the error.
If you request an asynchronous pong message, the timeout for getting the response is 30 seconds. If you do not get any response after 30 seconds, go to View Logs from the Control Panel to find the response in the system log.

property.name: SQLDataSource
property.summary: SQL Data Source
property.description: The SQL Data Source object that is associated with current B2B gateway. For transactions using IBM MQFTE destination, IBM MQFTE transfer metadata can be retrieved by clicking the integration ID from B2B viewer as long as IBM MQFTE logger is enabled and this SQL data source object is configured correctly to connect to the database which stores IBM MQFTE transfer metadata. It is recommended that all transactions within one B2B gateway that utilize IBM MQFTE front side handler or IBM MQFTE URL opener should use the same database as IBM MQFTE logger backend database because only one SQL data source object can be associated per B2B gateway.

property.name: FrontSideTimeout
property.summary: The idle time allowed for a front side connection before the connection is canceled during a transaction.
property.description: Controls the amount of time when a front side client connection can be idle before the connection is canceled within a transaction. For a B2B outbound transaction, a front side connection means the connection between an internal back-end application and a B2B gateway. For aB2B inbound transaction, a front side connection means the connection between an external partner and a B2B gateway

property-group.name: Probe
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional probe settings
property-group.description:
The MultiStep Probe allows developers to view the changing value of variables and the changing contents of processing contexts. The developer can step through each action for any given transaction, up to a configured number of transactions. The Probe Settings page turns on this debugging tool and also sets the number of concurrently captured transactions.
Note: The number of concurrent xml sessions is limited to the value of the transaction history size.

object.description: The configuration for a B2B gateway instance. A B2B gateway can handle B2B messages transmitted over a variety of AS and non-AS protocols for inbound and outbound flows, as well as MDN messages.

object.name: B2BPersistence

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: RaidVolume
property.summary: Location of the data store

description.p: Specifies the location of the persistent data store. The location must be the raid0 RAID volume.
During firmware initialization, the raid0 volume is associated with persistent storage.

property.name: StorageSize
property.summary: Maximum size for the data store

description.p: Sets the maximum size for the persistent data store in megabytes. This data store is for all B2B Gateway services. These services store transaction metadata on the unencrypted partition of the RAID volume. These services store copies of the messages on the encrypted portion of the RAID volume.
The storage location for messages is defined on a service-by-service basis during the configuration of the B2B Gateway object.
Attention: The maximum size for the persistent data store cannot be changed to a smaller value. Changing to a larger value might interrupt transactions that are in flight.
Use an integer in the range 1024 - 65536. The default is 1024.

property.name: HAEnabled
property.summary: Enables high availability configuration
property.description: When on, the appliance is in active-passive high availability mode with the configured 'Alternate Host'.

property.name: HAOtherHosts
property.summary: Alternate host
property.description: Specifies the alternate host name and port of the other appliance in the active-passive high availability configuration.

property.name: HALocalIP
property.summary: Replication listener address
property.description: The IP address that the persistence store uses to support replication of data between appliances in the high availability cluster.

property.name: HALocalPort
property.summary: Replication listener port
property.description: The TCP port that the persistence store uses to support replication of data between appliances in the high availability cluster.

property.name: HAVirtualIP
property.summary: Virtual IP address
property.description: The virtual IP address that is used by the high availability cluster to process B2B transactions.

object.description: Data storage for B2B transaction data

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: ProfileType
property.summary: Type of trading partner
property.description: Whether the profile is for an internal or external partner. The default is internal.

property.name: BusinessIDs
property.summary: Identifiers for the partner
property.description:
Specifies the identifier for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, its identifier (ID) must be unique within a specific B2B gateway configuration. The identifiers for the trading partner should be equivalent to one of the following values:
In AS messages, a value for an AS*-From or AS*-To header, where * is 1, 2, or 3.
In ebMS messages, a value for an PartyID element, where the PartyID element can be under either From or To element.
In none of above, a value that is extracted from the body of the EDI message: SenderID or ReceiverID .

property.name: BusinessIDsDUNS
property.summary: Identifiers for the partner by DUNS Number
property.description: Specifies the 9-digit D-U-N-S (Data Universal Numbering System) identication number for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, the identifier (ID) should be unique not only within the 3 types of ID System (Freeform, DUNS, and DUNS+4) but also within a specific B2B gateway configuration.

property.name: BusinessIDsDUNSPlus4
property.summary: Identifiers for the partner by DUNS+4 Number
property.description: Specifies the 13-digit D-U-N-S (Data Universal Numbering System + 4) identication number for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, the identifier (ID) should be unique not only within the 3 types of ID System (Freeform, DUNS, and DUNS+4) but also within a specific B2B gateway configuration.

property.name: CustomStylePolicy
property.summary: Customer processing policy
property.description: Select a Document Processing Policy from the list of available policies. Click + to create a new Policy. This policy controls the transformations, filtering and other actions taken on the submitted message.

property.name: ResponseType
property.summary: Characterize response traffic
property.description: Characterizes the traffic that originates from 'To' partner. For inbound transaction, this is the traffic type that originates from internal partner. For outbound transaction, this is the traffic type that originates from external partner. The default is Non-XML.

property.name: EmailAddresses
property.summary: E-mail addresses for the partner in AS1 To or From headers
property.description:
The identifier (e-mail address) for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, its e-mail address must be unique within a specific B2B gateway configuration. The e-mail addresses for the trading partner should be equivalent to one of the following values:
In AS1 messages, a value for a From or To header
In non-AS1 messages, a value that is extracted from the body of the EDI message: SenderID or ReceiverID .

property.name: Destinations
property.summary: Destinations
property.description: Defines routing information for the partner. The first destination is the default destination. The gateway uses the default destination when no specific destination is assigned or when no matching destination is found.

property.name: InboundVerifyValCred
property.summary: Validation credentials set
property.description: Sets the validation credentials set to verify the signature on an MDN or inbound AS message from this external partner.

property.name: InboundRequireSigned
property.summary: Whether to require a signature
property.description: Indicates whether inbound AS messages to this internal partner must be signed. The default is off.

property.name: InboundRequireEncrypted
property.summary: Whether to require encryption
property.description: Indicates whether inbound AS messages to this internal partner must be encrypted. If requiring encryption (on), set the identification credentials to decrypt inbound messages. The default is off.

property.name: InboundDecryptIdCred
property.summary: Identification credentials set
property.description: Sets the identification credentials set to decrypt inbound AS messages to this internal partner when requiring encryption.

property.name: MDNSSLProxy
property.summary: The MDN SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an MDN SSL client profile.
property.description: Sets the SSL proxy profile to establish an SSL-enabled, secured connection to external partners who request asynchronous MDNs sent to HTTPS addresses. This SSL proxy profile will be used for all HTTPS addresses in the inbound Receipt-Delivery-Option header. To specify an SSL proxy profile for specific URLs, configure a user agent for the XML manager associated with the gateway.

property.name: OutboundSign
property.summary: Whether to sign outbound messages

description.p: Controls whether to sign outbound messages from this internal partner. The default is off.

ul.li: If enabled, signs outbound messages with the configured identification credentials and algorithm. If the configuration of a destination indicates to send messages unsigned, messages from this partner to that destination will not be signed.
If disabled, does not sign outbound messages.

description.p: This setting has no effect on outbound MDN messages. Regardless of this setting and if a partner requests a signed MDN, the outbound MDN is signed if this partner has a configured identification credentials.

property.name: OutboundSignIdCred
property.summary: Credentials to sign outbound messages, and if requested, MDN messages.
property.description: Sets the identification credentials set to sign an outbound message or outbound MDN from this internal partner when requiring a signature. The outbound MDN is signed if requested by a partner and this setting is configured.

property.name: OutboundSignDigestAlg
property.summary: Hash algorithm
property.description: Sets the hash algorithm for the signature on an outbound message from this internal partner when requiring a signature.

property.name: OutboundSignMICAlgVersion
property.summary: Which S/MIME version's micalg parameter value format to use

description.p: Specifies the S/MIME Specification version to generate the desired format of "micalg" parameter values in a multipart/signed message. The following one is a sample Content-Type header of the multipart/signed message:
Content-Type: multipart/signed;protocol="application/pkcs7-signature";micalg=sha1; boundary=...

The "micalg" parameter indicates which message digest algorithm (such as, MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512) is used in the calculation of the Message Integrity Check (MIC). The formats of the micalg value differ between S/MIME Version 3.1 (RFC 3851) and Version 3.2 (RFC 5751).

ul.li: In Version 3.1, the micalg parameter value has micalg=[md5|sha1|sha256|sha384|sha512].
In Version 3.2, the micalg parameter value has micalg=[md5|sha-1|sha-256|sha-384|sha-512].

property.name: Contacts
property.summary: Contact information
property.description: Specifies the contact information for the partner. To define the contact information, you must provide information for at least one of the properties.

property.name: OverrideASID
property.summary: Override AS Identifier
property.description:
Overrides the identifiers for the partner in AS message headers.
For outbound messages, the value to use for the AS*-From or AS*-To header, where * is 1, 2, or 3. If blank, the transaction retains the identifiers that were extracted from the message payload.
For inbound messages, the value becomes another valid identifier for the partner in addition to those already defined for the partner.

property.name: ASAllowDuplicateMessage
property.summary: When to allow and reprocess duplicate AS inbound messages
property.description: Controls when to allow and reprocess duplicate AS inbound messages. Note that this option does not apply to MDN or ACK.

property.name: PreserveFilename
property.summary: Whether to expose the Content-Disposition header of inbound AS messages for filename preservation
property.description: According to RFC 2183, the file name information is optional in Content-Disposition header. When you enbale filename preservation, the Content-Disposition header of the inbound AS message is exposed if the inbound AS message is in S/MIME format. Then, the receiving partner can retrieve the original file name that is contained in the header and transfer the received file to its backend system with the received file name.

property.name: EBMSRole
property.summary: Name of Role
property.description: Specifies the name of authorized role of the party. When sending outbound message, the role associated with internal partner presents the From party and the role associated with external partner presents the To party, respectively. The value is referencing to the Role specified in CPA. A Role is better defined as a URI, for example, http://rosettanet.org/roles/buyer.

property.name: EBMSPersistDuration
property.summary: Duration of message to be persisted
property.description: The time, which can be obtained from a CPA, indicates to the receiving partner the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage. When receiving inbound message, the Persist Duration is used to compute the expiry time using the formula: Time to Persist = Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's expiry time has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation. Default to 0 to expire the received document at the time we receive the document.

property.name: EBMSAckURL
property.summary: Redirection URL for sending an asynchronous ebMS Acknowledgment Message
property.description: Specifies the redirection URL where to send the Ackowledgment message when received ebMS message requests for asynchronous response. When an asynchronous reply is requested by the inbound ebMS document, this field is required to determine where to send the acknowldgment. Though optional, it is recommended to set the URL.

property.name: EBMSErrorURL
property.summary: Redirection URL for sending an asynchronous ebMS Error Message
property.description: Specifies the redirection URL where to report the Error message when received ebMS message requests for asynchronous response. When an asynchronous reply is requested by the inbound ebMS document, this field is used as the error reporting location to send the error message - which contains the error code such as MimeProblem, and the description of the problem - when any problem occurs. Error URL should not be empty if the Acknowledgment URL is specified.

property.name: EBMSInboundVerifyValCred
property.summary: Validation credentials set
property.description: Sets the validation credentials set to verify the signature on an Acknowledgment or inbound ebMS message from this external partner. For ebMS messages, the DataPower appliance supports only X509Data and KeyName signature methods.

property.name: EBMSDefaultSignerCert
property.summary: Default validation certificate used to verify the signature of inbound message
property.description: Set the default validation certificate to verify the signature of an inbound ebMS message or an acknowledgment. The default signature validation certificate is used if either keyInfo element is missing or signature method is unsupported.

property.name: EBMSAckSSLProxy
property.summary: The Acknowledgment/Error SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an Acknowledgment/Error SSL client profile.
property.description: Sets the SSL proxy profile to establish an SSL-enabled, secured connection to external partners who request asynchronous reply (the response can be an Acknowledgment or an Error Message) sent to HTTPS addresses. To specify an SSL proxy profile for specific URLs, configure a user agent for the XML manager associated with the gateway.

property.name: EBMSInboundRequireSigned
property.summary: Whether to require a signature
property.description: Indicates whether inbound ebMS messages to this internal partner must be signed. The default is off.

property.name: EBMSInboundRequireEncrypted
property.summary: Whether to require encryption
property.description: Indicates whether inbound ebMS messages to this internal partner must be encrypted. If requiring encryption (on), set the identification credentials to decrypt inbound ebMS messages. The default is off.

property.name: EBMSInboundDecryptIdCred
property.summary: Identification credentials set
property.description: Sets the identification credentials set to decrypt inbound ebMS messages to this internal partner when requiring encryption.

property.name: EBMSOutboundSign
property.summary: Whether to sign outbound messages

description.p: Controls whether to sign outbound messages from this internal partner. The default is off.

ul.li: If enabled, signs outbound messages with the configured identification credentials and algorithm. If the configuration of a destination indicates to send messages unsigned, messages from this partner to that destination will not be signed.
If disabled, does not sign outbound messages.

description.p: This setting has no effect on outbound Acknowledgment messages. Regardless of this setting and if a partner requests a signed Ack, the outbound Acknowledgment is signed if this partner has a configured identification credentials.

property.name: EBMSOutboundSignIdCred
property.summary: Credentials to sign outbound messages, and if requested, Acknowledgment messages
property.description:
Sets the identification credentials set to sign an outbound message or outbound Acknowledgment from this internal partner when requiring a signature. The outbound Acknowledgment is signed if requested by a partner and this setting is configured.
For ebMS messages, the DataPower appliance supports only X509Data and KeyName signature methods.

property.name: EBMSOutboundSignatureAlg
property.summary: Signature algorithm used to sign outbound message
property.description: Sets the algorithm used to sign the outbound ebMS message from this internal partner. The default is dsa-sha1, which is recommended by the ebMS specification.

property.name: EBMSOutboundSignatureC14NAlg
property.summary: Signature canonicalization algorithm used before signing outbound message
property.description: Sets the algorithm used to canonicalize the SOAP Envelope XML and exclude comments before signing outbound ebMS message. The default is c14n, which is recommended by the ebMS specification.

property.name: EBMSOutboundSignDigestAlg
property.summary: Digest algorithm used in the XML Signature when hashing the payloads during signing.
property.description: Sets the algorithm used to hashing the payloads during signing. The default is sha1. See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/

property.name: EBMSEnableCPABinding
property.summary: Whether to enable CPA bindings
property.description: When enabled, the CPA, service, and action that are specified by the matched CPA binding are used for the outbound ebMS messages instead of the default CPA, service, and action of the external profile. The CPA binding is matched by the internal partner profile.

property.name: EBMSProfileCPABindings
property.summary: CPA Bindings
property.description: Specifies the CPA binding that you prefer to use to the external partner profile. A CPA binding binds a CPA entry (CPA, service, and action) that you prefer to use. When a CPA entry is matched through the internal partner profile, outbound messages from the internal partner use the CPA, service, and action that are specified by the matched CPA entry. You must have defined the CPA entry in the ebXML settings of the associated B2B Gateway before you add the entry to the CPA bindings list.

property.name: EBMSCpaId
property.summary: Default CPA ID
property.description: Sets the CPAId to be packaged in the outbound ebMS message header. This value is the default CPA ID to use when the B2B Gateway is CPA-enforced.

property.name: EBMSService
property.summary: Default Service
property.description: Sets the Service to be packaged in the outbound ebMS message header. This value is the default service to use when the B2B Gateway is CPA-enforced.

property.name: EBMSAction
property.summary: Default Action
property.description: Sets the Action to be packaged in the outbound ebMS message header. This value is the default action to use when the B2B Gateway is CPA-enforced.

property.name: EBMSStartParameter
property.summary: Generate the start parameter when creating the content-type header of an outbound ebMS message.
property.description: Indicates whether to generate a start parameter for the ebMS message. The start parameter identifies the root part of the ebMS message. This setting is disabled by default. If enabled, the appliance generates a start parameter with its value enclosed in angle brackets.

property.name: EBMSAllowDuplicateMessage
property.summary: When to allow and reprocess duplicate ebMS inbound messages
property.description: Controls when to allow and reprocess duplicate ebMS inbound messages. Note that this option does not apply to MDN or ACK.

property.name: MDNSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: MDNSSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: EBMSAckSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: EBMSAckSSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

object.name: B2BProfileGroup

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: B2BProfiles
property.summary: Associated Partner Profiles
property.description: Associates the partner profile with this group.

object.description: A group of B2B Partner Profile objects that can be enable or disable at the same time. Each partner profile in the group is identified by its name and optional destination. Without a destination, the configuration uses the first destination for the partner profile.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: SenderXPath
property.summary: XPath expression to select the sender
property.description: Defines the XPath expression to select the identifier of the sending partner from the message.

property.name: ReceiverXPath
property.summary: XPath expression to select the receiver
property.description: Defines the XPath expression to select the identifier of the receiving partner from the message.

property.name: DocumentIDXPath
property.summary: XPath expression for the unique identifier of the exchange
property.description: Defines the XPath expression to select the unique identifier of the exchange. Together with the internal partner ID and with the external partner ID, this XPath expression uniquely identifies a specific XML EDI message.

property.name: DateTimeXPath
property.summary: XPath expression for the timestamp
property.description: Defines the XPath expression to select the timestamp from the message. The results of this expression must be in the form of an xs:dateTime type.

object.name: WXSGrid

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Descriptive summary of the configuration
property.description: Specify a brief, but descriptive, summary of the configuration.

property.name: Collective
property.summary: Load Balancer Group that corresponds to a collective of eXtreme Scale
property.description: Specify the Load Balancer Group that contains members in the collective of eXtreme Scale. You must define at least one member in the collective.

property.name: Grid
property.summary: Name of the eXtreme Scale grid
property.description: Specify the name of the eXtreme Scale grid. The value cannot contain whitespace or the following characters: ^ . \ / , # $ @ : ; * ? < > | = + & % [ ] " ' .

property.name: UserName
property.summary: User who connects to the eXtreme Scale collective

description.p: Specify the user account of the eXtreme Scale user who connects to the eXtreme Scale collective. The value can be up to 64 characters in length and cannot be blank. You can use all alphanumeric characters and most special characters. You cannot use spaces or the following special characters: # < .
The user must have sufficient eXtreme Scale permissions to access the grid.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias of the password for the user who connects to the eXtreme Scale collective
property.description: Specify the password alias to use to look up the password of the eXtreme Scale user who connects to the eXtreme Scale collective.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Time limit to establish a connection
property.description: Specify the maximum time to wait to establish a connection to an eXtreme Scale. If unable to establish a connection, the operation fails. Enter a value in the range 10 - 86400000. The default value is 1000.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: Encrypt
property.summary: Whether the data in the eXtreme Scale data grid is encrypted
property.description: Indicates whether the data in the eXtreme Scale data grid is encrypted. If encrypted, the data is encrypted, when writing to, and decrypted, when reading from, the eXtreme Scale data grid.

property.name: EncryptSSKey
property.display: Shared Secret Key for Encryption and Decryption
property.summary: Shared secret key for PKCS #7 encryption and decryption
property.description: Specify the shared secret for PKCS #7 encryption and decryption. When writing data to the data grid, encrypts the data. When reading data from the eXtreme Scale data grid, decrypts the data.

property.name: EncryptAlg
property.display: PKCS #7 algorithm for encryption and decryption
property.summary: Algorithm that encrypt and decrypt data transfers with the eXtreme Scale collective
property.description: Specify the PKCS #7 algorithm for encryption and decryption. When writing data to the data grid, encrypts the data. When reading data from the eXtreme Scale data grid, decrypts the data.

property.name: KeyObfuscation
property.summary: Whether to apply a hash algorithm for key-obfuscation
property.description: Indicate whether to apply a hash algorithm to obfuscate keys before reading data from or writing data to the eXtreme Scale data grid.

property.name: KeyObfuscationAlg
property.summary: Hash algorithm for key-obfuscation
property.description: Specify the hash algorithm to obfuscate keys before reading data from or writing data to the eXtreme Scale data grid.

object.summary: Connection details to an eXtreme Scale grid in an eXtreme Scale collective
object.description: The configuration of an eXtreme Scale Grid defines the connection details to an eXtreme Scale grid in an eXtreme Scale collective. To define this configuration, you must define the eXtreme Scale collective, the grid name, and the user and password for the user account who connects to the eXtreme Scale. If you need to secure connections to eXtreme Scale, you must assign an SSL Proxy Profile.

object.name: XC10Grid

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Descriptive summary of the configuration
property.description: Specify a brief, but descriptive, summary of the configuration.

property.name: Collective
property.summary: Load Balancer Group that corresponds to a collective of XC10 appliances
property.description: Specify the Load Balancer Group that contains members in the collective of XC10 appliances. You must define at least one member in the collective. With one member, you can use the action that discovers the collective to complete the population of the load balancer group.

property.name: Grid
property.summary: Name of the XC10 grid
property.description: Specify the name of the XC10 grid. The value cannot contain whitespace or the following characters: ^ . \ / , # $ @ : ; * ? < > | = + & % [ ] " ' .

property.name: UserName
property.summary: User who connects to the XC10 collective

description.p: Specify the user account of the XC10 user who connects to the XC10 collective. The value can be up to 64 characters in length and cannot be blank. You can use all alphanumeric characters and most special characters. You cannot use spaces or the following special characters: # < .
The user must have sufficient XC10 permissions to access the grid.

ul.li: To discover a collective, the user requires the XC10 Administrator role.
To create or clear a grid, the user requires the XC10 Administrator or Creator role.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password of the user who connects to the XC10 collective
property.description: Specify the password of the XC10 user who connects to the XC10 collective.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias of the password for the user who connects to the XC10 collective
property.description: Specify the password alias to use to look up the password of the XC10 user who connects to the XC10 collective.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Time limit to establish a connection
property.description: Specify the maximum time to wait to establish a connection to an XC10 appliance. If unable to establish a connection, the operation fails. Enter a value in the range 10 - 86400000. The default value is 1000.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure communication with the XC10 collective
property.description:
Specify the type of the SSL Profile to communicate securely with the XC10 collective. To perform the following actions, the configuration requires an SSL profile.
To clear the content of a data grid
To create a data grid
To discover an XC10 collective to populate and manage the Load Balancer Group

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description:
Specify the name of the SSL Proxy Profile to communicate securely with the XC10 collective. To perform the following actions, the configuration requires an SSL profile. It can be either an SSL client profile or SSL proxy (deprecated) profile.
To clear the content of a data grid
To create a data grid
To discover an XC10 collective to populate and manage the Load Balancer Group

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description:
Specify the name of the SSL Client Profile to communicate securely with the XC10 collective. To perform the following actions, the configuration requires an SSL profile. It can be either an SSL client profile or SSL proxy (deprecated) profile.
To clear the content of a data grid
To create a data grid
To discover an XC10 collective to populate and manage the Load Balancer Group

property.name: Encrypt
property.summary: Whether the data in the XC10 data grid is encrypted
property.description: Indicates whether the data in the XC10 data grid is encrypted. If encrypted, the data is encrypted, when writing to, and decrypted, when reading from, the XC10 data grid.

property.name: EncryptSSKey
property.display: Shared Secret Key for Encryption and Decryption
property.summary: Shared secret key for PKCS #7 encryption and decryption
property.description: Specify the shared secret for PKCS #7 encryption and decryption. When writing data to the data grid, encrypts the data. When reading data from the XC10 data grid, decrypts the data.

property.name: EncryptAlg
property.display: PKCS #7 algorithm for encryption and decryption
property.summary: Algorithm that encrypt and decrypt data transfers with the XC10 collective
property.description: Specify the PKCS #7 algorithm for encryption and decryption. When writing data to the data grid, encrypts the data. When reading data from the XC10 data grid, decrypts the data.

property.name: KeyObfuscation
property.summary: Whether to apply a hash algorithm for key-obfuscation
property.description: Indicate whether to apply a hash algorithm to obfuscate keys before reading data from or writing data to the XC10 data grid.

property.name: KeyObfuscationAlg
property.summary: Hash algorithm for key-obfuscation
property.description: Specify the hash algorithm to obfuscate keys before reading data from or writing data to the XC10 data grid.

on-glass.p: These settings are for appliance caches on an XC10 data grid. For software caches on an eXtreme Scale data grid, configure an eXtreme Scale Grid.

object.summary: Connection details to an XC10 grid in an XC10 collective
object.description:
The configuration of an XC10 Grid defines the connection details to an XC10 grid in an XC10 collective. To define this configuration, you must define the XC10 collective, the grid name, and the user and password for the user account who connects to the XC10 appliance. If you need to secure connections to XC10 appliances or perform actions that manage the grid or collective, you must assign an SSL client profile.
To create an XC10 grid, the user account needs the XC10 Administrator or Creator role. The action submits a secured request to the remote XC10 appliance.
To clear an XC10 grid, which deletes the content of the XC10 grid, the user account needs the XC10 Administrator or Creator role. The action submits a secured request to the remote XC10 appliance.
To discover an XC10 collective, which populates and manages the load balancer group for the XC10 collective, the user account needs the XC10 Administrator role. The action submits a secured request to the remote XC10 appliance.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local address

description.p: Specify the IPv4 or IPv6 address or the host alias on which the Target Control Service listens. The default of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all IPv4 addresses.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service-scheduling priority
property.description: Select the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services are favored over lower priority services.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Local listening port
property.description: Specify the local listening port for the service.

property.name: ServiceName
property.summary: Name of the service, or enterprise application, to connect to.
property.description: Specify the Service Name of the enterprise application to connect to. This corresponds to a back-end Service Name defined on the Cloud Gateway in the enterprise.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Hostname or IP address of the Cloud Gateway.
property.description: Specify the hostname or IP address of the remote server.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Listening port on the Cloud Gateway
property.description: Specify the listening port number of the Cloud Gateway.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: SSL proxy profile to secure connections
property.description: Select an SSL proxy profile to manage SSL communications with the peers. The SSL proxy profile identifies the keys and certificates for the handshake.

property.name: FrontTimeout
property.summary: Maximum idle time for client connections in a transaction
property.description: Specify the maximum idle time for client connections in a transaction. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: BackTimeout
property.summary: Maximum idle time for the Cloud Gateway connection in a transaction
property.description: Specify the maximum idle time for Cloud Gateway connections in a transaction. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: ConnTimeout
property.summary: Maximum duration for transactions
property.description: Specify the maximum duration for transactions. This timer monitors the duration of end-to-end transactions. If the specified connection time is exceeded, the client connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: ConnLimit
property.summary: Maximum number of concurrent client connections
property.description: Specify the maximum number of concurrent client connections to the service. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 65535. The value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of connections. The default value is 100.

description.p: Creates a Cloud Connector service, which is a type of SSL forwarder. This service can be used with a Cloud Gateway Service to secure traffic from cloud-based clients to enterprise applications.

This service requires an SSL proxy profile that defines the connections for secure communication. You must use SSL between the Cloud Connector and its Cloud Gateway, otherwise connection establishment will fail.

ul.li: If the SSL proxy profile is defined as forward, the data is secured toward the Cloud Gateway, but is not secured toward the client.
If the SSL proxy profile is defined as reverse, the connection will fail.
If the SSL proxy profile is defined as two way, the data is secured in both directions.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service-scheduling priority
property.description: Select the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services are favored over lower priority services.

property.name: ConnTimeout
property.summary: Maximum duration for transactions
property.description: Specify the maximum duration for transactions. This timer monitors the duration of end-to-end transactions. If the specified connection time is exceeded, the client connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local address

description.p: Specify the IPv4 or IPv6 address or the host alias on which the Cloud Gateway service listens. The default of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all IPv4 addresses.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Local listening port
property.description: Specify the local listening port for the service.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: SSL proxy profile to secure connections
property.description: Select an SSL proxy profile defined with direction Reverse to manage SSL communications with the cloud-based clients. The SSL proxy profile identifies the keys and certificates for the handshake.

property.name: FrontTimeout
property.summary: Maximum idle time for cloud-based client connections in a transaction
property.description: Specify the maximum idle time for client connections in a transaction. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: BackConnections
property.summary: Allowed enterprise application connections
property.description: Allowed enterprise application connections. Each enterprise application connection has a unique service name.

description.p: Cloud Gateway services are used with Bluemix Cloud Integration Services to secure traffic from cloud-based Bluemix applications to enterprise applications or data sources.

The Cloud Gateway service requires an SSL proxy profile that defines the secure communication from the cloud into the enterprise network or DMZ. You must use SSL/TLS between the cloud-based client and its Cloud Gateway, and you must define the SSL proxy profile as Reverse, otherwise connection establishment fails. The SSL proxy profile references a Crypto Profile that includes both Identification Credentials and Validation Credentials. The Identification Credentials provides the private key and certificate that is associated with the gateway, and the Validation Credentials provides the certificate from the cloud. There can be multiple cloud certificates in the gateway's Crypto Validation Credentials object, which allow multiple clouds to connect to a single gateway.

Each Cloud Gateway service must have one or more enterprise applications defined. When a cloud-based client establishes a connection to a Cloud Gateway service, the client identifies which enterprise application to connect to using the Service Name.

object.name: CompactFlash

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: ReadOnly
property.summary: Access permission to files on the storage volume
property.description: Set the access permission to files on the storage volume. When set to "on", the access permission is read-only. When set to "off", the default value, the access permission is read-write.

property.name: Directory
property.summary: Directory name
property.description: Specify the subdirectory in the local: and logstore: directories where the files on the storage volume are available. Each application domain contains these subdirectories.
