property.description: Specifies the SSL client profile to secure connections when DataPower obtains an access token from the social login provider.

property.name: Provider
property.summary: Which social login provider to use
property.description: Controls which social login provider to use.

property.name: ProviderAZEndpoint
property.summary: The provider's endpoint URL that accepts an authorization request from a client to perform social login with the provider
property.description: Specify the provider's endpoint URL that accepts an authorization request from a client to perform social login with the provider. For example, the authorization endpoint of Google is https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/auth

property.name: ProviderTokenEndpoint
property.summary: The provider's endpoint URL that accepts an authorization grant, or code, from a client in exchange for an access token from the social login provider
property.description: Specify the provider's endpoint URL that accepts an authorization grant, or code, from a client in exchange for an access token from the social login provider. For example, the token endpoint of Google is https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v3/token

property.name: ValidateJWTToken
property.summary: Whether to validate the JWT token from the provider

description.p: Controls whether to validate the JWT token (ID token)from the provider. If yes, it is recommended that you validate the ID token that is obtained from Google by defining the following settings in the JWT Validator configuration.

ol.li: Verify the signature by fetching the certs from https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v3/certs
Verify that the aud claim matches the client ID of DataPower.
Verify that the iss claim matches accounts.google.com or https://accounts.google.com

description.p: For other recommendations on validating the ID token from Google, see https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/OpenIDConnect.

property.name: JWTValidator
property.summary: The JWT Validator configuration
property.description: Specify the JWT Validator configuration that defines how to validate and verify the ID token.

object.summary: Configure and manage the policy that defines social login behavior
object.description: DataPower can act as an OpenID Connect client. In this case, a social login policy enables DataPower to redirect the user to a social login provider like Google for user authentication and consent for authorization.

object.name: SSHClientProfile

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: UserName
property.summary: A user name
property.description: Specifies the user to log in as on the remote SSH server.

property.name: ProfileUsage
property.summary: Allowable profile usage
property.description: Specifies the usage of the profile. The usage can be either sftp or scc, but not both. If the profile is to be used with the SFTP protocol, the usage must be sftp. If the profile is to be used with a Secure Cloud Connector, the usage must be scc.

property.name: SSHUserAuthentication
property.summary: Allowable user authentication types
property.description: Specifies the type(s) of SSH user authentication available for use by the client. Authentication can be either public key or password or both public key and password. If the configuration includes both authentication methods, public key authentication is attempted first.

description.p: Specifies the Crypto Key representing the private key to use for public key authentication. Keys used as user private keys must not be password protected.

property.name: Password
property.summary: A password
property.description: Specifies the password associated with the user name used for the SSH client.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: A password alias
property.description: Specifies the password alias of the password associated with the user name used for the SSH client.

property.name: PersistentConnections
property.summary: Enable/Disable persistent connections for objects using this profile
property.description: When on, persistent connections are enabled. Persistent connections allow new SSH requests to reuse the connection of a previous SSH session without having to reauthenticate. When off, persistent connections are disabled. The default is on.

property.name: PersistentConnectionTimeout
property.summary: Timeout in seconds that a persistent connection can remain idle before closing the connection.
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds that a persistent connection can remain idle before closing the connection. Enter any value of 1 - 86000. The default is 120.

description.p: Specifies how host keys are checked during the connection and authentication phase. By default strict host key checking is disabled. The SSH client verifies the incoming host key against the keys in the known hosts list. If the host key does not match an existing known host entry for the remote server, the connection is rejected. If the known host list does not contain a host key for the remote server, the SSH client automatically accepts the host and adds its host key to the known host list.

When strict host key checking is enabled, the SSH client connects only to known hosts with valid SSH host keys that are stored in the known hosts list. Host keys not listed in the known host list are rejected.

object.description: An SSH Client Profile is associated with an SSH URLOpener or with a Secure Cloud Connector. Also, a Secure Cloud Connection requires an Application Optimization license. The remote server's public key must be contained in the SSH Client Profile known hosts list.

object.name: SSLClientProfile

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: Protocols
property.summary: Which SSL and TLS protocol versions to support.
property.description: Specify the SSL and TLS protocol versions to support.

property.name: Ciphers
property.summary: Which SSL and TLS cipher suites to support.
property.description: Specify the list of SSL and TLS cipher suites to support.

property.name: Idcred
property.summary: The credentials to identify the appliance to an SSL server.
property.description: Specify an optional identification credentials that the appliance uses to identify itself to an SSL server if client authentication is requested.

property.name: ValidateServerCert
property.summary: Whether to validate the server certificate during the SSL handshake.
property.description: Indicate whether to validate the server certificate during the SSL handshake.

property.name: Valcred
property.summary: The credentials to validate the authenticity of received certificates.
property.description: Specify an optional set of validation credentials to authenticate the certificate that the SSL server sends during the SSL handshake.

property.name: Caching
property.summary: Whether to cache SSL sessions.
property.description: Indicate whether to enable the caching of SSL sessions.

property.name: CacheTimeout
property.summary: The time that SSL sessions are allowed to remain in the SSL session cache.
property.description: Specify the number of seconds that SSL sessions are allowed to remain in the SSL session cache before they are removed. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 300.

property.name: CacheSize
property.summary: The maximum size of the SSL session cache.
property.description: Specify the maximum number of entries in the session cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 500000. The default value is 100.

property.name: SSLClientFeatures
property.summary: Enable different features supported by this client.
property.description: Indicate what kind of features supported by this client.

property.name: EllipticCurves
property.summary: Which elliptic curves to support for TLS EC ciphers.
property.description: Specify the list of elliptic curves to support.

property.name: UseCustomSNIHostname
property.summary: Which hostname to pass in extended client hello.
property.description: By default the backend target is passed as hostname in extended TLS client hello, or a custom hostname can be passed instead.

property.name: CustomSNIHostname
property.summary: User-defined SNI hostname to pass in extended client hello.
property.description: Specify the hostname to pass in extended TLS client hello message. By default the backend target is used as hostname in client hello, but here you can specify a custom hostname which will be passed in client hello message.

object.summary: Configure and manage SSL Client Profile.

object.name: SSLProxyProfile

property.name: Direction
property.description: Indicates which end of the SSL connection this SSL Proxy Profile describes.

property.name: ForwardCryptoProfile
property.description: The cryptographic profile that is used when acting as an SSL client for a "forward" or "two-way" proxy.

property.name: ReverseCryptoProfile
property.description: The cryptographic profile that is used when acting as an SSL server for a "reverse" or "two-way" proxy.

property.name: ServerCaching
property.description: Enable/disable the caching of SSL sessions when acting as an SSL server.

property.name: SessionTimeout
property.description: Specify the timeout in seconds for each entry in the server-side session cache.

property.name: CacheSize
property.description: Specify the number of entries (multiplied by 1024) in the server-side session cache.

property.name: ClientCache
property.description: Enable/disable the caching of SSL sessions when acting as an SSL client.

property.name: ClientSessionTimeout
property.description: Specify the timeout in seconds for each entry in the client-side session cache.

property.name: ClientCacheSize
property.description: Specify the number of entries in the client-side session cache.

property.name: ClientAuthOptional
property.description: When acting as an SSL server and performing client authentications, requests but does not require SSL client authentication. This property is meaningful when SSL client authentication is enabled in the server crypto profile. When both properties are enabled, SSL client authentication is optional. The request does not fail when there is no client certificate. When disabled (the default), SSL client authentication is required by the application server.

property.name: ClientAuthAlwaysRequest
property.description: When acting as an SSL server, always request SSL client authentication even when there are no validation credentials present in the server crypto profile. When disabled (the default), the SSL server only requests SSL client authentication when validation credentials are present in the server crypto profile.

property.name: PermitInsecureServers
property.display: Permit Connections to Insecure SSL Servers
property.description: When acting as an SSL client, specifies whether to permit connections to SSL servers that do not support RFC 5746. Such servers are vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks as documented in CVE-2009-3555. The default is off which means reject insecure connections during the SSL handshake.

object.summary: Profile describing SSL endpoint (client or server)

description.p: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. To secure the connections, use the SSL client profile and SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile based on the role of the appliance.
An SSL proxy profile is associated with a DataPower service to describe how SSL connections should be made from or to the proxy's port.

object.name: SSLServerProfile

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: Protocols
property.summary: Which SSL and TLS protocol versions to support.
property.description: Specify the SSL and TLS protocol versions to support.

property.name: Ciphers
property.summary: Which SSL and TLS cipher suites to support.
property.description: Specify the list of SSL and TLS cipher suites to support.

property.name: Idcred
property.summary: The credentials to identify the appliance.
property.description: Specify the identification credentials that the appliance uses to identify itself.

property.name: RequestClientAuth
property.summary: Whether to request client authentication during the SSL handshake.
property.description: Indicate whether to request client authentication during the SSL handshake.

property.name: RequireClientAuth
property.summary: Whether to require client authentication during the SSL handshake.
property.description: Indicate whether to require client authentication during the SSL handshake. When enabled, the handshake is aborted if the client certificate is not provided. When disabled, the request does not fail when there is no client certificate.

property.name: ValidateClientCert
property.summary: Whether to validate the client certificate during the SSL handshake.
property.description: Indicate whether to validate the client certificate during the SSL handshake if the client certificate is provided.

property.name: SendClientAuthCAList
property.summary: Whether to send the SSL client a CA list during the SSL handshake.
property.description: Indicate whether to send the SSL client a list of CA Distinguished Names for client authentication during the SSL handshake.

property.name: Valcred
property.summary: The credentials to validate the authenticity of received certificates.
property.description: Specify the validation credentials to validate the certificate that the SSL client sends during the SSL handshake.

property.name: Caching
property.summary: Whether to cache SSL sessions.
property.description: Indicate whether to enable the caching of SSL sessions.

property.name: CacheTimeout
property.summary: The time that SSL sessions are allowed to remain in the SSL session cache.
property.description: Specify the number of seconds that SSL sessions are allowed to remain in the SSL session cache before they are removed. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 300.

property.name: CacheSize
property.summary: The maximum size of the SSL session cache.
property.description: Specify the maximum number of entries (multiplied by 1024) in the session cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 500. The default value is 20.

property.name: SSLOptions
property.summary: The options to apply to the SSL connection.
property.description: Specify the options to apply to the SSL connection. Enabling these options has negative impact on the performance of the SSL communication.

property.name: MaxSSLDuration
property.summary: The maximum duration of an established SSL session.
property.description: Specify the maximum duration of an established SSL session. The SSL connection terminates when the duration is reached. Enter a value in the range 1 - 11520. The default value is 60 seconds.

property.name: NumberOfRenegotiationAllowed
property.summary: The maximum number of client initiated renegotiations to allow.
property.description: Specify the maximum number of client initiated renegotiations to allow. Enter a value in the range 0 - 512. The default value is 0, which indicates SSL client initiated renegotiation is not allowed.

property.name: ProhibitResumeOnReneg
property.summary: Whether to prohibit the use of SSL session resumption during a renegotiation handshake.
property.description: Indicate whether to prohibit the use of SSL session resumption during a renegotiation handshake.

property.name: Compression
property.summary: Whether to enable SSL compression.
property.description: Indicate whether to enable SSL compression. Enabling SSL compression in HTTPS is dangerous because the connection becomes vulnerable to the CRIME attack.

property.name: AllowLegacyRenegotiation
property.summary: Whether to allow SSL renegotiation with SSL clients that do not support RFC 5746.
property.description: Indicate whether to allow SSL renegotiation with SSL clients that do not support RFC 5746. By default, this support is disabled because renegotiation with such clients is vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks as documented in CVE-2009-3555. Renegotiation with SSL clients that support RFC 5746 is permitted regardless of the setting specified.

property.name: PreferServerCiphers
property.summary: Whether to use the server's cipher suite preferences instead of deferring to the client's preferences.
property.description: Indicate whether to give priority to the server's cipher suite preferences instead of deferring to the client's preferences.

property.name: EllipticCurves
property.summary: Which elliptic curves to support for TLS EC ciphers.
property.description: Specify the list of elliptic curves to support.

object.summary: Configure and manage SSL Server Profile.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: SNIMapping
property.display: Host Name to SSL Server Profile Mapping
property.summary: A table of match patterns to pick an SSL Server Profile based on the SNI host name that the SSL client sends.
property.description: Specify a table of match patterns to pick an SSL Server Profile based on the SNI host name that the SSL client sends.

object.name: SSLSNIServerProfile

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.
property.description: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Protocols
property.summary: Which SSL and TLS protocol versions to support.
property.description: Specify the SSL and TLS protocol versions to support.

property.name: SNIServerMapping
property.summary: A table of match patterns to pick an SSL server profile based on the SNI host name that the SSL client sends.
property.description: Specify a table of match patterns to pick an SSL server profile based on the SNI host name that the SSL client sends.

property.name: SNIServerDefault
property.summary: The SSL server profile that processes the request when the client does not send an SNI extension.

description.p: Select the SSL server profile to process the request when the ClientHello SNI extension is not provided.

ul.li:
When the default server profile is defined, the following rules apply.
When the client does not send a ClientHello SNI extension, the default server profile processes the request.
When the client sends a ClientHello SNI extension but it does not match a configured host name mapping, the request is rejected.
When not defined and the client does not send a ClientHello SNI extension, the request is rejected.

property.name: SSLOptions
property.summary: The options to apply to the SSL connection, this overrides the individual settings on the SSL server profiles.
property.description: Specify the options to apply to the SSL connection. Note that enabling these options has negative impact on the performance of the SSL communication. This overrides the individual settings on the SSL server profiles.

property.name: MaxSSLDuration
property.summary: The maximum duration of an established SSL session.
property.description: Specify the maximum duration of an established SSL session. The SSL connection terminates after the duration is reached. Enter a value in the range 1 - 691200. The default value is 3600 seconds.

property.name: NumberOfRenegotiationAllowed
property.summary: The maximum number of client initiated renegotiations to allow.
property.description: Specify the maximum number of client initiated renegotiations to allow. Enter a value in the range 0 - 512. The default value is 0, which indicates client initiated renegotiation is not allowed.

object.summary: Configure and manage the SSL SNI server profile.
object.description: The SSL Server Name Indication (SNI) server profile secures connections between the client and the appliance.

object.name: DeploymentPolicyParametersBinding

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: DeploymentPolicyParameter
property.summary: Deployment Policy Variable bindings table.
property.description: A list of name-value pairs. The name specifies a variable in a deployment policy, which will be replaced by its associated value before applying the policy to a configuration import.

object.description: Configuration to persist the values of the deployment policy variables.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Mode
property.summary: Enable/disable failure notification
property.description: Use the radio buttons to enable/disable system failure notification. It is disabled by default.

property.name: UploadReport
property.summary: Whether to upload the error report to a specific destination

description.p: Specify whether to upload the error report to an NFS, iSCSI (deprecated), RAID, SMTP, or FTP destination or write the error report to the local temporary directory. If you enable this feature:

ul.li: It enables the Failure Notification status provider, which tracks previous error reports
It changes the naming convention to include the serial number of the appliance and the timestamp, which prevents one report overwriting another

property.name: UseSmtp
property.summary: Whether to send e-mail notification at start-up
property.description: Specify whether to send an e-mail at start-up only that contains the error report. If you want to receive e-mail notification, use the upload error report property instead of this property.

property.name: InternalState
property.summary: Whether to include the internal state in the error report
property.description: Specify whether to include the internal state of the appliance in the error report. The internal state can be useful in diagnosing the cause of the error.

property.name: FFDCPacketCapture
property.summary: Whether to use a background packet capture

description.p: Specify whether to use a background packet capture. This feature enables network packet capture for all interfaces including the internal loopback interface. When enabled, this feature runs continuously.

If the appliance encounters a problem or a user triggers the generation of an error report, the error report includes the data from this packet capture data. This data helps to determine the messages that the appliance was processing when it encountered the problem.

property.name: FFDCEventLogCapture
property.summary: Whether to use a background log capture

description.p: Specify whether to use a background log capture. This feature enables the capture of all log and trace points with minimal overhead. When enabled, this feature runs continuously.
If the appliance encounters a problem or a user triggers the generation of an error report, the error report includes data from this log capture. This data can help IBM Support identify the problem.
These messages are independent of messages written to log and trace targets.

property.name: FFDCMemoryLeakCapture
property.summary: Whether to use automatic leak detection

description.p: Specify whether to enable automatic leak detection. This feature finds gradual memory leaks that occur steadily over time. This feature does not help in situations where messages are larger than the appliance can parse.

When enabled and if memory falls below an internal threshold, the appliance tracks all memory allocations. When the appliance reaches a critical condition that will lead to a crash, it generates an error report that contains information about memory allocation.
The configuration of the Throttle Settings affects this feature. The throttle settings can prevent the appliance from reaching the internal threshold.

property.name: AlwaysOnStartup
property.summary: Whether to generate an error report when the appliance reboots or reloads

description.p: Specify whether the appliance generates an error report when it reboots or reloads. If this feature is enabled logs will be collected before they are overwritten when the system reloads. When the appliance reboots or reloads and when using the upload error report feature, the status provider lists on-start as the reason code. If the appliance reloads due to a crash, the status provider lists crash as the reason code.

ul.li: In general enable this feature.
In particular when in production, enable this feature to track reloads and reboots.

property.name: AlwaysOnShutdown
property.summary: Whether to generate an error report when the appliance shuts down

description.p: Specify whether the appliance generates an error report when it shuts down. When the appliance shuts down and when using the upload error report feature, the status provider lists on-shutdown as the reason code. If the appliance shuts down due to a crash, the status provider lists crash as the reason code.

ul.li: In general enable this feature.
In particular when in production, enable this feature to make sure debugging information is captured when the appliance shuts down.

property.name: Protocol
property.summary: Protocol to use to upload the error report
property.description: Specify the protocol to use to upload the error report. Note that the selection you will see depends on your device features and licenses.

property.name: LocationIdentifier
property.summary: Text to include in the subject of an e-mail notification
property.description: Specify text to include in the subject of an e-mail notification. In general, this value should be how you identify this appliance in your environment. When using the upload error report feature, this property is not necessary. In this case, failure notification uses the serial number of the appliance and the timestamp of the error report.

property.name: SmtpServer
property.summary: Host name or IP address of the SMTP server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote SMTP server to which to send the error report.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.summary: E-mail address of the recipient
property.description: Specify the e-mail address to which to send the error report.

property.name: EmailSenderAddress
property.summary: E-mail address of sender

property.name: FTPServer
property.summary: Host name or IP address of the FTP server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote FTP server to which to upload the error report.

property.name: FTPPath
property.summary: Directory on FTP server to upload the error report
property.description: Specify the directory on the FTP server to which to upload the error report. Use %2F to specify an absolute path.

property.name: FTPUserAgent
property.summary: User Agent for FTP access
property.description: Specify the User Agent that describes how to connect to remote FTP servers. In addition to the FTP Policy to define the connection, ensure that this User Agent defines the basic authentication policy (user name and password) to connect to the FTP server.

property.name: NFSMount
property.summary: NFS Mount
property.description: Specify the NFS mount point to which to upload the error report.

property.name: NFSPath
property.summary: NFS Path
property.description: This describes the NFS path location for the Error Report

property.name: RaidVolume
property.summary: RAID volume
property.description: Specify the volume on the RAID array to which to upload the error report.

property.name: RaidPath
property.summary: Directory on RAID volume
property.description: Specify the directory on the RAID volume to which to upload the error report.

property.name: IScsiVolume
property.summary: iSCSI volume

description.p: The iSCSI protocol is deprecated.
Specify the iSCSI volume to which to upload the error report.

property.name: IScsiPath
property.summary: Directory on iSCSI volume

description.p: The iSCSI protocol is deprecated.
Specify the directory on the iSCSI volume to which to upload the error report.

property.name: ReportHistoryKept
property.summary: Number of local error reports to maintain

description.p: Specify the maximum number of local error reports to maintain when using the upload error report feature. After reaching this limit, the next local error report overwrites the oldest local error report. Use any value of 2 - 10. The default value is 5.
This feature only applies to locally stored error reports, including temporary and Raid.
To view the history, see the Failure Notification status provider.
Failure notification is a serviceability tool. By default, failure notification is disabled. To use failure notification, you must enable the configuration and allow the error report to be uploaded.

The uploading of an error report allows the capture of more diagnostic information, which safely improves serviceability. Although there is a tradeoff between performance and serviceability, you should choose serviceability by enabling the following properties:

ul.li: Include Internal State
Background Packet Capture
Background Log Capture
Background Memory Trace

description.p: When you allow the error report to be uploaded, this setting enables the Failure Notification status provider. This status provide in combination with the report history tracks the error reports that the appliance generates, the reason why the appliance generated the error report, and its upload status to the specific destination.

You can specify an NFS, iSCSI (deprecated), RAID, SMTP, or FTP destination. You can also specify the local temporary directory as the destination. The appliance generates error reports, the naming convention includes the serial number of the appliance and the timestamp of the report. This naming convention prevents one report from overwriting another.
You can use Event Triggers to generate error reports automatically when specific events occur.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: ProductOID
property.summary: The read-only string that identifies the installed DataPower agent software.
property.description: The read-only string that identifies the installed DataPower agent software.

property.name: Description
property.summary: The read-only string that identifies the product.
property.description: The read-only string that identifies the product.

property.name: SerialNumber
property.summary: The read-only string that identifies the serial number for the appliance.
property.description: The read-only string that identifies the serial number for the appliance.

property.name: EntitlementNumber
property.summary: Set the entitlement serial number for the appliance.
property.description: After an appliance replacement, the serial number of the original device. Without the original serial number, IBM cannot entitle the replacement appliance for maintenance or warranty services.
property.hoverhelp: After an appliance replacement, set to the serial number of the original appliance.

property.name: ProductID
property.summary: The read-only string that identifies the appliance type.
property.description: The read-only string that identifies the appliance type.

property.name: Contact
property.summary: Enter contact information for the appliance.
property.description: Information that identifies the individual or functional area that is responsible for appliance maintenance and management.

property.name: SystemName
property.summary: Enter the name of the appliance.
property.description: The name of the appliance to use internally as a custom prompt and to use externally to integrate with remote systems. The name should be a unique, 7-bit US-ASCII name of 64 characters or less. The name should not use characters with special, file system context meaning, such as '/' and ':'.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the name of the appliance. The name should be a unique, 7-bit US-ASCII name of 64 characters or less. The name should not use characters with special, file system context meaning.

property.name: Location
property.summary: Enter the location of the appliance.
property.description: The location of the appliance.

property.name: Services
property.summary: The read-only hex value that indicates support for application, presentation, session, and data-link layer services.
property.description: The read-only hex value that indicates support for application, presentation, session, and data-link layer services.

property.name: BackupMode
property.summary: The read-only installation setting that indicates whether a secure-backup is allowed.
property.description: The read-only installation setting that indicates whether a secure-backup is allowed.

property.name: ProductMode
property.summary: The read-only installation setting that indicates the operational mode of the appliance.
property.description: The read-only installation setting that indicates the operational mode of the appliance.

property.name: LoginMessage
property.summary: NONTRANSLATABLE - Custom message displayed at user login.
property.description: NONTRANSLATABLE - This property is deprecated. Use the 'Custom User Interface File' property.

property.name: CustomUIFile
property.summary: Set the URL of the custom user interface file.

description.p: The URL of the custom user interface file. This file contains custom messages for CLI and GUI sessions as well as the custom CLI prompt. The file must reside in the store: or local: directory, not on a mounted file system.

hoverhelp.p: Set the URL of the custom user interface file. The file must reside in the store: or local: directory, not on a mounted file system.

property.name: AuditReserve
property.summary: Enter the disk space to reserve for audit records.
property.description: The disk space to reserve for audit records. When the disk is full, all services enter the down operational state and stop processing traffic. To restore disk space and resume traffic processing, manual intervention is required. Enter a value in the range 0 - 10000. The default value is 40.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the disk space to reserve for audit records. Enter a value in the range 0 - 10000.

property.name: GlobalIPLogFilter
property.summary: NONTRANSLATABLE - Global IP Filter Address
property.description: NONTRANSLATABLE - Global IP Filter Address

property.name: DetectIntrusion
property.summary: Indicate whether to check for intrusion detection.
property.description: Whether to check for intrusion detection.

property.name: HardwareXMLAcceleration
property.summary: Indicate whether to use the hardware XML accelerator.

description.p: Whether to use the Hardware XML accelerator.
Attention: Disable the XML hardware accelerator only when directed by IBM Support. When disabled, XML hardware acceleration rules in the compile options policy have no effect.

After you change the state, restart the appliance to remove items from the cache. After the appliance restarts, the specified state is in effect. You can view the status of the XML hardware accelerator in the appliance version information. The XML accelerator shows the type appended with (disabled) when the accelerator is disabled.

hoverhelp.p: Indicate whether to use the hardware XML accelerator.
Attention: Disable the XML hardware accelerator only when directed by IBM Support.
After you change the state, restart the appliance to remove items from the cache. After the appliance restarts, the specified state is in effect.

property.name: Locale
property.summary: Set the locale for the operating language of the appliance.
property.description: The locale for the operating language of the appliance. The locale setting manages locale-specific conventions, such as date and time formats, and controls the language of log messages. The language must be enabled before you can select it as the system locale.
property.hoverhelp: Set the locale for the operating language of the appliance. The locale setting manages locale-specific conventions, such as date and time formats, and controls the language of log messages. The language must be enabled before you can select it as the system locale.

property.name: SystemLogFixedFormat
property.display: Enable Fixed Format in System Logs
property.summary: Enable fixed format in system logs.
property.description: Ensures that system logs are in the format that is used in version 6.0.1. When enabled, fields added for serviceability improvements after version 6.0.1 are not in the log. Added fields can help with monitoring and troubleshooting.

description.p: System settings provide the following purposes.

ul.li: Define appliance-specific information, such as contact information, location, and name.
Update serial number after a replacement.
Enable interface for custom GUI messages and custom CLI prompt.
Reserve disk space for the audit log.
Define information about the hardware for use by the SNMP system table, such as serial number, and model type

object.name: TimeSettings

property.name: LocalTimeZone
property.summary: Set the local time zone.
property.description: The time zone to use in management interfaces. The default value is EST-5EDT.

property.name: CustomTZName
property.summary: Enter the symbolic name for the custom time zone.
property.description: The symbolic name for the custom time zone. This name is appended to local times. The name must be three or more alphabetic characters. If you use any other characters, the time zone becomes UTC.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the symbolic name for the custom time zone. The name must be three or more alphabetic characters. If you use any other characters, the time zone becomes UTC.

property.name: UTCDirection
property.summary: Set the direction relative to UTC for the custom time zone.
property.description: The direction relative to UTC for the custom time zone. Asia is east. North America is west. The default value is East.
property.hoverhelp: Set the direction relative to UTC for the custom time zone. Asia is east. North America is west.

property.name: OffsetHours
property.summary: Enter the number of hours the custom time zone is from UTC.
property.description: The number of hours the custom time zone is from UTC. If 2 hours and 30 minutes from UTC, enter 2.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the number of hours the custom time zone is from UTC. If 2 hours and 30 minutes from UTC, enter 2.

property.name: OffsetMinutes
property.summary: Enter the number of minutes the custom time zone is from UTC.
property.description: The number of minutes the time zone is from UTC. If 2 hours and 30 minutes from UTC, enter 30.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the number of minutes the time zone is from UTC. If 2 hours and 30 minutes from UTC, enter 30.

property.name: DaylightOffsetHours
property.summary: Enter the offset hours from DST.
property.description: The offset in hours when the custom time zone observes DST. Generally, the offset is 1 hour. The default value is 1.

property.name: TZNameDST
property.summary: Enter the symbolic name for the custom time zone during DST.
property.description: The symbolic name for the custom time zone during DST. This name is appended to local times. The name must be three or more alphabetic characters. If you use any other characters, the time zone becomes UTC.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the symbolic name for the custom time zone during DST. The name must be three or more alphabetic characters. If you use any other characters, the time zone becomes UTC.

property.name: DaylightStartMonth
property.summary: Set the month when DST starts for the custom time zone.
property.description: The month when DST starts for the custom time zone. The default value is March.

property.name: DaylightStartWeek
property.summary: Enter the instance of the day in the month when DST starts for the custom time zone.
property.description: The instance of the day in the month when DST starts for the custom time zone. If DST starts on the second Sunday in the month, enter 2.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the instance of the day in the month when DST starts for the custom time zone. If DST starts on the second Sunday in the month, enter 2.

property.name: DaylightStartDay
property.summary: Set the day of the week when DST starts for the custom time zone.
property.description: The day of the week when DST starts for the custom time zone. The default value is Sunday.

property.name: DaylightStartTimeHours
property.summary: Enter the hour when DST starts.
property.description: The hour when DST starts for the custom time zone. If the start boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 2.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the hour when DST starts for the custom time zone. If the start boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 2.

property.name: DaylightStartTimeMinutes
property.summary: Enter the minute when DST starts for the custom time zone.
property.description: The minute when DST starts for the custom time zone. If the start boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 30.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the minute when DST starts for the custom time zone. If the start boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 30.

property.name: DaylightStopMonth
property.summary: Set the month when DST ends for the custom time zone.
property.description: The month when DST ends for the custom time zone. The default value is November.

property.name: DaylightStopWeek
property.summary: Enter the instance of the day in the month when DST ends for the custom time zone.
property.description: The instance of the day in the month when DST ends for the custom time zone. If DST ends on the second Sunday in the month, enter 2.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the instance of the day in the month when DST ends for the custom time zone. If DST ends on the second Sunday in the month, enter 2.

property.name: DaylightStopDay
property.summary: Set the day of the week when DST ends for the custom time zone.
property.description: The day of the week when DST ends for the custom time zone. The default value is Sunday.

property.name: DaylightStopTimeHours
property.summary: Enter the hour when DST ends for the custom time zone.
property.description: The hour when DST ends for the custom time zone. If the end boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 2.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the hour when DST ends for the custom time zone. If the end boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 2.

property.name: DaylightStopTimeMinutes
property.summary: Enter the minute when DST ends for the custom time zone.
property.description: The minute when DST ends for the custom time zone. If the end boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 30.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the minute when DST ends for the custom time zone. If the end boundary is 2:30 AM, enter 30.

object.summary: Set the local time zone for the appliance.

description.p: The time zone for the appliance. The time zone affects the time that the appliance displays. All time stamps in the CLI and GUI use this time zone.
Note: The appliance clock runs on Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
When daylight saving time (DST), or summer time, applies to a time zone, the appliance adjusts the time when a DST boundary is crossed.

object.name: DFDLSettings

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation
property.description: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: DFDLValidation
property.summary: Enable additional runtime checks to verify that binary data is fully valid according to the DFDL schema.
property.description: Enable additional runtime checks to verify that binary data is fully valid according to the DFDL schema. These checks are in addition to the checks that are needed to parse or serialize the data.

property.name: DFDLStrictValidation
property.summary: Error if there is a runtime DFDL validation error, instead of warning.
property.description: Additional DFDL runtime checks verify that binary data is fully valid according to the DFDL schema. These runtime checks are in addition to the checks that are needed to parse or serialize the data. Because these checks are not needed to complete processing, an error can be reported as a warning and ignored in Lax Mode, or can be treated as an error in Strict Mode. This property is only relevant if DFDL Validation is enabled.

property.name: DFDLIgnoreTrailingData
property.summary: Instruct DFDL processing to ignore any trailing data after completion of a good recognized message, for example during processing of a single message as part of batch processing.

description.p: Enable DFDL processing to ignore any trailing data after completion of a good recognized message, for example during processing of a single message as part of batch processing.

This setting is off by default, which is the stricter and more secure setting because it does not allow extraneous extra data after the message. You can enable this setting if you are expecting such data.

One example use case scenario to enable this setting is batch processing. Another example use case scenario to enable this setting is to read only the front of a message to make a routing decision or some other decision.
This settings only applies to DFDL parsing, and does not apply to DFDL serialization.

property.name: DFDLEncodingDefault
property.summary: DFDL Default Encoding
property.description: Inside a DFDL Schema, the value of $dfdl:encoding carries the system assumption of encoding. You can use that variable within a DFDL schema to make it more resilient for systems that require different encodings, depending on transport header values, and so on. If the encoding value is not determined by the system based on the transport headers, then the system defaults to the value of this field. If the value is calculated from transport headers, then this field is not used.

property.name: DFDLByteOrderDefault
property.summary: DFDL Default Byte Order
property.description: Inside a DFDL Schema, the value of $dfdl:byteOrder carries the system assumption of byte order. You can use that variable within a DFDL schema to make it more resilient for systems that require different byte orders, depending on transport header values, and so on. If the byte order value is not determined by the system based on the transport headers, then the system defaults to the value of this field. If the value is calculated from transport headers, then this field is not used.

property.name: DFDLBinaryFloatRepDefault
property.summary: DFDL Default Binary Float Representation
property.description: Inside a DFDL Schema, the value of $dfdl:binaryFloatRep carries the system assumption of choice of binary float representation. You can use that variable within a DFDL schema to make it more resilient for systems which require different binary float representations, depending on transport header values, and so on. If the binary float representation value is not determined by the system based on the transport headers, then the system defaults to the value of this field. If the value is calculated from transport headers, then this field is not used.

property.name: DFDLOutputNewLineDefault
property.summary: DFDL Default New Line
property.description: Inside a DFDL Schema, the value of $dfdl:outputNewLine carries the value that is set here. You can use that variable within a DFDL schema to make it more resilient for systems which require carriage return and line feed at the end of a line, and other systems that require only a line feed. You can configure the system preference to control the DFDL Schema using this setting. The value specifies the character or characters that are used to replace the %NL; character class entity during unparse.

property.name: DFDLUserTrace
property.summary: Enable DFDL processing user trace messages.

description.p: Enable DFDL processing of user trace messages to be calculated and sent to the DataPower log at various log levels.
CAUTION: Do not leave the DFDL user trace enabled in production conditions. Disable the DFDL user trace before you move the configuration into production.

object.description: The DFDL settings specify constraints for parsing and serializing binary data, where the data is modeled by a DFDL schema.

object.name: DomainAvailability

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

object.summary: Monitors services and their front-side handlers to determine when the domain is ready to accept traffic.
object.description: Domain Availability monitors the services within the domain. If the operational state of any service in the domain is in the down state, then the operational state for Domain Availability goes down, indicating that all services are not up and ready to accept traffic. Otherwise, the operational state for Domain Availability is up. At startup time, Domain Availability maintains all front-side handlers in a quiesced state until the associated services are fully configured, and a log event is created, indicating that the domain is ready to process traffic.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

object.name: SchemaExceptionMap

property.name: OriginalSchemaURL
property.description: This is the location of the full original schema document. This is required. This may reside on or off the device.

property.name: SchemaExceptionRules
property.summary: Schema Exception Rules
property.description: Rules describe what elements may be excepted from the schema validation when the Original Schema is used for Schema Validation.

object.summary: A map of local XML Schema exceptions
object.description: This object describes exceptions to an XML Schema by identifying elements of the schema that may be encrypted in an instance document. When Schema Validation is performed on the document using this Exception Map, encrypted elements are considered valid when they appear in place of the specified elements.

property.name: NameSpaceMappings
property.description: The prefix and URI for namespaces that might be encountered in requests.

object.name: DocumentCryptoMap

property.name: Operation
property.summary: Operation to perform on selected document nodes
property.description: Select the operation to perform on the selected document nodes.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression selecting document nodes for the specified operation.

description.p: Enter the XPath expression identifying the elements on which to operate in the blank field in front of the Add button. Click Add to add the expression to those included in the map.

Click the XPath Tool button to use the graphically oriented XPath Tool to construct the message. You will need to upload an example document to use this tool. Note that this example should be the encrypted document when the operation is decrypt.

object.summary: A map to drive partial document crypto operations
object.description: A Document Crypto Map indicates which elements, of a complete schema, to encrypt or decrypt. The indicated element or elements may also be signed.

object.name: XPathRoutingMap

property.name: XPathRoutingRules
property.summary: XPath routing rules

object.summary: Information for routing documents based on XPath expressions

description.p: An XPath Routing Map matches XPath expressions with corresponding destination URLs. When the XPath expression evaluates to true when applied to the message submitted, the target destination for the message is set to the corresponding URL.
Use the Rules tab to establish these mappings. Use the Namespace Mapping tab to determine Namespace URIs for namespaces used in the XPath Expressions.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Descriptive summary
property.description: Specify a brief, descriptive summary.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Type of log target
property.description: Specify the type of the log target.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Log target priority
property.description: Control the log scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority operations will be favored over lower priority operations.

property.name: SoapVersion
property.summary: SOAP version for log target
property.description: Specify the SOAP version for SOAP log targets.

property.name: Format
property.summary: Format of log entries
property.description: Specify the format in which to represent log entries.

property.name: TimestampFormat
property.summary: Format of log timestamp
property.description: Specify the format of the timestamp for log entries.

property.name: FixedFormat
property.summary: Fix the format of logs
property.description: Makes the format of logs unchanging. The log format fixed at V6.0.1. New fields added to log formats afterwards are ignored.

property.name: LocalIdentifier
property.summary: Local system identifier
property.description: Specify a descriptive string that identifies the log target to remote recipients. For syslog destinations, do not include spaces.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.summary: Email address
property.description: Specify the email address to which to send log entries.

property.name: SenderAddress
property.summary: Email address
property.description: Specify the email address of the sender. The value must match the email address of the cryptographic key if email messages are signed.

property.name: SMTPDomain
property.summary: SMTP client domain
property.description: Specify the fully-qualified domain name of the SMTP client. This information will be part of the SMTP session initiation (HELO command).

property.name: Size
property.summary: Maximum log size
property.description: Specify the maximum size of file-based log targets. Enter a value in the range 100 through 50000. The default value is 500.

property.name: URL
property.summary: POST URL
property.description: Specify the HTTP URL to which to send log entries. The appliance sends the entries with the POST method. The appliance uses the default User Agent.

property.name: NFSMount
property.summary: Instance of the NFS Static Mount
property.description: Specify the name of an NFS Static Mount over which to write the log.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: LocalFile
property.summary: Name of the file for the file-based log target
property.description: Specify the name of the log file. Examples: logtemp:///filename.log or logstore:///filename.log . If using an iSCSI volume for log storage, consider tuning the Session Reestablish Timeout property of the associated iSCSI Target configuration.

property.name: NFSFile
property.summary: Path to the file for the NFS-based log target
property.description: Specify the path to the log file. The path is relative to the NFS mount. Use a regular expression in the ^[_a-z0-9A-Z/][-_a-z0-9A-Z/.]*$ format. Do not end the path with a forward slash (/).

property.name: ArchiveMode
property.summary: Method to archives
property.description: Specify the method to create archives.

property.name: UploadMethod
property.summary: Protocol to upload log files
property.description: Specify the protocol to upload log files. If you use SCP to upload multiple log targets at the same time, a system error might occur. The appliance supports only one SCP connection at a time. To minimize the risk when using SCP, configure log targets with different settings, such as different event subscriptions and different log sizes.

property.name: Rotate
property.summary: Maximum number of rotations
property.description: Specify the maximum number of rotations to permit. Enter a value in the range 1 through 100. The default value is 3.

property.name: UseANSIColor
property.summary: Use ANSI color scheme
property.description: Enables the use of ANSI X3.64 escape sequences to color-code messages by log level.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address

description.p: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote server.

To establish a secure SSL connection to the server, set this value to the value of the remote host of an SSL Proxy service on the appliance. The local SSL Proxy service then securely forwards the log entries to its configured remote server.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number

description.p: Specify the listening port on the remote server.
If using a local SSL Proxy service to establish a secure SSL connection, set this value to the value of the remote port of the SSL Proxy service.

property.name: RemoteLogin
property.summary: Account (user name)
property.description: Specify the account or user name to access the remote server.

property.name: RemotePassword
property.summary: Password
property.description: Specify the password for the account or user name for non-public key authentication. Public key authentication can be configured through the default instance of the User Agent.

property.name: RemoteDirectory
property.summary: Directory on the remote server

description.p: Specify an existing writable directory on the remote server to which to upload files.

ul.li:
To denote an absolute directory from the root directory, specify a single forward slash character (/) or equivalent encoded character (%2F) before the fully qualified path.
For SCP or SFTP, enter / to resolve to //.
For FTP, enter %2F to resolve to /%2F.
To denote a directory that is relative to the user's home directory, do not specify a forward slash character or encoded character before the fully qualified file name.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local interface address
property.description: Specify a host alias or IP address of a local interface.

property.name: SyslogFacility
property.summary: syslog facility
property.description: Set the log facility (per RFC 3164) to include in messages sent to the syslog log target.

property.name: RateLimit
property.summary: The maximum number of events logged

description.p: Set the maximum number of events to be logged per second. Enter a value in the range 1 - 1000. The default value is 100.

ul.li: Remote log targets might receive more than this number of events within a second, depending on network latency and buffering. syslog over TCP log targets are exclusive, because only a single TCP connection is made to the server.

In the case of syslog over TCP log targets, the rate limit is the maximum number of events transmitted over the connection within one second. A value of 0 disables rate-limiting by the logging target.

property.name: ConnectTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait for a connection to the server to be established before generating an error.
property.description: Set the number of seconds to wait for a connection to the server to be established before generating an error. A log message will be generated in the default log and connection retry attempts will be made. Enter a value in the range 1 - 90. The default value is 60.

property.name: IdleTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait before closing an established but inactive connection to the server.

description.p: Set the number of seconds to wait before closing an established but inactive connection to the server. Enter a value in the range 1 - 600. The default value is 15.

Attention: If multiple log targets have the following configuration, they might share connections.
The same local address and port
The same remote address and port Because of potential connection-sharing, set the same idle timeout value for these log targets.

property.name: ActiveTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait before closing an established and active connection to the server.

description.p: Set the number of seconds to wait before closing an established and active connection to the server. Enter a value in the range 0 - 60. A value of 0 allows the log target to most efficiently send messages to the server by maintaining a healthy connection indefinitely. The default value is 0.

Attention: If multiple log targets have the following configuration, they might share connections.
The same local address and port
The same remote address and port Because of potential connection-sharing, set the same active timeout value for these log targets.

property.name: FeedbackDetection
property.summary: Whether to suppress events from logging subsystem
property.description: Indicate whether to suppress events from the logging subsystem itself. A log target always suppresses its own events, but will record events from other log targets. Under certain circumstances with multiple log targets, these events could create a positive feedback loop that could cause resource contention. Enable to suppress all log events from the logging subsystem and prevent resource contention.

property.name: IdenticalEventSuppression
property.summary: Suppress identical events
property.description: Indicate whether to suppress identical events from the same object over a set time period. When enabled, the log target records only one instance of the event until the suppression period expires.

property.name: IdenticalEventPeriod
property.summary: Duration to suppress identical events
property.description: Set the duration of the suppression period. The default value is 10.

property.name: LogEventCode
property.summary: Filter to log specific event codes
property.description: Subscription filters allow only those log messages that contain the configured event codes to be written to this log target. With this filter, it is possible to create a log target that collects only log messages for a specific set of event codes.

property.name: LogEventFilter
property.summary: Filter to suppress specific event codes
property.description: Suppression filters suppress those log messages that contain the configured event codes to be written to this log target. With this filter, it is possible to create a log target that collects a wide range of log messages except for a specific set of event codes.

property.name: LogObjects
property.summary: Filter to log events for specific objects
property.description: Object filters allow only those log messages for specific objects to be written to this log target. Object filters are based on object classes. With this filter, you can create a log target that collects only log messages generated by particular instances of the specified object classes.

property.name: LogIPFilter
property.summary: Filter to log events for specific IP addresses
property.description: IP address filters allow only those log messages from specific IP addresses to be written to this log target.

property.name: LogTriggers
property.summary: Event Trigger Points

description.p: Event triggers perform actions only when triggered by a specified message ID or event code. With this filter, it is possible to create a log target that collects only the results of the specified trigger action. For example, to trigger the generation of an error report when a certain event occurs use the save error-report command.

property.name: SSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: Backup
property.summary: Log Target
property.description: Sets another Log Target object as a backup to receive redirected events in case of an error on the current file-based log target. This setting has no effect on network-based log targets. For network-based log targets, set a load balancer group as the remote host.

property.name: LogEvents
property.summary: Log event subscription

description.p: Subscribes the log target to particular event categories. Some example categories include:

dl.dd: Authorization events
Configuration management events
XSLT processing events

description.p: For each event category chosen (including the all category), you can establish a priority level that must be met before the log message will be captured by the log target. Without event subscriptions, no events are included by default. To allow the log target to capture messages, the configuration must include at least one event subscription. The category can be the all category.

Log targets capture messages that are posted by the various objects and services that are running on the appliance. Target types enable additional capabilities that include rotating files, encrypting and signing files or messages, and sending files to remote servers.

Messages in log targets can be restricted (filtered) by priority, event code, event category, object type, or IP address. By default, a log target cannot accept messages until it is subscribed to one or more events.

object.name: TraceTarget

property.name: Backup
property.summary: Backup Trace Target
property.description: Allows setting of a backup trace target to redirect events to in case of an error on the current trace target

property.name: LogEvents
property.summary: Trace event subscription
property.description: Defines the log events the current trace target is subscribed to

object.description: Allows the configuration of a trace target.

object.name: FormsLoginPolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LoginForm
property.summary: URL fragment of login form
property.description: The front-side URL fragment of the HTML login form to collect user name and password information. The default is /LoginPage.htm.

property.name: UseCookieAttributes
property.summary: Indicate whether to attach a policy that describes cookie attributes.
property.description: Whether to attach a cookie attribute policy. If you do not use a cookie attribute policy, the configuration use the properties of the forms login policy.

property.name: CookieAttributes
property.summary: Set the policy that describes cookie attributes.

description.p:
Use a cookie attribute policy to allow predefined or custom attributes to be included in forms login cookie. Properties in the policy override common attributes of the forms login policy.
Max-Age overrides inactivity timeout and session lifetime.
Path replaces the form POST action URL.
Secure replaces the use SSL for login.

property.name: UseSSLForLogin
property.summary: Whether to use SSL for the login
property.description: Whether to use a secure connection for the login exchange. If enabled, you must provide the SSL port. The default is enabled.

property.name: EnableMigration
property.summary: Whether to allow sessions to migrate between cluster members if an appliance fails
property.description: Whether to permit session failover between cluster members. If enabled, you must specify a shared secret. The default is disabled.

property.name: SSLPort
property.summary: Port for SSL login redirection
property.description: The port the service uses for SSL redirection during the login transaction. Specify the port of the HTTPS handler that the Web application firewall uses for secure communication. The default is 8080.

property.name: SharedSecret
property.summary: Shared secret, common to all appliances to which a session may migrate
property.description: Shared secret object that will be used to protect the migration cookie. All cluster members must specify the same shared secret.

property.name: ErrorPage
property.summary: URL fragment of error page
property.description: The front-side URL fragment of the HTML page to display after a login failure. The default is /ErrorPage.htm.

property.name: LogoutPage
property.summary: URL of logout page
property.description: The front-side URL of the HTML page to use for logout. An empty string disables logout. The default is /LogoutPage.htm.

property.name: DefaultURL
property.summary: URL fragment to go to after successful login
property.description: The URL fragment to visit after a successful login when no other target is available. In most cases, login is triggered via an attempt to access a URL in the application, and the client is redirected to this URL after succesfully logging in. However, if users explicitly visit the URL of the login form, they are redirected to this URL after logging in. The default is /.

property.name: FormsLocation
property.summary: Location of HTML pages
property.description: The location for where the appliance retrieves the login, logout and error pages. The default is the remote application server.

property.name: LocalLoginForm
property.summary: Location of local login form
property.description: The location of the login form on the appliance. The default is store:///LoginPage.htm.

property.name: LocalErrorPage
property.summary: Location of local error page
property.description: The location of the error page on the appliance. The default is store:///ErrorPage.htm.

property.name: LocalLogoutPage
property.summary: Location of local logout page
property.description: The location of the logout page on the appliance. The default is store:///LogoutPage.htm.

property.name: UsernameField
property.summary: Attribute value of the user name field
property.description: The value of the 'name' attribute for the user name field on the login form. The default is j_username.

property.name: PasswordField
property.summary: Attribute value of the password field
property.description: The value of the 'name' attribute for the password field on the login form. The default is j_password.

property.name: RedirectField
property.summary: Attribute value of the hidden field for the target URL
property.description: The value of the 'name' attribute for the hidden field on the login form. This field stores the original target URL (the URL that the client is attempting to access). The default is originalUrl.

property.name: FormProcessingURL
property.summary: Processing URL fragment
property.description: The URL fragment to which the login form posts its results when a user submits the request. The default is /j_security_check.

property.name: InactivityTimeout
property.summary: Allowable duration for an inactive session
property.description: The number of seconds before an inactive session is invalidated. The default is 600.

property.name: SessionLifetime
property.summary: Maximum time before requiring reauthentication
property.description: The maximum time in seconds that a session can persist before that session becomes invalid and requires reauthentication. The minimum value is 1. The default is 10800.

property.name: RedirectURLType
property.summary: How to retrieve host information for HTTP URL-redirects
property.description: Control how the service retrieves host information for HTTP URL-redirects. The default behavior is to use the variable value.

property.name: FormSupportType
property.summary: Source for HTML pages
property.description: Manage the source for HTML pages. The default behavior is to use static HTML pages from an explicit location.

property.name: FormSupportScript
property.summary: Location of the custom processing to generate HTML pages and form

description.p: Specify the location of the custom XSLT stylesheet or GatewayScript file that generates the HTML pages.
This stylesheet or GatewayScript file must generate the following HTML pages:

ul.li: A login form request allows processing to generate a login form with the login operation.
A logout page request allows processing to generate a logout page with the logout operaton.
An error page request allows processing to generate an error page with the error operation.

object.summary: Policy that defines HTML form behavior
object.description: The HTML forms login policy defines the details for collecting user authentication information.

object.name: FTPQuoteCommands

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: FTPQuotedCommands
property.summary: Quoted Commands
property.description: The list of commands to send to the remote FTP server.

object.description: The configturation creates a named list of FTP commands to be quoted to a remote FTP server before a file transfer. These commands are referenced by the FTP Policies section of a User Agent configuration.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: FrontProtocol
property.summary: Protocol handler
property.description: Specify a protocol handler to determine the network communication protocol, address, port, and other protocol-specific settings.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML manager

description.p: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of style sheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy.

Optionally, an XML Manager can employ a User Agent. The User Agent settings, in turn, can affect the behavior of the gateway when communicating with remote servers or with clients when sending back responses.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.summary: URL rewrite policy

description.p: Define a URL Rewrite Policy that defines rules for the following rewrite and replacement operations:

ul.li: Rewrite the entire URL or a portion of the URL
Replace a header value in a message
Rewrite the HTTP POST body in a message

description.p: The rewrite rules are applied before document processing. Therefore, the evaluation criteria in the Matching Rule is against the rewritten value.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: FWCred
property.summary: Crypto Credentials list
property.description: Specify a credentials list for the service. The credentials specify which keys and certificates are available to support processing. In the absence of credentials, all locally-stored key and certificates are available to the service.

property.name: StylesheetParameters
property.description: Style sheets used in processing policies can take stylesheet parameters. These parameters can be passed in by this object. You can define more than one parameter.

property.name: DefaultParamNamespace
property.description: If a stylesheet parameter is defined without a namespace (or without explicitly specifying the null namespace), then this is the namespace into which the parameter will be assigned.

property.name: QueryParamNamespace
property.description: The namespace in which to put all parameters that are specified in the URL query string.

property.name: BackendUrl
property.summary: Backend address and port

description.p: Specify the URL of the static backend server. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use.
To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL.
To use the on demand router, specify http://ODR-LBG instead of the address-port pair in the URL.

ul.li: If the URL starts with http://, the DataPower service uses the HTTP protocol.
If the URL starts with https://, the DataPower service uses the HTTPS protocol to secure connections.

If the URL starts with ftp://, the DataPower service uses the FTP protocol.
For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the ftp://user:password@host:port/path format.
For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the ftp://user:password@host/%2Fpath format. %2F is the URL encoding of a forward slash.
Include a password in the URL with caution. The use of user:/password@host results in a server connection. However, with this configuration, the connection could be unable to send multiple commands to the FTP server. For a stable connection, define a basic authentication policy in the user agent. The user agent is in the XML manager associated with the DataPower service.

If the URL starts with sftp://, the DataPower service uses the SSH FTP protocol.
For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the sftp://host:port/path format.
For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the sftp://host:port/~/path format.
If password authentication is desired, specify the password in the SFTP Client Policy of the User Agent. If Public key authentication is desired, specify the user's private key in the SFTP Client Policy of the User Agent. When no SFTP Client Policy is specified, the Basic-Auth Policy and Pubkey-Auth Policy take effect.
This protocol is available on XI and XB appliances only.

If the URL starts with dpnfs://, the DataPower service uses the NFS protocol.
For static mounts, specify the URL in the dpnfs://MountObjectName format, where MountObjectName is the name of an existing NFS mount.
For dynamic mounts, specify the URL in the dpnfs://host or dpnfs://host/path format.

If the URL starts with dpmq://, the DataPower service uses the IBM MQ protocol. The IBM MQ Queue Manager that is referenced in the URL must exist in the current application domain.
If the URL starts with mq://, the protocol is for a dynamic backend server.
These protocols are available on XI, XB, and XM appliances only.

If the URL starts with dpwasjms://, the DataPower service uses the WebSphere JMS protocol to secure connections. The server object that is referenced in the URL must exist.
This protocol is available on XI, XB, and XM appliances only.

If the URL starts with dpims:// or dpimsssl://, the DataPower service uses the IMS protocol.
These protocols are available on XI and XB appliances only.

If the URL starts with dptibems://, the DataPower service uses the TIBCO EMS protocol to secure connections. The server object that is referenced in the URL must exist.
If the URL starts with tibems://, the protocol is for a dynamic backend server.
These protocols are available on XI, XB, and XM appliances only.

If the URL starts with dptibrv:///, the DataPower service uses the TIBCO RV protocol.
This protocol is available on XM appliances only.

description.p: For assistance in building a URL, click the appropriate Helper button.

property.hoverhelp: Specify the URL of the static destination. The format of the URL determines the protocol that is used for communicating with the destination.
property.label: URL

property.name: PropagateURI
property.summary: Controls URI propagation

description.p: URI propagation is meaningful only when:

ul.li: The service uses a static backend.

The service uses a dynamic backend and routing is set with a route with stylesheet (route-action) action. In this case, use dp:set-target() to define the backend server.
For the other routing options that are available with route-action and route-set, the URI is absolute.
