property.name: EnforcementMode
property.summary: How to ensure that messages meet security requirements
property.description: Enforcement Mode defines how the service uses WS-Policy to ensure that messages meet security requirements. The default behavior is enforce.

property.name: PolicyReferences
property.summary: Controls WSDL-defined policy references.
property.description: Enable policies attached to WSDL using PolicyURI attributes and PolicyReference elements. These attachments are sometimes called XML element attachments. If 'off', all PolicyURI attributes and PolicyReference elements are ignored and only external policies are enforced.

property.name: IgnoredPolicyAttachmentPoints
property.summary: Disables an external policy for a service or port.
property.description: Disable all policies attached by policy references at a configured attachment point leaving other policy references intact.

property.name: ExternalPolicy
property.summary: Associates an external policy with a service or port.
property.description: Associate an external policy with a service.

property.name: SLAEnforcementMode
property.summary: Controls the application of SLA Policies to transactions.
property.description: SLA Enforcement Mode controls the application of SLA Policies to transactions. Transactions are either allowed or rejected based on whether an SLA rule is applied to the transaction.

object.name: QuotaEnforcementServer

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: A descriptive summary for the configuration
property.description: Specifies a brief descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: RaidVolume
property.summary: Whether data storage is persisted on the RAID volume or is in-memory.

description.p:
Specifies whether data storage is persistent or in-memory.
For persistent storage, select the RAID volume that must be raid0 .
For in-memory storage, do not select the RAID volume.

property.name: ServerPort
property.summary: Server port of the quota enforcement server
property.description: Indicates the listening port used by the GatewayScript module to communicate with the quota enforcement server. The default port value is 16379.

property.name: MonitorPort
property.summary: Monitor port of the quota enforcement server
property.description: Indicates the listening port for operational state monitoring for the quota enforcement server. The default port is 26379.

property.name: EnablePeerGroup
property.summary: Whether to enable the peer group mode
property.description: Indicates whether the appliance is enabled to work in peer group mode. By default, peer group mode is disabled, which indicates that the appliance works in standalone mode.

property.name: EnableSSL
property.summary: Whether to enable the SSL to secure connection
property.description: Indicates whether SSL is used to secure connection among the peers of the peer group. By default, the SSL is enabled.

property.name: SSLCryptoKey
property.summary: Private key alias
property.description: Indicates the key alias for the appliance to authenticate a peer of the appliance during the SSL handshake.

property.name: SSLCryptoCertificate
property.summary: Certificate alias
property.description: Indicates the certificate alias that is sent to a peer when the appliance negotiates an SSL connection with the peer.

property.name: IPAddress
property.summary: IP address of the appliance

description.p: Indicates the IP address of the appliance for other peers to connect to. The IP address can be the IP address on any interface of the appliance and must be accessible by other peers in the peer group. The IP address cannot be 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0 or ::. This IP address uniquely identifies the appliance.

You can use a local host alias instead of a static IP address. A host alias resolves a locally configured alias to a static IP address. Aliasing can help when you move configurations among appliances.

property.name: Peers
property.summary: The IP address or hostname of peers of the appliance

description.p: Specifies peers of the appliance in the peer group. The appliance connects to each peer in the order in which peers are added in the list. It is not necessary to specify all peers in the Peers list.

ul.li: When the appliance connects to none of peers in the list, this appliance is the first active server and this appliance joins the peer group as the master.
When the appliance connects to any peer in the list, it joins the peer group as a slave.

description.p: You can use a local host alias instead of a static IP address. A host alias resolves a locally configured alias to a static IP address. Aliasing can help when you move configurations among appliances.
Note: Do not specify the IP address or hostname of this appliance.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: The priority of the appliance

description.p: Indicates the priority that is used to decide which slave is promoted as the new master when failover occurs.
Enter a value in range 0 - 255. The default value is 100. The slave with the lowest priority number is promoted. The slave with the value of zero can never be promoted.

property.name: StrictMode
property.summary: Whether to enable or disable the strict mode
property.description: Based on your requirements for quota enforcement, enable or disable strict mode. By default, the strict mode is enabled.

object.summary: Quota enforcement server working in standalone mode or peer group mode.

description.p: On each DataPower appliance, you configure the quota enforcement server to store the thresholds and associated metadata in memory or persist them on the RAID volume.
The quota enforcement server can work in standalone mode or peer group mode.

A peer group is collection of at least three DataPower appliances across which quota enforcement is implemented. In each peer group, one appliance is the master and other appliances are slaves. Failover might occur when the master becomes unavailable.
When you enable the peer group mode, the appropriate configuration properties are displayed. You must configure the connection among peers.
Based on your requirements for quota enforcement, you can enable or disable strict mode. Strict mode affects data-consistency across the peer group.

When strict mode is enabled, the following effects are caused:
When the master is operational and when strict mode of all appliances in a peer group is enabled, threshold synchronization is more frequent to ensure data-consistency across the peer group. However, more network bandwidth is used. Therefore, strict mode is suitable for peers in the same data center.
When the master becomes unavailable, before failover occurs, the slave with enabled strict mode cannot process the request.
If service performance and availability are more important than data-consistency, you can disable strict mode for the slave so that this slave can process the request. The slave with disabled strict mode writes the threshold and associated metadata to the local data storage. After failover occurs, the connection is resumed between the slave and the new master. The threshold and associated metadata stored by the slave might be overwritten by the new master when the new master synchronizes the data to all slaves. Data-consistency might be affected across the peer group.
By default, data is stored in memory and quota enforcement server works in standalone mode.

object.name: RaidVolume

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: ReadOnly
property.summary: Set the access permission to files on the storage volume.

description.p: The access permission to files on the storage volume.

ul.li: When enabled, access permission is read-only. On appliances with the B2B feature, access permission must be read/write, the appliance will ignore this setting if B2B feature enabled.
When disabled, the default value, access permission is read/write.

hoverhelp.p: Set the access permission to files on the storage volume.

ul.li: When enabled, access permission is read-only. On appliances with the B2B feature, access permission must be read/write, the appliance will ignore this setting if B2B feature enabled.
When disabled, the default value, access permission is read/write.

property.name: Directory
property.summary: Enter the name of the subdirectory.
property.description: The subdirectory where the files on the storage volume are available. The name can be up to 64 characters long. The name cannot start with a period. The name can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: . - _.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the name of the subdirectory where the files on the storage volume are available. The name can be up to 64 characters long. The name cannot start with a period. The name can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: . - _.

object.summary: Configure the RAID array for data storage.

description.p: Configure a RAID volume for data storage. The RAID volume consists of two or more hard disk drives in a RAID configuration.
The subdirectory specified is available in the local: and logstore: directories. Each domain contains these subdirectories, and they are not shared across domains.

For access permission, the following behavior exists.
For XB62 appliances, this property is not available.
On appliances with the B2B feature, access permission must be read/write. Although the appliance ignores this setting, read-only permission generates a warning. B2B storage requires write access to the RAID volume.

property.name: EnableSharing

property.description: Enable sharing by allowing other sql objects to utilize this runtime. If disabled every object requiring a runtime will be assigned its own, which will have resource implications.

property.description: Enable Java Runtime Environment dumps to diagnose SQL Data Source Runtime problems.

object.name: SecureBackupMode

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: mode
property.summary: The backup mode to support

description.p: Sets the backup mode to support.

When set to secure backup, you can create a secure backup that you can use to restore all settings for an appliance. A secure backup creates a set of files that you can use to recover the configuration of a lost appliance. A secure backup contains private data on the appliance (certificates, keys, and user data). An administrator cannot see this data in the backup. The appliance encrypts this data with the DataPower key.

property-group.name: main
property-group.on-glass: The backup mode is an operation mode that is set the first time the DataPower Gateway is started. The only way to change an operational mode is to reinitialize the appliance. If you make a change, it is silently ignored.

object.description: Sets the backup operational mode. This mode controls whether a secure-backup is allowed. After this mode is set, it cannot be changed. Operational modes are set the first time the DataPower Gateway is started.

The Secure Cloud Connector will be terminated and an attempt will be made to restart the Secure Cloud Connector.

object.description: Telnet services on the appliance are Telnet handlers. They are available for compatibility with earlier versions. A Telnet handler supports client-initiated access to the CLI. Telnet is an unsecure protocol and should be used with extreme caution. Telnet should be enabled only on the trusted management port or on a secure network segment. To ensure an encrypted connection and verify the cryptographic authenticity of the server, SSH is a more secure choice.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Change the listening port for the B2B viewer
property.description: Changes the listening port for the B2B viewer. The default value is 9091.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The custom SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use a custom SSL server profile or custom SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: Allows users to specify an existing SSL proxy profile and assign the SSL proxy profile to b2bViewer-mgmt instead of the default profile, or create a new SSL proxy profile and assign that SSL proxy profile to b2bViewer-mgmt instead of the default profile.

property.name: UserAgent
property.summary: User Agent
property.description: Allows users to specify an existing User Agent and assign the User Agent to b2bViewer-mgmt, or create a new User Agent and assign that User Agent to b2bViewer-mgmt.

property.name: IdleTimeout
property.summary: Idle session logout time
property.description: The time after which an idle session will be invalidated, requiring reauthentication. To disable the idle timer altogether, use the value '0'.

property.name: ACL
property.summary: Modify the web-b2b-viewer access control list
property.description: Modifies the web-b2b-viewer access control list to allow or deny access based on the IP address of the client.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

object.description: Configure the web B2B Viewer Management interface.

object.name: WebGUI

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Enter the TCP port that the web management service monitors
property.description: The TCP port that the web management service monitors. The default value is 9090.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The custom SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use a custom SSL server profile or custom SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile that the web management service uses to secure connections. If you do not assign one, the service uses one with a self-signed certificate.
property.hoverhelp: Assign a custom SSL proxy profile to secure connections. Without one, the service uses one with a self-signed certificate.

property.name: UserAgent
property.summary: Assign a custom user agent.
property.description: The user agent that the web management service uses.

property.name: SaveConfigOverwrites
property.summary: Whether saved configurations overwrite the startup configuration.
property.description: When enabled, saving a configuration overwrites the startup configuration with the running configuration. When disabled, a manual step is required that prevents overwriting the manually edited startup configuration.
property.hoverhelp: Whether saved configurations overwrite the startup configuration. When enabled, saving a configuration overwrites the startup configuration with the running configuration. When disabled, a manual step is required that prevents overwriting the manually edited startup configuration.

property.name: IdleTimeout
property.summary: Enter the time after which to invalidate idle sessions.
property.description: The time after which to invalidate idle sessions. When invalidated, requires reauthentication. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 600. A value of 0 disables the timer.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the time after which to invalidate idle sessions. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. A value of 0 disables the timer.

property.name: ACL
property.summary: Edit the access control list.
property.description: The access control list uses the defined client IP addresses to allow or deny access.
property.hoverhelp: Edit the "web-mgmt" access control list to define client IP addresses to allow or deny access.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Assign a custom SSL server profile.
property.description: The SSL server profile that the web management service uses to secure connections. If you do not assign one, the service uses one with a self-signed certificate.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

object.summary: Configuration of the web management service.
object.description: Modify the configuration of the web management service.

object.name: HTTPProxyService

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the local port to monitor for incoming client requests.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name, IP address, or Load Balancer Group
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the specific server supported by this DataPower service. If using load balancers, specify the name of the Load Balancer Group. If using the On Demand Router, specify the keyword ODR-LBG. Load balancer groups and the On Demand Router can be used only when Type is static-backend.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the port number to monitor. Used only when Type is static-backend.

property.name: ACL
property.description: This Access Control List will be used to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an Access Control List (ACL) denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

property.name: HTTPTimeout
property.summary: HTTP idle timer
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds (within the range 1 through 86400, with a default of 120) that a firewall or proxy maintains an idle HTTP connection.

property.name: HTTPPersistTimeout
property.summary: TCP idle timer
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds (within the range 0 through 7200, with a default of 180) that a firewall or proxy maintains an idle TCP connection.

property.name: DoHostRewrite
property.summary: Enable/Disable host rewrite
property.description: When enabled, the device will rewrite the Host: header to be the address of the back-end server. This is not what a strict proxy would do, and may not be appropriate for all topologies.

property.name: SuppressHTTPWarnings
property.summary: Enable/Disable 214 warnings
property.description: Toggle to enable or disable the generation of Transformation Applied (Warning Code: 214) messages by the HTTP service.

property.name: HTTPCompression
property.summary: Enable/Disable GZIP compression
property.description: Toggle to enable or disable the GZIP compression function.

property.name: HTTPIncludeResponseTypeEncoding
property.summary: Include the character set encoding in the HTTP content-type header
property.description: Toggle to enable or disable including the character set encoding in the HTTP content-type header produced. For example, when sending a UTF-8 encoded XML document: If this property is disabled, 'content-type=text/xml' will be sent. If this property is enabled, 'content-type=text/xml; charset=UTF-8' will be sent.

property.name: AlwaysShowErrors
property.summary: Provide full error reports even when inline with other documents.
property.description: If set, HTTP responses may be generated with errors appended to partially generated documents. If not set error responses will only be sent to the browser if no other output has been created.

property.name: DisallowGet
property.summary: Do not allow clients to do GET and HEAD
property.description: If set, only methods with incoming data (such as POST) are allowed.

property.name: DisallowEmptyResponse
property.summary: Require all responses to have bodies
property.description: If set, only responses with message bodies are allowed (that is, not 304 and so forth).

property.name: HTTPPersistentConnections
property.summary: Enable/Disable HTTP persistent connections
property.description: Toggle to enable or disable HTTP persistent connections.

property.name: HTTPClientIPLabel
property.summary: HTTP header label containing client IP address
property.description: Retain the default value (X-Client-IP) or provide an other value (for example, X-Forwarded-For).

property.name: HTTPLogCorIDLabel
property.summary: HTTP header label containing global transaction ID
property.description: Enter the name of an HTTP Header to read to determine the global transaction ID for chained services. This value defaults to X-Global-Transaction-ID.

property.name: HTTPProxyHost
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the HTTP proxy to use when the remote server can be accessed only through another HTTP proxy.

property.name: HTTPProxyPort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the port number on the HTTP proxy server.

property.name: HTTPVersion
property.summary: HTTP version

property.name: DoChunkedUpload
property.summary: Enabled/Disable HTTP/1.1 Chunked Request Bodies
property.description: Use the radio buttons to enable (on) or disable (off) the ability to send Content-Type Chunked Encoded documents to the back end server. When the device employs the HTTP/1.1 protocol, the body of the document can be delimited by either Content-Length or chunked encodings. While all servers will understand how to interpret Content-Length, many applications will fail to understand Chunked encoding. For this reason, Content-Length is the standard method used. However doing so interferes with the ability of the device to fully stream. To stream full documents towards the back end server, this property should be turned on. However, the back end server must be RFC 2616 compatible, because this feature cannot be renegotiated at run time, unlike all other HTTP/1.1 features which can be negotiated down at runtime if necessary. This property can also be enabled by configuring a User Agent to enable it on a per-URL basis.

property.name: HeaderSuppression
property.description: HTTP Headers can be suppressed (removed) from the message flow using this property. For example, the Via: header, which contains the name of the DataPower service handling the message, may be suppressed from messages sent by the DataPower device back to the client.

property.name: StylesheetParameters
property.description: Stylesheets used in Processing Policies can take stylesheet parameters. These parameters can be passed in by this object. More than one parameter can be defined.

property.name: DefaultParamNamespace
property.description: If a stylesheet parameter is defined without a namespace (or without explicitly specifying the null namespace), then this is the namespace into which the parameter will be assigned.

property.name: QueryParamNamespace
property.description: The namespace in which to put all parameters that are specified in the URL query string.

property.name: ForcePolicyExec
property.display: Process Messages Whose Body Is Empty
property.summary: Bypasses the one way exchange pattern

description.p: Some message patterns may include bodyless request and response messages. This is common with RESTful web services where messages may or may not include a body but still requires the processing policy to run. To enable this capability for services whose request and response type is XML (or marked as non-XML i.e. JSON), set this option to 'on'. By doing so, the processing policy rules will always be executed.

property.name: CountMonitors
property.description: Count Monitors watch for defined messaging events and increment counters each time the event occurs. When a certain threshold is reached, the monitor can either post a notification to a log or block service for a configured amount of time. Select a Count Monitor from the list to activate that monitor for this firewall. Click the + button to create a new Count Monitor.

property.name: DurationMonitors
property.description: Duration Monitors watch for events meeting or exceeding a configured duration. When a duration is met or exceeded, the monitor can either post a notification to a log or block service for a configured amount of time. Select a Duration Monitor from the list to activate that monitor for this firewall. Click the + button to create a new Duration Monitor.

property.name: MonitorProcessingPolicy
property.summary: Monitors evaluation method
property.description: Select the way that the system behaves when more than one monitor is attached to a service.

property.name: DebugMode
property.summary: Controls transaction diagnostic mode

description.p: Select the diagnostic mode for processing policies. When enabled, you can view details about the state of variables and contexts for a captured transaction in the probe. The default value is off .
Transaction diagnostic mode is not intended for use in a production environment. Transaction diagnostic mode consumes significant resources that can slow down transaction processing.

property.name: DebuggerType
property.summary: Probe Mode
property.description: Select the probe mode.

property.name: DebuggerURL
property.summary: External Server URL
property.description: Configures the URL for external probe mode

property.name: DebugHistory
property.summary: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe
property.description: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe. Enter a value in the range 10 - 250. The default value is 25.

property.name: DebugTrigger
property.summary: Probe Triggers
property.description: The probe captures transactions that meet one or more of the conditions defined by the triggers. These triggers examine the direction or type of the message flow and examine the message for an XPath expression match. When a message meets one of these conditions, the transaction is captured in diagnostics mode and becomes part of the list of transactions that can be viewed.

property.name: WebGUIMode
property.summary: Enable/Disable WebGUI Extensions
property.description: When enabled, WebGUI extension functions are supported.

object.name: XMLFirewallService

property.name: Type
property.summary: Type of operation
property.description: Specify the mode of the XML Firewall. The default is Dynamic Backend.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML manager
property.description: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of stylesheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy. More than one firewall may use the same XML Manager. Select an existing XML Manager from the list to assign the Manager to this firewall. Click the + button to create a new XML Manager that is assigned to this firewall. A default Manager is used if you do not create one.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.summary: URL rewrite policy
property.description: A URL Rewrite Policy applies the rules established in the named policy to rewrite the URL used by the client to connect to the service this firewall represents. This helps to mask the URL and location of the actual service. Select an existing URL rewrite policy from the list of available policies. Click the + button to create a new URL rewrite policy that is then assigned to this firewall.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile and an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list to assign the SSL proxy profile to this firewall. Click the + button to create a new SSL proxy profile and assign that SSL proxy profile to the firewall. SSL Proxy profiles can be used in either client or server communications.

property.name: StylePolicy
property.summary: Assign the processing policy
property.description: Assign the processing policy to the service. The processing policy defines the actions to take against messages that flow through the service.

property.name: MaxMessageSize
property.summary: The maximum allowable size in kilobytes of a message

description.p: Specifies the maximum allowable size in kilobytes of a message. Enter a value in the range 0 - 2097151. The default value is 0. A value of 0 specifies that no limit is enforced, and the message can be of unlimited size.
The maximum message size limit applies to JSON, SOAP, XML, and non-XML messages. If the message type is pass-through, no limit is enforced.

property.name: RequestType
property.summary: Characterize client-originated traffic
property.description: Characterizes the type of traffic that originates from the client. The default is SOAP.

property.name: ResponseType
property.summary: Characterize server-originated traffic
property.description: Characterizes the type of traffic that originates from the server. The default is SOAP.

property.name: FWCred
property.summary: Firewall credentials list
property.description: Specifies an optional Firewall Credentials list for the XML firewall. A Firewall Credentials list specifies which keys and certificates are available to support firewall processing. In the absence of an identified Firewall Credentials list, all locally-stored key and certificates are available to the firewall.

property.name: ServiceMonitors
property.description: Specifies a list of Web Service Monitors for the firewall. Web Service Monitors target Web Service endpoints. Use the Web Services wizard on the Control Panel to supply a WSDL and configure a Monitor for an endpoint. The Monitor collects statistics, establishes count and duration monitors and can take action when thresholds are met or exceeded. A Monitor must be selected here to be activated. Click + to create a new Web Services Monitor. Note that this Monitor is not the Service Level Monitor (SLM) used by a Multi-Protocol Gateway or Web Service Proxy.

property.name: RequestAttachments
property.summary: Attachment processing mode for client requests
property.description: Select how to treat client requests with attachments. The default is Strip.

property.name: ResponseAttachments
property.summary: Attachment processing mode for server responses
property.description: Select how to treat server responses with attachments. The default is Strip.

property.name: RootPartNotFirstAction
property.display: Action when required root part is not first
property.description: When streaming MIME messages, the action to take when the root part is not the first part of the message. If the root part must be first (for example to do BSP conformance checking) and the action is set to "process in order" the DP device will buffer attachments up to the root.

property.name: FrontAttachmentFormat
property.summary: Attachment processing format for client requests
property.description: Select how to interpret client requests with attachments. If an attachment arrives that is not of the type chosen, the attachment will be rejected.

property.name: BackAttachmentFormat
property.summary: Output attachment processing format
property.description: Select the attachment output format to backend servers. If an attachment arrives that is not of the type chosen, the attachment will be rejected.

property.name: MIMEHeaders
property.summary: Processing of MIME Package Headers

description.p: The body of a message (that is, the payload, independent of any protocol headers) can sometimes contain MIME headers before any preamble and before the first MIME boundary contained in the body of the message. These MIME headers can contain important information not available in the protocol headers, such as the string identifying the MIME boundary. If this property is set to on, then these MIME headers will be processed by the Firewall.
Note that if this is on and there are no MIME headers contained in the message, the device will continue to try and parse the message, using the protocol header information, if available.

When this is off and MIME headers are present in the body of the message, these MIME headers will be considered part of the preamble and not used to parse out the message. If the protocol headers (such as HTTP) indicate the MIME boundaries, the device can parse and process individual attachments. If such information is not available, no attachments can be parsed from the body of the message.

property.name: RewriteErrors
property.summary: Whether to rewrite error messages to avoid providing a padding oracle.
property.description: Error messages after a decryption action can provide an attacker who is using the padding oracle attack method with enough information to determine the contents of the plain-text data. When enabled, the default, the client receives error messages without the internal information that could lead to a discovery. When disabled, the client receives the original message with this information.

property.name: DelayErrors
property.summary: Whether to delay error messages to avoid providing a padding oracle.
property.description: The timing difference of the error messages returned after a decryption action can provide an attacker with enough information to determine the contents of the plain-text data. When enabled, the default, the appliance delays error messages for the defined duration. When disabled, the appliance does not delay error messages.

property.name: DelayErrorsDuration
property.summary: How long to delay error messages from the start of the transaction.
property.description: When enabling the delay of error messages, specify the delay duration in milliseconds (ms). If delaying messages for 3000ms, the appliance will not send error messages to the client until 3 seconds have elapsed since the appliance performed decryption on the requests. Use any value of 250 - 300000. The default value is 1000.

property.name: SOAPSchemaURL
property.summary: Specifies which W3C XML Schema will be used to validate SOAP documents
property.description: When a firewall is in SOAP mode, either on the request or response side, it will validate the incoming messages against a W3C Schema that defines what a SOAP message is supposed to look like. It is possible to customize which schema is used on a per-firewall basis by changing this property; this can be used to accommodate non-standard configurations or other special cases.

property.name: WSDLResponsePolicy
property.summary: Policy for responding to .NET WSDL requests
property.description: Select how the firewall handles requests for .NET WSDL requests via the http://domain.com/service?wsdl convention. The default is Off.

property.name: WSDLFileLocation
property.summary: Location of post-filter WSDL
property.description: URL of the file to return when WSDL response policy is set to serve local.

property.name: FirewallParserLimits
property.summary: Use firewall parser limits instead of XML Manager parser limits.
property.description: Use the firewall parser limits instead of the parser limits in the XML Manager for this firewall. Firewall limits override XML Manager limits.

property.name: ParserLimitsBytesScanned
property.summary: XML parser maximum bytes scanned
property.description: Defines the maximum number of bytes scanned by the XML parser. This applies to any XML document that is parsed. If any of the parser limits are set in the XML Firewall, they will override those on the XML Manager. If this value is 0, no limit is enforced.

property.name: ParserLimitsElementDepth
property.summary: XML parser maximum element depth
property.description: Defines the maximum depth of element nesting in XML parser. If any of the parser limits are set in the XML Firewall, they will override those on the XML Manager.

property.name: ParserLimitsAttributeCount
property.summary: XML parser maximum attribute count
property.description: Defines the maximum number of attributes of a given element. If any of the parser limits are set in the XML Firewall, they will override those on the XML Manager.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxNodeSize
property.summary: XML parser maximum node size
property.description: Defines the maximum size any one node may consume. The default is 32 MB. Sizes which are powers of two result in the best performance. If any of the parser limits are set in the XML Firewall, they will override those on the XML Manager. Although you set an explicit value, the appliance uses a value that is the rounded-down, largest power of two that is smaller than the defined value.

property.name: ParserLimitsForbidExternalReferences
property.summary: XML parser forbid external references toggle
property.description: Defines if the XML parser will abort when an input document specifies to resolve an external reference such as an external entity or external DTD definition.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxPrefixes
property.summary: XML parser maximum distinct prefixes
property.description: Enter an integer that defines the maximum number of distinct XML namespace prefixes in a document. This limit counts multiple prefixes defined for the same namespace, but does not count multiple namespaces defined in different parts of the input document under a single prefix. Enter a value in the rage 0 - 262143. The default value is 1024. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 1024.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxNamespaces
property.summary: XML parser maximum distinct namespaces
property.description: Enter an integer that defines the maximum number of distinct XML namespace URIs in a document. This limit counts all XML namespaces, regardless of how many prefixes are used to declare them. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 1024. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 1024.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxLocalNames
property.summary: XML parser maximum distinct local names
property.description: Enter an integer that defines the maximum number of distinct XML local names in a document. This limit counts all local names, independent of the namespaces they are associated with. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1048575. The default value is 60000. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 60000.

property.name: ParserLimitsAttachmentByteCount
property.summary: Maximum byte count per attachment
property.description: Defines the maximum number of bytes allowed in any single attachment. Attachments that exceed this size will result in a failure of the whole transaction. If this value is 0, no limit is enforced.

property.name: ParserLimitsAttachmentPackageByteCount
property.summary: Maximum cumulative byte count for all parts
property.description: Defines the maximum number of bytes allowed for all parts of an attachment package, including the root part. Attachment packages that exceed this size will result in a failure of the transaction. If this value is 0, no limit is enforced.

property.name: ParserLimitsExternalReferences
property.summary: Special handling for external references in XML
property.description: Select the special handling for input documents that contain external references, such as an external entity or external DTD definition.

property.name: CredentialCharset
property.summary: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values
property.description: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The appliance transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. Defaults to Protocol which is ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

property.name: SSLConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property-group.name: main
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display general settings

property-group.name: monitors
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional Monitor settings

property-group.name: attachments
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional Attachment Processing settings

property-group.name: ProbeSettings
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional Probe settings
property-group.description:
The MultiStep Probe allows developers to view the changing value of variables and the changing contents of processing contexts. The developer can step through each action for any given transaction, up to a configured number of transactions. The Probe Settings page turns on this debugging tool and also sets the number of concurrently captured transactions.
Note: The number of concurrent xml sessions is limited to the value of the transaction history size.

property-group.name: HTTPOptions
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional HTTP settings

object.description: Create or edit an XML Firewall on local IP/port (device address and port). This firewall may communicate with a dynamically identified server (or servers), a static back end server (at an identified remote IP/port) or as a loopback. The Firewall applies the selected processing policy to messages flowing through the firewall (request, response or both directions). Message content from client or server can be characterized as soap, xml, Non-XML (preprocessed) or Pass-Thru (unprocessed) and verified accordingly. The firewall may rewrite client request URLs using a URL rewrite policy. The firewall may use SSL communications to client, server or both directions if applicable.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Mode for proxy operation
property.description: Specified the configuration mode for the XSL Proxy. The default is static-backend.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML Manager
property.description: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of stylesheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. More than one proxy may use the same XML Manager. Select an existing XML Manager from the list to assign the Manager to this XSL proxy. Click the + button to create a new XML Manager that is assigned to this proxy. A default Manager is used if you do not create one.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.summary: URL rewrite policy
property.description: A URL Rewrite Policy applies the rules established in the named policy to rewrite the URL used by the client to connect to the service this proxy represents. This helps to mask the URL and location of the actual service. Select an existing URL rewrite policy from the list of available policies. Click the + button to create a new URL rewrite policy that is then assigned to this proxy.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile and an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list to assign the SSL proxy profile to this XSL proxy. Click the + button to create a new SSL proxy profile and assign that SSL proxy profile to the XSL proxy. SSL Proxy profiles can be used in either client or server communications.

property.name: StylePolicy
property.summary: Assign the processing policy
property.description: Assign the processing policy to the service. The processing policy defines the actions to take against messages that flow through the service.

property.name: CredentialCharset
property.summary: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values
property.description: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The appliance transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. Defaults to Protocol which is ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

property.name: SSLConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property-group.name: main
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display general settings

property-group.name: monitors
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional Monitor settings

property-group.name: ProbeSettings
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional probe settings
property-group.description:
The MultiStep Probe allows developers to view the changing value of variables and the changing contents of processing contexts. The developer can step through each action for any given transaction, up to a configured number of transactions. The Probe Settings page turns on this debugging tool and also sets the number of concurrently captured transactions.
Note: The number of concurrent xml sessions is limited to the value of the transaction history size.

property-group.name: HTTPOptions
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional HTTP settings

description.p: The XSL Proxy service is deprecated.

Creates an XSL Proxy on local IP/port for server on remote IP/port. A loopback proxy does not require a remote IP and port. The Proxy applies the selected XSL proxy processing policy to messages flowing through the proxy (as requests, responses or both directions). The proxy may apply the selected URL rewrite policy to client requests. If needed, the proxy may communicate with either the back end server or the requesting client using the SSL profiles selected.

object.description: Defines an HTTP Proxy Service.

object.name: HTTPService

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535, with a default of 80) that specifies the port monitored by the HTTP server.

property.name: Mode
property.summary: HTTP Server Mode
property.description: Selects the HTTP server mode. The default is Normal.

property.name: Identifier
property.summary: HTTP Server Identifier
property.description: This value is returned in the HTTP headers that Identify the HTTP Server.

property.name: BaseDir
property.summary: Base Directory
property.description: Specify the local flash directory from which the server serves documents (including the Start Page). This value is typically "local:///" (note the triple slashes) or "store:///". If no Start Page file exists in this directory, the server will return an automatically generated index of the contents of the directory.

property.name: StartPage
property.summary: Start Page in base directory
property.description: Specify the page to display when the client first accesses the server. The HTML file has to be located in the configured base directory. If this is left blank, the server will return an automatically generated list of the contents of the Base Directory.

property.name: ACL
property.description: This Access Control List will be used to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an Access Control List (ACL) denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

object.description: Creates an HTTP server. This server delivers documents stored on the local system.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service-scheduling priority
property.description: Select the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services are favored over lower priority services.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Local listening port
property.description: Specify the local listening port for the service.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Hostname or IP address of the server.
property.description: Specify the hostname or IP address of the remote server.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Listening port on the server
property.description: Specify the listening port number of the remote server.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile and an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: Select an SSL proxy profile to manage SSL communications with the peer. The SSL proxy profile identifies the keys and certificates for the handshake.

property.name: FrontTimeout
property.summary: Maximum idle time for client connections in a transaction
property.description: Specify the maximum idle time for client connections in a transaction. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: BackTimeout
property.summary: Maximum idle time for a server connection in a transaction
property.description: Specify the maximum idle time for server connections in a transaction. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: ConnTimeout
property.summary: Maximum duration for transactions
property.description: Specify the maximum duration for transactions. This timer monitors the duration of end-to-end transactions. If the specified connection time is exceeded, the client connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: ConnLimit
property.summary: Maximum number of concurrent client connections
property.description: Specify the maximum number of concurrent client connections to the service. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 65535. The value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of connections. The default value is 100.

property.name: SSLConfigType
property.summary: The SSL type for securing the communication between two parties.
property.description: SSL configuration type for securing communication between two parties.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

description.p: Creates an SSL Proxy service. This service can be used to wrap or unwrap a TCP stream in SSL.
This service requires SSL profiles to secure the connections.

ul.li: When the appliance is an SSL client, use a forward SSL proxy profile or an SSL client profile to secure connections between the clients and its targets.

When the appliance is an SSL server, use a reverse SSL proxy profile or an SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance. When the server supports Server Name Indication (SNI), you use an SSL SNI server profile.
When the appliance is both an SSL client and SSL server, use a two-way SSL proxy profile, or an SSL client profile and an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile to secure both connections.

object.name: TCPProxyService

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The TCP port number
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535) that specifies the port monitored by the TCP proxy

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote host for which this proxy is accepting TCP traffic. TCP traffic sent to the proxy will in turn be sent to this host. Click Ping to verify connectivity.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the port number of the remote host, specify with Remote Host, for which this proxy is accepting TCP traffic.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Maximum idle time
property.description: Specify the maximum idle time that is allowed for the front side connection and the server side connection. After the time is reached, the idle connections are terminated. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 360. A value of 0 disables the idle timer.

object.description: Creates a TCP Proxy service.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Enter the number of the local port monitored by by the XSL Coprocessor.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: Assign XML Manager
property.description: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of stylesheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy. More than one coprocessor may use the same XML Manager. Select an existing XML Manager from the list to assign the Manager to this Coprocessor. Click the + button to create a new XML Manager that is assigned to this Coprocessor. A default Manager is used if you do not create one.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.summary: Assign URL Rewrite Policy
property.description: Select an existing URL Rewrite policy and assign the policy to the XSL Coprocessor, or create a new URL Rewrite policy and assign that rewrite policy to the XSL Coprocessor.

property.name: StylePolicyRule
property.summary: Assign configured Processing Rule
property.description: Select an existing Processing Rule and assign the rule to the XSL Coprocessor, or select None (the default). When None is selected, the CoProcessor will use the stylesheet specified in the request. If the stylesheet is not cached on the device, the CoProcessor will call back and retrieve it from the requesting entity. To create a new Processing Rule and assign that Processing Rule to the XSL Coprocessor, click the + button. Select a rule and click the ... button to edit the rule.

property.name: ConnectionTimeout
property.summary: Idle Connection Timeout
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds (within the range 3 through 7200, with a default of 60) that a XSL coproc maintains an idle connection.

property.name: IntermediateResultTimeout
property.summary: Intermediate Result Timeout
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds (within the range 1 through 600, with a default of 20) that a XSL coproc maintains an unused Intermediate Result nodeset.

property.name: CacheRelativeURL
property.summary: Enables caching of relative client URL
property.description: Configures the caching of relative client URL's. If enabled documents specified by relative URL's will be cached.

property.name: UseClientURIResolver
property.summary: Redirect external resource URL to client URI resolver
property.description: Configures the resolving of external resource URL's. If enabled external resources are resolved through the client URI resolver.

property.name: CryptoExtensions
property.summary: Enables use of crypto extensions
property.description: Configures access to crypto extensions in referenced stylesheet rules. If enabled crypto extension functions can be used in multistep transformations.

property.name: DefaultParamNamespace
property.description: If a stylesheet parameter is defined without a namespace (or without explicitly specifying the null namespace), then this is the namespace into which the parameter will be assigned.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: An SSL profile
property.description: Select an existing SSL profile and assign the SSL profile to the XSL coproc, or create a new SSL profile and assign that SSL profile to the XSL coproc.

property.name: DebugMode
property.summary: Controls transaction diagnostic mode

description.p: Select the diagnostic mode for processing policies. When enabled, you can view details about the state of variables and contexts for a captured transaction in the probe. The default value is off .
Transaction diagnostic mode is not intended for use in a production environment. Transaction diagnostic mode consumes significant resources that can slow down transaction processing.

property.name: DebuggerType
property.summary: Probe Mode
property.description: Select the probe mode.

property.name: DebuggerURL
property.summary: Server UR
property.description: Configures the URL for external probe mode

property.name: DebugHistory
property.summary: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe

description.p: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe. Enter a value in the range 10 - 250. The default value is 25.

p.b: Note: The number of concurrent xml sessions is limited to the value of the transaction history size.

property.name: DebugTrigger
property.summary: Probe Triggers
property.description: The probe captures transactions that meet one or more of the conditions defined by the triggers. These triggers examine the direction or type of the message flow and examine the message for an XPath expression match. When a message meets one of these conditions, the transaction is captured in diagnostics mode and becomes part of the list of transactions that can be viewed.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property-group.name: ProbeSettings
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional Probe settings
property-group.description:
The MultiStep Probe allows developers to view the changing value of variables and the changing contents of processing contexts. The developer can step through each action for any given transaction, up to a configured number of transactions. The Probe Settings page turns on this debugging tool and also sets the number of concurrently captured transactions.
Note: The number of concurrent xml sessions is limited to the value of the transaction history size.

description.p: The XSL Coprocessor service is deprecated.

Creates an XSL Coprocessor. An XSL Coprocessor accepts input not from a client, as in XSL Proxy or XML Firewall operation, but from a Java program or a plug-in equipped application running on another machine on the local network. Messages are sent to the coprocessor by the Java library or plug-in, the Coprocessor then applies the Processing Rule selected and returns the result to the calling routine. When the Rule is set to None, the CoProcessor uses the XSL stylesheet supplied by the calling entity.

property.name: command
property.description: Enter the sequence of commands to invoke. Use a semicolon to separate the commands. The macro invokes the commands in the specified sequence. For example, configure terminal; backup latest.zip appdomain.

description.p: The Shell Alias command is deprecated.

Creates a user-defined macro that runs the specified sequence of commands when invoked from the command line. You can use the WebGUI to create and modify macros, but you can invoke these macros from the command line only.

object.name: SimpleCountMonitor

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: TPS
property.summary: Rate Limit
property.description: The rate of acceptable traffic, per user, expressed in transactions per second.

property.name: Action
property.summary: Style of enforcement action
property.description: Select the action to take when the rate limit is exceeded. The default is Reject.

property.name: MaxSources
property.summary: Number of Distinct Users Tracked
property.description: The system organizes the counts user by the identity most recently used. When too many distinct counts have been observed, the users not seen in the longest time are discarded. This parameter specifies how many distinct users are tracked before discard.

property.name: ConcurrentConnections
property.summary: Number of Connections per User
property.description: The number of simultaneous connections allowed per user. Set to 0 to disable this enforcement.

object.description: A simple TPS based message monitor that limits the transaction rate any single user may achieve.

object.name: SLMAction

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Control procedure to trigger
property.description: The control procedure (action) to trigger in addition to generating a log message for transactions in excess of the maximum rate.

property.name: LogLevel
property.summary: Log message priority
property.description: The priority (severity) of the generated message when a monitored transaction type exceeds its threshold.

object.description: An SLM action defines the control procedure to trigger for transactions in excess of the maximum transaction rate. As part of any control procedure, the monitor writes an event to the log for each transaction that exceeds a threshold.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: CredType
property.summary: Manner to obtain credentials
property.description: The manner to obtain the credential value (user identity) for each transaction. The default is a mapped credential from an AAA action.

property.name: CredMatchType
property.summary: Matching algorithm to apply
property.description: The matching algorithm to determine which credentials to apply an SLM policy.

property.name: CredValue
property.summary: Credential values to match
property.description: One or more credential values to match when the matching algorithm is for an exact match or regular expression.

property.name: Stylesheet
property.summary: Location of style sheet
property.description: The location of the style sheet when the credential type is for a custom style sheet.

property.name: Header
property.summary: Name of request header
property.description: The name of the header when the credential type is for a request header.

description.p: An SLM credentials class identifies a set of users (credentials) to be subject to an SLM policy. An SLM credentials class consists of the following types and properties:

ul.li: A credential type that specifies the manner to obtain user credentials
A match type that determines to which credentials to apply the SLM policy
Depending on the credential and match type, properties that identify specific instances of credentials

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: ExecutionPolicy
property.summary: Operational behavior of policy
property.description: The operational behavior of the policy. The default behavior is to process all policy statements.

property.name: Statement
property.summary: Policy statement to select messages
property.description: The policy statement that establishes criteria for selecting messages, sets a measurement interval, sets thresholds, and determines the action to take when the threshold is met for the selected messages. A policy can have multiple statements that run in the sequence defined by the statement identifier (index).

property.name: PeerGroup
property.summary: Peer Group
property.description: An SLM Policy may be enforced across a group of devices handling load-balanced traffic destined for the same resources. A Peer Group establishes a data sharing protocol among these devices such that each device includes the traffic that has passed through the other peers when calculating whether or not a threshold has been reached.

property.name: APIMgmt
property.summary: API Management
property.description: An internal hidden flag indicating that the SLM policy is used by API Management.

description.p: An SLM policy counts messages or measures latency for messages that match a set of select criteria and that pass through the appliance during a configured interval. The policy can take action when configured thresholds are reached.
Messages can be selected based on credential class, resource class, or both. If neither, all messages are selected.
A policy consists of one or more statements. Each statement establishes the credential class, resource class, thresholds, and actions to take when thresholds are met during an interval.
Examples:

ul.li: A policy that throttles all traffic that arrives at a rate faster than 1000 messages per second.
A policy that generates a log message for all messages that arrive during the last elapsed second that originated from a specific IP address and requested use of a specific resource.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: RsrcType
property.summary: Manner to identify resources
property.description: The manner to identify the group of resources that is subject to the SLM policy.

property.name: RsrcMatchType
property.summary: Matching algorithm to apply
property.description: The matching algorithm to determine which resources to apply an SLM policy.

property.name: RsrcValue
property.summary: List of values to match
property.description: The list of one or more resource values to match.

property.name: Stylesheet
property.summary: Location of style sheet
property.description: The location of the style sheet when the resource type is for a custom style sheet.

property.name: XPathFilter
property.summary: XPath filter to apply
property.description: The XPath expression to use as the filter when the resource type is for an XPath expression.

property.name: Subscription
property.summary: UDDI subscription key

description.p: The UDDI subscription is deprecated. Instead, use WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) subscription.
The subscription key when the resource type is a UDDI subscription.

property.name: WSRRSubscription
property.summary: WSRR Subscription
property.description: The subscription when the resource type is a WSRR subscription.

property.name: WSRRSavedSearchSubscription
property.summary: WSRR Saved Search Subscription
property.description: The subscription when the resource type is a WSRR Saved Search subscription.

description.p: An SLM resource class identifies a set of resources to be subject to an SLM policy. A resource class consists of the following types and properties:

ul.li: A resource type that specifies the manner to identify resources
A match type that determines to which resources to apply the SLM policy
Depending on the resource and match type, properties that identify specific instances of resources

object.name: SLMSchedule

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: DaysOfWeek
property.summary: Days of the week to enforce
property.description: The days of the week to enforce the schedule. The time and duration apply to all selected days. Enter Saturday and Sunday to define a weekend schedule.

property.name: StartTime
property.summary: Start time to enforce
property.description: The start time to enforce the schedule in the current timezone in the 24-hour format. To enforce from 8:00 AM to 8:30 PM, enter 08:00:00.

property.name: Duration
property.summary: Number of minutes after the start time to enforce
property.description: The number of minutes to enforce the schedule. Enter any value of 1 - 1440. The default is 1440. To enforce from 8:00 AM to 8:30 PM, enter 750.

property.name: StartDate
property.summary: Start date to enforce
property.description: The start date to enforce the schedule in the current timezone.

property.name: StopDate
property.summary: Stop date to enforce
property.description: The stop date to enforce the schedule in the current timezone. The enforcement period does not include the stop date.

property.name: TimeZone
property.summary: Time zone, relative to UTC
property.description: The time zone used to enforce the schedule. The default is the device local time zone.

object.description: An SLM schedule defines the time period (hours and days) during which to enforce the statements in an SLM policy. Schedules allow the application of different statements during different time periods.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: MailServerHost
property.summary: IP address or host name of outgoing mail server
property.description: The IP address or host name of SMTP server that is used to send outgoing e-mail messages.

property.name: MailServerPort
property.summary: Listening port on outgoing mail server
property.description: The listening port on the SMTP server that is used to send outgoing e-mail messages.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile to use to establish a secured connection with the mail server. If blank, the configuration uses the setting from the SSL proxy profile policy in the associated user agent.

property.name: Options
property.summary: SMTP options to enable
property.description: The SMTP options to enable for the SMTP client. If blank, the configuration uses the setting from the SMTP client policy in the associated user agent.

property.name: Auth
property.summary: Method to authenticate SMTP client
property.description: With the client authentication option, the method to authenticate the SMTP client. If blank, the configuration uses the setting from the SMTP client policy in the associated user agent.

property.name: AccountName
property.summary: Account or user name to authenticate
property.description: The account or user name of the SMTP client to authenticate on the SMTP server. The account generally takes the name@domain.com form. If blank, the configuration uses the setting from the basic authentication policy in the associated user agent.

property.name: AccountPassword
property.summary: Password for account
property.description: The password for the SMTP client account or user name that is authenticated to the SMTP server. If either password or alias are blank, the configuration uses the setting from the basic authentication policy in the associated user agent.

property.name: AccountPasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias for account
property.description: The password alias of the password for the SMTP client account or the user name that is authenticated to the SMTP server. If password or alias are blank, the configuration uses the setting from the basic authentication policy in the associated user agent.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

description.p:
The SMTP server connection defines the connection details for a Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP) server. The appliance uses the SMTP server connection for the following purposes:
B2B partners use this configuration to send an e-mail message to an AS1 or ESMTP destination.
B2B gateways use this configuration to request an AS1 MDN.
For ease of configuration, the DataPower appliance provides the default SMTP server connection configuration in each application domain. By default, this configuration is empty and disabled.

object.name: SNMPSettings

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Version
property.summary: The running SNMP version
property.description: Specifies the running SNMP software version. The default is version 2c.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: IP address monitored for incoming SNMP requests
property.description: A specific IP address monitored by the SNMP agent or engine for incoming SNMP requests. The default value of 0.0.0.0 allows the agent or engine to listen on all interfaces. Selecting the address of one interface restricts SNMP to that interface.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: UDP port monitored for incoming SNMP requests
property.description: A specific UDP port monitored by the SNMP agent or engine for incoming SNMP requests. By default, the agent or engine monitors port 161.

property.name: Policies
property.summary: Define access policies for SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c by communities, and their mapping to an application domain.

property.name: Targets
property.summary: Specify SNMP Trap and Notification recipients

property.name: Users
property.summary: Define SNMPv3 users
property.description: The name of a user (which must have SNMP credential parameters) which is authorized to use SNMPv3 to access the MIBs on this system.

property.name: Contexts
property.summary: Create non-default SNMPv3 contexts, and define their mapping to an application domain. The default (empty string) context is always mapped to the default application domain.
property.description: SNMPv3 context definitions, which provide SNMPv3 access to non-default application domains.

property.name: SecurityLevel
property.summary: Set minimum security level required for incoming SNMPv3 requests.
property.description: The minimum security level required for incoming SNMPv3 Get and Set requests. The default is Authentication, Privacy.

property.name: AccessLevel
property.summary: Set limits on MIB access for incoming SNMPv3 requests.
property.description: The type of access allowed to MIB objects for incoming SNMPv3 Get and Set requests.

property.name: EnableDefaultTrapSubscriptions
property.summary: Enable Default Event Subscriptions
property.description: Enable or Disable the default list of event codes that generate traps. The default is Enable Trap Subscriptions.

property.name: TrapPriority
property.summary: Minimum trap event priority
property.description: Select a mininum trap event priority. The priorities are hierarchical. The lowest is listed last. Set to the minimum that is required for your trap events.

property.name: TrapEventCode
property.summary: Trap event-code subscriptions
property.description: The list of event codes generating traps. You can add event codes which will be triggering traps send to the configured trap targets.

property.name: EngineIDSource
property.summary: Generate a unique SNMP Engine ID.

description.p: Select how to set the SNMP Engine ID: Fixed or uniquely generated.

ul.li: When fixed, the default value, multiple DataPower appliances might have the same SNMP Engine ID. When multiple SNMP engines have the same identifier, an SNMP replay attack is possible. The fixed value is "0x8000395d03000000000000".
When uniquely generated, the appliance creates a unique SNMP Engine ID.

description.p: If you change this setting, SNMP credentials are invalidated and must be updated. Change any SNMP credentials with the previous SNMP engine ID or with an ID of 0.

property.name: ConfigMib
