property.summary: Enter the maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: ACL
property.summary: Assign the access control list.
property.description: The access control list uses the defined client IP addresses to allow or deny access.

property.name: CredentialCharset
property.summary: Set the character encoding of the original basic authentication values.
property.description: The character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The appliance transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value represents ISO-8859-1 Latin 1.

property.name: HTTP2MaxStreams
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of current streams that a client can have

description.p: The maximum number of concurrent streams that the client can have outstanding at the same time with the handler. The limit applies to the number of streams that the client allows the target to create.
The greater the number of streams in use, the more resources the client uses. Resources include memory and the network connections to the destination.
Enter a value in the range 1 - 500. The default value is 100.

property.name: HTTP2MaxFrameSize
property.summary: Enter the largest payload frame size that clients can send
property.description: The largest payload frame size that the client can send. Enter a value in the range 16384 - 16777215. The default value is 16384.

property.name: HTTP2StreamHeader
property.summary: Whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response

description.p: Indicates whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response. When enabled, the HTTP/2 stream identifier is included in the X-DP-http2-stream header. With this header, you can correlate the HTTP/2 stream. The default behavior is disabled.

object.description: An HTTP handler receives HTTP requests that are not over SSL and forwards them to the appropriate DataPower service. HTTP handlers conform to RFC 2616.

object.name: HTTPSSourceProtocolHandler

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTPS handler listens.
property.description: The address on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value indicates that the handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value indicates that the handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.
property.label: IP address

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Enter the port on which the HTTPS handler listens.
property.description: The port on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value is 443.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value is 443.

property.name: HTTPVersion

If enabled, the DataPower service uses GZIP to compress HTTP transmissions when the Accept-Encoding HTTP header indicates that compressed documents can be processed.
The Transfer-Encoding HTTP header indicates compression.

property.description: The maximum idle time for client connections. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. property.name: MaxURLLen

property.description: The length of the longest incoming URL to accept. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128000. The default value is 16384.

property.name: MaxTotalHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow.
property.description: The maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

property.name: MaxHdrCount
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of headers to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum number of headers to allow in client requests. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxNameHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the name portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxValueHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the value portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxQueryStringLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: ACL
property.summary: Assign the access control list.
property.description: The access control list uses the defined client IP addresses to allow or deny access.

property.name: CredentialCharset
property.summary: Set the character encoding of the original basic authentication values.
property.description: The character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The appliance transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value represents ISO-8859-1 Latin 1.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance

description.p: The SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.
Note: The SSL server profile that secures the HTTP/2 connection must use the TLS 1.2 or better protocol with a cipher that is secure according to RFC 7540.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance

description.p: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.
Note: The SSL SNI server profile that secures the HTTP/2 connection must use the TLS 1.2 or better protocol with a cipher that is secure according to RFC 7540.

property.name: HTTP2MaxStreams
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of current streams that a client can have

description.p: The maximum number of concurrent streams that the client can have outstanding at the same time with the handler. The limit applies to the number of streams that the client allows the target to create.
The greater the number of streams in use, the more resources the client uses. Resources include memory and the network connections to the destination.
Enter a value in the range 1 - 500. The default value is 100.

property.name: HTTP2MaxFrameSize
property.summary: Enter the largest payload frame size that clients can send
property.description: The largest payload frame size that the client can send. Enter a value in the range 16384 - 16777215. The default value is 16384.

property.name: HTTP2StreamHeader
property.summary: Whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response

description.p: Indicates whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response. When enabled, the HTTP/2 stream identifier is included in the X-DP-http2-stream header. With this header, you can correlate the HTTP/2 stream. The default behavior is disabled.

object.description: An HTTPS handler receives HTTP requests over SSL and forwards them to the appropriate DataPower service. HTTPS handlers conform to RFC 2616.

object.name: IMSCalloutSourceProtocolHandler

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Descriptive summary
property.description: Specifies a descriptive summary.

property.name: IMSHost
property.summary: Host name or IP address of remote IMS Connect server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the target IMS Connect server.

property.name: IMSPort
property.summary: Listening port on the remote IMS Connect server
property.description: Specifies the listening port on the remote IMS Connect server.

property.name: DataStoreName
property.summary: Name of the IMS data store
property.description: Specifies the name of the IMS data store. The value can be up to eight characters in length and cannot be blank. The value can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: @ # $.

property.name: TPipe
property.summary: IMS OTMA tpipe names
property.description: Specifies the IMS OTMA tpipe names. A tpipe is also known as an alternate client ID. The value can be up to eight characters in length and cannot be blank. The value can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: @ # $.

property.name: UserID
property.summary: SAF user name
property.description: Specifies the security authorization facility (SAF) user name. The value can be up to eight characters in length and cannot be blank. The value can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: @ # $.

property.name: Password
property.summary: SAF password
property.description: Specifies the security authorization facility (SAF) password. The value can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: @ # $.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: SAF password alias
property.description: Specifies the password alias of the security authorization facility (SAF) password.

property.name: Group
property.summary: Name of SAF group
property.description: Specifies the name of the security authorization facility (SAF) group. The value can be up to eight characters in length and cannot be blank. The value can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: @ # $.

property.name: RetryErrorLimit
property.summary: Number of times to attempt to resume a tpipe
property.description: Specifies the number of times to attempt to resume a transaction pipe (tpipe) after processing encounters an error. Enter a value in the range 1 - 256. The default value is 5.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Interval to wait before processing attempts to resume the tpipe
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds to wait before processing attempts to resume the transaction pipe (tpipe). The minimum value is 1. The default value is 3.

property.name: ConnectTimeout
property.summary: Time to wait to establish a connection
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds that the appliance waits to establish a connection to IMS Connect. A value of 0 disables the timeout. The default value is 10.

property.name: ResponseConcurrency
property.summary: Number of response processors to allocate for concurrent transactions processing.

description.p: Specifies the number of response processors to allocate for each tpipe for concurrent transaction processing. Enter a value in the range 1 - 32. The default value is 1.
For example, when you set response concurrency to 2 and you have 5 tpipe definitions, the number of response processors is 10. The maximum number of response processors is 50.

property.name: TraceFile
property.summary: Location for the trace file
property.description:
Enables IMS tracing and specifies the location of the trace file. You can use the following directories as the location when you enable tracing:
logtemp
logstore
temporary
Note: Enable tracing when instructed by IBM Support to help in problem determination.
If you enabled tracing and want to disable, remove the directory and apply the configuration.

property.name: Vendor
property.summary: Vendor Name

property.name: SourceProtocolImpl
property.summary: HTTP dplane link

property.name: OtherProperties
property.summary: Other Properties

object.description: An IMS Callout handler allows a Multi-Protocol Gateway to make asynchronous requests to an IMS application with the ICAL protocol. An IMS handler can retrieve IMS Callout messages from an IMS application and send response data to the IMS application.

object.name: IMSConnectSourceProtocolHandler

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address
property.description: The address on which the service listens. The default of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Click Select Alias to use an alias for this value. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines. See Local Host Alias under Networking for more.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address to listen on for incoming IMS protocol traffic. The default value 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service listens on all IP addresses.
property.label: IP address

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535, with a default of 3000) that specifies the port monitored by the IMS Connect handler.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port number to listen on for incoming IMS protocol traffic. Specify a number in the range of 1 - 65535. The default value is 3000.
property.label: Port

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection.
property.label: SSL proxy profile

property.name: PersistentConnections
property.summary: Enable/Disable persistent connections on front side
property.description: Enable or disable persistent connections where appropriate on front side.

property.name: EBCDICInput
property.summary: Input headers encoding is EBCDIC
property.description: Indicates if input headers are in EBCDIC or ASCII. Note that payload is not automatically processed.

property.name: ACL
property.summary: Assign the access control list.
property.description: The access control list uses the defined client IP addresses to allow or deny access.

property.name: MaxSegmentSize
property.summary: Maximum Segment Size
property.description: Specifies the maximum segment size to split the response into before sending back to the IMS client. A value of "0" (OFF) means no segmentation is performed by DataPower. Any integer value from 1 to 32 represents the segment size in KB.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

object.description: An IMS Connect Handler object handles IMS protocol communications with DataPower services.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: GetQueue
property.summary: The name of the GET Queue that the JMS front side handler monitors for incoming client requests

description.p: Enter the name of the GET queue associated with the WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS object supported by this protocol handler.

The WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS Front Side Handler monitors the GET queue for incoming client requests. Upon message receipt, the handler forwards the extracted message to the supported WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS object that will gateway the message to a remote WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS message provider.

property.hoverhelp: Enter the name of the GET Queue that the JMS front side handler monitors for incoming client requests.
property.label: GET queue

property.name: PutQueue
property.summary: The name of the PUT Queue that contains the reply messages originated by the remote JMS message provider

description.p: Enter the name of the PUT queue associated with the WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS object supported by this protocol handler.
The PUT queue contains server-originated WAS JMS or TIBCO EMS reply messages.
Such messages are originated by a remote WAS JMS or TIBCO EMS message provider and put into this queue by a local WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS object.
Configuration of a PUT queue is optional.
A PUT queue should be configured if server replies are expected; if reply messages are not expected, a PUT queue need not be configured.
In the absence of a PUT queue, any received replies are dropped.

property.hoverhelp: Enter the name of the PUT Queue that contains the reply messages originated by the remote JMS message provider.
property.label: PUT queue

property.name: Selector
property.summary: The conditional expression that filters messages from a queue or a subscription by message properties. The selector uses the SQL92 conditional expression syntax.

description.p: Provide an SQL-like expression to filter messages from the GET queue.
For example, DeliveryMode LIKE PERSISTENT

This expression specifies that only client requests that have a DeliveryMode of PERSISTENT are forwarded to the WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS object for processing; all other messages are dropped from the GET queue.

The message selector is a conditional expression based on a subset of SQL92 conditional expression syntax. The conditional expression enables the WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS Front Side Handler to identify messages of interest .

The conditional expression does not operate on the body of the JMS or EMS message, rather it examines JMS or EMS message headers and properties (proprietary user-created headers that might appear between the required headers and the message body).
The required JMS and EMS headers are as follows:

ul.li: Destination - contains the destination (queue) to which the message is being sent
DeliveryMode - contains the delivery mode (PERSISTENT or NON_PERSISTENT)
Expiration - contains a message TTL or a value of 0 indicating an unlimited TTL
Priority - contains the message priority expressed as a digit from 0 (lowest priority) to 9 (highest priority)
MessageID - contains a unique message identifier starting with the prefix ID:, or a null value, effectively disabling message ID
Timestamp - contains the time the message was handed off for transmission, not the time it was actually sent
CorrelationID - contains a means of associating one message (for example, a response) with another message (for example, the original request)
ReplyTo - contains the destination (queue) to which a reply to this message should be sent
Type - contains a message identifier provided by the application
Redelivered - contains a boolean indicating that the message has been delivered in the past, but not yet acknowledged

description.p: Configuration of a message selector is optional. If a message selector is not specified, all incoming client request messages are transferred by the WebSphere JMS or TIBCO EMS Front Side Handler to the WebSphere JMS object or TIBCO EMS object for processing.

property.hoverhelp: Enter a conditional expression that filters messages from a queue or a subscription by message properties. The selector uses the SQL92 conditional expression syntax.

description.p: If enabled messages taken from the GET queue will be processed not necessarily in the same order as they were queued.
This property may be set to improve performance only if associated Multi-Protocol gateway or WS-Proxy isn't configured to process messages in order.

object.name: TibcoEMSSourceProtocolHandler

property.name: Server
property.summary: TIBCO EMS Server
property.description: Select a server from the list of available TIBCO EMS servers
property.hoverhelp: Select the TIBCO EMS server that is supported by this protocol handler.
property.label: TIBCO EMS server

property.name: BatchSize
property.summary: The number of messages to process as a batch.
property.description: The number of messages to process as a batch. The source protocol handler gets as many messages as specified and processes the messages as a batch.

property.name: ConnectionClientID
property.summary: Connection Client identifier
property.description: Specify the string to set as an identifier for the TIBCO EMS Connection Client.

property.name: SubscriptionName
property.summary: The subscription name of a durable subscription associated with the identified TIBCO EMS Server.
property.description: Enter the subscription name of a durable subscription associated with the identified TIBCO EMS Server.

property.name: Unsubscribe
property.summary: Unsubscribe options for the durable subscriber.
property.description: Select the conditions under which to unsubscribe the durable subscriber.

object.description: TIBCO EMS Front Side Handler

property.name: Server
property.summary: WebSphere JMS Server

description.p: Identify the WebSphere JMS server object supported by this protocol handler.
Select a server object from the list of available objects.

property.hoverhelp: Select the WebSphere JMS server object that is supported by this protocol handler.
property.label: WebSphere JMS server

property.name: RequestTopicSpace
property.display: WebSphere JMS Topic Space for Request
property.summary: WebSphere JMS Topic Space for Request

description.p: Use this property to disambiguate a topic if the request destination is a topic whose name appears in multiple topic spaces.

A topic space is a hierarchy of topics used for publish/subscribe messaging. Topics with the same name can exist in multiple topic spaces, but there can be only one topic space with a given name in a service integration bus.
For example, consider a topic hierarchy split into the following topic spaces:

ul.li: library - topics for document management
sales - topics for marketing and sales tracking
engineering - topics for engineering and technology

description.p: The topic volumes can appear in all three topic spaces, and have a different meaning in each.
Enter the name of the target topic space if necessary.

property.name: ReplyTopicSpace
property.display: WebSphere JMS Topic Space for Reply
property.summary: WebSphere JMS Topic Space for Reply

description.p: Use this property to disambiguate a topic if the response destination is a topic whose name appears in multiple topic spaces.

A topic space is a hierarchy of topics used for publish/subscribe messaging. Topics with the same name can exist in multiple topic spaces, but there can be only one topic space with a given name in a service integration bus.
For example, consider a topic hierarchy split into the following topic spaces:

ul.li: library - topics for document management
sales - topics for marketing and sales tracking
engineering - topics for engineering and technology

description.p: The topic volumes can appear in all three topic spaces, and have a different meaning in each.
Enter the name of the target topic space if necessary.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: QueueManager
property.summary: An IBM MQ Queue Manager name
property.description: Select a Queue Manager from the list of available Queue Managers. The queue manager provides messaging services for communicating applications by periodically monitoring or polling queues, and by ensuring that messages are directed to the correct receive queue or routed to another queue manager. The queue manager on the DataPower appliance corresponds to a queue manager running on another host on the network.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the queue manager that manages the distributed send and receive queues of IBM MQ. The queue manager provides messaging services for communicating applications by periodically monitoring or polling queues, and by ensuring that messages are directed to the correct receive queue or routed to another queue manager. The queue manager on the DataPower appliance corresponds to a queue manager running on another host on the network.
property.label: Queue manager

property.name: GetQueue
property.summary: The GET queue associated with the queue manager
property.description: Enter the name of the GET queue associated with the identified Queue Manager. The Handler will get messages from this queue.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the GET queue associated with the queue manager. The handler will get messages from this queue.
property.label: GET queue

property.name: GetMessageOptions
property.summary: Options flags for the MQGMO structure
property.description: Specifies the cumulative value of the MQGET options that are applicable to an IBM MQ message in decimal or hex format. The value is passed directly to the IBM MQ API. The default value is 32769, which is the decimal value for the MQGMO_WAIT and MQGMO_LOGICAL_ORDER options.

property.name: ConcurrentConnections
property.display: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations
property.summary: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations allocated for this source protocol handler
property.description: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations allocated for this source protocol handler. The default value is 1, but it can be increased to improve performance.

property.name: PollingInterval
property.summary: The number of seconds before MQGET operation returns if no messages are available
property.description: The number of seconds before MQGET operation returns if no messages are available, the next attempt will be performed immediately. Setting this value to minimum will help to detect quickly network connectivity issues and queue manager power shutdown but at the same time will increase network traffic.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the time, in seconds, before the MQGET operation returns if no message is available. The next attempt is performed immediately. Setting a low value helps to detect network connectivity issues and queue manager power shutdown but increases network traffic. The minimum value is 1. The default value is 30.
property.label: Polling interval

property.name: RetrieveBackoutSettings
property.summary: Controls retrieval of backout settings from the IBM MQ server

description.p: Controls whether to retrieve backout setting from the IBM MQ server.

When enabled, retrieves the Backout Threshold and Backout Requeue Queue Name settings from the IBM MQ server and compares these values to the backout values for the IBM MQ Queue Manager. On retry, the handler uses the higher priority backout settings. If IBM MQ server does not contain backout settings, the handler uses existing backout values, either empty or populated, from the IBM MQ Queue Manager. If the IBM MQ Queue Manager does not define backout values, this capability is disabled.
When disabled, the default, does not retrieve backout settings from the IBM MQ server. If these properties already exist in the IBM MQ Queue Manager, the handler use those values.

property.name: IgnoreBackoutErrors
property.summary: Controls whether to ignore backout errors

description.p: Controls whether to ignore backout errors
When disabled, the default, roll back and retry the transfer.
When enabled, ignore the error in sending the transfer to the backout queue and commit the transfer from the get queue.

property.name: UseQMNameInURL
property.summary: Whether to use the queue manager or the queue manager group in the front side URL

description.p: Indicates whether the var://service/URL-in variable returns the name of IBM MQ Queue Manager or the name of the IBM MQ Queue Manager Group when this configuration defines a queue manager group as the queue manager.

ul.li: When on, the variable returns the name of the queue manager.
When off, the default, the variable returns the name of the queue manager group.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: QueueManager
property.summary: An IBM MQ Queue Manager name
property.description: Select a Queue Manager from the list of available Queue Managers. The queue manager provides messaging services for communicating applications by periodically monitoring or polling queues, and by ensuring that messages are directed to the correct receive queue or routed to another queue manager. The queue manager on the DataPower appliance corresponds to a queue manager running on another host on the network.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the queue manager that manages the distributed send and receive queues of IBM MQ. The queue manager provides messaging services for communicating applications by periodically monitoring or polling queues, and by ensuring that messages are directed to the correct receive queue or routed to another queue manager. The queue manager on the DataPower appliance corresponds to a queue manager running on another host on the network.
property.label: Queue manager

property.name: GetQueue
property.summary: The GET queue associated with the queue manager
property.description: Enter the name of the GET queue associated with the identified Queue Manager. The Handler will get client-originated request messages from this queue.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the GET queue associated with the queue manager. The handler will get client-originated request messages from this queue.
property.label: GET queue

property.name: SubscribeTopicString
property.summary: The subscribe topic string associated with the queue manager
property.description: Enter the topic string associated with the identified Queue Manager. The Handler will subscribe to this topic string and get messages from it.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the subscribe topic string associated with the queue manager. The handler will subscribe to this topic string and get messages from it.
property.label: Subscribe topic string

property.name: SubscriptionName
property.summary: The subscription name of a durable subscription
property.description: Enter the subscription name of a durable subscription associated with the identified Queue Manager. This name identifies the subscription after reestablishing a lost connection.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the name of a durable subscription associated with the queue manager. This name identifies the subscription after reestablishing a lost connection.
property.label: Subscription name

property.name: PutQueue
property.summary: The PUT queue associated with the queue manager
property.description: Enter the name of the PUT queue associated with the identified Queue Manager. The Handler will put server-originated reply messages to this queue.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the Put queue associated with the queue manager. The handler will put server-originated reply messages to this queue.
property.label: PUT queue

property.name: PublishTopicString
property.summary: The publish topic string associated with the queue manager. The topic string describes the subject of the information that is published in a publish or subscribe message.

description.p: Enter the topic string associated with the identified Queue Manager. The handler will publish messages to this topic string.
If the Put Queue field is specified, this field is ignored.

property.hoverhelp: Enter the publish topic string associated with the queue manager. The topic string describes the subject of the information that is published in a publish or subscribe message. The handler will publish messages to this topic string. If the Put Queue field is specified, this field is ignored.
property.label: Publish topic string

property.name: CodePage
property.summary: Coded Character Set Identifier

description.p: Specifies the Coded Character Set Identifier to which the remote IBM MQ queue manager converts output data. This property is meaningful only when the IBM MQ Queue Manager has the convert property set to on. The CCSI will be put in the CodeCharSetId field of MQMD.
The default CCSI is for ISO-8859-1 (latin-1).
For MQCCSI_EMBEDDED enter 4294967295; for MQCCSI_INHERIT enter 4294967294. For the other CCSIDs, refer to the IBM Code Pages in the Information Center.

property.name: GetMessageOptions
property.summary: Options flags for the MQGMO structure
property.description: Specifies the cumulative value of the MQGET options that are applicable to an IBM MQ message in decimal or hex format. The value is passed directly to the IBM MQ API. The default value is 1, which is the decimal value for the MQGMO_WAIT option.

property.name: MessageSelector
property.summary: The selector that filters the messages delivered from a queue or a subscription
property.description: A selector filters the messages delivered from a queue or a subscription by their properties. The selector uses the SQL92 conditional expression syntax. The selector enables the handler to filter messages delivered from a queue or a subscription.
property.hoverhelp: Enter a conditional expression that filters messages by message properties. The selector uses the SQL92 conditional expression syntax. The selector enables the handler to filter messages delivered from a queue or a subscription.
property.label: Message selector

property.name: ParseProperties
property.summary: Parse the message properties
property.description: Parse the properties of the incoming messages from a queue or a subscription. By default, the properties are not parsed.

property.name: AsyncPut
property.summary: Asynchronously put a message to a queue.
property.description: Asynchronously put a message to a queue without waiting for a response from the queue manager.

property.name: ExcludeHeaders
property.summary: Messages header to strip
property.description: Select which headers after MQMD to strip from the message. By default only the MQMD header is parsed.

property.name: ConcurrentConnections
property.display: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations
property.summary: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations allocated for this source protocol handler
property.description: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations allocated for this source protocol handler. The default value is 1, but it can be increased to improve performance.

property.name: PollingInterval
property.summary: The number of seconds before MQGET operation returns if no messages are available.
property.description: The number of seconds before MQGET operation returns if no messages are available, the next attempt will be performed immediately. Setting this value to minimum will help to detect quickly network connectivity issues and queue manager power shutdown but at the same time will increase network traffic.

property.name: BatchSize
property.summary: The number of messages to process as a batch.
property.description: The number of messages to process as a batch. The source protocol handler gathers the specified number of messages and processes them as a batch.

property.name: ContentTypeHeader
property.summary: IBM MQ Header to extract Content-Type with XPath expression
property.description: IBM MQ Header to extract Content-Type with XPath expression.

property.name: ContentTypeXPath
property.display: XPath expression to extract Content-Type from IBM MQ header
property.summary: XPath expression to extract Content-Type from IBM MQ header
property.description: XPath expression to extract Content-Type from IBM MQ header

property.name: RetrieveBackoutSettings
property.summary: Controls retrieval of backout settings from the IBM MQ server

description.p: Controls whether to retrieve backout setting from the IBM MQ server.

When enabled, retrieves the Backout Threshold and Backout Requeue Queue Name settings from the IBM MQ server and compares these values to the backout values for the IBM MQ Queue Manager. On retry, the handler uses the higher priority backout settings. If IBM MQ server does not contain backout settings, the handler uses existing backout values, either empty or populated, from the IBM MQ Queue Manager. If the IBM MQ Queue Manager does not define backout values, this capability is disabled.
When disabled, the default, does not retrieve backout settings from the IBM MQ server. If these properties already exist in the IBM MQ Queue Manager, the handler use those values.

property.name: UseQMNameInURL
property.summary: Whether to use the queue manager or the queue manager group in the front side URL

description.p: Indicates whether the var://service/URL-in variable returns the name of IBM MQ Queue Manager or the name of the IBM MQ Queue Manager Group when this configuration defines a queue manager group as the queue manager.

ul.li: When on, the variable returns the name of the queue manager.
When off, the default, the variable returns the name of the queue manager group.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: MailServer
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: The host name or IP address of the mail server.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Listening port on the server. Normally, 110 for unsecured connections or STARTTLS negotiation and 995 for implicit SSL.
property.description: The listening port on the mail server. STARTTLS negotiation and an unsecured connection generally use port 110. An implicit, secured connection generally uses port 995.

property.name: ConnSecurity
property.summary: Security setting for server connection

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection.

property.name: AuthMethod
property.summary: Type of authentication to use
property.description: The type of authentication to use. If authentication fails, no connection is made.

property.name: Account
property.summary: Name for e-mail account
property.description: The name to access the mailbox on the server; for example, user@example.com.

property.name: Password
property.summary: password for the account
property.description: The password for the account that accesses the mailbox on the server.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: The password alias of the password for the account
property.description: The password alias of the password for the account that accesses the mailbox on the server.

property.name: DelayBetweenPolls
property.summary: Interval between polling sequences

description.p: The number of seconds to wait after the completion of one polling sequence before starting the next one. A polling sequence is the time to retrieve the messages plus the time to complete their processing. Enter any value of 1 - 65535. The default is 300.
Note: Some mail servers restrict the number of times an account can establish a connection during a specific time period. Ensure that the configured interval complies with any restriction.

property.name: MaxMessagesPerPoll
property.summary: Maximum number of messages to retrieve in each polling cycle
property.description: The maximum number of mail messages to retrieve in each polling cycle. Enter any value of 1 - 100. The default is 5.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

object.name: AS1PollerSourceProtocolHandler
object.description: The AS1 handler is a Post Office Protocol (POP) handler. The handler manages the polling of a mailbox on a mail server. The mailbox receives mail messages from external partners. The handler retrieves and deletes mail messages on each polling cycle. Each mail message that the handler retrieves results in one transaction.

object.name: POPPollerSourceProtocolHandler
object.description: The Post Office Protocol (POP) handler manages the polling of a mailbox on a mail server. The mailbox receives mail messages from external partners. The handler retrieves and deletes mail messages on each polling cycle. Each mail message that the handler retrieves results in one transaction.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address
property.description: Specifies the address on which the SFTP server service listens. The default of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. An alias name can be used to specify the address. Local host aliases can help ease migration tasks among machines.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address to listen on for incoming SFTP server traffic. The default value 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service listens on all IP addresses.
property.label: IP address

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Local TCP port for the SFTP server
property.description: Specifies the port that is monitored by the SFTP Server service. This port is the port on which SFTP connections can be established. This port does not control the TCP port that is used for the data connections. Enter any value of 1 - 65535. The default is 22.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port number to listen on for incoming SFTP server traffic. Specify a number in the range of 1 - 65535. The default value is 22.
property.label: Port

description.p: Specifies an Access Control List to apply. The ACL allows or denies access to the SFTP server based on the IP address of the SFTP client. When attached to a server, the default for an ACL is to deny all access. To deny access to only select IP addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0). Then, create deny entries for the desired hosts.
If an ACL with the same name as this handler exists, the system appliance might inadvertently use that ACL rather than the one specified here.

property.name: HostPrivateKeys
property.summary: The private keys to use for host authentication
property.description: Specifies the private keys to use for Host authentication. Keys used as host private keys cannot be password protected.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the private keys to use for host authentication. Keys that are used as host private keys cannot be password protected. To add a host private key, click Add, double-click the added box, and select the key from the list.
property.label: Host private keys

property.name: SSHUserAuthentication
property.summary: Allowable user authentication types
property.description: Specifies the type(s) of SSH user authentication available for use by the client.

property.name: AllowBackendListings
property.summary: Indicates whether backend directory listings are allowed
property.description: In transparent mode, determines whether or not SFTP directory listing (SSH_FXP_READDIR) requests to the back-end servers are allowed. Requires an FTP or SFTP server on the back-end.

property.name: AllowBackendDelete
property.summary: Indicates whether requests to delete files are allowed
property.description: In transparent mode, determines whether or not requests to delete files (SSH_FXP_REMOVE) to the back-end servers are allowed. Requires an FTP or SFTP server on the back-end.

property.name: AllowBackendStat
property.summary: Indicates whether requests to query file statistics are allowed
property.description: In transparent mode, determines whether or not SFTP directory listings requests to the back-end servers would query the back-end server to obtain a file's attributes (SSH_FXP_STAT/SSH_FXP_LSTAT/SSH_FXP_FSTAT), or use default values. Querying the back-end server may reduce performance, but is necessary for SFTP clients that do not follow the DataPower SFTP URL naming conventions. Requires an FTP or SFTP server on the back-end.

property.name: AllowBackendMkdir
property.summary: Indicates whether requests to create directories are allowed
property.description: In transparent mode, determines whether or not requests to create directories (SSH_FXP_MKDIR) on the back-end servers are allowed. Requires an FTP or SFTP server on the back-end.

property.name: AllowBackendRmdir
property.summary: Indicates whether requests to delete directories are allowed
property.description: In transparent mode, determines whether or not requests to delete directories (SSH_FXP_RMDIR) from the back-end servers are allowed. Requires an FTP or SFTP server on the back-end.

property.name: AllowBackendRename
property.summary: Indicates whether requests to rename files are allowed
property.description: In transparent mode, determines whether or not requests to rename files or directories (SSH_FXP_RENAME) on the back-end servers are allowed. Requires an FTP or SFTP server on the back-end.

property.name: AAAPolicy
property.summary: AAA Policy for SSH user authentication
property.description: Specifies the AAA Policy to perform SSH user authentication of the information provided during SSH key exchange.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the AAA Policy to perform SSH user authentication on the information that is provided during SSH key exchange.
property.label: AAA policy

property.name: FilesystemType
property.summary: The type of filesystem the SFTP server will present
property.description: Specifies the file system type that is presented by the SFTP server.

property.name: DefaultDirectory
property.summary: Default for current working directory
property.description: Specifies the initial working directory on the SFTP server (after users connect and authenticate).

property.name: IdleTimeout
property.summary: Inactivity limit on SFTP connection
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds that the SFTP connection can be idle. After the specified duration elapses, the SFTP server closes the control connection. Enter any value of 0 - 65535. The default is 0, which disables the timeout.

property.name: PersistentFilesystemTimeout
property.summary: Controls how long a Virtual Persistent file system with no active connections is retained
property.description: Specifies the duration in seconds that a connection to a virtual file system is retained after all SFTP control connections from user identities are disconnected. When the timeout expires, the virtual file system object is destroyed. Enter any value of 1- 43200. The default is 600.

property.name: VirtualDirectories
property.summary: Create directory in virtual file system of SFTP server
property.description: In virtual mode, create a directory in the virtual file system that is presented by this SFTP server. The SFTP client can use all of these directories to write file to be processed. The root directory (/) is always present and cannot be created.

description.p: The SFTP Server Front Side Handler provides an SSH SFTP server that can be used to submit files for processing by the system. Each file that is written results in one transaction.

There can be multiple SFTP servers, but only one server can be configured to listen on the default SSH port 22 on a given interface. There can be multiple simultaneous connections from SFTP clients to the same SFTP server.
Note: Changes in the configuration affect only new connections to this SFTP server. Existing connections continue to use their current configuration until they disconnect.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address
property.description: The address on which the service listens. The default of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Click Select Alias to use an alias for this value. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines. See Local Host Alias under Networking for more.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address to listen on for incoming stateless TCP protocol traffic. The default value 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service listens on all IP addresses.
property.label: IP address

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535, with a default of 4000) that specifies the port monitored by the service.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port number to listen on for incoming stateless TCP protocol traffic. Specify a number in the range of 1 - 65535. The default value is 4000.
property.label: Port

property.name: PersistentConnections
property.summary: Enable/Disable persistent connections on front side
property.description: Enable or disable persistent connections where appropriate on front side.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection.
property.label: SSL proxy profile

property.name: ACL
property.description: This Access Control List will be used to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an Access Control List (ACL) denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

description.p: The configuration for the stateless TCP protocol handler. This protocol uses raw XML - where the close of the root node delineates the document - PI's and comments outside of the root node are not allowed.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address
property.description: The address on which the service listens. The default of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Click Select Alias to use an alias for this value. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines. See Local Host Alias under Networking for more.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address to listen on for incoming stateful raw XML over TCP traffic. The default value 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service listens on all IP addresses.
property.label: IP address

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535, with a default of 3000) that specifies the port monitored by the stateful raw XML over TCP service.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port number to listen on for incoming stateful raw XML over TCP traffic. Specify a number in the range of 1 - 65535. The default value is 4000.
property.label: Port

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the backend stateful TCP server.
property.label: Remote IP

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the remote TCP port number of the backend stateful TCP server.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the TCP port number of the back-end stateful TCP server.

property.name: CloseOnFault
property.summary: Terminate Session On Fault
property.description: If enabled, both the front and back TCP connections are closed when the DataPower device generates a fault; otherwise only a connection termination, timeout, or error closes the session.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile and an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection. Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list to assign the SSL proxy profile to this handler. Click the + button to create a new SSL proxy profile and assign that SSL proxy profile to the handler.

property.name: ACL
property.description: This Access Control List will be used to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an Access Control List (ACL) denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

property.name: SSLConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance with another party
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance with another party.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

description.p: The configuration for the stateful TCP protocol handler. This protocol uses raw XML - where the close of the root node delineates the document - PI's and comments outside of the root node are not allowed. The source protocol also specifies the destination address and any single TCP connection will use the same TCP session on the backside for all of its transactions (one transaction per document).
Any Gateway that employs one of these Handlers must use a Dynamic Backend.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Database
property.summary: Type (vendor) of data server
property.description: The database type (vendor name) of the data server.

property.name: Username
property.summary: User to establish connection
property.description: The name of the user to establish the connection to the data source. The data server maintains this information, not the appliance.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password for user to establish connection
property.description: The password for the user to establish the connection to the data source. The data server maintains this information, not the appliance.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias of the password for user to establish connection
property.description: Specify the password alias to use to look up the password for the user to establish the connection to the data source. This information is maintained on the data server, not the appliance.

property.name: DataSourceID
property.summary: Identifier of the data source

description.p: The identifier of the data source. The terminology the vendor uses differs depending on the type of database.

ul.li: DB2 - The DB2 database alias
Oracle - The Oracle system identifier (SID) or service name
Sybase - The name of the Sybase database
Microsoft SQL Server - The name of the Microsoft SQL Server data source
IMS - The IMS data store name

property.name: DataSourceHost
property.summary: Host name or IP address of data server
property.description: The host name or IP address of the server where the data source resides.

property.name: DataSourcePort
property.summary: Listening port on data server
property.description: The TCP port on which the data source listens for requests.

property.name: LimitReturnedData
property.summary: Whether to limit data from an operation

description.p: Whether to limit the amount of data that a SELECT statement can return. To limit, enable (select the check box), and set the maximum amount to allow. The default value is disabled.

property.name: LimitReturnedDataSize
property.summary: Maximum amount of data to allow from an operation
property.description: The maximum number of kilobytes of data to allow for a SELECT statement. The default value is 128.

property.name: SQLDataSourceConfigNVPairs
property.summary: Optional but valid data source connection (or CLI) configuration parameters
property.description: The collection of name-value pairs for optional but valid data source connection (or CLI) configuration parameters for your data server connection. Configuration parameters modify the behavior of the services that run with a data server. Some parameters in the configuration file are informational and define characteristics about the environment. These parameters cannot be modified.

property.name: MaxConnection
property.summary: Maximum number of concurrent connections to allow
property.description: The maximum number of concurrent connections that can be opened to this data source. The default value is 10.

property.name: OracleDataSourceType
property.summary: Type of identifier for an Oracle data source
property.description: The type of identifier that configuration uses to refer to an Oracle data source.

property.name: OracleObjects
property.summary: Enable Oracle-specific object support

description.p: Set the check box to include support for ancillary servers and for additional Oracle database objects. This feature should remain disabled unless the extra functionality is required. When enabled, this feature can have performance and memory implications. This option is available for only Oracle databases.
Define ancillary servers for high availability or load balancing.
For advanced Oracle object-based data types, the following objects are supported:

ul.li: OBJECT
VARRAY
TABLE

description.p: When enabled the SQL Data Source instance is hosted in a runtime environment. There are additional configuration options that you can define in the Runtime Settings for the default domain.

property.name: ConnectTimeout
property.summary: The length of time to wait to establish a new connection

description.p: A connection timeout indicates the number of seconds that the appliance waits to establish a new connection to the remote data server. The minimum value is 0, which disables the timeout. The default value is 15.
The connection timeout should be less than the query timeout. With this configuration, the initial query has time to establish the connection to the remote data server.

property.name: QueryTimeout
property.summary: The length of time to wait for an SQL request to complete

description.p: A query timeout indicates the number of seconds that the appliance waits for an SQL request to complete. The measured duration is from when the service sends the request to and receives the results from the SQL data server. The minimum and default value is 0. The value of 0 uses the standard timeout in the user agent.
The query timeout should be greater than the connection timeout. With this configuration, the initial query has time to establish the connection to the remote data server.

property.name: IdleTimeout
property.summary: The length of time that a connection can remain idle before it is released
property.description: An idle timeout indicates the minimum length of time that a connection from the connection pool can remain idle before the appliance might release the connection. The minimum value is 0, which will disable the timeout. The default value is 180.

property.name: LoadBalancing
property.summary: Enable load balancing for only DB2 on z/OS
property.description: For DB2 on z/OS, enables DB2 workload balancing and DB2 automatic client reroute. The "Data Source Host" field should refer to the Sysplex DVIPA when load balancing is enabled.

property.name: AncillaryServers
property.summary: Ancillary servers for high availability or load balancing

description.p: Define ancillary servers for high availability or load balancing configurations. The effect of ancillary servers depends on the database vendor and other SQL data source configuration options. Ancillary servers are only supported for the following configurations:

ul.li: Oracle with Oracle object support enabled. Each ancillary server specifies a remote ONS daemon on Oracle RAC nodes. The host and port fields are the only required fields.

description.p: A SQL data source provides the configuration to establish a direct connection to a database instance on a remote data server. When configured, it is possible to dynamically perform database operations, such as SELECT and INSERT, on the remote database instance.

A SQL data source is used by a SQL action in a processing policy. The SQL action retrieves the data for further processing by the processing policy. Conversely, the processing policy can store the processed data in the configured database instance.

When configuring a SQL data source you can define optional but valid data source connection (or CLI) configuration parameters for your data server. Configuration parameters modify the behavior of the services that run with a data server. Some configuration parameters in the configuration file are informational and define characteristics about the environment. These configuration parameters cannot be modified.

object.name: StandaloneStandbyControl

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: This property is read-only.
property.description: This property is read-only.

property.name: Interface
property.summary: The network interface for the standby group.
property.description: The network interface that the standby group uses.

property.name: Group
property.summary: Set the number of the standby group in the multicast domain.

description.p: The number of the standby group in a multicast domain. The multicast domain is a group of interfaces that receive traffic from each other on the IP address 224.0.0.2 (the all-routers IP multicast group). If the multicast domain becomes partitioned, which is an unusual situation, a member in each partition becomes the active member to handle connections in its partition.
Attention: Do not use a group number that conflicts with the number of an existing standby group or any network group that uses Hot Standby Router Protocol (HSRP).
The interfaces of a standby group are on the same network segment and share the responsibility for one virtual IP address. Interfaces in the standby group require the following configuration.

ul.li: Belong to the same group.
Use the same primary virtual IP address.
Use the same authentication, or security token.

property.name: VirtualIP
property.summary: Set the primary virtual IP address of standby group.

description.p: The primary virtual IP address of the standby group. The active member of the standby group uses this IP address. All interfaces in the standby group must use the same virtual IP address. External clients that contact the active member of the standby group should use this IP address.
Attention: Virtual IP addresses in a standby configuration must be IPv4 addresses.

property.name: SecondaryVirtualIP
property.summary: Manage secondary virtual IP addresses that follow the active virtual IP address to the active interface.

description.p: Auxiliary, or secondary, virtual IP addresses to the standby configuration. Secondary addresses follow the active virtual IP address to the active interface. Secondary addresses are on the same interface as the primary address and are enabled and disabled in coordination with the primary address.
Attention: Virtual IP addresses in a standby configuration must be IPv4 addresses.

property.name: Preempt
property.summary: Indicates whether to support preemption in the standby group.

description.p: Whether to support preemption in the standby configuration for the initially active interface. Depending on the preemption setting, the follow activity occurs when the initially active member returns to service after a failure.

ul.li: When preemption is enabled, the interface resumes its active role. The standby interface becomes a passive member.
When preemption is disabled, the interface is a passive member.

description.p: Attention: Do not enable preemption.

hoverhelp.p: Indicates whether to support preemption in the standby group. Attention: Do not enable preemption.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Set the priority of the interface in the standby group.

description.p: The priority of the interface in the standby group. Enter a value in the range 0 - 255. The default value is 100. Use the default value unless one system or interface is in some way better than another one.

For each standby group, there is one active member and one or more passive members. The interface with the highest priority seeks to be the active member. If multiple interfaces have the same priority, one becomes the active member.

property.hoverhelp: Set the priority of the interface in the standby group. Enter a value in the range 0 - 255. Use the default value unless one system or interface is in some way better than another one.

property.name: SelfBalance
property.summary: Indicates whether to use self-balancing in the standby group.

description.p: Whether to use self-balancing in the standby group.

ul.li: When enabled, the active member distributes connections to available members.

When disabled, all connections go to the active member. The active member receives all TCP connections and processes all requests and responses. If the active member becomes unavailable, the standby member becomes the active members.

description.p: The active member manages all TCP connections to virtual IP addresses. When a client initiates a new TCP connection, the active member selects a member to act as the connection endpoint. The active member tracks member capabilities to distribute traffic appropriately. The selected member completes the establishment of the connection. The active member forwards all segments of the TCP connection to the member that is acting as the connection endpoint.

ul.li: In a non-graceful transition, if the active member becomes unavailable, the passive member with the next highest priority becomes the active member. The active member might become unavailable because of network issues, an appliance crash, power outage, or similar cause.

In a graceful transition, such as for scheduled maintenance, most connections can be preserved if the appliance that terminates the connection remains available. In practice, quiesce the active appliance to ensure that established connections complete before you start maintenance; for example, apply firmware. In some environments, the time for the takeover exceeds the client timeout value. Similarly, if the appliance timeout value is aggressive, connections can be lost because the appliance terminated the connection because of a timeout.

hoverhelp.p: Indicates whether to use self-balancing in the standby group.

ul.li: When enabled, the active member distributes connections to available members.

When disabled, all connections go to the active member. The active member receives all TCP connections and processes all requests and responses. If the active member becomes unavailable, the standby member becomes the active members.

property.name: Authentication
property.summary: Set the authentication string for the interface in the standby group.
property.description: The authentication string, or security token in hex. The default value is 0x5841333500000000. Every member in the standby group must use the same security token.
property.hoverhelp: Set the authentication string, or security token in hex. Every member in the standby group must use the same security token.

property.name: HelloTimer
property.summary: Set the frequency to broadcast hello messages.
property.description: The frequency to broadcast hello messages. Set this value to at least one third the duration of the hold timer. Enter a value in the range 2 - 40. The default value is 3.
property.hoverhelp: Set the frequency to broadcast hello messages. Set this value to at least one third the duration of the hold timer. Enter a value in the range 2 - 40.

property.name: HoldTimer
property.summary: Set the duration to wait before the standby member attempts a failover.
property.description: The duration to wait before the standby member attempts a failover. Set this value to at least three times the interval of hello messages. Enter a value in the range 6 - 120. The default value is 10.
property.hoverhelp: Set the duration to wait before the standby member attempts a failover. Set this value to at least three times the interval of hello messages. Enter a value in the range 6 - 120.

property.name: DistAlg
property.summary: Set the distribution algorithm for incoming connections when self-balancing is enabled.
property.description: The algorithm to distribute incoming connections to available members when self-balancing is enabled.

object.summary: Indicate whether to allow a standby configuration.

description.p: The standby configuration defines the policies for the group that this interface is a member. A standby group is the collection of interfaces on different appliances in the multicast domain that share the responsibility for one virtual IP address. When at least one member of a standby group can reach the multicast domain, the virtual IP group receives the traffic.
Attention: Virtual IP addresses in a standby configuration must be IPv4 addresses.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: This is not a configurable item.
property.description: A StandaloneStandbyControlInterface exists for each kernel interface that is capable of being used with StandaloneStandbyControl.

description.p: There is a StandaloneStandbyControlInterface for each kernel interface that is capable of being used with StandaloneStandbyControl. This is the interface being referred to in StandaloneStandbyControl and YieldStandaloneStandby.

object.name: Statistics

property.name: LoadInterval
property.summary: Statistics sampling interval
property.description: The load interval may have a minimum of 500 msec and a maximum of 5000 msec.

object.description: Use this page to establish Statistics settings. Statistics must be enabled for some of the monitors to work correctly.

object.name: StylePolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.
property.description: Enter a comment. This appears on the Policy catalog page.

property.name: DefStylesheetForSoap
property.summary: Identify the default style sheet used for SOAP filtering.
property.description: Identify the default style sheet used for SOAP filtering. The default rejects all SOAP documents.

property.name: DefStylesheetForXsl
property.display: Default style sheet for XSL transforms
property.summary: Identify the default style sheet used for XSL transformation
property.description: Identify the default style sheet used for XSL transformation. The default mirrors all documents.

property.name: DefXQueryForJSON
property.display: Default XQuery style sheet for JSON
property.summary: Identify the default XQuery style sheet used for JSON transformation
property.description: Identify the default XQuery style sheet used for JSON transformation. The default rejects all JSON documents.

property.name: PolicyMaps
property.description: A list of processing rules their corresponding matching rule that this policy will evaluate. If a match is found, the corresponding processing rule is run. The policy runs the first processing rule with a successful match. Therefore, the order of rules in this list is important.

object.description: Create, Edit or Delete a Processing Policy. A policy consists of one or more Processing Rules. Rules execute depending upon the direction of the message and on whether or not a corresponding matching rule selects the document for processing. A service may have only one policy active at a time. Click Services in the left-hand navigation menu and then click the appropriate policy link to use the graphical interface to create and edit policies.

object.name: StylePolicyAction

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Action
property.description: Select an action to be performed by the processing rule. The default is Transform.

property.name: Input
property.summary: The target context
property.description:
Input identifies the context that contains the document acted upon by this action. Enter the context name or string PIPE used for streaming execution mode, or the string INPUT which identifies the original input into this policy rule.
Not used when the action type is rewrite, method-rewrite, or route-set and otherwise required.

property.name: Transform
property.summary: Location of the XSL stylesheet or transform file

description.p:
Specify the location of the XSL stylesheet or transform file to use for document filtering or transformations. Specify the location with one of the following formats:
Use a URL, for example, store:///myTest.xsl
Use a context variable that expands to a URL, for example, var://context/contextName/varName
Use a context, for example, var://context/Name or var://context/Name/ . The context runs as a stylesheet.

property.name: DFDLSettingsReference
property.summary: Specify the DFDL Settings to use when processing binary content with DFDL schemas.
property.description: Identifies the DFDL Settings used by this action when processing data as understood by a DFDL schema. This reference, if provided, overrides the reference on the XML manager. If no DFDL Settings are specified on both objects, the default values are applied.

property.name: InputLanguage
property.summary: Language of input to the transformation

property.name: DFDLInputRootName
property.summary: Set the root element in the DFDL model from which to start a parse.

description.p: Set the root element in the DFDL model from which to start a parse. This property is only meaningful in the context of a DFDL parse.

For the input root name, specify the global xsd:element in the XSD file to use to begin parsing the binary input. The input root name can be selected from the specified XSD file or specified as a variable. If a variable is used, it must resolve to a valid namespace URL written with the name between braces ({}) as a prefix to the local part.

For instance, if in the DFDL Schema, the target namespace is "http://example.com/messages" and the local element is <xsd:element name="Message">...</xsd:element>, the variable must resolve to {http://example.com/messages}Message.

The schema author might specify the root parse element by using the ibmSchExtn:docRoot="true" element within the schema. For instance, <xsd:element ibmSchExtn:docRoot="true" name="Message">...</xsd:element>. In this case, the input root name shows in the selection as the element name followed by (@ibmSchExtn:docRoot="true"). Use of another value for the DFDL input root name overrides the value that is specified in the schema.

property.name: InputDescriptor
property.summary: Descriptor of the input to the transformation as understood according to the input language

description.p: Specify the input descriptor, understood according to the input language.

ul.li: If input language is DFDL, the input descriptor must be a URL to a schema file that defines the input. The input descriptor can be a URL to a directory from which you can select a schema file, or the input descriptor can be a variable that resolves to a schema at run time.
If input language is XML, do not specify an input descriptor because the input is not type-assessed.
If input language is XSD, the input descriptor must be a URL to an XML schema for type assessing the input to the transformation.
If input language is JSON, do not specify an input descriptor because the input is not type-assessed.

property.name: OutputDescriptor
property.summary: Descriptor of the output from the transformation as understood according to the output language

description.p: Specify the output descriptor, understood according to the output language.

ul.li: If output language is DFDL, then output descriptor must be a URL to a DFDL schema for serializing the output from the transformation.

property.name: TransformLanguage
property.summary: Language of the transformation

description.p: Specifies that the transform is specified either as an XQuery file or as None to indicate an identity transformation that is only changing the message via input or output descriptors.

ul.li: If transform language is None, do not specify a Transform.
If transform language is XQuery, then specify a way to find that XQuery script in the Transform property.

property.name: OutputLanguage
property.summary: Language of output from the transformation

description.p: Specify the output language, to Default or DFDL.

property.name: TxMap
property.summary: Location of WTX map file

description.p: Enter the URL of the WTX map file for the transform. You must create the WTX map file by exporting the file from Design Studio. In DPA mode, the WTX-generated map file is hosted locally on the appliance or on a remote HTTP or HTTPS server. Use one of the following formats:

ul.li: When the file is local, use <directory>:///<filename>
When the file is remote, use HTTP://<filename> or HTTPS://<filename>

description.p: Do not specify an XSL style sheet when using a WTX map file.

property.name: GatewayScriptLocation
property.summary: Location of the GatewayScript file

description.p: Specify the location of the GatewayScript file. The file location can be specified in one of the following formats:

ul.li: Use a URL. Select the local:, store:, or temporary: directory, and select, upload, or fetch the script file.
Use a context variable that expands to a URL, such as var://context/contextName/varName .
Use a context, for example, var://context/Name or var://context/Name/ . The context content runs as GatewayScript.

property.name: ActionDebug
