property.summary: Enable GatewayScript Debug

property.name: TxTopLevelMap
property.summary: Name of the map to run
property.description: Enter the name of the specific map in the map file for the transform. A map file might contain more than one map. When this field is left blank, the transform uses the first map in the file.

property.name: TxMode
property.summary: Mode in which to run the map
property.description: Select the mode in which to run the map. DPA is the recommended mode.

property.name: TxAuditLog
property.summary: The context name for saving the WTX audit log
property.description: Enter the context name for saving the WTX audit log. This property is only valid in the DPA mode.

property.name: Output
property.summary: The destination context
property.description:
Output identifies the destination context that receives the document upon completion of the specified action. Enter the context name or string PIPE used for streaming execution mode (except for the last action), or the string OUTPUT which identifies the final input output from this policy rule. Depending on the rule's direction, OUTPUT specifies the transmission to the requesting client or responding server. If the action type is results, and no output is specified, the target context is transmitted to OUTPUT.
Required when the action type is convert-http, cryptobin, extract, fetch, xform, xformbin, xformpi, or xformng. Optional when the action type is results, log, validate, or sql. Not used when the action type is rewrite, method-rewrite, route-set, or setvar.

property.name: NamedInOutLocationType
property.summary: Locate Named Inputs and Outputs
property.description: Named Inputs and Outputs can be specified explicitly or dynamically, or can default to the unnamed regular input and output. Select the value appropriate for your WTX configuration.

property.name: NamedInputs
property.summary: Create all of the named inputs needed for the WTX transform.
property.description: Create all of the named inputs needed for the WTX transform.

property.name: NamedOutputs
property.summary: Create all of the named outputs needed for the WTX transform.
property.description: Create all of the named outputs needed for the WTX transform.

property.name: Destination
property.summary: A remote URL

description.p: Specify the location of the resource (source or destination). Specify the location as either a URL or as a variable that expands to a URL. If a variable, use the var://context/name form.

Required for a fetch, log, results-async, or route-set action. Optional for a results action. When not defined for a results action, the input context is written to the output context. Not used for all other actions.

ul.li: For fetch, specify the source.
For route-set, specify the destination.
For log, results, and results-async, specify the destination (a foreign server to which to send the data).

property.name: SchemaURL
property.summary: An XML schema

description.p:
Used only when the action type is validate, identifies an XML schema used for document validation regardless of any xsi:schemaLocation attributes contained with the document. Identify the schema with one of the following formats:
Use a URL, for example, store:///valHigh.xsd
Use a context variable that expands to a URL, for example, var://context/contextName/varName
Use a context, for example, var://context/Name or var://context/Name/ . The context runs as a schema validation.

property.name: JSONSchemaURL
property.summary: A JSON schema

description.p:
Used only when the action type is validate, identifies a JSON schema used for JSON document validation. Identify the schema with one of the following formats:
Use a URL, for example, local:///valHigh.jsv
Use a context variable that expands to a URL, for example, var://context/contextName/varName
Use a context, for example, var://context/Name or var://context/Name/ . The context runs as a JSON schema validation.

property.name: WsdlURL
property.summary: The URL of the WSDL file
property.description:
The URL of the WSDL file that defines the operations to use during the validate action. The WSDL file can reside on the local system or on the network. By default, the WSDL validation always applies to the entire input message. This can be modified by compile options on the XML manager.
Identify the WSDL with one of the following formats:
Use a URL, for example, local:///myTest.wsdl
Use a context variable that expands to a URL, for example, var://context/contextName/varName
Use a context, for example, var://context/Name or var://context/Name/ . The context runs as a WSDL validation.

property.name: Policy
property.summary: A URL Rewrite Policy
property.description:
This is most commonly used with the rewrite action. Doing so specifies the URL rewrite policy to be used to change the active URL of the current transaction.
Rewrite Policy can also be used to rewrite the external references contained within the input document when the action type is validate, xform, xformpi, xformbin, or xformng. This includes things such as stylesheet URLs, document include paths, and so forth. Select a URL Rewrite Policy from the values list. Setting this property on an action other than rewrite does not change the URL of the current transaction.
Used only when the action type is rewrite, validate, xform, xformpi, xformbin, or xformng.
It is required when the action type is rewrite, and identifies the URL Rewrite Policy used to rewrite the incoming URL. It is optionally used when the action type is validate and xformpi is used to identify the URL.

property.name: AAA
property.summary: AAA policy to use
property.description: Select an AAA Policy to assign the authentication and authorization policy to the DataPower service.

property.name: AAAPolicyViaVariable
property.summary: Use the AAA policy that this variable resolves to at runtime.
property.description: Resolve a AAA Policy to assign the authentication and authorization policy to the DataPower service with a multistep variable.

property.name: DynamicSchema
property.summary: A dynamic schema
property.description:
Select a dynamic schema from the values list.
Used only when the action type is validate. Identifies the dynamic XML Schema used to perform XML document validation regardless of any validation processing instructions contained within the document.

property.name: DynamicStylesheet
property.summary: Dynamic stylesheet
property.description: Used only when the action type is xform, xformbin, or xformpi. For the xform and xformbin action types, specifies the dynamic stylesheet used to transform an input document. For the xformpi action type, specifies the dynamic stylesheet used to transform an input document in the absence of internal processing instructions within the document. Select a dynamic stylesheet from the values list.

property.name: InputConversion
property.summary: An HTTP Input Conversion Map
property.description: Select an HTTP Input Conversion Map from the values list. Used only when the action type is convert-http. Optionally identifies the HTTP Input Conversion Map that provides encoding rules.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath expression
property.description: Specifies the XPath expression that is applied to the context identified by Input. Enter the XPath expression or a variable in the form var://context/name which expands to an XPath expression. Used only when the action type is extract,

property.name: Variable
property.summary: Create a variable

description.p:
Used only when action type is setvar, extract, or sql. Enter the variable URL, in one of the following forms:
var://context/CONTEXT-NAME/VAR-NAME
var://local/VAR-NAME
var://system/CONTEXT-NAME/VAR-NAME
var://service/SERVICE-NAME

var://context/CONTEXT-NAME/VAR-NAME is the primary way to reference variables. var://context/CONTEXT-NAME/_roottree is a special variable that holds the value of the context when used as an input to an action. var://context/CONTEXT-NAME (or var://context/CONTEXT-NAME/) is treated as shorthand for var://context/CONTEXT-NAME/_roottree.

var://local/VAR-NAME can be used to reference variables in the Input context for this action (when reading the variable) or in the Output context for this action (when writing the variable). Because this reference is context-sensitive, The use of var://context/CONTEXT-NAME/VAR-NAME is recommended.
var://system/CONTEXT-NAME/VAR-NAME is used to reference global variables. These variables are rarely used.

var://service/SERVICE-NAME is used to reference certain internal state variables. These variables are defined by the firmware and cannot be created by users. Refer to the manuals or the resource CD for details.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Assigns a value to Variable Name
property.description: Enter the variable value. The value can be a number, a string (for example, a URL), or another variable URL in one of the formats that is described in the help for the Variable property. This property is used only when the action type is setvar.

property.name: SSLCred
property.summary: The SSL credential is deprecated. Use an SSL client credential.
property.description: Specifies a SSL Proxy Profile used to establish a secure connection with the destination URL. Enter the name of an SSL Proxy Profile. Used only, and optional, when the action type is route-set.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClientCred
property.summary: SSL client profile
property.description: Specifies an SSL Client Profile to establish a secure connection with the destination URL. Enter the name of an SSL client profile. Used only, and optional, when the action type is route-set.

property.name: AttachmentURI
property.summary: URI specifying an attachment
property.description: This specifies which attachment to strip. If omitted, all attachments are stripped from the specified context. Used only when the action type is strip-attachments.

property.name: StylesheetParameters
property.description: Stylesheets used in Processing Policies can take stylesheet parameters. These parameters can be passed in by this object. More than one parameter can be defined.

property.name: ErrorMode
property.description: Select whether to continue on error.

property.name: ErrorInput
property.description: The input context for the error rule.

property.name: ErrorOutput
property.description: The output context for the error rule.

property.name: Rule
property.summary: Processing Rule to call
property.description: Specify which rule to call.

property.name: OutputType
property.summary: How to interpret a server response
property.description: Select how to interpret the response from the server, if any.

property.name: LogLevel
property.summary: Log Level
property.description: The log levels of the messages that was generated by the operation.

property.name: LogType
property.summary: Log Type
property.description: This is the log type of the messages generated by the log operation.

property.name: Transactional
property.summary: Transactional Asynchronous Operation
property.description: Defines if the asynchronous operation should be committed or rolled back as part of the entire multistep session transaction.

property.name: CheckpointEvent
property.summary: Event that triggers the checkpoint
property.description: Select the event that triggers the checkpoint action.

property.name: SLMPolicy
property.summary: SLM policy to enforce
property.description: Configure the Service Level Monitoring policy to enforce. This property is required by the SLM processing action. It is not relevant to other action types.

property.name: SQLDataSource
property.summary: SQL Data Source
property.description: The SQL Data Source object to use when executing this action. Not relevant to any other action type.

property.name: SQLText
property.summary: SQL Text

description.p: If the SQL input method is static, use the SQL text property to provide an SQL statement. Enter the literal text of the SQL statement that the SQL action runs.
SQL text is required when the action type is SQL and the SQL input method is static. Otherwise, the property is not used.

property.name: SOAPValidation
property.summary: Method to validate SOAP documents and faults

description.p: Select which parts of the SOAP message to validate.

This setting does not affect validating the input context to ensure that it is a valid document. If you are validating an intermediate context, such as the result of a transform or a fetched document, this setting will not be implicitly validated as SOAP. You might want to select validate the entire document.
Similarly, WSDL validation always applies to the entire document, except as modified by WSDL compiler options.

property.name: SQLSourceType
property.summary: Select the SQL input source
property.description: Select the source of the SQL statement for the SQL action.

property.name: JOSESerializationType
property.summary: JSON Web Serialization format
property.description: The JSON Web Serialization format in the JSON Web Sign and the JSON Web Encrypt actions.

property.name: JWEEncAlgorithm
property.summary: JWE encrypt algorithm
property.description: Assign a JWE encrypt algorithm in the JSON Web Encrypt action.

property.name: JWSSignatureObject
property.summary: Add a JWS signature object to the JSON Web Sign action
property.description: Add a JWS signature object to the JSON Web Sign action.

property.name: JWEHeaderObject
property.summary: Add a JWE header object to the JSON Encrypt action
property.description: Add a JWE header object to the JSON Encrypt action.

property.name: JOSEVerifyType
property.summary: The identifier type used to verify the signature in the JSON Web Verify action
property.description: The identifier type used to verify the signature in the JSON Web Verify action.

property.name: JOSEDecryptType
property.summary: The identifier type used to verify the recipient in the JSON Web Decrypt action
property.description: The identifier type used to verify the recipient in the JSON Web Decrypt action.

property.name: SignatureIdentifier
property.summary: Add a signature identifier object to the JSON Web Verify action
property.description: Add a signature identifier object to the JSON Web Verify action. This property is mutually exclusive from Single Identifier - Certificate and Single Identifier - Shared Secret Key.

property.name: RecipientIdentifier
property.summary: Add a recipient identifier object to the JSON Web Decrypt action
property.description: Add a recipient identifier object to the JSON Web Decrypt action. This property is mutually exclusive from Single Identifier - Private Key, Single Identifier - Shared Secret Key and Direct Key.

property.name: SingleCertificate
property.summary: Add a certificate object to the JSON Web Verify action
property.description: Add a certificate object to the JSON Web Verify action. This property is mutually exclusive from Signature Identifiers and Single Identifier - Shared Secret Key.

property.name: SingleKey
property.summary: Add a private key object to the JSON Web Decrypt
property.description: Add a private key object to the JSON Web Decrypt. This property is mutually exclusive from Recipient Identifiers, Single Identifier - Shared Secret Key and Direct Key.

property.name: SingleSSKey
property.summary: Add a shared secret key object to the JSON Web Decrypt or the JSON Web Verify action
property.description: Add a shared secret key object to the JSON Web Decrypt or the JSON Web Verify action. The JSON Web Verify action is mutually exclusive from Signature Identifiers and Single Identifier - Certificate. The JSON Web Decrypt action is mutually exclusive from Recipient Identifiers, Single Identifier - Private Key and Direct Key.

property.name: JWEDirectKeyObject
property.summary: Add a shared secret key object to the JSON Web Decrypt action
property.description: Add a shared secret key object to the JSON Web Decrypt action. This property is mutually exclusive from Recipient Identifiers, Single Identifier - Private Key and Single Identifier - Shared Secret Key. This property is used when the algorithm is 'dir'.

property.name: JWSVerifyStripSignature
property.summary: Write the payload in the JWS object to the output context
property.description: Write the payload in the JWS object to the output context.

property.name: Asynchronous
property.summary: Marks this action as asynchronous
property.description: Marks this multistep action as asynchronous. It will not need to complete for the next multistep action to begin.

property.name: Condition
property.summary: XPath condition to check and action to run if it is found.
property.description: Used for the conditional action, this is a single condition which maps an XPath condition to search for in the input context to an action to run if it is found. If it is not found, then other conditions can be checked.

property.name: ResultsMode
property.summary: How to handle multiple results targets

description.p: When configuring a multi-way results or results-async action, specify whether to use the first available target from the target list or to try to send to all targets. If "first-available", the action sends to potential targets one at a time, and stops with success when the input has been sent to any single target. If "require-all", the action sends to all of the potential targets, and fails if any one of the targets fails. If "attempt-all", the action succeeds even if some or all of the target backends fail.

property.name: RetryCount
property.summary: Number of times to retry the operation

description.p: If connecting to a target specified in a results or results-async action fails, the connection attempt may be retried after an interval. This indicates the number of retry attempts; the default of "0" indicates that the operation fails immediately if the connection fails.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Time between operation retries

description.p: If connecting to a target specified in a results or results-async action fails, the connection attempt may be retried after an interval. This indicates the time between retries, in milliseconds. The default value of "1000" makes retry attempts once per second.

property.name: MultipleOutputs
property.summary: Place parallel outputs into separate contexts

description.p: A results action can target several backends simultaneously by specifying a variable containing an XML node-set as the results target. If this option is true, the context named as the output context of the action is ignored, but the status of individual attempts to reach the targets are recorded in separate contexts by appending a number to the provided name, resulting in context names such as "ctx_1" for an output context name of "ctx". If this option is false, only one result is kept: in require-all mode, it is the first target to have failed and have no retries left, or the last target on success; in attempt-all mode, the last target to be attempted; in first-available mode, the first target to succeed or the last failing target.
This option is available with the results action only when a destination is specified.

property.name: IteratorType
property.summary: Type of iterator, an xpath expression or a loop count
property.description: Used for the loop action. This specify the type of the iterator. It will either be an xpath expression or a number designating the number of times to execute the loop.

property.name: IteratorExpression
property.summary: Iterator to operate on: an xpath expression
property.description: Used for the loop action. An xpath expression defining the content to iterate on.

property.name: IteratorCount
property.summary: Number of times to run the loop action
property.description: Specify the number of times to run the loop action. Use an integer in the range of 1 through 32768.

property.name: LoopAction
property.summary: The action to execute within the loop

property.name: AsyncAction
property.summary: List of asynchronous actions to wait for

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: The time in milliseconds to wait for async actions to complete
property.description: Wait for this number of milliseconds for listed actions to complete, timeout after this period and raise an error. Use 0 to wait forever.

property.name: WSDLPortQName
property.summary: Validate messages from a specific wsdl:port
property.description: The QName of the WSDL port that defines the service traffic to validate. The value should be a QName in the form "{namespace-uri}local-part" or "*" for all ports that are defined in the WSDL file. If specified and not "*", only messages that are defined for the named port are considered valid.

property.name: WSDLOperationName
property.summary: Validate messages that match the specified wsdl:operation
property.description: The name of the WSDL operation that defines the service traffic to validate. The value should be the unqualified name of the operation or "*" for all operations that are defined in the WSDL file. If specified and not "*", only messages that are defined for operations that match the specified name are considered valid.

property.name: WSDLMessageDirectionOrName
property.summary: Validate messages from wsdl:input, wsdl:output, or wsdl:faults that match the given name or direction
property.description: The name or direction of the WSDL input (wsdl:input), output (wsdl:output), or fault (wsdl:fault) that defines the service traffic to be validated. The value should be the name of one or more WSDL input, output, or fault components, or "#input" or "#output" for the request and response directions respectively, or "*" for all inputs, outputs, and faults that are defined in the WSDL file. If specified and not "*", only messages that are defined for inputs, outputs, and faults that match the specified name or direction are considered valid. Faults are considered valid for the response direction.

property.name: WSDLAttachmentPart
property.summary: Validate messages defined by mime:content in the WSDL that match the specified message part name
property.description: The name of the WSDL message part that defines the content of a MIME attachment (mime:content/@part). The value should be the unqualified name of the message part. The name is the same as the part attribute on the corresponding mime:content component in the WSDL file. When this property is not defined or has the special value "*", the root MIME part is validated. The root MIME part is bound to a soap:body.

property.name: MethodRewriteType
property.summary: The HTTP method type
property.description: The HTTP method type to use for this action.

property.name: MethodType
property.summary: The HTTP method type
property.description: The HTTP method type to use for this action.

property.name: MethodType2
property.summary: The HTTP method type
property.description: The HTTP method type to use for this action.

property.name: PolicyKey
property.summary: Identifier that associates action output for external monitoring
property.description: Do not modify this value. The appliance uses this identifier to store the output from the action. The output can be used for external monitoring by products such as Tivoli Composite Application Manager.

object.description: Define XSL filters and/or transformations

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Direction
property.summary: A rule type
property.description: Select a rule type. The default is Rule.

property.name: InputFormat
property.summary: Filter or preprocess Processing Rule input
property.description: Select a decompression algorithm to apply to all messages before any other processing occurs (a preprocess step). All messages are decompressed using the selected algorithm. If the message is not compressed with this algorithm, an error is raised. This setting is independent of transport-level decompression. The default is None.

property.name: OutputFormat
property.summary: Filter or post-process Processing Rule output
property.description: Select a compression algorithm to apply to all messages after any other processing occurs (a post-process step). All messages are compressed using the selected algorithm. The resulting archive contains only one file. This setting is independent of transport-level compression. The default is None.

property.name: NonXMLProcessing
property.summary: Should Rule Apply to Non-XML traffic too
property.description: Normally, processing is only performed on XML content. This option allows processing actions to be performed on Non-XML content as well.

property.name: Unprocessed
property.summary: Permit rule to pass-through data unprocessed
property.description: Permit rule to pass-through data unprocessed

object.name: StylePolicyRule

property.name: Actions
property.description: Define XSL filters and/or transformations. Select the desired existing action from the list and click Add to add the action to the rule. Actions are executed in the order (top to bottom) in which they are listed in the box. Click the + button to create a new Action; select an action and click the ... button to edit an existing action. To delete an action, select it from the list and click Delete.

object.description: Create, edit, or delete processing policy rules. Rules can also be created and edited using a drag and drop interface by opening the Services menu area on the left-hand navigation bar. Click the appropriate Policy link which will then present an opportunity to create both Rules and Actions.

object.name: WSStylePolicyRule

property.name: Actions
property.description: The full action pipeline that includes the actions generated from the WSDL as well as the rules configured by the user.

object.description: Create, edit, or delete processing policy rules. Rules can also be created and edited using a drag and drop interface by opening the Services menu area on the left-hand navigation bar. Click the appropriate Policy link which will then present an opportunity to create both Rules and Actions.

object.name: Throttler

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: ThrottleAt
property.summary: Memory throttle inbound traffic threshold
property.description: Enter a value of 0 - 100 to establish the threshold of minimal available memory (in percent) at which traffic is throttled. When the threshold is reached, the system waits for the timeout period before rebooting, to allow memory usage to recover.

property.name: TerminateAt
property.summary: Memory terminate operation threshold
property.description: Enter a value of 0 - 100 to establish the threshold of minimal available memory (in percent) at which the system reboots.

property.name: TempFSThrottleAt
property.summary: Temporary file space throttle inbound traffic threshold
property.description: Enter a value of 0 - 100 to establish the threshold of minimal available temporary file space (in percent) at which traffic is throttled. When this threshold is reached, the system waits for the timeout period before rebooting, to allow temporary file space to recover.

property.name: TempFSTerminateAt
property.summary: Temporary files space terminate operation threshold
property.description: Enter a value 0 - 100 to establish the threshold of minimal available temporary file space (in percent) at which the system reboots.

property.name: QnameWarnAt
property.display: XML Names and JSON Keys Warn At
property.summary: XML Names and JSON Keys warn threshold
property.description: Enter a value in the range 5 - 65 to establish the threshold of minimal available XML Names and JSON Keys (in percent) for any of the pools. As this threshold is approached, the system attempts to free unused XML Names and JSON Keys resources, so that this threshold is never reached. If this threshold is reached, then the system logs an alert. Note that the system reboots with less than 5% free XML Names or JSON Keys available, for any of the pools. To see the percentage currently available, use the XML Names and JSON Keys status provider.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Timeout period
property.description: Enter a value to set the number of seconds the system waits to take action when a throttling threshold is reached.

property.name: Statistics
property.summary: Periodic status Log
property.description: This setting controls the generation of throttle log messages. Select on or off.

property.name: LogLevel
property.summary: Status log level
property.description: Configure the level of the periodic status log.

property.name: EnvironmentalLog
property.summary: Monitor Environmental Sensors
property.description: This setting monitors system fan speeds and power supply status and generates log messages when a failure event occurs. Select on or off.

property.name: BacklogSize
property.summary: Backlog Size
property.description: Enter a value of 0 - 500 to specify the size of the backlog queue where incoming requests are routed if a throttling threshold is reached. If the size is set to 0, no requests are routed to the backlog queue.

property.name: BacklogTimeout
property.summary: Backlog Timeout
property.description: Enter a value to specify the number of seconds that a request remains in the backlog queue before it is rejected if a throttling threshold is reached.

object.description: This setting throttles, or disallows, traffic when the total memory available to the system reaches the thresholds established here.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: IPAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the UDDI registry.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Port
property.description: Specify the port of the SOAP over HTTP interface on the UDDI Registry.

property.name: UseSSL
property.summary: Use SSL
property.description: Select when to use HTTPS connections to the remote UDDI registry.

property.name: SSLPort
property.summary: Port (SSL)
property.description: The port number of the registry's SOAP over HTTPS interface. The default is 443.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: Select an existing SSL Proxy Profile from the list of existing profiles. Click the + button to create a new profile. Select a profile and click the ... button to edit an existing profile.

property.name: InquiryURL
property.summary: The local path (URI) part of the inquiry URL.
property.description: The local path (URI) portion of the URL used to query the Registry. UDDI inquiry requests will be sent to http(s)://hostname:port/inquiry-url. A typical default looks like https://192.18.1.120:443/uddi/inquiry.

property.name: PublishURL
property.summary: The local path (URI) part of the publish URL.
property.description: The local path (URI) portion of the URL used to publish to the Registry. UDDI Publish requests will be sent to http(s)://hostname:port/publish-url. A typical default looks like https://192.18.1.120:443/uddi/publishing.

property.name: SubscriptionURL
property.summary: The local part of the URL of the subscription API
property.description: The local path (URI) portion of the URL used to subscribe to the Registry. UDDI subscription requests will be sent to http(s)://hostname:port/subscription-url. A typical default looks like https://192.18.1.120:443/uddi/subscription.

property.name: SecurityURL
property.summary: The local part of the URL of the security API
property.description: The local path (URI) portion of the URL used to subscribe to the Registry. UDDI security requests will be sent to http(s)://hostname:port/security-url. A typical default looks like https://192.18.1.120:443/uddi/security.

property.name: Version
property.summary: Version
property.description: Select the API version that is in use by the registry. This value must agree with the version that is running on the registry.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

description.p: The UDDI registry is deprecated. Instead, use WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) server.
Configuration required for locating and accessing a UDDI registry. To configure a UDDI Subscription, the UDDI registry must support the UDDI Subscription API set.

object.name: URLMap

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: URLMapRule
property.description: Add, edit or delete a URL map match pattern

object.description: Configure/Edit URL maps. URL Maps are used by Processing Actions and by XML Manager Compile Options Policies.

object.name: URLRefreshPolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: URLRefreshRule
property.description: Add, edit or delete a refresh rule

object.description: Configure/Edit URL Refresh Policies

object.name: URLRewritePolicy

property.name: Direction
property.summary: URL Rewrite Direction
property.description: Restricts the URL Rewrite Policy to a specified direction. Direction is applied at the service object level and has no effect on policies used from multistep or elsewhere.

property.name: URLRewriteRule
property.description: Add, edit, or delete a URL rewrite rule

object.description: Configure/Edit URL Rewrite Policies

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Enter the password for the user account.
property.description: The password for the account. The password must comply to the password policy in RBM settings.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the password for the account. The password must comply to the password policy in RBM settings.

property.name: AccessLevel
property.summary: Set the access level of the user account.
property.description: The access level for the user account.

property.name: GroupName
property.summary: Set the user group for the user account.
property.description: The user group for the user account. Each user group has an access profile to manage access rights. A user account inherits access rights from its user group.
property.hoverhelp: Set the user group for the user account. Each user group has an access profile to manage access rights. A user account inherits access rights from its user group.

property.name: SnmpCreds
property.summary: Manage the SNMPv3 credentials for the user account.

description.p: The SNMPv3 credentials for the user account. An account can have multiple SNMPv3 credentials, one for each SNMPv3 engine that is identified by an engine ID. The secrets for authentication and privacy (encryption) can be defined as a password (passphrase), which is hashed and localized with the engine ID, or as a localized hex key.
Note: The current implementation supports only SNMPv3 credentials for the local engine ID. Therefore, each user account can define only one set of SNMPv3 credentials.

property.name: UserDomain
property.summary: Deprecated - Set which application domains to grant access.
property.description: Deprecated - Which application domains to grant access. The user account can log in to only these application domains. Without an application domain, the user account can log in to any application domain.

description.p: Create or edit a local user account. When you modify a local user account, the changes do not affect remote user accounts in a role-based management XML information file.
An administrator can change the password for the account. An administrator can force the account owner to change the password during the next log in attempt.

object.name: UserGroup

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: AccessPolicies
property.summary: Manage the set of access policies that define the access privileges for members of the group.

description.p: The set of access policies that define the access privileges for members of the group. When more than one policy applies to a resource, the most specific policy is used. To create access policies, enter a correctly formatted policy statement.
A policy statement takes the address / domain / resource ?Access= privileges & field = value general format.

dl.dd: The complete local IP address or host alias. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any address.
The complete name of the application domain. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any application domain.
The complete value for the resource type. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any resource type.
The privileges to apply. Separate permissions with the plus sign (+). For example, a+d+x+r+w defines add, delete, execute, read, and write privileges.
The complete name of a specific property in the configuration; for example, Name .
The PCRE match expression for the property value; For example, foo(.*)bar .

hoverhelp.p: Enter the set of access policies that define the access privileges for members of the group. When more than one policy applies to a resource, the most specific policy is used. To create access policies, enter a correctly formatted policy statement.
A policy statement takes the address / domain / resource ?Access= privileges & field = value general format.

dl.dd: The complete local IP address or host alias. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any address.
The complete name of the application domain. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any application domain.
The complete value for the resource type. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any resource type.
The privileges to apply. Separate permissions with the plus sign (+). For example, a+d+x+r+w defines add, delete, execute, read, and write privileges.
The complete name of a specific property in the configuration; for example, Name .
The PCRE match expression for the property value; For example, foo(.*)bar .

property.name: CommandGroup
property.summary: Manage the command groups to which the user group has CLI access.
property.description: The command groups to which the user group has CLI access. This property is superceded by the access profile when role-based management is applied to the CLI.
property.hoverhelp: Manage the command groups to which the user group has CLI access. This property is superceded by the access profile when role-based management is applied to the CLI.

object.summary: Manage user groups and their access privileges.
object.description: Create or edit user groups and their access privileges.

object.name: WCCService

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Contains a brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: ODCInfoHostname
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Host name or IP address of the Deployment Manager. It is used to communicate with the ODCInfo servlet. The ODCInfo servlet must be installed in a WebSphere Application Server environment.

property.name: ODCInfoPort
property.summary: Destination port of ODCInfo servlet
property.description: Specifies the listening port of the ODCInfo servlet on the deployment manager. To determine the listening port number, log in to the WebSphere Application Server administrative console and click System Administration > Deployment Manager > ports. From the list, use the port associated with WC_adminhost for HTTP or the port associated with WC_adminhost_secure for HTTPS.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: You must select an SSL proxy profile if you are using SSL (HTTPS) to connect to the ODCInfo servlet. If you do not specify a profile, an HTTP connection is used.

property.name: UpdateType
property.summary: Method for retrieving WebSphere information
property.description: Specifies the method for retrieving WebSphere information. The method defines the responsiveness of the updates received by the appliance. The method also affects the amount of system resource used for providing those updates. The default is poll.

property.name: TimeInterval
property.summary: Interval for updates

description.p: If the update method is poll, the time interval specifies the amount of time in seconds between poll requests.
If the update method is subscribe, the time interval specifies the maximum duration of the request in seconds.
Use any value of 1 - 86400. The default is 10.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

object.description: Use the WebSphere Cell configuration to retrieve configuration information and runtime information from a Network Deployment or Virtual Enterprise product. Load balancer groups use this information to automate configuration and updates.

object.name: WebAppErrorHandlingPolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Error Handling Mode
property.description: Select how to handle errors. The default is Standard.

property.name: URL
property.summary: Error Page URL
property.description: This is the fully qualified URL (for example, http://host/..) that the user will either be redirected to or the contents of that URL will be proxied for depending on the setting of the mode property.

property.name: ErrorStylePolicyRule
property.summary: Assign a processing rule for errors
property.description: Custom error rule to be run if mode is error-rule.

property.name: ErrorMonitor
property.summary: Error Monitor

Message Monitor for rejected messages. It will be incremented each time this error handling policy is invoked, regardless of the overall mode of the policy. It can be used to implement a rate limiter for errors that will blacklist IPs based on excessive error count.

object.description: When an error occurs this policy specifies how to handle the response to the user.

object.name: WebAppFW

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: FrontSide
property.summary: The addresses and ports on which the Web Application Firewall listens.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the backend server. If the backend requires SSL, ensure that the SSL client profile is configured for client (forward) connections.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the port on the remote server.

property.name: StylePolicy
property.description: Select a security policy from the list of available policies. Click + to create a new Policy. This policy controls which profiles are enforced.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML manager

description.p: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of stylesheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy.

Note that an XML Manager can optionally employ a User Agent. The User Agent settings, in turn, can affect the behavior of the gateway when communicating with back end servers or with clients when sending back responses.

More than one firewall may use the same XML Manager. Select an existing XML Manager from the list to assign the Manager to this firewall. Click the + button to create a new XML Manager that is assigned to this firewall. A default Manager is used if you do not create one.

property.name: ErrorPolicy
property.summary: Error Handling Policy
property.description: If any policy is violated, this is the default policy that will handle the response sent to the client. It might be overridden in the profile that fails.

property.name: URINormalization
property.description: If this property is enabled the URI is rewritten to make sure the URI is RFC compliant by escaping certain characters. Additionally, characters that are escaped that do not need to be are unescaped. This makes checking for attack sequences such as .. more reliable.

property.name: RewriteErrors
property.summary: Whether to rewrite error messages to avoid providing a padding oracle.
property.description: Error messages after a decryption action can provide an attacker who is using the padding oracle attack method with enough information to determine the contents of the plain-text data. When enabled, the default, the client receives error messages without the internal information that could lead to a discovery. When disabled, the client receives the original message with this information.

property.name: DelayErrors
property.summary: Whether to delay error messages to avoid providing a padding oracle.
property.description: The timing difference of the error messages returned after a decryption action can provide an attacker with enough information to determine the contents of the plain-text data. When enabled, the default, the appliance delays error messages for the defined duration. When disabled, the appliance does not delay error messages.

property.name: DelayErrorsDuration
property.summary: How long to delay error messages from the start of the transaction.
property.description: When enabling the delay of error messages, specify the delay duration in milliseconds (ms). If delaying messages for 3000ms, the appliance will not send error messages to the client until 3 seconds have elapsed since the appliance performed decryption on the requests. Use any value of 250 - 300000. The default value is 1000.

property.name: StreamOutputToBack
property.description: Select the desired streaming behavior.

property.name: StreamOutputToFront
property.description: Select the desired streaming behavior.

property.name: FrontTimeout
property.summary: Idle time a front side connection is allowed before being canceled during a transaction.
property.description: Controls the amount of time a front side client connection can be idle before being abandoned within a transaction.

property.name: BackTimeout
property.summary: Idle time a back side connection is allowed before being canceled during a transaction.
property.description: Controls the amount of time a back side client connection can be idle before being abandoned within a transaction.

property.name: FrontPersistentTimeout
property.summary: Maximum Idle Time Between Front Persistent Uses
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds (within the range 0 through 86400, with a default of 180) that a gateway maintains an idle persistent TCP connection on the front side.

property.name: AllowCacheControlHeader
property.summary: Specify whether to allow the HTTP GET method to pass the Cache-Control header through to the back end.
property.description: Specify whether to allow the HTTP GET method to pass the Cache-Control header through to the back end. If disabled, a "Cache-Control:no-transform" header is passed. If enabled, the client request can specify the cache control behavior, or if the client request does not specify the Cache-Control header, a "Cache-Control:no-transform" header is passed.

property.name: BackPersistentTimeout
property.summary: Maximum maximum inter-transaction idle time for service-to-server connections

description.p: Specify the maximum inter-transaction idle time in seconds for service-to-server connections. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 180.

This value is the maximum idle time between the completion of a TCP transaction and the initiation of a new TCP transaction on this connection. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down.
Note: For HTTP GET and HEAD requests, the service attempts the connection again after the specified value, Therefore, the actual timeout is twice the specified value.
An idle TCP connection can remain in the idle state for 20 seconds after the expiration of the persistence timer.

property.name: FrontHTTPVersion
property.summary: Client-side HTTP response version
property.description: Select the HTTP version to be use on client responses. Incoming version 1.0 requests will always be replied to with 1.0 compatible responses regardless of this setting. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: BackHTTPVersion
property.summary: Server-side HTTP request version
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the server-side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: RequestSideSecurity
property.description: If this property is disabled, no request side security policies will be enforced and all requests will be allowed through.

property.name: ResponseSideSecurity
property.description: If this property is disabled, no response side security policies will be enforced and all responses will be allowed through.

property.name: DoChunkedUpload
property.summary: Enabled/Disable HTTP/1.1 Chunked Request Bodies
property.description: Use the radio buttons to enable (on) or disable (off) the ability to send Content-Type Chunked Encoded documents to the back end server. When the device employs the HTTP/1.1 protocol, the body of the document can be delimited by either Content-Length or chunked encodings. While all servers will understand how to interpret Content-Length, many applications will fail to understand Chunked encoding. For this reason, Content-Length is the standard method used. However doing so interferes with the ability of the device to fully stream. To stream full documents towards the back end server, this property should be turned on. However, the back end server must be RFC 2616 compatible, because this feature cannot be renegotiated at run time, unlike all other HTTP/1.1 features which can be negotiated down at runtime if necessary. This property can also be enabled by configuring a User Agent to enable it on a per-URL basis.

property.name: FollowRedirects
property.summary: Enable/Disable gateway redirect resolution
property.description: Some protocols generate redirects as part of the protocol - for example HTTP response code 302. If this property is enabled the firewall will try and transparently resolve those redirects.

property.name: HTTPClientIPLabel
property.summary: HTTP header label containing client IP address
property.description: Retain the default value (X-Client-IP) or provide an other value (for example, X-Forwarded-For).

property.name: HTTPLogCorIDLabel
property.summary: HTTP header label containing global transaction ID
property.description: Enter the name of an HTTP Header to read to determine the global transaction ID for chained services. This value defaults to X-Global-Transaction-ID.

property.name: DebugMode
property.summary: Controls transaction diagnostic mode

description.p: Select the diagnostic mode for processing policies. When enabled, you can view details about the state of variables and contexts for a captured transaction in the probe. The default value is off .
Transaction diagnostic mode is not intended for use in a production environment. Transaction diagnostic mode consumes significant resources that can slow down transaction processing.

property.name: DebuggerType
property.summary: Probe Mode
property.description: Select the probe mode.

property.name: DebuggerURL
property.summary: External Server URL
property.description: Configures the URL for external probe mode

property.name: DebugHistory
property.summary: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostics in the probe
property.description: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostics in the probe. Enter a value in the range 10 - 250. The default value is 25.

property.name: DebugTrigger
property.summary: Probe Triggers
property.description: The probe captures transactions that meet one or more of the conditions defined by the triggers. These triggers examine the direction or type of the message flow and examine the message for an XPath expression match. When a message meets one of these conditions, the transaction is captured in diagnostics mode and becomes part of the list of transactions that can be viewed.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.summary: Header and URL rewrite policy
property.description: A Rewrite Policy can be used to modify the values of certain headers before the security policies are executed. One common use for this is to rewrite the contents of an HTTP Location header to reflect external DNS names. By using a Rewrite Policy, it is possible to intercept and rewrite URLs that might send a browser directly to the back end web site, rather than through the Web Application Firewall.

property.name: DoHostRewriting
property.summary: Enable/Disable rewriting of host names when accessing back side server
property.description: Some protocols have distinct name based elements, separate from the URL, to de multiplex. HTTP uses the Host header for this purposes. If this feature is enabled the backside server will receive a request reflecting the final route, otherwise it will receive a request reflecting the information as it arrived at the DataPower device. Web servers issuing redirects may want to disable this feature, as they often depend on the host header for the value of their redirect.

property.name: SSLConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile and an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.
property.description: The SSL proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property-group.name: main
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display general settings

property-group.name: ProbeSettings
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional Probe settings
property-group.description:
The MultiStep Probe allows developers to view the changing value of variables and the changing contents of processing contexts. The developer can step through each action for any given transaction, up to a configured number of transactions. The Probe Settings page turns on this debugging tool and also sets the number of concurrently captured transactions.
Note: The number of concurrent xml sessions is limited to the value of the transaction history size.

object.description: The web application firewall provides filtering, security, and input validation for HTTP transactions.

object.name: WebAppRequest

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: PolicyType
property.summary: Satisfaction Style
property.description: Select the satisfaction policy for the profile. The default value is Admission.

property.name: SSLPolicy
property.description: Select how the client side of the inspected transaction handles SSL. The default value is Allow.

property.name: AAA
property.summary: AAA policy to enforce
property.description: If this property references a AAA policy, then that AAA policy will be run as a filter on this transaction and the success of that AAA run will be required to continue processing. Any input to this transaction as XML, application/www-url-encoded, or multipart/form-data MIME types will be automatically provided to the AAA processing policy.

property.name: SSKey
property.summary: Shared Secret Key used for Value or Cookie protection
property.description: Select the Shared Secret Key for both signing or encrypting.

property.name: RateLimiter
property.summary: Rate Limiting Policy
property.description: A rate limiting policy restricts identities (as determined by AAA or the client IP address if AAA is not available) to a specific number of transactions per second.

property.name: ACL
property.description: This Access Control List will be used to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an Access Control List (ACL) denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

property.name: OKMethods
property.summary: Allowable Request Methods
property.description: Specify which HTTP methods are acceptable from the client acceptable.

property.name: OKVersions
property.summary: Allowable Request Versions
property.description: Specify which HTTP versions are acceptable from the client.

property.name: MinBodySize
property.summary: Minimum Request Body Size
property.description: Minimum request body size if method provides a body.

property.name: MaxBodySize
property.summary: Maximum Request Body Size
property.description: Specify the largest response body size that is acceptable.

property.name: XMLPolicy
property.summary: Processing policy when encountering XML
property.description: Specify how the device handles requests that contain an XML MIME type.

property.name: XMLRule
property.summary: Assign an additional processing rule for xml
property.description: This is the transformation rule that is run when the request contains an XML MIME type and the XML processing policy is set to XML or SOAP.

property.name: NonXMLPolicy
property.summary: Processing policy when encountering Non-XML
property.description: Specify how the device handles requests that do not contain an XML MIME type.

property.name: NonXMLRule
property.summary: Assign an additional processing rule for non-xml
property.description: This is the transformation rule that is run when the request does not contain an XML MIME type and the Non-XML processing policy is set to binary or side-effect.

property.name: ErrorPolicy
property.summary: Error Handling Policy
property.description: If this request policy is violated the firewall error policy will be invoked unless this more specific error policy is provided, in which case this policy takes precedence.

property.name: SessionManagementProfile
property.description: The session management policy enforces the start pages acceptable for requests that match this security profile. If no policy is referenced, any page is an acceptable start page.

property.name: HeaderGNVC
property.summary: The name-value profile for request headers
property.description: The name-value profile allows you to specify what headers are expected, what headers should be stripped, and what headers should be mapped to known values. If no profile is specified, any header is allowed.

property.name: UrlEncodedGNVC
property.summary: The name-value profile for application/www-url-encoded body members
property.description: The name-value profile allows you to specify what form elements are expected, what form elements should be stripped, and what form elements should be mapped to known values. If no profile is specified, any set of pairs is allowed.

property.name: QueryStringPolicy
property.description: Select how the client URL handles query strings. The default is Allow.

property.name: QueryStringGNVC
property.summary: The name-value profile for query string
property.description: The name-value profile for query-string. If not present, no profile is enforced. The profile allows you to validate data members of the query string, filter out unknown ones, or map certain names to known values.

property.name: SQLInjection
property.summary: SQL Injection Filter on all data parameters
property.description: Data parameters from the query string, application/www-urlencoded requests, and multipart/form-data requests will be passed through the standard SQL Injection filter if this property is enabled.

property.name: MaxURISize
property.description: The URI may be no longer than the value specified here.

property.name: URIFilterUnicode
property.summary: Filter Requests with Unicode in the URI
property.description: If Unicode is detected in the URI and this property is enabled then the transaction will be rejected

property.name: URIFilterDotDot
property.summary: Filter Requests with .. in the URI
property.description: Filter Requests with .. in the URI after URI normalization

property.name: URIFilterExe
property.summary: Filter Requests with .exe in the URI
property.description: Filter Requests with .exe in the URI after URI normalization

property.name: URIFilterFragment
property.summary: Policy for how to Handle Requests with # in the URI
property.description: Select how to handle URI fragments in requests. A URI fragment is the portion of a URI after the # symbol. The default is Truncate

property.name: ContentTypes
property.summary: List of Acceptable Content-Type Expressions
property.description: A list of PCRE regular expressions that indicate acceptable content-type MIME headers on the request. If this list is empty, any content-type is acceptable. If the request does not have a content type that will be represented as an empty string for matching purposes. Requests without a body (GET, HEAD, and so forth) are not subject to this constraint. An empty list will match all content types.

property.name: CookieProfile
property.summary: Cookie Management Profile
property.description: The cookie management profile allows you to specify validation profiles for incoming cookies, whether cookies should be allowed at all, and the signature and encryption policies for cookies.

property.name: ProcessAllCookie
property.summary: Sign or Encrypt cookies header
property.description: The process will sign or encrypt all cookies when enabled. The default is enabled.

property.name: CookieNameVector
property.summary: List of the cookies, by name, to process
property.description: The list of cookies, by name, that the process signs and encrypts.

property.name: SQLInjectionPatternsFile
property.summary: SQL Injection Patterns File
property.description: The patterns file that the SQL injection filter uses.

object.description: The web request profile specifies various properties about the request side of the transaction that must be satisfied.

object.name: WebAppResponse

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: PolicyType
property.summary: Satisfaction Style
property.description: Select the satisfaction policy for the profile. The default is Admission.

property.name: OKCodes
property.summary: Allowable Response Codes
property.description: Specify which response codes from the backend server are acceptable.

property.name: OKVersions
property.summary: Response Versions
property.description: Specify which HTTP versions are acceptable from the backend server.

property.name: MinBodySize
property.summary: Minimum Response Body Size
property.description: Specify the smallest response body size that is acceptable.

property.name: MaxBodySize
property.summary: Maximum Response Body Size
property.description: Specify the largest response body size that is acceptable.

property.name: HeaderGNVC
property.summary: Name/Value validation profile for response headers
property.description: The validation profile allows you to specify what headers are expected, what headers should be stripped, and what headers should be mapped to known values. If no profile is specified, any header is allowed.

property.name: ContentTypes
property.summary: List of Acceptable Content-Type Expressions
property.description: A list of PCRE regular expressions that indicate acceptable content-type MIME headers on the response. If this list is empty, any content-type is acceptable. If the response does not have a content type that will be represented as an empty string for matching purposes. An empty list will match all content types.

property.name: XMLPolicy
property.summary: Processing policy when encountering XML
property.description: Specify how the device handles responses that contain an XML MIME type.

property.name: XMLRule
property.summary: Assign an additional processing rule for xml
property.description: This is the transformation rule that is run when the response contains an XML MIME type and the XML processing policy is set to XML or SOAP.

property.name: NonXMLPolicy
property.summary: Processing policy when encountering Non-XML
property.description: Specify how the device handles responses that do not contain an XML MIME type.

property.name: NonXMLRule
property.summary: Assign an additional processing rule for non-xml
property.description: This is the transformation rule that is run when the response does not contain an XML MIME type and the Non-XML processing policy is set to binary or side-effect.

property.name: ErrorPolicy
property.summary: Error Handling Policy
property.description: If this response policy is violated the firewall error policy will be invoked unless this more specific error policy is provided, in which case this policy takes precedence.

object.description: The web response profile specifies various properties about the response side of the transaction that must be satisfied.

object.name: WebAppSessionPolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: AutoRenew
property.summary: Renew session on each click
property.description: If this property is enabled, the session lifetime is renewed on each use of the session. Otherwise the session lifetime is the total amount of time allowed before returning to the login sections.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Length of time a login session is considered active.
property.description: The login cookie is only good for the amount of time specified by this property. It may be automatically renewed during activity depending on the value of the Auto Renew property.

property.name: AddressAgnosticCookie
property.summary: Allow use of a single session across different IP Address
property.description: Normally the session cookie contains the client IP address and this prevents them from using the session on any other host. Some proxy server environments may make this undesirable. Turning this property on will make the session cookie address independent.

property.name: StartMatches
property.summary: Valid Start Pages
property.description: Select the matching rule that is used to identify start pages. Start pages are pages that can be accessed without a session cookie and if their security policy passes will issue a session cookie.

object.description: Session policy - specify a series of start pages that the a web application firewall protected host use as initial browsing points. Accessing these pages issues a signed and time limited cookie which must be presented for accessing any pages not designated as a starting point.

object.name: WebServiceMonitor

property.name: WSDLURL
property.summary: WSDL URL
property.description: The URL of the WSDL file that defines the Endpoints, Transport Type and Operations watched by this monitor. The WSDL file may reside on the local system or elsewhere on the network.

property.name: Operations
property.summary: Operations
property.description: Select the operations that you wish to monitor by checking the check box to the left of the operation name.

property.name: EndpointName
property.summary: Name of the Endpoint this monitor will watch
property.description: Enter the name of the Endpoint, as defined in the WSDL file identified above, this monitor will watch.

property.name: EndpointURL
property.summary: The URL of the desired endpoint
property.description: Enter the URL of the Endpoint, as defined in the WSDL file identified above, this monitor will watch.

property.name: FrontendURL
property.summary: URL employed by the client to access the Web Service
property.description: This is the URL used by the client to access the Web Service endpoint. This may not be the same as the Endpoint URL. Wildcards (such as *) may be used; a value is required.

property.name: Transport
property.summary: The transport type used by the selected endpoint
property.description: Select the transport type used by the identified Endpoint. This transport type must agree with the transport type specified in the WSDL file.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

object.description:
Web Service SLM (Service Level Monitor) Object
An SLM watches Web Services traffic destined for the Endpoint URL defined in the Endpoint URL field using the transport method defined in the Transport Type field. The monitor watches only traffic the client sent to the Front End URL (which accepts wildcards). The Endpoint, Endpoint URL and Transport Type must agree with the definitions provided in the WSDL file identified by the WSDL URL field.

object.name: WebServicesAgent

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: MaxRecords
property.summary: Maximum accounting record size

property.name: MaxMemoryKB
property.summary: Maximum memory usage

property.name: CaptureMode
property.summary: Message capture mode

description.p: Select which messages to capture for further analysis.
Because not all Web Services Management protocols can accommodate full message-capture, configure this property only if the spooler can forward full messages.
Full message-capture incurs a performance penalty. Keep this in mind when performing load testing of the managed service.

property.name: BufferMode
property.summary: Buffering mode
property.description: Select the behavior of the Agent when there are no registered consumers of the transaction events.

property.name: MediationMetrics
property.summary: Controls the collection of Mediation Enforcement metrics
property.description: Select this option to enable the collection of Mediation Enforcement metrics. No collection of metrics is the default.

property.name: PushSubscribers
property.summary: Push Subscribers
property.description: Push Subscribers

property.name: PushInterval
property.summary: Push Interval
property.description: Push Interval

property.name: PushPriority
property.summary: Controls the push scheduling priority.

object.description: The Web Services Management Agent provides manageability for Web Services by providing status, metrics, and transaction history to external management stations.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Registry
property.description: The UDDI Registry object identifying a UDDI Registry offering the subscriptions desired.

description.p: This is a subscriptionKey for the subscription, which must already exist in the registry. In order to track services that are modeled in UDDI, serveral subscriptions may be required if, for example, you wish to receive updates for both the service and tModel components. All of these subscriptions must use the same Username and Password.

property.name: Username
property.summary: Username
property.description: The username used to authenticate with the Registry.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password
property.description: The password used to authenticate with the Registry. Enter the password twice to confirm its accuracy.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password Alias
property.description: The password alias of the password used for authentication with the Registry.

description.p: The UDDI subscription is deprecated. Instead, use WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) subscription.

Configuration required for a UDDI subscriber to receive notifications from a UDDI Server. In addition to configuring the UDDI Subscription, you must also enable UDDI Subscription as a service in the configuration of the XML Management Interface in the default domain.
Web Service Proxies are automatically built and updated based on the UDDI subscription. Web Service Proxy virtualizes the Web Service endpoints detailed in the WSDLs returned by the subscription.
Specifies the WSRR Server that stores the saved searches, WSRR resources, and possibly associated XSD or XML files, required for WS-Proxy operations.
Specifies the name of an existing saved search or named query on the WSRR server that returns the subscribed-to resource.

Specifies the parameters for the saved search or named query that requires parameters. The parameters are used in the query that is sent to the WSRR server. A parameter can be up to 255 characters in length. You can define a maximum of 9 parameters for a query. If a saved search or named query requires query parameters, you must specify the required parameters. It is an error to define parameters for a saved search or named query that does not require parameters.

Note: In WSRR, a named query and a saved search can have the same name. WSRR matches named queries before saved searches. Therefore, WSRR never finds a saved search with the same name as a named query.

See the WebSphere Service Registry and Repository information center for information about creating a saved search or named query with parameters or modifying an existing saved search or named query to accept parameters.
Specifies the method for synchronizing updates from the saved search result set stored on the remote WSRR server.
Specify the refresh interval in seconds. Enter any value of 60 - 4294967. The default is 86400.

Used only with the Poll method, the refresh interval is the interval in seconds between regularly-scheduled WSRR queries used to synchronize updates from the saved search result set stored on the remote WSRR server.
Specify the auto renewal interval in days of WSRR event notification registrations to WSRR server.

Used only with the Automatic method, the auto-renewal interval is the internal interval in days that appliance will renew WSRR event notification registration which is needed to receive event notifications from WSRR server of changes to registry documents being monitored.
Fetch attached policy from the registry.

If enabled, the subscription will query the registry for external WS-Policy PolicyAttachments that apply to the retrieved WSRR resources. Retrieved policies will be processed by any DataPower service that is using this subscription and is configured to allow external policy attachments.
Use this screen to provide the required configuration properties for a WSRR (WebSphere Service Registry and Repository) saved search subscription.

The Saved Search Subscription is useful when you want to deploy services with an indirect reference to a set of WSRR resources required for DataPower service operations. The configuration requires a reference to a WSRR server and the name of an existing saved search or named query from the WSRR server. The management of the service documents is controlled from the WSRR server.

DataPower services associated with the saved search subscription are updated based on the synchronization method specified in the subscription. A DataPower service virtualizes the service bindings based on the WSRR resources returned by executing the configured saved search.
Use the values-list, a list of all WSRR server objects, to identify the WSRR Server that stores the WSRR resources, and possibly associated XSD or XML files, required for WS-Proxy operations.
Use the Namespace property in conjunction with the Object Name property to unambiguously identify the subscribed-to WSSR resource.

Both the resource namespace and name are assigned when a resource is first loaded to a WSRR, or when a collection of resources is aggregated as a concept.If the namespace is specified, it must mach the Namespace on WSRR.

property.name: ObjectType
property.description: Select the WSRR resource type.

description.p: Use the Object Name property in conjunction with the Namespace property to unambiguously identify the subscribed-to WSSR resource.
Both the resource name and namespace are assigned when a resource, such as a WSDL file, is first loaded to a WSRR, or when a collection of resources is aggregated as a concept.

property.name: Method
property.description: Select the method to synchronize the the local copy of the subscribed object with the version stored on the remote WSRR server.

description.p: Specify the refresh interval in seconds.

Used only with the Poll method, the refresh interval is the interval in seconds between regularly-scheduled WSRR queries used to synchronize the local copy of the subscribed resource with the WSSR-resident version.
Specify the auto renewal interval in days of WSRR event notification registrations to WSRR server.

Used only with the Automatic method, the auto-renewal interval is the internal interval in days that appliance will renew WSRR event notification registration which is needed to receive event notifications from WSRR server of changes to registry documents being monitored.
Use the version field of the WSRR resurce provided by WSRR
If enabled, the subscription will query the registry for version specified in the Object Version field. Otherwise, it will not use the version field.
This field needs to be enabled when more than one version of the object exists on the WSRR server

property.name: ObjectVersion
property.description: Version of the WSRR resource that applies to this subscription.
property.label: WSDL version

description.p: Fetch attached policy from the registry.

If enabled, the subscription will query the registry for external WS-Policy PolicyAttachments that apply to the retrieved WSRR resources. Retrieved policies will be processed by any WS-Proxy that is using this subscription and is configured to allow external policy attachments.
Use this screen to provide the required configuration properties for a WSRR (WebSphere Service Registry and Repository) subscription.
