The WSRR Subscription is useful when you want to deploy web services with a direct reference to a service document required for DataPower service operations. The configuration requires the reference to a WSRR server, the name of the WSRR resource, and its namespace. If there is more than one version of the service document, you must specify the version to reference.

DataPower services associated with the subscription are updated based on the synchronization method specified in the subscription. A DataPower service stores a local copy of the subscribed object. Changes performed on the WSRR server to service document attributes such as the name of the WSRR resource, namespace, or version will require updating the WSRR Subscription.
For an indirect reference to a set of WSRR resources see WSRR Saved Search Subscription.

object.name: WebTokenService

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Specify the descriptive comment
property.description: Specify a brief, descriptive comment.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Set the service-level priority
property.description: Set the service-level priority. When resources are in high demand, the appliance handles transactions for higher priority services over lower priority services.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: Assign the XML manager
property.description: Assign the XML manager that obtains and manages documents on behalf of the service. The user agent, which is referenced by this XML manager, controls access to remote destinations. Unless you have service-specific needs, use the default XML manager.

property.name: RequestType
property.summary: Characterize client-originated traffic
property.description: Characterizes the traffic that originates from the client. The default is Non-XML.

property.name: FrontSide
property.summary: Define addresses and ports that the service listens on
property.description: Define the addresses and ports that the service listens on. You can define listening sources for HTTP and HTTPS requests. For HTTPS request, set the listening source to use SSL parameter and assign the SSL profile.

property.name: StylePolicy
property.summary: Assign the processing policy
property.description: Assign the processing policy to the service. The processing policy defines the actions to perform on security token requests.

property.name: RewriteErrors
property.summary: Whether to rewrite error messages to avoid providing a padding oracle.
property.description: Error messages after a decryption action can provide an attacker who is using the padding oracle attack method with enough information to determine the contents of the plain-text data. When enabled, the default, the client receives error messages without the internal information that could lead to a discovery. When disabled, the client receives the original message with this information.

property.name: DelayErrors
property.summary: Whether to delay error messages to avoid providing a padding oracle.
property.description: The timing difference of the error messages returned after a decryption action can provide an attacker with enough information to determine the contents of the plain-text data. When enabled, the default, the appliance delays error messages for the defined duration. When disabled, the appliance does not delay error messages.

property.name: DelayErrorsDuration
property.summary: How long to delay error messages from the start of the transaction.
property.description: When enabling the delay of error messages, specify the delay duration in milliseconds (ms). If delaying messages for 3000 ms, the appliance will not send error messages to the client until 3 seconds have elapsed since the appliance performed decryption on the requests. Enter any value in the range 250 - 300000. The default value is 1000.

property.name: FrontTimeout
property.summary: Set the intra-transaction timeout for service-to-client connections
property.description: Set the intra-transaction timeout for service-to-client connections. This value is the maximum idle time to allow in a transaction on the service-to-client connection. This timer monitors idle time in the data transfer process. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 120.

property.name: FrontPersistentTimeout
property.summary: Set the inter-transaction timeout for service-to-client connections
property.description: Set the inter-transaction timeout for service-to-client connections. This value is the maximum idle time to allow between the completion of a TCP transaction and the initiation of a new TCP transaction on the service-to-client connection. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 180. A value of 0 disables persistent connections.

property.name: FrontHTTPVersion
property.summary: Set the HTTP version for client-to-service connections
property.description: Set the HTTP version for client-to-service connections. If the client submits an HTTP 1.0 request, the service on the DataPower appliance always replies with HTTP 1.0 compatible responses regardless of this setting. The default version is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: HTTPClientIPLabel
property.summary: Set the HTTP header that contains the client IP address
property.description: Set the HTTP header that contains the client IP address. When defined, the client IP address is read from this HTTP header. This IP address will then be used for monitoring and logging. Retain the default value X-Client-IP or specify another value; for example, X-Forwarded-For .

property.name: HTTPLogCorIDLabel
property.summary: HTTP header label containing global transaction ID
property.description: Enter the name of an HTTP Header to read to determine the global transaction ID for chained services. This value defaults to X-Global-Transaction-ID.

property.name: DebugMode
property.summary: Controls transaction diagnostic mode

description.p: Select the diagnostic mode for processing policies. When enabled, you can view details about the state of variables and contexts for a captured transaction in the probe. The default value is off .
Transaction diagnostic mode is not intended for use in a production environment. Transaction diagnostic mode consumes significant resources that can slow down transaction processing.

property.name: DebuggerURL
property.summary: External Server URL
property.description: Configures the URL for external probe mode

property.name: DebugHistory
property.summary: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe
property.description: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe. Enter a value in the range 10 - 250. The default value is 25.

property-group.name: ProbeSettings
property-group.description: The probe allows service developers to view the value of variables and the contents of processing contexts. The developer can step through each action for any given transaction.

object.description: The web token service provides on-box HTTP services.

object.name: WSEndpointRewritePolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: WSEndpointLocalRewriteRule
property.description: Add, edit, or delete a local endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in a deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should use locally for matched services. They convert addresses in WSDL files to local endpoints.

property.name: WSEndpointRemoteRewriteRule
property.description: Add, edit, or delete a remote endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should use remotely for matched services. They convert address in WSDL files to remote endpoints.

property.name: WSEndpointPublishRewriteRule
property.description: Add, edit, or delete a publish endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should publish when producing its own WSDL files. Use this if you wish to publish an address different from the local address, for example the address of a load balancer in front of appliance.

property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionLocalRule
property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.

property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionRemoteRule
property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.

property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionPublishRule
property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.

object.summary: Create or edit WS Endpoint Rewrite Policies
object.description: Create or edit WS Endpoint Rewrite Policy

object.name: WSRRServer

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: SoapURL
property.summary: URL of the WSRR SOAP API endpoint.
property.description: The URL used to communicate with the Registry via WSRR SOAP API. A typical default looks like https://192.18.1.120:9443/WSRRCoreSDO/services/WSRRCoreSDOPort or http://192.18.1.120:9080/WSRRCoreSDO/services/WSRRCoreSDOPort depending on whether WebSphere global security is enabled.

property.name: ServerPrefix
property.summary: Prefix of the WSRR server if configured to use one.
property.description: The prefix configured on the WSRR instance.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: You must select SSL proxy profile if you are using SSL (i.e. https) to connect to WSRR server. Either select from the list of existing profiles of click the + button to create a new profile. Select a profile and click the ... button to edit an existing profile.

property.name: Username
property.summary: Username
property.description: The username used to login to the WSRR server. Leave this field empty if authentication is not required.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password
property.description: The password used to login to the WSRR server. Leave this field empty if authentication is not required.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password Alias
property.description: The password alias of the password used to login to the WSRR server. Leave this field empty if authentication is not required.

property.name: WSRRVersion
property.summary: WSRR Server Version
property.description: The WSRR server version.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

object.description: Configuration required to locate and access WSRR (WebSphere Service Registry and Repository).

object.name: WSStylePolicy

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.
property.description: Enter a comment. This appears on the Policy catalog page.

property.name: DefStylesheetForSoap
property.summary: Identify the default stylesheet used for SOAP filtering.
property.description: Identify the default stylesheet used for SOAP filtering. The default rejects all SOAP documents.

property.name: DefStylesheetForXsl
property.summary: Identify the default stylesheet used for XSL transformation
property.description: Identify the default stylesheet used for XSL transformation. The default mirrors all documents.

property.name: PolicyMaps
property.description: A list of Policy Rules and corresponding Matching Rules that this policy will execute. If a Match is found, the corresponding Rule runs. The policy executes the first Rule with a successful Match. The order in this list is therefore important.

object.description: Create, Edit or Delete a Processing Policy. A policy consists of one or more Processing Rules. Rules execute depending upon the direction of the message and on whether or not a corresponding matching rule selects the document for processing. A service may have only one policy active at a time. Click Services in the left-hand navigation menu and then click the appropriate policy link to use the graphical interface to create and edit policies.

object.name: XMLManager

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: An SSL proxy
property.description: Optionally assigns an SSL proxy to the XML manager. The proxy will be used as an SSL helper by the manager, and may also be used as a default SSL proxy when fetching documents over SSL and there is no explicit matching ssl policy in the User Agent Configuration. This parameter can not be modified after the XML Manager has been created.

property.name: URLRefreshPolicy
property.summary: A Stylesheet refresh policy
property.description: Optionally, assigns a Stylesheet Refresh Policy to the XML manager. Stylesheets cached by this manager will be refreshed in accordance with policy rules.

property.name: CompileOptionsPolicy
property.summary: The Compile Options Policy assigned to this XML Manager
property.description:
Optionally, assigns a Compilation Options Policy to the XML Manager. Stylesheets cached by this manager will be compiled in accordance with policy rules. Compile Options allow the administrator to turn on and off profiling and debug modes, which are helpful during development and troubleshooting sessions. Profiling and debug modes should not be left on for production purposes.
Compile Options Policy also enables streaming mode , which may be an excellent choice for production environments that regularly encounter very large documents.

property.name: CacheSize
property.summary: Maximum number of style sheets in XSL Cache
property.description: Enter the maximum number of style sheets in the XSL cache. Enter a value in the range 5 - 250000. The default value is 256.

property.name: SHA1Caching
property.summary: Enable/disable SHA1-assisted caching
property.description: Enables/disables SHA1-assisted stylesheet caching. With SHA1 caching enabled, stylsheets are cached by both URL and SHA1 message digest value. With SHA1 caching disabled, stylesheets are cached only by URL.

property.name: StaticDocumentCalls
property.summary: Enable/disable static document calls
property.description: The latest XSLT specifications require that multiple document calls in the same transformation return the same result. Click off to disable this standard behavior and allow all document calls to operate independently.

property.name: SearchResults
property.summary: XSLT expression optimization
property.description: Configures optimization of '//' in XPath expressions

property.name: SupportTxWarn
property.summary: Enables the support of WTX warning conditions
property.description: Enables the XML manager to support WTX warning conditions. The appliance sets the warning message to the "var:///service/multistep/tx-warn" variable and continues the map processing when encountering a warning condition.

property.name: VirtualServers
property.summary: Load Balancer Groups
property.description: Select a Load Balancer Group and assign that group to this XML manager. A Load Balancer Group, or server pool, provides redundancy among backside resources.

property.name: Memoization
property.summary: XSLT Memoization Optimization
property.description: Configures optimization of invariant XPath expressions.

property.name: ExtensionFunctions
property.summary: Defines XSLT extension functions
property.description: Defines a mapping for XSLT extension functions used in custom stylesheets to DataPower-defined extension functions. The most common example is the node-set extension function, offered by several vendors. A namespace-function pair is mapped to the DataPower-supported namespaces (including exslt) and function.

property.name: ParserLimitsBytesScanned
property.summary: XML parser maximum bytes scanned
property.description: Enter the maximum number of bytes scanned in one message. This property applies to any XML document that is parsed. If the value is 0, no limit is enforced. The default value is 4194304.

property.name: ParserLimitsElementDepth
property.summary: XML parser maximum element depth
property.description: Enter the maximum depth of element nesting in XML parser. The default value is 512.

property.name: ParserLimitsAttributeCount
property.summary: XML parser maximum attribute count
property.description: Enter the maximum number of attributes of a given element. The default value is 128.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxNodeSize
property.summary: XML parser maximum node size
property.description: Enter the maximum size that any one node can consume. Enter a value in the range 1024 - 4294967295. The default value is 33554432. Sizes which are powers of two result in the best performance. Although you define a value, the appliance uses a value that is the rounded-down to the largest power of two that is smaller than the defined value.

property.name: ParserLimitsForbidExternalReferences
property.summary: XML parser forbid external references toggle
property.description: Defines if the XML parser will abort when an input document specifies to resolve an external reference such as an external entity or external DTD definition.

property.name: ParserLimitsExternalReferences
property.summary: Special handling for external references in XML
property.description: Select the special handling for input documents that contain external references, such as an external entity or external DTD definition.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxPrefixes
property.summary: XML parser maximum distinct prefixes
property.description: Enter the maximum number of distinct XML namespace prefixes in a document. This limit counts multiple prefixes defined for the same namespace, but does not count multiple namespaces defined in different parts of the input document under a single prefix. Enter a value in the range 0 - 262143. The default value is 1024. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 1024.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxNamespaces
property.summary: XML parser maximum distinct namespaces
property.description: Enter the maximum number of distinct XML namespace URIs in a document. This limit counts all XML namespaces, regardless of how many prefixes are used to declare them. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 1024. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 1024.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxLocalNames
property.summary: XML parser maximum distinct local names
property.description: Enter the maximum number of distinct XML local names in a document. This limit counts all local names, independent of the namespaces they are associated with. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1048575. The default value is 60000. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 60000.

property.name: DocCacheMaxDocs
property.summary: Maximum number of documents cached
property.description: Enter the maximum number of documents to cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 250000. The default value is 5000.

property.name: DocCacheSize
property.summary: Maximum size of document cache
property.description: Enter the maximum size of the document cache. Regardless of the specified size, no document that is greater than 1073741824 bytes is cached. This restriction applies even if the cache has available space.

property.name: DocMaxWrites
property.summary: Maximum number of concurrent writes to create documents in the cache
property.description: Enter the maximum number of concurrent write requests to create documents or refresh expired documents in the document cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 32768. The default value is 32768. After the maximum number is reached, requests are forwarded to the target server and the response is not written to the cache.

property.name: DocCachePolicy
property.summary: Document Cache Policy
property.description: A document cache policy allows the administrator to determine how documents are cached by the XML manager. The policy offers time-to-live, priority, and type configuration values. This document cache is distinct from the stylesheet cache for the XML manager. Documents and style sheets that the XML manager retrieves can be cached.

property.name: SchemaValidation
property.summary: Schema validation rules to apply to all input documents for this manager

property.name: ScheduledRule
property.summary: Run a processing policy rule periodically.
property.description: Certain applications might require the running of a scheduled processing rule. Integration with a CA Unicenter Manager is facilitated by a regularly scheduled processing rule that obtains relationship data from the Unicenter Manager.

property.name: UserAgent
property.summary: Specify the user agent configuration to use.
property.description: Identifies the User Agent configuration the XML manager uses to connect to external servers to retrieve resources.

property.name: JSONParserSettings
property.summary: Specify the JSON Settings to use when processing JSON content
property.description: Identifies the JSON Settings used by the XML manager when processing a JSON body. If no JSON Settings are specified, the default limits are enforced.

property.name: DFDLSettingsReference
property.summary: Specify the DFDL Settings to use when processing binary content with DFDL schemas.
property.description: Identifies the DFDL Settings used by the XML manager when processing data as understood by a DFDL schema. The reference to a DFDL Settings object on the Style Policy Action can override this setting. If no DFDL Settings are specified on both objects, the default values are applied.

property.name: LDAPConnPool
property.summary: Specify the LDAP Connection Pool to use
property.description: Identifies the LDAP connection pool to be used by the XML Manager when contacting LDAP

property-group.name: xmlparser
property-group.on-glass: These settings do not impact resource allocation. These settings are used only as part of threat protection.

object.description: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of stylesheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy. More than one firewall may use the same XML Manager.

object.name: xmltrace

property.name: Mode
property.summary: File Capture Mode
property.description: Selects the File Capturing diagnostic mode. The default is None.

object.description: The device can record all, or a subset, of documents that pass through it for later inspection. This should not be turned on in production environments except for problem resolution. File capture can fill the available storage space. Files are cycled FIFO when the available space is exhausted.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address

description.p: Specify the IPv4 or IPv6 address or the host alias on which the Target Control Service listens. The default of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all IPv4 addresses.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Local TCP port for the Target Control Service

description.p: Specify the port on which the Target Control Service listens. Defaults to 1702. Use any value of 1 - 65535.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile.

description.p: Specify an SSL Proxy Profile to control support of SSL/TLS encryption by this Target Control Service.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: the SSL server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance
property.description: The SSL SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the appliance.

description.p: The Sysplex Distributor Target Control Service on the DataPower appliance establishes control connections with the z/OS Sysplex Distributor that allow the z/OS Sysplex Distributor to intelligently distribute traffic across multiple DataPower appliances.

Multiple z/OS Sysplex Distributors can establish control connections to the single Sysplex Distributor Target Control Service on the DataPower appliance. When the Sysplex Distributor Target Control Service is disabled, existing z/OS Sysplex Distributor control connections are closed.

Ensure that the reverse path filtering property for Network Settings is not selected. If you allow reverse path filtering, the interface cannot correctly route requests from the Sysplex Distributor to use the Target Control Server.

object.name: ZosNSSClient

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.description: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: IP address or hostname of the NSS server
property.description: Specifies IP address or host name of the NSS server. In conjunction with the Remote Port, identifies the host and listening port of the NSS server. The NSS server must have the XMLAppliance discipline support enabled.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: NSS server port
property.description: Specifies NSS server port. In conjunction with the Remote Address, identifies the host and listening port of the NSS server.

property.name: ssl
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.

description.p: Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list to assign the SSL proxy profile to use for a secure connection.
To create a new SSL Proxy Profile, click the + button. To edit an existing SSL Proxy Profile, click the ... button.

property.name: ClientID
property.summary: Specifies the Client ID for registration with the NSS server.

description.p: Specifies the client ID to be used for registration with the NSS server. Minimum length is 1. Maximum length is 24.
Valid characters are:

ul.li: a through z
A through Z
0 through 9
_ (underscore)
- (dash)

description.p: Embedded spaces are invalid.
The Client ID identifies the client ID to register the appliance with the NSS server. The NSS client ID is a unique string used by the NSS Server to track clients.

The Client ID does not have to correspond to any preexisting object. It is provided to the server at the time of registration. If another client attempts to register with the same client ID to the same NSS Server, the NSS server will send a heartbeat to the first client. If the first client responds to the heartbeat, the second client's registration will be rejected. If the first client does not respond, the connect to the first client will be severed and the second client will be registered.

property.name: SystemName
property.summary: Specifies a name that identifies the NSS client to the NSS server.

description.p: Specifies a name for the NSS client. Minimum length is 1. Maximum length is 8.
Valid characters are:

ul.li: a through z
A through Z
0 through 9
_ (underscore)
- (dash)

description.p: Embedded spaces are invalid.
The System Name identifies the NSS client to the NSS server. NSS server commands identify NSS clients by system name in the output when displaying information for connected NSS clients.

property.name: UserName
property.summary: Specifies a user name to authenticate as in SAF on the NSS server

description.p: Specifies a user name to use to authenticate to the NSS server. Minimum length is 1. Maximum length is 8.
Valid characters are:

ul.li: a through z
A through Z
0 through 9
_ (underscore)
- (dash)

description.p: Embedded spaces are invalid.
The user name must match an existing user ID on the NSS Server.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password to use to authenticate to NSS

description.p: Specifies the password to use to authenticate to the NSS server. Minimum length is 1. Maximum length is 8.
Valid characters are:

ul.li: a through z
A through Z
0 through 9
_ (underscore)
- (dash)

description.p: Embedded spaces are invalid.
The Password specifies the password to use in conjunction with the value provided by the User Name.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password Alias of the password to use to authenticate to NSS

description.p: Specifies the password alias of the password to use to authenticate to the NSS server.
The associated password is used in conjunction with the value provided by the User Name.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and the NSS server
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and the NSS server.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and the NSS server
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and the NSS server.

object.description: The z/OS NSS client object provides the parameters for authentication with SAF on a z/OS Communications Server.

object.name: ActiveUsers

property.name: session
property.summary: System-assigned session ID
property.description: A system-assigned session identifier.

property.name: name
property.summary: User name
property.description: Username presented during login.

property.name: connection
property.summary: The method used to connect to the device.
property.description: The method used to connect to the device, such as web-gui (using a browser), cli (through telnet or ssh), or serial (via a serial cable).

property.name: address
property.summary: The IP address of the user's client machine.
property.description: The IP address of the user's client machine. Not valid for serial connections.

property.name: login
property.summary: Time of login
property.description: Time of login.

property.name: domain
property.summary: Application domain
property.description: Application domain for this user session.

object.description: This is a list of all users currently logged into the device.

object.name: ARPStatus

property.name: IPAddress
property.summary: IP address of the network interface node.
property.description: The IP address of the network interface node corresponding to the MAC address listed in this ARP entry.

property.name: HardwareAddress
property.summary: MAC address of the network interface node.
property.description: The MAC address of this network interface node.

property.name: Interface
property.summary: Device interface
property.description: The device network interface (such as eth0, eth1) to which this ARP entry corresponds. If the entry is on a VLAN, this is the Ethernet interface that VLAN is on.

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: Device interface type
property.description: The type of the interface this ARP entry is on. Ethernet indicates that it is on the base Ethernet MAC interface. VLAN indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

property.name: VlanName
property.summary: The name of the VLAN the ARP entry is on.
property.description: If this ARP entry is on a VLAN, this is the name of that VLAN.

object.description: Status of ARP translations on all interfaces, both Ethernet and VLAN. Only complete ARP entries are shown.

object.name: B2BHighAvailabilityStatus

property.name: PersistenceState
property.summary: Current state of the persistence store replication state machine
property.description: Lists the current state of the persistence store state machine.

property.name: ConnectionStatus
property.summary: Current status of the connection to the backup appliance managed by the persistence store.
property.description: Lists the current status of the connection to the backup appliance managed by the persistence store.

object.description: Displays the status of the high availability configuration of the B2B persistence store.

object.name: B2BMessageArchiveStatus

property.name: GatewayName
property.summary: Name of the B2B gateway
property.description: Lists the name of each instance of the B2B Gateway object in the current domain.

property.name: OperationMode
property.summary: Type of operation
property.description: Lists the type of operation last performed for the specific gateway. The value can be Archive & Purge or Purge Only .

property.name: Trigger
property.summary: Trigger for the operation
property.description:
Lists whether the system or an administrator triggered the operation.
If by the system, the value is Auto followed by the criteria for the trigger (date or size).
If by an administrator, the value is Manual .

property.name: StartTime
property.summary: Start time of the operation
property.description: Lists the timestamp when the operation started; for example, Thu Mar 12 12:58:59 2009 . If value is populated when requested. If no operation previously requested, lists N/A .

property.name: EndTime
property.summary: End time for the operation
property.description: Lists the timestamp when the operation finished; for example, Thu Mar 12 13:01:12 2009 . If value is populated when requested. If no operation previously requested, lists N/A .

property.name: Status
property.summary: Status of the operation
property.description:
Lists the status of the operation, which can be one of the following values:
Completed -- The operation completed successfully. The operation is complete when the values in the Records Processed and File Processed columns report 100%.
Processing -- The operation is currently processing.
Failed ( code ): ' reason ' -- The operation failed for the reason defined by the code.

property.name: RecordsProcessed
property.summary: Number of records processed
property.description: Lists the number of records processed by the operation. The value is percentage complete and records processed; for example, 17% (50 of 300) .

property.name: FilesProcessed
property.summary: Amount of file data processed
property.description: Lists the amount of file data processed by the operation. The value is percentage complete and kilobytes processed; for example, 6% (300KB of 5000KB) .

object.description: Displays the status of the expiration operation for each B2B gateway in the domain.

object.name: CryptoEngineStatus

property.name: EngineType
property.summary: The crypto accelerator type.
property.description: The hardware type that is installed. Type 2 is a pure accelerator. HSM, which is a module for secure storage of private keys, also performs on-board cryptographic operations.

property.name: EngineStatus
property.summary: The crypto accelerator status.
property.description: A status message from the accelerator. If the message is "HSM is uninitialized", you must initialize the HSM into one of the two FIPS 140-2 levels before you can use it.

property.name: FIPSLevel
property.summary: Crypto accelerator FIPS 140-2 level.
property.description: This information is applicable only to an appliance that has an HSM attached. Not initialized applies if the status message is "HSM is uninitialized". Levels 2 and 3 refer to the FIPS 140-2 level to which the HSM is initialized.

property.name: FIPSRole
property.summary: Crypto accelerator FIPS 140-2 role.
property.description: This information is applicable only to an appliance that has an HSM attached. The HSM role that the appliance has assumed. Appliances with an HSM of type hsm1 never assume the role of Crypto Officer. Appliances with an HSM of type hsm2 need to assume the role of Crypto Officer in order to execute KWK cloning. All other operations require the role of Crypto User.

property.name: DisableAmount
property.summary: How much of the crypto hardware is diabled.
property.description: Parts of the cryptographic hardware functionality may be be disabled either at user request or by entering certain crypto modes. This field shows what cryptographic hardware functionality is currently disabled.

object.description: This provider lists the type, status, and FIPS 140-2 level of the crypto accelerator.

property.name: EngineType
property.summary: The crypto accelerator type.
property.description: The hardware type that is installed. Type 2 is a pure accelerator. HSM, which is a module for secure storage of private keys, also performs on-board cryptographic operations.

property.name: EngineStatus

property.name: FIPSLevel

property.description: This information is applicable only to an appliance that has an HSM attached. The HSM role that the appliance has assumed. Appliances with an HSM of type hsm1 never assume the role of Crypto Officer. Appliances with an HSM of type hsm2 need to assume the role of Crypto Officer in order to execute KWK cloning. All other operations require the role of Crypto User.

property.name: DisableAmount

object.name: CryptoHwDisableStatus

property.name: TargetDisableAmount
property.summary: Target current disablement mode of cryptographic hardware
property.description: Indicates the aspects of the cryptographic hardware that are expected to be currently disabled after the previous firmware reload.

property.name: ActualDisableAmount
property.summary: Actual current disablement mode of cryptographic hardware
property.description: Indicates the aspects of the cryptographic hardware that are actually disabled now. Current disablement mode should be equivalent to the target disablement mode unless a problem occurred during the previous firmware reload.

property.name: PendingTargetDisableAmount
property.summary: Target disablement mode of cryptographic hardware for next firmware reload
property.description: Indicates the aspects of the cryptographic hardware that are expected to be disabled after the next firmware reload.

object.description: This table provides status about cryptographic hardware disablement.

object.name: CryptoModeStatus

property.name: TargetMode
property.summary: Target current cryptographic mode
property.description: Indicates the cryptographic mode that the firmware is expected to be running in currently. This is the mode that is requested in the previous run of the firmware and this mode is expected to take effect at the previous firmware reload.

property.name: ActualMode
property.summary: Actual current cryptographic mode
property.description: Indicates the cryptographic mode that the firmware is actually running in. The current mode should be equivalent to the target mode unless a problem occurred during the previous firmware reload.

property.name: PendingTargetMode
property.summary: Target cryptographic mode for next firmware reload
property.description: Indicates the cryptographic mode that the firmware is expected to run in after the next firmware reload.

object.description: This table provides status about the appliance-wide cryptographic mode.

object.name: CurrentSensors

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the current sensor.
property.description: The name of the current sensor that is being monitored.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The most recent current reading.
property.description: The most recent reading of the current sensor in milliamperes. There are only three significant digits.

property.name: UpperCriticalThreshold
property.summary: The maximum allowable current reading.
property.description: The maximum allowable reading of the current sensor in milliamperes.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.summary: Status of the current reading.
property.description: An indicator of whether the current reading is OK or the reading exceeds the upper critical threshold. If the status is not OK, check whether the temperature is too high or the fan does not work. If the temperature is normal and the fan works, the appliance must have failed. Replace the appliance.

object.description: Sensors that read electrical currents, from the power supplies and other components of the appliance.

object.name: DateTimeStatus

property.name: time
property.summary: Current local time.
property.description: The current local time. This time is obtained from the timezone settings established on the Time Settings object and with the date and time settings set on the System Control page.

property.name: uptime
property.summary: The time in seconds since the last reload or reboot.
property.description: The total amount of time the appliance has been up since the last reload or reboot. Note that a shutdown and reload resets this counter.

property.name: timezone
property.summary: The name of the current effective time zone.
property.description: The name of the time zone currently in effect, as set on the Time Settings page.

property.name: tzspec
property.summary: POSIX.1 timezone specification string.
property.description: The POSIX.1 timezone specification. See time settings for more information.

property.name: bootuptime
property.summary: The time in seconds that the appliance has been up since the last reboot.
property.description: The total amount of time in seconds since the last reboot. Note that this counter is reset by a shutdown and reboot , but not by a shutdown and reload .

property.name: uptime2
property.summary: The time in seconds since the last reload or reboot.
property.description: The total amount of time the appliance has been up since the last reload or reboot. Note that a shutdown and reload resets this counter.

property.name: bootuptime2
property.summary: The time in seconds that the appliance has been up since the last reboot.
property.description: The total amount of time in seconds since the last reboot. Note that this counter is reset by a shutdown and reboot , but not by a shutdown and reload .

object.description: Date and time information. The uptime: reload and uptime: reboot values differ significantly if the system has undergone a reload since the last reboot.

object.name: DebugActionStatus

property.name: ID
property.summary: Session ID
property.description: The session identifier uniquely identifes a debug session.

property.name: Transaction
property.summary: Transaction ID
property.description: The transaction identifier matches the "tid" that can be found in the system log.

property.name: Service
property.summary: Service name
property.description: The service name which the debug session is running in.

property.name: Script
property.summary: The file to be debugged
property.description: The file location specifies the stylesheet or script to be debuged.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Source IP address
property.description: The remote address shows the source IP address of the transaction that activates the debugger.

property.name: InUse
property.summary: Debug session status
property.description: Each debug session can have one connection. The In Use property indicates whether there is an active connection attached to the session.

property.name: User
property.summary: The user who is connecting to the debug session.
property.description: If the session is in use, the Remote User shows the name of the user who is connecting to this session.

property.name: From
property.summary: IP address of the debugging user.
property.description: If the session is in use, the User Location shows the IP address of the remote user.

property.name: ElapsedTime
property.summary: Elapsed time in seconds
property.description: The elapsed time specifies the time in seconds that has elapsed since the debug session started.

object.description: This status provider lists the active debug sessions in the current domain or in all domains.

object.name: DNSNameServerStatus

property.name: IPAddress
property.summary: IP address of the DNS server
property.description: The numeric IP address for any DNS server that is configured for use on this appliance.

property.name: UDPPort
property.summary: UDP port of the DNS server
property.description: The UDP port number of the DNS server. (The default DNS UDP port is 53.) When the load balancing algorithm is first alive, this value is ignored.

property.name: TCPPort
property.summary: The TCP port of the DNS server
property.description: The TCP port number of the DNS server. (The default DNS TCP port is also 53.) When the load balancing algorithm is first alive, this value is ignored.

property.name: MaxRetries
property.summary: Number of connection retries to DNS target before failure is reported
property.description: The maximum number of lookup requests that are sent to a given DNS name server before a connection failure is reported. However, if the load balancing algorithm is first alive, the individual host uses the top-level retry setting from DNS settings.

object.summary: A list of configured and acquired name servers.

object.name: DNSSearchDomainStatus

property.name: SearchDomain
property.summary: Configured and acquired domain names
property.description: A list of configured and acquired domain names. The list is used if a partial host name is submitted to the DNS service. Each domain name is appended to the partial host name, and a DNS host name lookup is attempted for the host.domain pair until a name lookup succeeds or until the list is exhausted.

object.summary: List of configured and acquired search domains.

property.name: DiagEnabled
property.summary: Indicates whether diagnostic tracing is enabled.
property.description: Indicates whether diagnostic tracing is enabled. Note that diagnostic tracing applies to all domains.

property.name: CurrentCommand
property.summary: Lists commands currently running on the domain.
property.description:
Provides a list of commands that are currently running on the domain. Use this column to confirm whether long-running commands have completed. Possible values are:
no value - there are no commands running on the domain.
no domain - an Application Domain object is being deleted.
restart domain - the domain is being restored to a state defined in a saved configuration file.
reset domain - objects in the domain configuration are being deleted.
write memswitch - the configuration is being saved.
import-execute - importing an Import Package object.
exec - a configuration script is running.
domain - the domain is being created.
backup - an archive of configuration data is being generated.
save chkpoint - a checkpoint configuration file is being generated.
test schema - an XML file is being tested against a schema.
umount - a file system is being unmounted.
configuring - the domain is being configured.
secure-backup - the domain is being securely backed up.
secure-restore - the domain is being restored from a secure backup.

property.name: QuiesceState
property.summary: Indicates the quiesce state of the domain.
property.description:
Indicates the quiesce state of the domain. Individually quiesced services within a domain are not reported here. Possible values are:
Quiesce not in progress - this is the default status if the system is not quiesced. This will also be the status if individual services within the domain have been quiesced but the domain has not been quiesced.
Stopping new connections - the domain is being quiesced. Note that this state is only briefly active.
Waiting for persistent connections to complete - the domain is waiting for existing connections to complete before entering the Quiesced state. Note that a timeout value is associated with the quiesce domain request. If the timeout value is reached before the existing connections complete then the domain will be forced into the Quiesced state.
Waiting for services to stop The domain is waiting for all the services and protocols to reach an operational state of down .
Quiesced - the domain is quiesced. The operational states of the domain and its services are down . If the entire device is quiesced: all domains are in the Quiesced state, all non-default domains have an operational state of down , and new services in all non-default domains will not accept requests.
Unquiesce started - the domain has begun to start up from a quiesced state.
Unquiesce done - the domain is up and running after being quiesced. After a brief time this state will change to Quiesce not in progress .
Error - there has been an error. Report this error to IBM support.
Unknown quiesce state - An internal has occurred, report this to IBM support.

property.name: InterfaceState
property.summary: Indicates the state of the networking interfaces of the appliance.
property.description: Indicates the state of the networking interfaces of the appliance which affects all domains. Connections to only management interfaces is permitted when networking has an invalid configuration. Any values that indicate errors are present means the appliance is in this state and the value gives an indication as to which networking objects require attention. Possible values are:

property.name: FailsafeMode
property.summary: Indicates the failsafe startup mode of the appliance.
property.description: Indicates the failsafe startup mode of the appliance. Failsafe modes are entered after the appliance unexpectedly restarts one or more times. Until you correct the problem, the appliance cannot accept and process client requests. Contact IBM support. Possible values are:

property.summary: The minimum allowable fan speed.
property.description: The lowest allowable reading of the fan speed sensor.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.summary: Status of the current fan speed reading.
property.description: An indicator of whether the current fan speed is OK or the fan speed is below the lower critical threshold. If the status is not OK, replace the fan (if replacing the fan is applicable on the machine type of the appliance); otherwise, replace the appliance.

property.name: UpperCriticalThreshold
property.summary: The maximum allowable fan speed.
property.description: The highest allowable reading of the fan speed sensor. If the maximum speed for a fan does not exist, no value is displayed.

property.name: InterfaceIndex
property.summary: The SNMP ifIndex
property.description: The value of the SNMP ifIndex column in the ifTable for this interface.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The interface name
property.description: The configuration name of this interface.

property.name: InUnicastPackets
property.summary: Received unicast packets
property.description: The number of unicast packets received on this interface.

property.name: InMulticastPackets
property.summary: Received multicast packets
property.description: The number of multicast packets received on this interface.

property.name: InBroadcastPackets
property.summary: Received broadcast packets
property.description: The number of broadcast packets received on this interface.

property.name: OutUnicastPackets
property.summary: Transmitted unicast packets
property.description: The number of unicast packets transmitted on this interface.

property.name: OutMulticastPackets
property.summary: Transmitted multicast packets
property.description: The number of multicast packets transmitted on this interface.

property.name: OutBroadcastPackets
property.summary: Transmitted broadcast packets
property.description: The number of broadcast packets transmitted on this interface.

property.name: InOctets
property.summary: Received octets
property.description: The number of bytes received on this interface at the MAC level.

property.name: OutOctets
property.summary: Transmitted octets
property.description: The number of bytes transmitted on this interface at the MAC level.

property.name: InErrors
property.summary: Receive errors
property.description: The total number of receive errors on this interface.

property.name: OutErrors
property.summary: Transmit errors
property.description: The total number of transmit errors on this interface.

property.name: OutDiscards
property.summary: Transmit discards
property.description: The number of packets not transmitted for flow control reasons.

property.name: AlignmentErrors
property.summary: Receive alignment errors
property.description: The number of packets received on this interface that were not an integral number of bytes in length.

property.name: FCSErrors
property.summary: Receive checksum errors
property.description: The number of packets received on this interface with an invalid Frame Check Sequence (checksum). This does not include FCS errors on packets that were too long or too short.

property.name: SingleCollisionFrames
property.summary: Transmitted with single collsion
property.description: The number of packets sucessfully transmitted on this interface after a single collision. This can only happen when the interface is running in Half-Duplex mode.

property.name: MultipleCollisionFrames
property.summary: Transmitted with multiple collsions
property.description: The number of packets sucessfully transmitted on this interface after multiple collisions, but less than 16 collisions. This can only happen when the interface is running in Half-Duplex mode.

property.name: SQETestErrors
property.summary: Transmit SQE test errors
property.description: The number of times that an SQE test error was encountered. This only can happen when the link is operating in 10BASE-T Half-Duplex.

property.name: DeferredTransmissions
property.summary: Deferred transmissions
property.description: The number of frames for which the first transmission attempt was deferred because the medium was busy. This can only happen when the interface is running in Half-Duplex mode.

property.name: LateCollisions
property.summary: Late collisions
property.description: The number of times that a collision was detected later than one slot time after the transmission of a packet. This can only happen when the interface is running in Half-Duplex mode.

property.name: ExcessiveCollisions
property.summary: Excessive collisions
property.description: The number of times that transmission of a packet failed because it encountered sixteen collisions in a row. This can only happen when the interface is running in Half-Duplex mode.

property.name: InternalMacTransmitErrors
property.summary: Internal MAC transmit errors
property.description: The number of times that transmission of packets failed due to errors inside the MAC layer of the Ethernet interface. These may be due to temporary resource limitations.

property.name: CarrierSenseErrors
property.summary: Carrier sense errors
property.description: The number transmitted packets during which there were failures of carrier sense. This can only happen when the interface is running in Half-Duplex mode.

property.name: FrameTooShorts
property.summary: Received frame too shorts
property.description: The number of received packets that were shorter than 64 bytes. This can be the result of a collision. Such packages are also known as runts.

property.name: FrameTooLongs
property.summary: Received frame too longs
property.description: The number of received packets that were longer than the configured MTU. This can be the result of a collision, as well as due to incompatible configuration.

property.name: InternalMacReceiveErrors
property.summary: Internal MAC receive errors
property.description: The number of times that reception of packets failed due to errors inside the MAC layer of the Ethernet interface. These may be due to temporary resource limitations.

property.name: InPauseFrames
property.summary: Received pause frames
property.description: The number of pause frames received.

property.name: OutPauseFrames
property.summary: Transmitted pause frames
property.description: The number of pause frames transmitted.

property.description: The number of kilobytes of traffic that the interface received. Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: RxPackets
property.summary: Number of packets received
property.description: The number of packets that the interface received. Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: RxErrors
property.summary: Number of errors encountered during reception
property.description: The number of errors that the interface encountered during reception. Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: RxDrops

When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: TxKbytes
property.summary: Kilobytes of traffic transmitted
property.description: The number of kilobytes of traffic that the interface transmitted. Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: TxPackets
property.summary: Number of packets transmitted
property.description: The number of packets that the interface transmitted. Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: TxErrors
property.summary: Number of transmission errors
property.description: The number of errors that the interface encountered during transmission. When read via SNMP, Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: TxDrops

property.description: The number of packets that the interface dropped during transmission. Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. When read via SNMP, the value type improperly returns Counter64 from release 4.0.1.0 to release 4.0.1.7 and from release 4.0.2.0 to release 4.0.2.3.

property.name: FreeEncrypted
property.summary: Free, or unused and available, encrypted storage space on the device.
property.description: Free, or unused and available, encrypted storage space on the device. All files placed in encrypted storage are automatically encrypted for security by the device.

property.name: TotalEncrypted
property.summary: Total encrypted storage space on the device.
property.description: Total encrypted storage space on the device (the maximum capacity). All files placed in encrypted storage are automatically encrypted for security by the device.

property.name: FreeUnencrypted
property.summary: Free, or unused and available, unencrypted storage space on the device.
property.description: Free, or unused and available, unencrypted storage space on the device. All files placed in unencrypted storage are not encrypted for security by the device.

property.name: TotalUnencrypted
property.summary: Total unencrypted storage space on the device.
property.description: Total unencrypted storage space on the device. All files placed in unencrypted storage are not encrypted for security by the device.

property.name: FreeTemporary
property.summary: Free, or unused and available, temporary storage space on the device.
property.description: Free, or unused and available, temporary storage space on the device. The device uses temporary storage for processing, logging and debugging.

property.name: TotalTemporary
property.summary: Total temporary storage space on the device.
property.description: Total temporary storage space on the device. The device uses temporary storage for processing, logging and debugging.

property.name: FreeInternal
property.summary: Free, or unused and available, internal storage space on the device.
property.description: Free, or unused and available, internal storage space on the device. The device uses internal storage for import, export, firmware upgrades and debug captures.

property.name: TotalInternal
property.summary: Total internal storage space on the device.
property.description: Total internal storage space on the device. The device uses internal storage for import, export, firmware upgrades and debug captures.

object.description: A report of the current usage of storage capacity on the device.

object.description: Transaction rates for services. The rates are integers that represent the number of transactions per second (tps) over the specified time periods. Because of rounding and the 10 second refresh interval, the status provider displays 0 tps for services although these services processed transactions during that time period. Note that the status provider does not include current transactions.

property.summary: Extra information
property.description: Extra information used for some event types.

object.description: This table provides the Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) System Event Log (SEL) events that the Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) collected. The IPMI events pertain to memory errors, out-of-bound sensors, power cycling, restart failures, and other like events. The contents of this status provider are cryptic. This information is primarily for IBM Support and included in error reports. IBM Support can use this information to determine whether there was a hardware failure.

property.name: PoolSizeLimitExceededs

property.name: RejectedConnections

property.name: CurrentConnections

property.name: PeakConnections

object.summary: LDAP connection pool status for this domain.

property.name: ErrorInfo

property.summary: Partition name
property.description: The name of the Luna HSM partition that the DataPower Gateway accesses for cryptographic transactions.

property.name: Latest
property.summary: Latency of last transaction
property.description: The latency of the last transaction in milliseconds.

property.name: Average
property.summary: Average latency of recent transactions
property.description: A decayed average of the last 10 transactions where more weight is applied to the newest transaction. The unit is milliseconds.

property.name: Count
property.summary: Transaction counter
property.description: The number of cryptographic transactions that are processed by the partition.

object.description: Information about the cryptographic transactions that are processed by the Luna HSM partitions.

object.name: MemoryStatus

property.name: Usage
property.summary: The percentage of memory used.
property.description: The instantaneous memory usage as a percentage of the total memory.

property.name: TotalMemory
property.summary: The total memory of the system.
property.description: The total memory of the system in kilobytes. The total memory equals the amount of installed memory minus the amount of reserved memory.

property.name: UsedMemory
property.summary: The amount of memory that is currently in use.
property.description: The amount of memory that is currently in use. The used memory equals the amount of total memory minus the amount of free memory. The used memory does not include any hold memory.

property.name: FreeMemory
property.summary: The amount of memory that is currently not in use.
property.description: The amount of memory that is currently not in use and is therefore available. The free memory value includes any hold memory that is not currently in use.

property.name: ReqMemory
property.summary: The amount of memory requested.
property.description: The amount of memory that has been requested. Requested memory is not reported as used memory until the memory is actually in use.

property.name: XG4Usage
property.summary: The percentage of memory off-loaded to the accelerator card.
property.description: If an XML accelerator is available, the percentage of memory that is off-loaded to the XML accelerator.

property.name: HoldMemory
property.summary: The amount of memory that the appliance reserves for its own use.
property.description: The amount of memory that is reserved by the appliance itself.

property.name: ReservedMemory
property.summary: The amount of installed memory minus the amount of total memory.
property.description: The reserved memory equals the amount of installed memory minus the amount of total memory.

property.name: InstalledMemory
property.summary: The amount of physical memory in the appliance.
property.description: The amount of physical memory in the appliance.

property.name: RxHCBytes
property.summary: Amount of successfully received data
property.description: The amount of data successfully received on the interface, which includes MAC framing overhead.

property.name: RxHCPackets
property.summary: Number of successfully received packets
property.description: The number of packets successfully received on the interface that were passed up to the network layer for processing.

property.name: RxErrors2
property.summary: Number of packets not received due to errors
property.description: The number of packets that could not be received due to errors in the packet or in the hardware.

property.name: RxDrops2
property.summary: Number of packets received that were dropped
property.description: The number of received packets that were not in error, but were not passed up to the network layer due to resource constraints.

property.name: TxHCBytes
property.summary: Amount of successfully transmitted data
property.description: The amount of data successfully transmitted on the interface, which includes MAC framing overhead.

property.name: TxHCPackets
property.summary: Number of successfully transmitted packets
property.description: The number of packets successfully transmitted on the interface.

property.name: TxErrors2
property.summary: Number of packets not transmitted successfully due to errors
property.description: The number of packets that were not successfully transmitted due to errors on the network or in the hardware.

property.name: TxDrops2
property.summary: Number of packets that were not transmitted
property.description: The number of packets that were not transmitted because the network layer was generating packets faster than the physical network could accept them.

property.name: Type
property.description: The type of mount service this NFS mount provides.

property.description: The configuration identifier for this NFS mount.

property.description: The remote NFS mount point for this mount.

property.name: State
property.description: The state of this NFS mount. If the state is up, Files can be opened over this mount.

property.name: Version
property.description: The version of the NFS protocol being used for this mount.

property.name: Address
property.description: The IP address of the interface of the NFS server that NFS RPC traffic is being sent to, or was last sent to.

property.name: Transport
property.summary: Transport type
property.description: The transport protocol being used under the RPC protocol for this NFS mount.

property.name: Port
property.description: The UDP or TCP port number that RPC data for this NFS mount is sent to.

property.name: FilesRead
property.description: The number of files that were opened for reading over this NFS mount.

property.name: FilesWritten
property.description: The number of files that were opened for write (create) over this NFS mount.

property.name: FilesOpen
property.description: The number of files that are currently open for read or write (create) over this NFS mount.

property.description: The IP address or host name of the ODR load balancer group member.

property.description: The member-specific target port.

property.description: The administrative state overrides the health of the server.

object.description: Displays the status of the ODR load balancer group members.

object.name: OtherSensors

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the sensor.
property.description: The name of the sensor that is being monitored. The name is in the form of a descriptive predicate. If the value of the sensor is true, the descriptive predicate is true; if the value of the sensor is false, the descriptive predicate is false. For example, the sensor name Intrusion detected with a value of false means that intrusion is not detected.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The value of the sensor.
property.description: The value of the sensor. The value is either true or false.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.summary: Status of the sensor.
property.description:
The current status of the sensor. The status can be one of the following values:
OK: The reading of the sensor is normal.
Failure: The reading of the sensor indicates a problem or a failure in the appliance.
No reading: No reading of the sensor is available at this time. An internal hardware or software error might occur. Contact IBM Support.
Invalid: The DataPower software requested a sensor reading by using an invalid sensor identifier. An internal DataPower software error might occur. Contact IBM Support.

object.description: Sensors that have true or false values.

object.name: PCIBus

property.name: Address
property.summary: PCI address
property.description: The PCI address of this function. This is a series of hexadecimal numbers, in the format xxxx:xx:xx.x, with each group being domain, bus, target, and function in turn. So 0000:01:02.3 is domain 0, bus 1, target 2, and function 3.

property.name: VendorID
property.summary: Vendor identification
property.description: The vendor identification of this PCI function.

property.name: DeviceID
property.summary: Device identification
property.description: The device identification of this PCI function. Each vendor assigns their own device identifications.

property.name: Class
property.summary: Class
property.description: The class of this PCI function. Class values are assigned by the PCI SIG.

property.name: Revision
property.summary: Revision
property.description: The Revision of this PCI function.

property.name: InterruptLine
property.summary: Interrupt Lline
property.description: The interrupt line assigned to this PCI function, if any. If none is assigned, no value is displayed.

object.description: List of the PCI functions on the system. They are identified by domain, bus, device, and function.

property.name: Description

property.name: Namespace

property.description: The namespace for the policy domain.

property.name: URL
property.summary: Domain URL
property.description: The URL for custom policy domains, built-in policy domains display 'System'.

object.summary: Displays all the policy domains (custom policy domains and built-in policy domains) supported.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the power sensor.
property.description: The name of the power sensor that is being monitored.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The current power reading.
property.description: The most recent reading of the power sensor in milliwatts. There are only three significant digits.

object.description: Sensors that read electrical power, from the power supplies and other components of the appliance.

object.name: QuotaEnforcementStatus

property.name: State
property.summary: Operational state
property.description: Lists the operational state of the quota enforcement server. The operational state is up or down.

property.name: Mode
property.summary: Working mode
property.description: Lists the mode that the quota enforcement server works in. The mode is standalone or peer group.

property.name: Role
property.summary: Role
property.description: Lists the role that the appliance plays. The role is master or slave.

property.name: Master
property.summary: Master server in the peer group
property.description: Lists the IP address of the master in the peer group that the appliance belongs to. When the quota enforcement server is in standalone mode, the master information is not available.

property.name: ConnectedSlaves
property.summary: Connected slaves
property.description: Lists the number of slaves that the master is connected with. When the appliance is slave, the value is zero.

property.name: Size
property.summary: Size in bytes
property.description: Lists the size of database in persistent storage. The unit is byte.

property.name: Keys
property.summary: Total keys
property.description: Lists the total number of keys in database in persistent storage. Each key represents a threshold defined for the specific traffic type.

object.summary: Quota enforcement status for the appliance
object.description: Displays the quota enforcement status for the appliance.

object.name: RaidArrayStatus

property.name: ControllerID
property.summary: RAID controller ID
property.description: The reference number of the RAID card. The value is always 1.

property.name: ArrayID
property.summary: Reference of array
property.description: The referece number of the this array. Numbering starts with 1.

property.name: LogicalDriveID
property.summary: Identifier of the logical driver
property.description: The identifier of the logical driver of which this array is part.

property.name: RaidLevel
property.summary: RAID level of the array
property.description: The RAID level of this array configuration.

property.name: NumPhysicalDrives
property.summary: Number of the physical drives for this array
property.description: The number of the physical drives for this array.

property.name: TotalSize
property.summary: Coerced size of array
property.description: The normalized size of this array in megabytes. The value is rounded down to an even multiple, which allows you to swap drives of the same nominal size but might not be the same raw size.

object.description: Details about the status of the RAID array.

object.name: RaidBatteryBackUpStatus

property.name: ControllerID
property.summary: RAID controller ID
property.description: The reference number of the RAID controller. The value is always 1.

property.name: BatteryType
property.summary: Battery type
property.description: The type of the BBU.

property.name: Serial
property.summary: Serial number
property.description: The serial number of the BBU.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name
property.description: The product name of the BBU.

property.name: Status
property.summary: Status
property.description: The status of the BBU.

property.name: Voltage
property.summary: Voltage
property.description: The actual voltage of the battery in millivolts.

property.name: Current
property.summary: Current
property.description: The current that flows through the battery terminals in milliamperes.

property.name: Temperature
property.summary: Temperature
property.description: The temperature of the battery in degrees Celcius.

property.name: DesignCapacity
property.summary: Design capacity
property.description: The designed capacity of the battery in milliampere-hour.

property.name: DesignVoltage
property.summary: Design voltage
property.description: The designed voltage of the battery in millivolts.

property.name: RemainingCapacity
property.summary: Remaining capacity
property.description: The predicted capacity remaining in the battery in milliampere-hour.

property.name: FullChargeCapacity
property.summary: Full charge capacity
property.description: The predicted capacity of the battery when fully charged in milliampere-hour.

property.name: RunTimeToEmpty
property.summary: Run time to empty
property.description: The relative gain or loss of the battery in response to a change in the power policy in minutes.

property.name: AvgTimeToEmpty
property.summary: Average time to deplete the battery
property.description: The time in minutes to deplete the battery. The time is calculated based on the 1-minute rolling average of the power that is being charged to the battery.

property.name: AvgTimeToFull
property.summary: Average time to fully charge the battery
property.description: Time in minutes to fully charge the battery. The time is calculated based on the 1-minute rolling average of the power that is being charged to the battery.

property.name: CycleCount
property.summary: Number of charge cycles occurred
property.description: The number of charge cycles that the battery has experienced.

property.name: RemainingCapacityAlarm
property.summary: Remaining capacity alarm
property.description: The threshold of the remaining capacity in milliampere-hour. When the threshold is reached, the system will throw an alarm. If the 'Battery Type' is iBBU08, this is deprecated and does not display any value.

property.name: RemainingTimeAlarm
property.summary: Remaining time alarm
property.description: The threshold of the remaining time in minutes. When the threshold is reached, the system will throw an alarm. If the 'Battery Type' is iBBU08, this is deprecated and does not display any value.

object.summary: Details about the RAID battery backup unit
object.description: The details about the battery backup unit (BBU) of the RAID controller. The BBU protects against the loss of cached data in the event of a power failure.
