object.name: RaidPhysDiskStatus
object.description: Deprecated due to indexing problems.

object.name: RaidPhysDiskStatus2

property.name: VolumeNumber
property.summary: RAID volume of which the physical disk is a part
property.description: The RAID volume of which this physical disk is a part. Each physical disk is in only one RAID volume.

property.name: DiskNumber
property.summary: Number of the disk in the RAID volume
property.description: The number of the disk in the RAID volume. Numbering starts with 1.

property.name: PhysDiskNum
property.summary: Physical disk number of the disk
property.description: The physical disk number of this disk. The RAID controller assigns this number.

property.name: Target
property.summary: SCSI target of the disk
property.description: The SCSI target of the disk.

property.name: Location
property.summary: Location of this disk
property.description: The physical location of this disk. "HDD0" is the top disk in the module, and "HDD1" is the bottom disk in the module.

property.name: State
property.summary: Current state of the disk
property.description: The current state of the physical disk.

property.name: Role
property.summary: RAID role of the disk
property.description: The role of the disk in the RAID volume. When the contents on the disks disagree, the primary disk wins and the secondary disk is synchronized to match the primary disk.

property.name: VendorID
property.summary: Vendor identifier of disk drive
property.description: The vendor identification string for the hard disk drive.

property.name: ProductID
property.summary: Product identifier
property.description: The product identification string for the hard disk drive.

property.name: Revision
property.summary: Hard disk drive revision
property.description: The revision string of the hard disk drive from the vendor.

property.name: Identifier
property.summary: Identifier string
property.description: The vendors identifier string that is read from the hard disk drive. Generally, the identifier is unique for each physical drive.

property.name: OutOfSync
property.summary: Drives out of synchronization
property.description: For the secondary drive, means that it is not fully sycnhronized with the primary drive.

property.name: Quiesced
property.summary: Drive quiesced
property.description: Indicates whether the disk drive is quiesced, which prevents it from receiving read/write commands.

property.name: InactiveVolume
property.summary: Drive inactive due to inactive volume
property.description: If true, the physical disk is not a member of the RAID volume.

property.name: OptimalPrevious
property.summary: Optimal previous
property.description: True if the previous state was optimal, else false.

object.summary: Status of physical disks in the RAID volume
object.description: Details about the phyusical disks that are part of the RAID volume.

property.name: ProgressPercent
property.summary: Progress of current operation
property.description: The current progress percentage of the operation on the physical drive. Operations can be rebuild, copyback, patrol, or clear.

property.name: RawSize
property.summary: Raw size
property.description: The exact size of the drive in megabytes.

property.name: CoercedSize
property.summary: Coerced size
property.description: The normalized size in megabytes. The value is rounded down to an even multiple, which allows you to swap drives of the same nominal size but might not be the same raw size.

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: Drive interface type
property.description: The interface type of the drive.

property.name: InterfaceSpeed
property.summary: SAS interface speed
property.description: The SAS interface speed negotiated between the RAID controller and the physical drive.

property.name: SASaddress
property.summary: SAS address
property.description: The SAS address of a physical drive.

property.name: VendorID
property.summary: Vendor identifier
property.description: The vendor identification string for the hard disk drive.

property.name: ProductID
property.summary: Product identifier
property.description: The product identification string for the hard disk drive.

property.name: Revision
property.summary: Hard disk drive revision
property.description: The revision string of the hard disk drive from the vendor.

property.name: SpecificInfo
property.summary: Vendor-specific information
property.description: The vendor specific information string that is read from the hard drive. Generally, the identifier is unique for each physical drive.

property.name: Failure
property.summary: The hard disk failure state
property.description: If the hard disk failure state shows Yes, replace this drive as soon as possible to avoid possible data loss.

property.name: Temperature
property.summary: The temperature of hard disk drive
property.description: The temperature of the hard disk drive.

object.description: Details about the RAID physical drives

object.name: RaidVolumeStatus
object.description: Deprecated due to indexing problems.

object.name: RaidVolumeStatus2

property.name: VolumeNumber
property.summary: Number of RAID volume
property.description: The number of the RAID volume in the system. Numbering starting with 0.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Type of RAID volume
property.description: The type of RAID volume. The incorporation of a particular type does not mean that the software supports creating or using this type of volume.

property.name: VolumeID
property.summary: Identifier of the RAID volume
property.description: The volume identifier that the RAID controller assigned to the volume.

property.name: NumPhysDisks
property.summary: Number of physical disks in RAID volume
property.description: The number of physical disks that are configured to be part of the RAID volume.

property.name: State
property.summary: State of RAID volume
property.description: The overall state of the RAID volume.

property.name: Enabled
property.summary: Whether RAID volume is enabled
property.description: Whether the RAID volume is enabled. If not enabled, there is no file system access to the volume.

property.name: Quiesced
property.summary: Whether RAID volume is quiesced
property.description: Whether the RAID volume is quiesced. When quiesced, the volume is enabled but no commands (read, write) can be sent to it.

property.name: ResyncInProgress
property.summary: Whether resynchronization is in progress
property.description: Whether resynchronization of the RAID volume is in progress. Resynchronization occurs when the data on the secondary drive is not the same that on the primary drive. Resynchronization copies blocks from the primary drive to the secondary drive until they match.

property.name: ResyncPercentage
property.summary: Percentage of resynchronization completed
property.description: The percentage of the total blocks that are not the same on the primary and secondary drives. The value is rounded to the nearest percent, except that the result will never be 100% unless resynchronization is absolutely complete.

property.name: InactiveStatus
property.summary: Inactive status of volume
property.description: If the RAID volume is active, the status will be "active". If the volume is inactive, it gives the reason why it is inactive.

property.name: BadBlockTableFull
property.summary: Whether the bad block table is full
property.description: Whether the bad block table on the RAID volume is full.

property.name: WriteCachingEnable
property.summary: Whether write caching is enabled
property.description: Whether write caching on the RAID volume is enabled.

object.description: Details about the RAID volumes

object.name: RoutingStatus

property.name: Destination
property.summary: The destination IP subnet of this route.
property.description: The IP subnet that is the destination of this route.

property.name: Interface
property.summary: The Ethernet interface this route is via.
property.description: The Ethernet interface this route is via.

property.name: Gateway
property.summary: The next hop gateway for this route.
property.description: The next hop gateway that traffic using this route is sent to. If the next hop is 0.0.0.0, then the route is via the interface (no next-hop router).

property.name: Metric
property.summary: The metric for this route.
property.description: The metric for this route. Typically configured in units of hops, but it is really user-selected. Given ultiple routes with the same destination, the one with the lowest metric is used.

object.description: This table describes all the static IP routes on the system. This table was deprecated because it could not support VLANs.

object.name: RoutingStatus2

property.name: Destination
property.summary: The destination IP subnet of this route.
property.description: The IP subnet or aggregate that is the destination of this route.

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: The type of device interface used for this route.
property.description: The type of device interface used for this route. Ethernet indicates that it is on the base Ethernet MAC interface. VLAN indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface. Tunnel indicates that it is on a tun interface.

property.name: MacInterface
property.summary: The Ethernet interface ( for example, eth0, eth1) used for this route.
property.description: The Ethernet interface used for this route. If it is via a VLAN interface, this is the Ethernet interface that VLAN is running over. If it is via a tun interface this is empty.

property.name: VlanName
property.summary: The name of the VLAN or tun interface used for this route.
property.description: The name of the VLAN or tunnel interface for this route. If not using a VLAN or tun interface, this is empty.

property.name: Gateway
property.summary: The next hop gateway for this route.
property.description: The next hop gateway for traffic using this route. For routes with a Route Type of local, this will be 0.0.0.0 for IP Version 4 or :: for IP Version 6.

property.name: Metric
property.summary: The metric for this route.
property.description: The metric for this route. Given multiple routes with the same destination, the one with the lowest metric is used.

property.name: RouteType
property.summary: The type of route.
property.description: The type of route. The value local means that the Gateway is the final destination. The value remote means that the Gateway is not the final destination.

property.name: RouteProto
property.summary: How route was learned.
property.description: The protocol by which this route was learned. Only routes created by management can be deleted through the user interface.

object.description: This table describes the IP routes on the system. This includes static and default routes created by configuration, and dynamic routes from discovery protocols.

object.name: RoutingStatus3

property.name: IPType
property.summary: IP address version
property.description: The version of the IP address: ipv4 or ipv6.

property.name: Destination
property.summary: Destination subnet of the route
property.description: The IP subnet or aggregate that is the destination of the route.

property.name: PrefixLength
property.summary: IP address's prefix length.
property.description: The prefix length of the IP address that represents the configured netmask.

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: The interface type for the route
property.description: The type of device interface used for this route. For example, Ethernet indicates that the interface is on the base Ethernet MAC interface and VLAN indicates that the interface is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

property.name: MacInterface
property.summary: Configured name of the interface
property.description: The configured name of the interface for the route.

property.name: GatewayIPType
property.summary: IP address version of next hop gateway
property.description: The IP address version that corresponds to the next hop gateway: ipv4 or ipv6.

property.name: Gateway
property.summary: Next hop gateway
property.description: The next hop gateway for traffic that uses the route. For routes with a local route type, the value i 0.0.0.0 for IPv4 and :: for IPv6.

property.name: Metric
property.summary: Route metric
property.description: The metric for the route. When the same destination has multiple routes, the route with the lowest metric is used.

property.name: Flags
property.summary: Route state flag string

description.p: String that shows flags that are associated with the route, one character for each flag that is set. Possible characters are as follows.

ul.li: U - Route is up
G - Route is via a gateway (router)
! - Route is a reject route
H - Route is to a host
R - Route will be reinstated after timeout
D - Route is dynamic, from ICMP redirect
M - Route is modified by routing protocol
d - IPv6 route is a default
c - IPv6 route is an addrconf learned from Router Advertisement
o - IPv6 route has no next hop
e - IPv6 route can expire
c - IPv6 route is cache
f - IPv6 route is flow-significant
p - IPv6 route is policy route
l - IPv6 route is local
u - Route has MTU
w - Route has window clamping
i - Route has IRTT

object.description: This table describes the IP routes on the appliance. The table includes static and default routes from interface configuration and dynamic routes from discovery protocols.

object.name: SelfBalancedStatus

property.name: localVIPA
property.summary: Virtual IP address
property.description: The Virtual IP address that the service is accepting requests on.

property.name: port
property.summary: Port
property.description: The port that the service is accepting requests on.

property.name: realServer
property.summary: Target IP address
property.description: The IP address of the target appliance.

property.name: targetState
property.summary: Target state
property.description: The state of the target in the standby control group.

property.name: serviceDomain
property.summary: Domain
property.description: The domain where the service object exists.

property.name: serviceType
property.summary: Type
property.description: The type of the service object.

property.name: serviceName
property.summary: Name
property.description: The name of the service object.

property.name: weight
property.summary: Weight
property.description: The weight of this target. The weight is determined by the processing capabilities of each appliance, and is used in the connection distribution decisions by the active member of the standby control group.

property.name: activeconns
property.summary: Active connections
property.description: The number of connections in a TCP ESTABLISHED state to this target. This information will only be displayed on the row for the active member of the standby control group, and might differ from the actual number of connections because self balancing is not the endpoint for TCP connections.

property.name: inactiveconns
property.summary: Inactive connections
property.description: The number of connections that are not established to this target. This includes previously active connections that have closed but not yet timed out. There might be a large number of inactive connections depending on the number of connections per second received and the connection time out. This information will only be displayed on the row for the active member of the standby control group and might differ from the connections in TIME_WAIT because self balancing is not the endpoint for TCP connections.

object.description: Status of self-balanced services in standby control groups.

object.name: SelfBalancedStatus2

property.name: localVIPA
property.summary: Virtual IP address
property.description: The Virtual IP address that the service is accepting requests on.

property.name: port
property.summary: Port
property.description: The port that the service is accepting requests on.

property.name: realServer
property.summary: Target IP address
property.description: The IP Address of the target appliance.

property.name: targetState
property.summary: Target state
property.description: The state of the target in the standby control group.

property.name: serviceDomain
property.summary: Domain
property.description: The domain where the service object exists.

property.name: serviceType
property.summary: Type
property.description: The type of the service object.

property.name: serviceName
property.summary: Name
property.description: The name of the service object.

property.name: weight
property.summary: Weight
property.description: The weight (processing capabilities) of this target. The processing capabilities of each appliance are used in the connection distribution decisions by the active member of the standby group. For standby members in the standby group, this value is always 0.

property.name: activeconns
property.summary: Active connections
property.description: The number of connections in a TCP ESTABLISHED state to this target. This information is available for only the active member of the standby group. The actual number can differ because self balancing is not the endpoint for TCP connections.

property.name: inactiveconns
property.summary: Inactive connections
property.description: Indicates the number of connections of established, idle connection to this target. This number includes previously active connections that are closed but not yet timed out. Depending on the number of connections per second that were received and the connection timeout, there might be many inactive connections. This information is available for only the active member of the standby group. The actual number can differ from the connections in the TCP TIME_WAIT state because self balancing is not the endpoint for TCP connections.

object.description: Status of self-balanced services in standby control groups.

object.name: SelfBalancedTable

property.name: localVIPA
property.description: The virtual IP address upon which connections are being accepted. An address of 0.0.0.0 means that connections will be accepted at any IP address of the system, a specific address indicates that connections will only be accepted at that virtual IP address.

property.name: serviceName
property.description: The name of the configuration object that created the listener.

object.description: This table describes all local services that are listening for incoming connections on a self-balanced standby control virtual IP address. For each entry in the table, the configuration object that created the listener is shown.

Obsoleted in release 5.0.0.0 due to incompatible SNMP changes in release 4.0.1.0. property.name: TotalMemory

object.name: StandbyStatus

property.name: Name
property.summary: The physical Ethernet interface
property.description: The physical Ethernet interface assigned to standby

property.name: Group
property.summary: The standby group number.
property.description: An integer used to identify a standby group; allowable identifiers are in the range 1 through 255.

property.name: IP
property.summary: The virtual IP address assigned to the group
property.description: The virtual IP address managed by this group, which will be active on one member of the group at any given time. This is the address external clients use to contact the group.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Priority level of the interface within the group
property.description: The priority value (an integer within the range 100 through 255, with a default of 100) determines the device's eligibility for the active role. The device within the standby group with the highest assigned priority assumes the active role.

property.name: Mode
property.summary: Current state of this standby member.
property.description: The current state of this member of this standby control group. If it is active, this member is the one receiving traffic for the group's IP address. If it is standby, some other member of the group is active.

property.name: Preempt
property.summary: Regain active status enabled
property.description: With preempt mode enabled, a previously active (rather than standby) device regains its active status provided it has a high enough priority when returned to service following a failure. With preempt mode disabled (the default state), a previously active device assumes the standby role when returned to service following a failure.

property.name: GroupLeader
property.summary: The machine currently responding to virtual IP address
property.description: The address or host name of the machine in the group that currently responds to the virtual IP address

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: The type of interface standby control is on.
property.description: The type of the interface this standby control is on. This may be Ethernet or VLAN.

property.name: VlanName
property.summary: The VLAN the standby control is on.
property.description: If this standby control is on a VLAN, the name of that VLAN.

property.name: SelfBalance
property.summary: Distribute incoming connections to all members of the standby group, rather than just the active
property.description: With self-balancing enabled, the active device distributes incoming requests across all members of the standby group with the self-balancing feature enabled.

property.name: DistAlg
property.summary: Algorthim used for distributing incoming connections
property.description: The active device uses chosen algorithm to distribute connections to members of the standby group with the self-balancing feature enabled. All members in the standby group must use the same algorithm.

object.description: Status of standby control protocol on Ethernet interfaces or VLANs on top of Ethernet interfaces.

object.name: StandbyStatus2

property.name: InterfaceIndex
property.summary: SNMP ifIndex.
property.description: Indicates the value of the SNMP ifIndex column in the ifTable for the interface that is running standby. The ifIndex is a unique value that is greater than zero for each interface.

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: Interface type
property.description: Indicates the interface type of the network interface that is running standby. Same numeric value as ifType in ifTable.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Interface name
property.description: Indicates the configuration name of the interface that is running standby.

property.name: Group
property.summary: Standby group number
property.description: Indicates the identifier for the standby group.

property.name: IP
property.summary: Virtual IP address for the group
property.description: Indicates the virtual IP address for the group, which is active on only one member of the standby group. This IP address is the address that external clients use to contact the group.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Priority level of the interface
property.description: Indicates the priority value. The appliance within the standby group with the highest assigned priority assumes the active role when there is an election.

property.name: State
property.summary: Current state of this standby member.
property.description: Indicates the current state of this member in the standby group. If it is active, this member is the one that receives traffic for the IP address of the group. In other states, some other member of the group is active.

property.name: Preempt
property.summary: Preemption state
property.description: Indicates whether preemption is enabled. Do not enable preemption.

property.name: GroupLeader
property.summary: The machine currently responding to virtual IP address
property.description: Indicates the underlying IP address of the appliance in the group that is active and is receiving traffic to the virtual IP address.

property.name: SelfBalance
property.summary: Active appliance for distributing incoming connections
property.description: With self-balancing enabled, indicates the active appliance that distributes incoming requests across all members of the standby group that have the self-balancing feature enabled.

property.name: DistAlg
property.summary: Algorthim to distribute incoming connections
property.description: Indicates the algorithm to distribute connections to members of the standby group that have the self-balancing feature enabled. All members in the standby group must use the same algorithm.

object.description: Status of standby control protocol on Ethernet interfaces or VLANs on top of Ethernet interfaces.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML manager that is managing the style sheets
property.description: The name of the XML manager that is managing the style sheets. More than one service can use an XML manager.

property.name: CacheSize
property.summary: Maximum number of style sheets for the cache
property.description: The maximum number of style sheets that can be added to the cache.

property.name: CacheCount
property.summary: Number of style sheets in the cache
property.description: The number of style sheets in the cache.

property.name: ReadyCount
property.summary: Number of style sheets in the ready state.
property.description: The number of style sheets in the cache that are available for use.

property.name: PendingCount
property.summary: Number of style sheets in the pending state
property.description: The number of style sheets in the cache that are pending compilation.

property.name: BadCount
property.summary: Number of style sheets in the bad state
property.description: The number of style sheets in cache that the appliance encountered compilation errors for use during run time. When errors occur, the style sheet is cached and marked as bad. Flush these style sheets from the cache to prevent runtime errors.

property.name: DupCount
property.summary: Number of requests to compile an existing style sheet in the cache
property.description: The number of requests to compile a style sheet that is already cached.

property.name: CacheKBCount
property.summary: Total memory usage for cached style sheets
property.description: The total amount of memory that cached style sheets use.

object.description: The current status of the stylesheet cache. The cache contains a copy of all style sheets or WSDL files compiled within the refresh time, total count limit, or total cache size.

The value 'stream' indicated specialized compilation mode for direct output to a network stream. The value 'context' indicates specialized compilation mode for output to a temporary context variable. The value 'events' indicates specialized compilation mode for event-driven output.

object.description: Profiling of the Execution Time for a Stylesheet

object.name: StylesheetProfilesSimpleIndex

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: The name of the XML manager employed
property.description: The name of the XML manager employed.

property.name: ID
property.summary: Stylesheet cache identifier number
property.description: A number that identifies the style sheet in the cache that processed this request.

property.name: OutputMode
property.summary: The output mode of the compiler.
property.description: The output mode of the compiler.

property.name: URL
property.summary: The URL of the style sheet
property.description: The URL of the style sheet. This value might refer to a remote location or to a location on the device.

property.name: Index
property.summary: An index of the calls made to this style sheet
property.description: An index of the calls made to this style sheet.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the template, global variable, or dp:profile node in the style sheet
property.description: The name of the template, global variable, or dp:profile node in the style sheet that the entry represents. Each named template in the style sheet is listed if processed by the style sheet. If a style sheet calls the same template from multiple places in the style sheet, each of the multiple entries is listed.

property.name: Location
property.summary: Location in style sheet
property.description: The line number in the style sheet where the template was called or the location of the declaration of a global variable or dp:profile element. For example, a report of local:///mine.xsl:16 indicates a template was called on line 16 of the indicated style sheet. Entries with the 'built-in' location refer to the implicit templates defined by the XSLT 1.0 specification.

property.name: Count
property.summary: The number of times the template runs
property.description: The number of times the listed entry ran during the processing of a request by the style sheet. A template or dp:profile node can be called more than once during the processing of a style sheet.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Type of profiling entry
property.description: The type of this entry. The value can be either a template, global variable, dp:profile node, or the total for the entire stylesheet execution.

property.name: TotalTimeMS
property.summary: Total time spent, in milliseconds
property.description: The total time, measured in milliseconds, spent processing the instructions represented in this entry. The instructions represented by a given entry can run more than once, as indicated by the count. The total time is the sum measured across all runs of the style sheet. As some entries represent nested portions of the stylesheet processing, the sum of all entries do not equal the total time.

object.description: Table that summarizes profiling information about style sheets. The table reports each template, global variable, and dp:profile element that the style sheet processes in their own entry. No data is available unless an XML Manager with a Compile Options Policy with Profiling enabled matches a request or response that the device processed.

object.name: StylesheetStatusSimpleIndex

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: The XML Manager controlling the stylesheet.
property.description: The name of the XML Manager performing the compiling and caching of the stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: ID
property.summary: A unique identifier.
property.description: A unique identifier assigned by the system to the compiled stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: OutputMode
property.summary: The output mode used by the compiler.
property.description: The output mode used by the compiler. The value 'general' indicates general-purpose compilation mode, no specialization. The value 'stream' indicated specialized compilation mode for direct output to a network stream. The value 'context' indicates specialized compilation mode for output to a temporary context variable. The value 'events' indicates specialized compilation mode for event-driven output.

property.name: URL
property.summary: The URL of the stylsheet or WSDL.
property.description: The URL of the stylesheet or WSDL compiled. This may reside on or off the device.

property.name: CompileOptions
property.summary: The Compile options applied to the stylesheet or WSDL.
property.description: The Compile options applied to the stylesheet or WSDL. Compile options are set by a Compile Options Policy associated with the XML manager used.

property.name: Status
property.summary: The current status of the compiled stylesheet or WSDL.
property.description: The current status of the compiled stylesheet or WSDL. The value 'ready' indicates ready for execution, does not require further compilation. The value 'pending' indicates that it is waiting for compilation, the system has a queue for compilation. The value 'bad' indicates that is failed to compile, cannot execute. Check the Compiler log for reasons. The value 'expired' indicates that it has expired from the cache; cannot execute. This indicates the file has not been required for processing for the cache lifetime amount of time. On next request, it will automatically recompile.

property.name: CompileSpeed
property.summary: Time to compile, in milliseconds.
property.description: Time to compile, in milliseconds.

property.name: RefreshInterval
property.summary: Time between automatic refreshes, in seconds.
property.description: Time between automatic refreshes, in seconds. When an automatic refresh is in force, files are fetched and recompiled to maintain a fresh cache.

property.name: Flushable
property.summary: Indicates ability to remove (flush) from cache.
property.description: Indicates ability to remove (flush) from cache. If the compiled version of the file can be flushed from the cache (in effect forcing a refresh the next time the file is called), click the Flush Stylesheet Cache button on the XML Manager object page to optionally remove the file from the compiled cache. Useful during development and debugging.

property.name: LastRefresh
property.summary: Timestamp of the last refresh.
property.description: Timestamp of the last refresh. Indicates length of time in cache. Use the Refresh button to immediately refresh a compiled stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: Message
property.summary: Helpful compiler messages.
property.description: Helpful compiler messages.

property.name: Log
property.summary: Helpful compiler log messages.
property.description: Helpful compiler log messages. Any compilation errors can be found here.

property.name: XG4Enabled
property.summary: Status of XML hardware acceleration for stylesheet.
property.description: Reports use (on) of XML hardware acceleration during compile of particular stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: XG4Size
property.summary: Status of XML hardware acceleration usage.
property.description: Reports usage percentage of XML hardware acceleration during compile of particular stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: MemSize
property.summary: Memory used by the compiled stylesheet
property.description: The memory used by the compiled stylesheet in KB.

object.description: A report of the status of XSL stylesheets and WSDL files compiled during processing. The compiler log messages are helpful for debugging and development. Once compiled, these files are cached for speed. The compiled files may be flushed from the cache and/or refreshed periodically.

object.name: SystemUsage

property.name: Interval
property.summary: The interval of measurement, in milliseconds.
property.description: The device collects and displays load statistics over the interval, expressed in milliseconds, given here.

property.name: Load
property.summary: Percent of load on the device.
property.description: The percentage of total load on the device during the measurement interval. A load above 90 indicates the device is at or near load capacity.

property.name: WorkList
property.summary: The number of pending messages.
property.description: The number of pending messages in queue for processing by the device. Pending messages may include such activities as off-box logging and stylesheet or WSDL retrieval from remote locations.

object.description: The percentage of load on the device. Capacity planning should be made with reference to all of CPU, Load, Memory and transaction latencies.

object.name: SystemUsage2Table

property.name: TaskID
property.summary: Task Instance ID.
property.description: Instance of the task.

property.name: TaskName
property.summary: The task or component name.
property.description: The name of the task or component.

property.name: Load
property.summary: Percentage of load on the appliance.
property.description: The percentage of total load for the task during the measurement interval. A load above 90 indicates that the task is at or near load capacity. High load values are not necessarily indicative of a problem, provided that transaction latencies are not affected. Low load values mean that the task is looking for work; high load values mean that the task is doing work.

property.name: WorkList
property.summary: The number of pending work items including internal communication.
property.description: The number of pending work items including internal communication in the queue for processing by the appliance. This number is for internal diagnostics and is not intended for purposes of capacity planning.

property.name: CPU
property.summary: Percentage of CPU used.
property.description: The percentage of CPU used by this task.

property.name: Memory
property.summary: Percentage of memory used.
property.description: The percentage of memory used by this task. This ratio is relative to the amount of memory accessible to each task, rather than the memory accessible to the appliance as a whole. The cumulative task memory is not comparable to the memory usage as reported by the memory usage status provider.

property.name: FileCount
property.summary: Number of open file handles.
property.description: Number of open file handles. The file count increases when the appliance accepts new connections, or opens a file for reading. The count decreases when this file handle is closed. The file count helps to identify which tasks are contributing to high open file counts.

object.description: Component level system usage.

object.name: SystemUsageTable

property.name: TaskName
property.summary: The task or component name.
property.description: The name of the task or component.

property.name: Load
property.summary: Percentage of load on the device.
property.description: The percentage of total load on the device during the measurement interval. A load above 90 indicates that the device is at or near load capacity. High load values are not necessarily indicative of a problem, provided that transaction latencies are not affected. Low load values means that the appliance is looking for work; high load means that the appliance is doing work.

property.name: WorkList
property.summary: The number of pending work items including internal communication.
property.description: The number of pending work items including internal communication in the queue for processing by the device. This number is for internal diagnostics is not intended for purposes of capacity planning.

property.name: CPU
property.summary: Percentage of CPU used.
property.description: The percentage of CPU used by this component.

property.name: Memory
property.summary: Percentage of memory used.
property.description: The percentage of memory used by this component. The cumulative task memory is not comparable to the memory usage as reported by the memory usage status provider. This value helps to identify which components are contributing to memory usage.

property.name: FileCount
property.summary: Number of open file descriptors.
property.description: Number of open file descriptors. The file count increases when the device accepts new connections, or opens a file for reading and decreases when this descriptor is closed. This value helps to identify which components are contributing to high open file counts.

object.description: Component level system usage.

object.name: TCPProxyServiceSummary

property.name: TCPProxyService
property.summary: The name of the TCP Proxy
property.description: The name of the TCP Proxy

property.name: Quiesce
property.summary: The quiesce state of the TCP Proxy
property.description: The quiesce state of the TCP Proxy

object.description: TCP Proxy summary

object.name: TCPSummary

property.name: established
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the established state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the established state. Connections in this state have completed all handshakes and can transfer data in either direction.

property.name: syn_sent
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the syn-sent state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the syn-sent state. Connections in this state are waiting for a matching connection request after sending a connection request.

property.name: syn_received
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the syn-received state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the syn-received state. Connections in this state are waiting for a confirming connection request acknowledgment after both receiving and sending a connection request.

property.name: fin_wait_1
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the fin-wait-1 state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the fin-wait-1 state. Connections in this state are waiting for a connection termination request from the remote TCP or an acknowledgment of the connection termination request previously sent.

property.name: fin_wait_2
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the fin-wait-2 state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the fin-wait-2 state. Connections in this state are waiting for a connection termination request from the remote TCP.

property.name: time_wait
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the time-wait state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the time-wait state. Connections in this state are waiting for enough time to pass to be sure that the remote TCP received the acknowledgment of its connection termination request.

property.name: closed
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the closed state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the closed state. This state represents no connection state at all.

property.name: close_wait
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the close-wait state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the close-wait state. Connections in this state are waiting for a connection termination request from the local user.

property.name: last_ack
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the last-ack state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the last-ack state. Connections in this state are waiting for an acknowledgment of the connection termination request previously sent to the remote TCP (which includes an acknowledgment of its connection termination request).

property.name: listen
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the listen state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the listen state. Connections in the listen state are waiting for a connection request from any remote TCP and port.

property.name: closing
property.summary: The number of TCP connections in the closing state.
property.description: The number of TCP connections in the closing state. Connections in this state are waiting for a connection termination request acknowledgment from the remote TCP.

object.summary: The number of TCP connections in each state on this appliance.
object.description: This provider lists the number of TCP connections on this appliance in each of the states defined in the TCP specification, RFC 793.

object.name: TCPTable

property.name: localIP
property.summary: Local IP address for this connection.
property.description: The local IP address of this TCP connection. For connections in the listen state, an IP address of 0.0.0.0 means that connections will be accepted at any IP address of the system. A specific IP address indicates that connections will only be accepted at that IP address.

property.name: localPort
property.summary: Local TCP port for this connection.
property.description: The local TCP port number of this TCP connection.

property.name: remoteIP
property.summary: Remote IP address for this connection.
property.description: The remote IP address of this TCP connection. The value is 0.0.0.0 for connections in the listen state. The value is a specific IP address for established connections.

property.name: remotePort
property.summary: Remote TCP port for this connection.
property.description: The remote TCP port number of this TCP connection.

property.name: state
property.summary: The state of the connection.
property.description: The state of the TCP connection as defined in RFC 793.

property.name: serviceDomain
property.summary: Domain of the configuration object.
property.description: For TCP connections that were created by a configuration object this value indicates the domain that the configuration object that created the listener is in. Only applies to connections in the listen state.

property.name: serviceClass
property.summary: The type of the configuration object.
property.description: The type of configuration object that created the listener. For all connections not in the listen state this value will be configBase.

property.name: serviceName
property.summary: The name of the configuration object.
property.description: The name of the configuration object that created the listener. Only applies to TCP connections in the listen state.

object.description: This table describes all TCP connections on the system. Active connections and listeners are included. For listeners that are related to router configuration objects, the table indicates with what object the listener is associated.

object.name: TemperatureSensors

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the temperature sensor.
property.description: The name of the temperature sensor that is being monitored.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The current temperature reading.
property.description: The most recent reading of the temperature sensor in degree Celsius. There are only three significant digits.

property.name: UpperNonCriticalThreshold
property.summary: Overtemperature warning threshold.
property.description: The temperature at which a warning of high temperature occurs. If the current temperature is above this value, investigate the cause and correct the problem.

property.name: UpperNonRecoverableThreshold
property.summary: Overtemperature damage threshold.
property.description: The temperature at which a risk of permanent damage to the appliance exists. If the current temperature is above this threshold, correct the problem immediately; otherwise, turn off the power supply of the appliance.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.summary: Status of the current temperature reading.
property.description: An indicator of whether the current temperature is OK or exceeds the warning, danger, or critical threshold.

property.name: UpperCriticalThreshold
property.summary: Overtemperature critical threshold.
property.description: The temperature at which a critical error of high temperature occurs. If the current temperature is above this value, correct the problem immediately.

object.description: Sensors that read temperatures, both of the air flowing through the appliance and of key components in the appliance.

property.description: When the virtual appliance is hosted on a cloud platform, shows the name of the cloud OS Linux distribution. The host system provides the information.

property.summary: The name of the voltage sensor.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The current voltage reading.
property.description: The most recent reading of the voltage sensor in millivolts. There are only three significant digits.

property.name: LowerCriticalThreshold
property.summary: The minimum allowable voltage reading.
property.description: The lowest allowable reading of the voltage sensor in millivolts.

property.name: UpperCriticalThreshold
property.summary: The maximum allowable voltage reading.
property.description: The highest allowable reading of the voltage sensor in millivolts.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.summary: Status of the current voltage reading.
property.description: An indicator of whether the current voltage is OK or the voltage exceeds the upper or lower critical threshold. If the status is not OK, check whether the temperature is too high or the fan does not work. If the temperature is normal and the fan works, the appliance must have failed. Replace the appliance.

object.description: Sensors that read voltages, from the power supplies and other components of the appliance.

property.name: Index
property.description: An identifier for this Subscriber, unique since the WSM Agent started.

property.name: Context
property.description: The identifying string provided by the Subscriber; not always meaningful to a human reader.

property.name: Protocol
property.description: Identifies which protocol the Subscriber is using.

property.name: SubProtocol
property.description: Identifies which variant protocol the Subscriber is using.

property.name: PollInterval
property.description: For Push mode Subscribers, the maximum interval between notifications.

property.name: Records
property.description: Number of messages on the queue which have not yet been successfully acknowledged by the subscriber.

property.name: LastReadIndex
property.description: The transaction ID of the last record read by the subscriber.

property.name: LastAckedIndex
property.description: The transaction ID of the last record successfully acknowledged by the subscriber.

property.name: LastReadTime
property.description: Timestamp of the last Read event for this subscriber.

property.name: LastAckTime
property.description: Timestamp of the last Ack event for this subscriber.

object.summary: Web Services Management Agent Spooler status

object.name: WSMAgentStatus

property.name: SpoolerCount
property.description: The total number of active subscribers for this Application Domain.

property.name: PolledSpoolers
property.description: The total number of Push mode subscribers for this Application Domain.

property.name: RecordsSeen
property.description: The total number of messages successfully enqueued since the WSM Agent was restarted.

property.name: RecordsLost
property.description: The total number of messages dropped due to resource constraints since the WSM Agent was restarted.

property.name: PendingRecords
property.description: The total number of messages currently in the queue for transactions which have not completed. This number is normally very low, and is approximately a product of the current transaction rate and external latency.

property.name: CompleteRecords
property.description: The total number of messages currently in the queue for completed transactions. This number is approximately a product of the current transaction rate and subscriber polling interval.

property.name: MemoryUsedKB
property.description: The amount of memory (in kilobytes) used by this Agent for transaction records and buffered messages. This number is compared to the configured Max Memory property of the Agent to limit resource usage.

property.name: MediationEnforcementMetrics
property.description: Mediation enforcement metrics

object.description: One WSM Agent exists per application domain.

action.name: AddKnownHost

parameter.name: ClientName
parameter.description: Specifies the SSH Client Profile associated with the SSH peer.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.summary: IP address for the SSH peer
parameter.description: Specifies the IP address for the SSH peer.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Specifies the key type for peer.

parameter.name: Key
parameter.description: Specifies the host key value for the SSH peer.

confirm.text: Add ${Type} key for host ${Host}?

action.description: Defines an SSH peer as an SSH client known host. The host specified and its host key is added to the SSH client known host list. When strict host key checking is on, the SSH client connects only to known hosts with valid SSH host keys that are stored in the known hosts list. Host keys not listed in the known host list are rejected.

action.name: AddPasswordMap

parameter.name: AliasName
parameter.description: An alias for an encrypted password.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: A password to associate with the alias.

action.summary: Add new password to password map
action.description: Adds a password to the existing password map. The password alias can be used in the configuration to refer to the password.

action.name: AddSelTestEntry
action.display: Add IPMI BMC SEL Test Entry
action.summary: Adds an event to the IPMI SEL
action.description: This action adds an event to the Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) System Event Log (SEL). SEL events are collected by the Baseboard Management Controller (BMC). Use this action to test the code that captures events from the SEL. When run, this action creates an OEM SEL record of hex type 'DF' with an OEM-defined value of 'DPTest'.

action.name: AddTrustedHost

parameter.name: Host
parameter.summary: IP address for the SSH peer
parameter.description: Specifies the IP address for the SSH peer.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Specifies the key type for peer.

parameter.name: Key
parameter.description: Specifies the host key value for the SSH peer.

confirm.text: Add SSH known host '${Host}'?

action.description: Defines an SSH peer as an SSH client known host. The host specified and its host key is added to the SSH client known host list. When strict host key checking is on, the SSH client connects only to known hosts with valid SSH host keys that are stored in the known hosts list. Host keys not listed in the known host list are rejected.

parameter.name: AcceptLicense
parameter.display: I accept the terms of the license agreements.
parameter.summary: Acknowledge acceptance of the license agreements

confirm.text: Boot Image ${File}?[br/]For a firmware image, system will reload after clicking "Confirm".[br/][br/]Note: This action may take a few minutes.[br/]Please refrain from performing other actions during this time.

action.name: B2BArchiveNow

parameter.name: ArchiveIncomplete
parameter.summary: Whether to expire data for all transactions
parameter.description: Indicates whether to expire all transaction or only transactions that are complete. If the value is on, expire all transactions. If the value is off, expire only transactions that are complete.

parameter.name: ArchiveUnexpiredEBMS
parameter.summary: Whether to archive data for all ebMS transactions
parameter.description: Indicates whether to archive data for all ebMS transactions. If the value is on, archive all ebMS transactions, including expired and unexpired ones. If the value is off, archive only expired ebMS transactions (the TimeToPersist time < CurrentTime).

confirm.text: Archive/purge messages based on archive configuration?

action.description: Based on the configuration of the B2B Gateway, the data will either be archived or purged immediately. The expiration process removes both messages and message metadata. After transferring to a permanent archive, the data cannot be imported into the appliance and cannot be viewed through the Transaction Viewer.

action.name: B2BHAInitSecondary

action.description: This command *PERMANENTLY DESTROYS* all persisted B2B messages on this appliance. Any data destroyed using this command cannot be recovered.

action.name: CopyLocalTAMDb

parameter.name: TAMObject
parameter.description: The name of the IBM Security Access Manager client that references a local policy database.

parameter.name: CopyDatabase
parameter.description: Copy the local policy database to the temporary: directory.

parameter.name: RemoveDatabase
parameter.description: Remove the local policy database from memory.

confirm.text: Manage Local Access Manager policy database?

action.display: Manage local Access Manager policy database

description.p: This action allows an administrator to manage the the local policy database for an IBM Security Access Manager client.
For troubleshooting purposes, you might need to copy the local policy database for Access Manager clients to the file system or remove the local policy database.

ul.li: If you choose to copy the local database, the action copies the local policy database to the temporary: directory.
If you choose to remove the local database, the action removes the local policy database.
If you select both copy and remove, the action copies the local policy database to the temporary: directory and then removes the local policy database.

description.p: Attention: When you run this action, the identified client is stopped, if running, and restarted when the action completes.

confirm.text: Create the directory ${Dir}?

action.name: CreateLunaClientCert

parameter.name: CN
parameter.description: Specifies the common name for the certificate. The value must be a fully qualified hostname or IP address of the DataPower Gateway. The Luna HSM registers the DataPower Gateway by the common name. The NTL connection breaks when the provided common name is incorrect. The value is limited to 64 characters.

parameter.name: C
parameter.description: Specifies the ISO two-character country code for the certificate.

parameter.name: ST
parameter.summary: Unabbreviated name of state or province
parameter.description: Specifies the unabbreviated name of the state or province for the certificate. The value is limited to 64 characters.

parameter.name: L
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the city or town for the certificate. The value is limited to 64 characters.

parameter.name: O
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the organization for the certificate. The value is limited to 64 characters.

parameter.name: OU
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the organizational unit for the certificate. The value is limited to 64 characters.

parameter.name: Email
parameter.description: Specifies the email address for the certificate.

parameter.name: PrivKeyFilename
parameter.summary: File name for the private key
parameter.description: Specifies the file name for the private key. Do not specify a directory or a file extension. If not specified, the common name is used.

parameter.name: CertFilename
parameter.description: Specifies the file name for the certificate. Do not specify a directory or a file extension. If not specified, the file name is the common name with a 'Key' suffix.

parameter.name: ExportPrivKey
parameter.summary: Whether to export a copy of the key file to the temporary: directory
parameter.description: Specifies whether the action writes a copy of the key file to the temporary: directory in addition to the cert: directory. The default value is off.

confirm.text: When you re-create the key and certificate, you must remove and re-register the DataPower Gateway on each Luna HSM that the DataPower Gateway is registered with. Do you want to continue?

action.summary: Create Luna client certificate
action.description: Create the Luna client certificate and key pair for DataPower Gateway to establish network trust link (NTL) connection to the Luna HSM.

description.p: Whether to create copies of the Access Manager key database and stash files in also the temporary: directory. The default behavior is to create the files in only the cert: directory.

When enabled, the action places a copy of these files in the cert: and temporary: directories.
You can download files from the temporary: directory.
You cannot download files from the cert: directory.

The base name for the created Access Manager files. File naming uses the following convention:
The Access Manager client authorization file must be a .conf suffix. This file is placed in the local: directory.
An obfuscation file for the Access Manager configuration file has a .conf.obf suffix. This file is placed in the local: directory.
The Access Manager client key database file has the .kdb suffix. This file is placed in the cert: directory.
The Access Manager client stash file has a .sth suffix. This file is placed in the cert: directory.
The user name of the Access Manager administrator. This user must have permission to register the Access Manager client application. The default value is sec_master .

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: The password for the Access Manager administrator.

parameter.name: TAMVersion
parameter.description: The version of Access Manager to be used. The default value is 8.0.1.Note: On Type 9235 appliances, the Access Manager version installed with your firmware is used regardless of which value you select here.

description.p: The operating domain of the Access Manager client. The default value is Default .
The application ID used to create the unique client identifier in the Access Manager policy server.

ul.li: If the appliance has a system identifier, the system identifier is appended to the application ID. The system identifier is a System Settings property. Use this approach, for it identifies which appliance has this client.
If the appliance does not have a system identifier, the host name of the policy server is appended to the application ID.

description.p: Attention: If the client identifier is not unique, the Access Manager policy server generates an error and the action fails.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: The host name or IP address of the Access Manager policy server.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: The listening port on the Access Manager policy server. The default value is 7135.

parameter.name: SSLKeyFileLifetime
parameter.description: The length of time in days that the password for the generated SSL key file is valid. Enter a value in the range 1 - 7200. The default value is 183.

parameter.name: SSLTimeout
parameter.description: The length of time in seconds between requests to perform an SSL handshake. This timeout controls how often to complete a full SSL handshake between Access Manager clients and servers. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 7200.

parameter.name: LocalMode
parameter.description: Indicates whether the authorization mode is local or remote. The default value indicates that the authorization mode is remote. When the authorization mode is local, use the accept policy update notification property to indicate whether to accept notifications of policy updates from the Access Manager policy server.

description.p: Indicates whether to accept notifications of policy updates when the authorization mode of the Access Manager client is local. The default value is to not accept notifications of policy updates.

When enabled:
For the local authorization server, enter the host name or IP address of the DataPower appliance that receives notifications of policy updates.
For the local authorization port, enter the listening port on the DataPower appliance that receives notifications of policy updates.
This property is available only when you use a local authorization server.

parameter.name: LocalHost
parameter.description: Specifies the host name or IP address of the DataPower appliance that receives notifications of policy updates. If using a host name, it must be the relevant Domain Name System (DNS) name of the DataPower appliance from the Access Manager policy server.

parameter.name: UseADRegistry
parameter.description: Indicates whether to use Active Directory as the registry type. Active Directory is not supported after ISAM version 7.0.

parameter.name: ADPrimaryDomain
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the primary domain in distinguished name format.

parameter.name: ADPrimaryHost
parameter.description: Specifies the name or IP address of the primary domain host.

parameter.name: ADPrimaryReplicas
parameter.display: Active Directory primary domain replica hosts
parameter.description: Specifies the host names or IP addresses of replica hosts. To specify multiple replica hosts, separate entries with the vertical bar (|) character.

parameter.name: LDAPServer
parameter.description: Specifies the FQDN or IP address of the Access Manager LDAP directory server.

parameter.name: LDAPPort
parameter.description: Specifies the listening port on the Access Manager LDAP directory server. The default value is 389.

parameter.name: LDAPBindPassword
parameter.description: Specifies the password for the LDAP administrator that corresponds to the entered distinguished name.

parameter.name: LDAPAuthenticateTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds that an authentication request to the Access Manager LDAP server waits before timing out. Enter a value in the range 1 - 600. The default value is 30.

parameter.name: LDAPSearchTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds that a search request to the Access Manager LDAP server waits before timing out. Enter a value in the range 1 - 600. The default value is 30.

parameter.name: ADClientTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the timeout value in seconds for any call made to the Active Directory registry. Enter a value is the range 1 - 900. The default value is 30.

parameter.name: EnableRegistryCache
parameter.description: Indicates whether to use a client-side registry LDAP cache for similar queries.

parameter.name: LDAPUserCacheSize
parameter.display: Number of entries in the LDAP user cache
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of entries in the client-side LDAP user cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 256. The special value of 0 disables caching.

parameter.name: LDAPPolicyCacheSize
parameter.display: Number of entries in the LDAP policy cache
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of entries in the client-side LDAP policy cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 20. The special value of 0 disables caching.

parameter.name: ADLdapCacheSize
parameter.display: Number of object entries in the Active Directory cache

description.p: Specifies the maximum number of Active Directory object entries or type-specific object entries to cache. For type-specific object entries, specify a semicolon-separate list of object-type pairs.

ul.li: To set the cache to a total of 251 object, enter 251 .
To set the cache to 251 objects for each of the user and group objects and not to cache entries for other object types, enter user:251;group:251 .

description.p: For total entries or the numeric portion of type-specific entries, enter a value in the range 3 - 65535. The default value is 251. The number specified is rounded up to the next higher prime number.

parameter.name: ADLdapCacheLife
parameter.display: Lifetime of object entries in the Active Directory cache
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time that an object is kept in the cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 300.

parameter.name: ADDnforpd
parameter.display: Active Directory Access Manager distinguished name
parameter.description: Specifies the distinguished name of the registry entry where Access Manager data is stored.

parameter.name: ADUseMultiDomain
parameter.display: Enable for Active Directory multi-domain configuration
parameter.description: Indicates whether to enable secondary domain configuration. To enable this behavior, Active Directory must be configured for multi-domain operation. When enabled, the secondary domain configuration is enabled. By default, this behavior is disabled.

parameter.name: ADDomaindomain
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the secondary domain in distinguished name format.

parameter.name: ADDomainHost
parameter.description: Specifies the host name or IP address of the secondary domain host.

parameter.name: ADDomainReplicas
parameter.display: Active Directory secondary domain replica hosts
parameter.description: Specifies the host names or IP addresses of replica hosts. To specify multiple replica hosts, separate entries with the vertical bar (|) character.

parameter.name: ADUseEmailUid
parameter.display: Allow email format for userPrincipalName attribute
parameter.description: Indicates whether to support the alternate format of the userPrincipalName registry attribute. By default, the alternate format is not supported.

parameter.name: ADGcHost
parameter.description: Specifies the host name or IP address of the global catalog host. Note: This option is available only when you allow email format for the userPrincipalName.

confirm.text: Create Access Manager configuration files?

description.p: This action registers an IBM Security Access Manager client configuration.
Attention: This action stop all clients in the domain, if running, and restarts them when the action completes.

An Access Manager client configuration consists of a unique identity in the secure Access Manager domain. The registration process creates client configuration files, a key database file, and a stash file. After these files are created, you can use them to configure an Access Manager client on the appliance.

Attention: Use these files for only one Access Manager client to ensure that each client has its own unique identity in the secure Access Manager domain. This approach avoids discrepancies when the key database and key stash files are refreshed.

ul.li: You can export certificate objects on any appliance.
You can export key objects on only HSM-equipped appliance. On non-HSM appliances, the interface does not display properties associated with keys.

You can import an export package for key objects on only HSM-equipped appliance. On non-HSM appliances, the interface does not display properties associated with keys.

action.name: DomainQuiesce

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds to wait for all transactions to complete. Specify a long enough timeout value to handle long living transactions. The minimum is 60.

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: Specifies the interval of time in seconds to wait before initiating the quiesce action. This could be used in self-balancing where the intent to quiesce is propagated to the distributor before initiating the quiesce action. This allows new connections to be routed to other nodes before quiesce is initiated. Specify a long enough time to propagate to the distributor. In general a value less than 10 seconds should be sufficient. The minimum is 0 (quiesce immediately).

confirm.text: Quiesce ${name}?

action.description: Transitions the operational state of a domain, and the services and handlers associated with the domain, to down in a controlled manner. When the default domain is quiesced, it does not change to the down operational state.

confirm.text: Unquiesce ${name}?

description.p: Transitions the quiesced domain, and all services and handlers associated with the domain, to the up operational state.
The running configuration reflects any changes that were applied while the domain was in the quiesced state.

parameter.description: Specify the common name for the CSR. The value is generally the fully qualified domain name of the server. The value is limited to 64 characters.

parameter.name: KeyType
parameter.summary: What type of key to generate
parameter.description: Select the type of key to generate.

parameter.name: KeyLength
parameter.description: Specify the length of the generated RSA key. The generation of a 4096-bit key can take up to 30 seconds. The default value is 1024-bit.

parameter.name: Digest
parameter.description: Specify the hash algorithm of the generated RSA certificate.

parameter.name: ECDSACurve
parameter.summary: Elliptic curve to use to generate ECDSA key
parameter.description: Select the elliptic curve to use to generate the ECDSA key.

parameter.name: FileName
parameter.summary: Name of the key file to generate
parameter.description: Specify a common prefix for the generated private key, CSR, and self-signed certificate. The value takes the name format. Do not specify a directory or a file extension. Based on the specified options, the action generates the required files with the appropriate file extensions. If not specified, the value for the "Object Name" property is used.

parameter.name: Days
parameter.summary: Days for which the self-signed certificate is valid
parameter.description: Specify the validity period in days for the self-signed certificate. The default value is 365.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Not available in the GUI. Replaced by the Password Alias property.

parameter.name: PasswordAlias
parameter.summary: Password alias that defines the alias that maps to the cleartext password
parameter.description: Specify the existing password alias map that defines the alias that maps to the cleartext password. The password in the map encrypts the files, and the alias in the map decrypts the password to access the file.

parameter.name: ExportKey
parameter.summary: Whether the action writes the key file to the temporary: directory
parameter.description: Specify whether the action writes a copy of the key file to the temporary: directory in addition to the cert: directory. The default value is off.

parameter.name: GenSSCert
parameter.summary: Whether to generate a self-signed certificate
parameter.description: Specify whether to create a self-signed certificate in addition to the private key and CSR. The default value is on.

parameter.name: ExportSSCert
parameter.summary: Whether to export the self-signed certificate
parameter.description: Specify whether the action writes a copy of the self-signed certificate to the temporary: directory in addition to the cert: directory. The default value is on.

parameter.name: GenObject
parameter.summary: Whether to create objects from the generated file
parameter.description: Specify whether the action creates key and certificate objects from the specified file. The default value is on.

parameter.name: ObjectName
parameter.summary: Name to use for the objects
parameter.description: Specify the name to use for the objects. If not specified, the action uses the value of the common name (CN).

parameter.name: HSM
parameter.summary: Whether to create the key on the HSM

description.p: Specify whether to create the key on the HSM. There is no default value.

ul.li: When created on the HSM, the URL is in the hsm://hsm1/ name format.
When created on the appliance, the URL is in the cert:/// name format.

parameter.name: UsingKey
parameter.summary: Name of an existing key for which to create a new certificate and CSR
parameter.description: Specify the name of an existing key. The action creates a new certificate and CSR for this key. The action does not create a new key.

confirm.text: Generate an ${KeyType} key pair and a CSR?

action.summary: Generate a private key and optionally a self-signed certificate

description.p: This action generates a private cryptographic key and optionally a self-signed certificate. By default, the action creates the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) needed by a certificate authority (CA). Because CA policies can vary with the amount of information they require in a CSR, check with the CA before you generate a CSR to ensure that you provide sufficient information.
If the action creates the files in only the cert: directory, then the files cannot be edited. If the files are in the local: or temporary: directory, then they can be edited.

Note: Use a password alias in environments that require password-protected files. Before you use a password alias, ensure that a password map exists to encrypt the private key password (plaintext) and associate an alias with the encrypted password. An attempt to reference an encrypted password that is not in the password map results in failure.

In environments that use encrypted passwords, the password map is queried and its associated encrypted password is identified. The encrypted password, in turn, is decrypted by using the locally generated host key to yield the plaintext password that is used to open and read the key file

parameter.name: timeout

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: Specifies the interval of time in seconds to wait before initiating the quiesce action. This could be used in self-balancing where the intent to quiesce is propagated to the distributor before initiating the quiesce action. This allows new connections to be routed to other nodes before quiesce is initiated. Specify a long enough time to propagate to the distributor. In general a value less than 10 seconds should be sufficient. The minimum is 0 (quiesce immediately).

confirm.text: Refresh client certificate?

description.p: Refreshing the IBM Security Access Manager client certificate affects the key database (*.kdb) and stash (*.sth) files.

ul.li: The key database file contains the client certificate that the Access Manager policy and authorization servers recognize.
The stash file contains the password for the key database file.

description.p:
When you run this action, it performs the following operations:
Updates the password for the key database file with a randomly generated value.
Updates the stash file with the new password.
Renews the certificate in the key database file.
Attention: This client and any other client in the same domain are stopped, if running, and restarted when the refresh completes.

description.p: Refreshes the password of the IBM Security Access Manager key database file. The key database file is secured by an internal password in the key stash file. If the password expires, it is reset using this action.
Attention: This client and any other client in the same domain are stopped, if running, and restarted when the refresh completes.
