parameter.name: cert
parameter.summary: Crypto Certificate contains the public key used in encrypting the secure backup

parameter.name: destination
parameter.summary: Specify the URL of a directory to place the multiple files that comprise the backup. The URL must specify a schema identifier for one of the supported file system folders, or the URL must specify a supported protocol. The supported file system folders are local: and temporary:. The supported protocol is ftp:. For the ftp: protocol, use the ftp://user:pw@host/ format.

parameter.name: include-iscsi
parameter.summary: Whether to back up the iSCSI device

parameter.name: include-raid
parameter.summary: Whether to back up the RAID device

confirm.text: The secure backup will copy off certificates from the appliance to ${destination}. This backup should be secured with all other installation certificates.[br/]The credential corresponding to the certificate ${cert} will be required for the secure restore.[br/]OK?

parameter.name: cred
parameter.summary: Specify the identification credentials that contains the credentials to decrypt the secure backup.

parameter.name: source
parameter.summary: Specify the URL of the source directory to restore the backup files from. The supported file system locations are local: and temporary:. The supported remote location is an FTP server. For the FTP protocol, use the ftp://user:password@host/ format.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.summary: Indicate whether to validate the backup files or restore from the backup files. When enabled, validates the backup files, and does not restore from the backup files.

parameter.name: BackupMachineType
parameter.summary: Machine type model of the appliance where the backup image was created in the form <machine type><model type>
parameter.description:
Specify the machine type model of the appliance where the backup image was created. The format of the machine type model is <machine type><model type>. Open the manifest of the backup image to find the machine type and model type. The following table lists the machine type model values for most, if not all, DataPower products.
Product nameMachine type model
DataPower Gateway843652X (without HSM)
843653X (with HSM)
DataPower Service Gateway719832X
DataPower Integration Appliance719942X
DataPower B2B Appliance719962X
DataPower Gateway Virtual Edition5725T09
DataPower Service Gateway Virtual Edition5725J90
DataPower Integration Appliance Virtual Edition5725J91
To perform the secure backup and restore process, the source appliance and target appliance must meet the following requirements:
They must be at the same firmware level and have the same features.
When the backup image contains RAID data, the target appliance must have equal or greater RAID volume than the source appliance. Otherwise, the RAID data is not completely restored.
When the backup image contains data related to features, the target appliance must have licenses for the same features. Otherwise, the restore fails.
You can use a backup image from a Type 7198-32X appliance to restore a Type 7198-32X or Type 8436 appliance.
You can use a backup image from a Type 7199-42X appliance to restore a Type 7199-42X or Type 8436 appliance.
You can use a backup image from a Type 7199-62X appliance to restore a Type 7199-62X or Type 8436 appliance.
You can use a backup image from a Type 8436 appliance to restore a Type 8436 appliance.
You can use a backup image from a virtual appliance to restore a virtual appliance. The following cases are supported.
Use a backup image from a production appliance to restore a production, nonproduction, or developers appliance.
Use a backup image from a nonproduction appliance to restore a production, nonproduction, or developers appliance.
Use a backup image from a developers appliance to restore a production, nonproduction, or developers appliance.
You cannot use a backup image from a physical appliance to restore a virtual appliance.
You cannot use a backup image from a virtual appliance to restore a physical appliance.

confirm.text: When the action is to restore the backup image, the secure restore deletes all data on the appliance. Therefore, ensure that you have a secure backup image in case you need any data from this appliance. Quiesce the appliance before the secure restore to stop all active work on the appliance.[br/][br/]When the action is to validate the backup image, the data on the appliance are not changed.[br/][br/]OK?

action.name: UniversalPacketCaptureDebug

parameter.name: InterfaceType
parameter.summary: Type of Interface to enable packet capture on.
parameter.description: Type of interface to enable packet capture on.

parameter.name: EthernetInterface
parameter.summary: Ethernet Interface to enable packet capture on.
parameter.description: Ethernet interface to enable packet capture on.

parameter.name: VLANInterface
parameter.summary: VLAN interface to enable packet capture on.
parameter.description: VLAN interface to enable packet capture on.

parameter.name: LinkAggregation
parameter.summary: Link Aggregation interface for the packet capture
parameter.description: Specify the Link Aggregation interface for the packet capture.

parameter.name: StandaloneInterface
parameter.summary: Network Interface configured by the underlying operating system for the packet capture.
parameter.description: Specify the network interface for the packet capture.

parameter.name: CaptureMode
parameter.summary: The timing mode for the packet capture.
parameter.description: The timing mode for the packet capture. Can be continuous or timed mode. In timed mode the packet capture stops after the specified time or earlier if another criterion is met. In continuous mode the capture continues until it is manually stopped.

parameter.name: MaxTime
parameter.summary: Maximum duration of packet capture in timed mode.
parameter.description: Maximum duration of the packet capture in timed mode. The minimum value is 5 seconds and the maximum value is 86400 seconds.

parameter.name: MaxSize
parameter.description: The maximum size of the entire packet capture. If this size is reached the packet capture stops. Enter a value in the range 10 - 500000.

parameter.name: MaxPacketSize
parameter.summary: Maximum size of each packet recorded
parameter.description: The maximum size of each packet recorded during a packet capture session. Enter any value in the range 20 - 9000 bytes. The special value -1 invokes the default 9000 bytes, which corresponds to the maximum transmission unit for Ethernet interfaces and therefore allows the entire frame to be saved.

parameter.name: Filter
parameter.description: The packet capture filter expression is a string that defines how the packet capture should be filtered. Full details of the syntax can be found by searching the web for "pcap-filter(7) format".

confirm.text: Do you want to start a ${CaptureMode} packet capture on ${InterfaceType} with the following settings: temporary:///capture.pcap, ${MaxTime} seconds, if timed, and ${MaxSize} KB? The link to download the file is available before the capture completes. Before you download the file, wait 30 seconds after the capture completes or after you manually stop the capture.

action.summary: Start a packet capture session.
action.description: Start a packet capture session to monitor traffic on your appliance.

action.name: YieldEthernetStandby

description.p: Specify the Ethernet interface to remove from the standby group. The state of the interface in the standby group controls what happens after you run the action.

ul.li:
When the active appliance, the following changes occur.
The active appliance resigns from the standby group and a standby control takeover occurs, which potentially breaks in flight connections and transactions.
The standby appliance becomes the active appliance.
An election occurs among the listen interfaces to determine which one becomes the standby appliance.

When standby appliance, the following changes occur.
The standby appliance is temporarily removed from the standby group.
An election occurs among the listen interfaces to determine which one becomes the standby appliance.
When a listen appliance, that appliance is removed without an observable difference.

confirm.text: Do you want to remove Ethernet interface ${Interface} from the standby group?

action.summary: Yield Ethernet interface from standby control.
action.description: Removes this appliance from the standby group. This action does not modify the configuration of the Ethernet interface.

confirm.text: Do you want to remove Link Aggregation interface ${Interface} from the standby group?

action.summary: Yield Link Aggregation interface from standby control.
action.description: Removes this appliance from the standby group. This action does not modify the configuration of the Link Aggregation interface.
